-V7oK3YSRt7q53PU1A9mYw.review_text: Buffalo Chili- DO IT!!!  It's delicious. you can have it alone, over rice or a baked potato...mmm so good on a cold, windy San Francisco night. They make stiff drinks, friendly folks, and the long line always moves real fast so don't let the line defer you from coming in for some hearty food.  My boyfriend LOVES there Thursday night Lamb Shanks and I'm a straight shot for the cole slaw and chili. Each night they have a special and the food is priced extremely reasonable. Dinner w/ 3 small side dishes= $13.00 C'mon now!

HYQoxBC1y1DGPq6pGP09Tw.review_text:
I can't believe how many different kind of beer they carry!! 
 There Buffalo Stew is lean and terrific, other than that food is above-average.

gX6zSNHe9IvEOaSIcKWssw.review_text: Far from the Tommy's Joynt I remember from 33 years back. Funny thing though, I met my future and still loving sweetheart wife at Tommy's. We went to the Joynt at around 2pm on a Friday afternoon. Well to make a long story longer, the place was laughably horrendous. The Buffalo Stew was watery and lacked the main ingredient, Buffalo. Table service, forget about it. The beer was good! After we finished we looked at each other and said at the same time, should have goon to Lefty O' Douls!

as58wHUswAr9TLmo21js0Q.review_text: Been here twice and was really impressed by the food. I tried the corned beef sandwich, pastrami sandwich, as well as the braised lamb shanks. Would definitely go back for the sandwiches! The corned beef was my favorite and was absolutely fantastic. Super juicy. Reminded me a little bit of Katz Deli in NYC but at a fraction of the price!   Beyond the food, this place is convenient and fast.

2rgzUE9BagBMWMFlcSKM8g.review_text: I secretly get excited every time the boyfriend suggests going here.  I don't know why...but I do.  In all honesty, I've cut back on my intake of meat...I still eat it, but not like I used to as find it to be a bit heavy.  That all goes out the window when we come here though!  I get the bbq brisket sandwich/plate.  So tender and delicious.  Everything about it makes me happy to my core.  We've done a few group get togethers here, and it's always nice because there's room upstairs for large groups, there's a wide variety of options for people to eat...and it's just plain yummy.  My only complaint here is the cash only situation.  Sure they have an atm available, but still...it's always frustrating when you're scrambling around to make sure you have enough money.

44FYwMVcqijDvvNHLpiqDQ.review_text: only go if you want to eat a lot of red meat which i hear is great.  but if you're not into meat (latest pink slim scare anyone?) keep walking.    forget the salmon special on friday nights - frozen fillets so dry the texture is way off and there's nothing the poor little wedge of lemon can do about it.  also forget about the grey mac and cheese - i thought it was just the lighting but the stuff was so overcooked and strange looking, one bite was one too many.  i will say the carrot/raisin/pineapple salad rocked and so did the uncle ben looking rice.  if i reallyed want all those calories tho, i could find a better way to get them.  and while the beer is good, the water IS cloudy - like it came out of the dishwasher ;o(

ERFbDSU0bg-dY6Pzgjl_Rg.review_text: Fun restaurant with great energy and friendly people!  Food was decent.   Bean is good and the sweetness is just right. The roast beef needs a little more flavor. Other than that, everything is great and I wanted to try every thing.  Last but not least, good price.  Cash Only.

WUVpkKZqewRiK8HWwjM5Vw.review_text: My husband and I were just here a few weeks ago and were waited on by Victoria. She was awesome!! So friendly and outgoing and made us feel right at home. After talking to her for awhile, we found out she was a new employee! She made our night very enjoyable--great drinks, great attitude, great experience. Thanks Victoria! Hope to see you again soon!

Ardg5LcOx_ryZYvXIXvr9g.review_text: Did anyone know that Guy Fieri was here for that show of his um "diner dives and drive ins"..or something like that....didnt know this place was that known..  Ive been here all my life and I always drive by this place wondering what the hell they serve..and one day a group of us decided to come here for dinner, now my friends have been here before but my lady and I havent so we were a bit excited.  Turns out this place is kind of like a cafeteria style restuarant. You come in and order while they slap it on the plate for ya and at the end you pay and go grab a table..after that the waitress will come around asking if you would like any drinks and thats pretty much how it goes..  I had the lamb shank..was pretty good, very tender came right off the bone had a bit of that lamb taste though, the taste a lot of people dont really enjoy, the veggies were also good,the stuffing was delicious and the roll it came with was hard but good  My lady had the beef stew with rice, that looked really delicious, just beef stew with rice..she was full but she didnt like the hard bread..so I ate it for her.  I can see how this place is so popular, since it has so much history and I'm willing to come back and try something else...give it a go if you havent come here yet...

jlBcOblhW239noTfNTnFDQ.review_text: Whenever I'm in the mood for home-cooking like my momma made (ie: not the greatest but not the worst meal) or a real Corned Beef sandwich I head to Tommy's Joynt.    I've had the Braised Lamb Shanks twice.  The first time I had them, they were good but salty and the last time I ate them the meat was a little tough. The star at Tommy's for me is the Corned Beef sandwich - hot, homemade Corned Beef on bread that is just right.  This sandwich makes the New Yorker in me very happy.

UZloE8c_eUdRoBU47tv2iQ.review_text: An old fashioned hofbrau known for long traditions and excellent roasted meats. Decent beers from just about every corner of the globe and filling comfort food like brisket sandwiches and roast turkey served in a super casual family style environment. Add your choice of sides like mash and gravy, beans, pickles and bread rolls. Come hungry or share sides between the table. Expect a queue, this is traditional San Francisco with a long history and a longer line. Cash only, good for a meal before the movies at AMC on Van Ness.

kuEJMiujF7NuyTpEXOfmvw.review_text: If you like hearty portions of delicious meat, potatoes, stuffing and gravy, Tommy's is your place. Not only do they serve huge plates, but for cheap as well. Full bar and huge selection of international beers. Recommended: Turkey sloppy joe, brisket plate and turkey plate. It's like Thanksgiving everyday.

OXZ7RqFIB4qWCtkAC2ix8w.review_text: Hadn't been here in several years and was surprised to see such a long line for food!  I don't remember there every being such a long line for chow.  Was fortunate to find a seat at the bar and had a beer instead.  Bar keep was a friendly dude.  I sensed that the place was spruced up a bit.  Didn't see as much bric-a-brac as before and beer menu had been updated.  Have to admit the place was looking a little run down last time I was here.

itXMelaTleEjLIFWCJtnwg.review_text: I ordered mac n' cheese. They were out of mac n' cheese. I ordered the sloppy jo. They were out of the sloppy jo. Course I was there at like 2am, and I wonder how much expectations you can truly have when dining at a "Joynt". I pouted and was fed a sample of the beef in gravy...which I then ordered -- not because it was awesome but because it was edible and I was starving. Let me tell you -- post-4 glasses of wine, 3 gin and tonics, and 1 shot, I feel like I should probably be able to eat a bar of soap happily. But this dish was not happening. I swallowed a few bites and immediately felt like I needed ANOTHER drink in order to steel myself to eat more. Bleck. I'll lend it to them that they have a fair amount of meat options for a caf -- and they've got a bar on site which :is: nifty if you find you need it after tasting your meal...like me.

jzSQHqViGjdB4MJDqNISEA.review_text: Yep, I have going to Tommy's for ages. I am a big fan of the buffalo stew. I took my wife here and she got scared and insisted that we leave. We ended up at Mel's across the street, yuck.  I must admit it can get a little scary at Tommy's so I will give my wife a pass on this one.

ZoirI_NFm2pGfXLGRjFBAA.review_text: I came here with a group of friends who were visiting SF based on Yelp reviews. It was very busy; the line was practically out the door. I got their pasta of the day with meat sauce which was a cheese Lasagna. It didn't taste very good at all and wasn't hot. It was barely warm! One of my friends got the Pastrami sandwich and that was good and another got the BBQ Beef Brisket, which was also good. The rest of the food was just ok. I won't recommend this place or go back ever again. I don't know what others were thinking.

JIKSBQ17zqc42GBYDtthqA.review_text: Best Brisket and Pastrami sandwiches in the Bay. cant be in San Fran without thinking about going to tommys

f7xpYaTDaVDGnxwhfeM30w.review_text: A long time ago, deep in the heart of Texas, I lived two blocks from Goode Company BBQ--the best barbecue in the Lone Star State. After years of knock-me-in-the-teeth brisket, I've gone a full year--seems like twenty!--without any succulent, indulgent meat. I hit up Tommy's recently and, whoah! My troubles are over!  This is barbecue as good as any I've had in Texas. The brisket was mouth-watering and I wolfed down the potatoes in seconds. The bar has dozens of beers from throughout the world--now that I'm living in the area, I guess I'll have to give 'em a try!  I got the BBQ Brisket dinner plate with salad and potatoes for $8.50. My beer, a bottle of Monk's Cafe Flemish Sour Red Ale, set me back $6 on top of that. The beer's a bit steep, but the food's absolutely worth it. 5 stars, will be back again--soon!

Rxl--2BMhmyn--gpvuu2Zg.review_text: Food was great! Even though the menu is confusing. We ate the bratwurst sandwich, corned beef hash sandwich (suggest this), potato salad, and cole slaw. The brat came with a sweet gravy that was delicious. A couple beers and the giants game... Solid afternoon!

CsOAZNAD-jMG3P0TpSEepw.review_text: Large, inexpensive meals that tastes like it came out of mom's kitchen.  With a full bar...it may be an overcast day paradise.

3TXNWQ-x98YphuVy2HegJA.review_text: If you're the kind of person who wants more bang for her buck, you'd love coming to Tommy's Joynt. It's a great neighborhood/city spot with ridiculously sized servings (maybe ridiculous to me since I'm used to going places where the entree is the size of my fist).  I came here quite a few times with friends and coworkers as I work in Civic Center. It's a short walk north from City Hall. If you're lazy, take the 47/49 bus up Van Ness... You can't miss the building because you'll definitely notice its wildly-colorful exterior!  I've had meatloaf, turkey leg, lamb shank... You name it! The meats are all nice and juicy and flavorful. And since the portions are huge, I recommend sharing them with friends. Most entrees cost less than $10, but the only thing that I have griped about is that it's cash only (yes, I am THAT person...), so make sure to stop by at the nearest ATM or Walgreens to pick up some cash if you're like me.  It's also a great place to come and grab drinks in the evening. There are TVs to watch games on, so you won't get bored if you're by yourself.

m0y3U1CBB7XyXWJSvzdWWg.review_text: After a failed venture to the SF Ramen Festival this weekend, I decided to say screw it and come to Tommy's where I waited only 3 minutes for some sweet, sweet BBQ brisket rather than the 3 hours it would've taken to get a crappy bowl of assembly line ramen.  Best "ramen" I've ever had. I can't believe the gigantic portions of the BBQ brisket and I absolutely loved their baked beans. Was also pleased to find plenty of seating in the back and a kickass waitress served us the most delicious cherry coke I've had in a long time.  Well, ok, maybe I was hungry from not eating anything all day due to the Ramen Festi-fail but damnit if it wasn't the best tasting comfort food I've had in a long time. Will be back to try the corned beef next time!

_pIG1_s6Bzymn1zeyLjBHQ.review_text: 2.5 stars.  After two weeks in Asia - upon returning, I needed a good "American Meal" fix.  I wanted something big, greasy, fattening, and totally wholesome.  But it was 11 at night, which really left me slim choices in San Francisco. Heading over to Mel's, always a reliable late night choice - we see Tommy's across the street and it becomes a moment of contemplation.  Now, Mel's is cool - - but them ain't no outstanding hamburgers.  So, let's opt for something different..... we head for Tommy's Joynt.  Sign looks cool.... and peering inside, it looks like they have fresh roasted meats and such.  Looks good.  First off -  kudos for the huge beer selection.  I think they rival Zeitgeist in bottled beers, though they don't hold a candle to Zeitgeist's beers on tap.  You dine here, cafeteria-style, which is never much my thing, but OK...  The roast beef was dry.... the bread they put the sandwich on was pretty blaaah.  The tri-tip dinner was served with mashed potatoes... the meat was a bit moister than the roast beef but I detected absolutely no flavor in either.  The cole slaw was .... soggy.  The potato salad, however, was pretty good.  Chimay White on tap.  1.5 stars for that. 1 star for the food - - cumulative 2.5 stars.  Meal:  $20 Two beers:  $12  $32, wasted.  I should have eaten at the airport.

TPRnTMnERabZqGNOOlFbjw.review_text: MEAT!!!! MEAT MEAT MEAT MEAAAAAAT! I've been a Tommy's veteran for uh.. I'm not even sure how many years any more. It's the default haunt for me and my friends. The spirits are always cheap, with a huge selection, the atmosphere is great, the clientele is about as diverse as you can get. But lets get to the most important thing.. the MEAT.   If it's not Thursday or Sunday, I will always get one of my favorites off of the regular menu, the BBQ brisket. I personally think it's heavenly. However, if it IS Thursday or Sunday, that means only one thing, and that is LAMB SHANKS! If you have not had the lamb shanks  yet at Tommy's, I highly recommend that you do so.  Amazing place, amazing vibe, great clientele and staff, good food (if you know what to look for), cheap drinks with a huge selection.  I'm sorry, can I just move in now?

ijpRP-xcbAtzE-Y-EVjEhg.review_text: Perfect idea of the place for such city as SF! I heart that joint - I am a meat craver sometimes, and I got total satisfaction  guarantee in that place.  They have awesome deals and great meat and side orders selection.  1 star minus for having a big line around 5:00 to approximately 9:00 pm! Probably it's a hungry time for the most people who try to save their bucks. ;)

SN5LggBbPGxD9laIxygneA.review_text: Been there 1 time with my wife late night (the only eating joint around) & the Buffalo stew was amazing! I'd go again...

8chjIckrqohVbpUhjX6MmA.review_text: This is a great place to eat and drink. Top shelf bar drinks really easy on your wallet.  Food is great and hasn't changed since the 40's.

HlfJrJUShJhohP6sXJL7gA.review_text: Amazing! The buffalo chili was so good!!

cQSpN9xybR_pS2JlEVE3XQ.review_text: great food. great atmosphere.  I like their turkey ala king.  Be ready to stand in line-however that's all part of the experience while you stare at the countless signs that serve as their menu.

Z5W8LdQCIehuDBRiXuvtYQ.review_text: Tommy's Joynt....hmm. I wonder where the y comes from. A double entendre perhaps? joint and 'joy'nt? Interesting   It's Monday, February 10, 2014. I just get out of AMC Van Ness and Yelp up a place to eat with my friend Phil. "Tommy's Joynt looks good." I say. "It has 4 stars, pretty good. Seems like they have sandwiches there. Hot Pastrami too." Phil agrees and we head over.  Upon entering, the place was packed. I can see why it's a joint--it has that joint feel to the place. TV, bar, tables, food, and people enjoying themselves. Phil and I stared at the menu for a good 7-8 minutes I think, trying to figure it out, because it's not really an organized menu and could be produced better, despite them wanting to keep a traditional feel to the menu. Fortunately for Tommy's, this place is so well established that it seems like most people coming in already know what they want once they get there, so the menu really isn't too much of a problem.  After listening to what 10 people ordered that Phil and I let cut in front of us since we were still looking at the menu, we finally decided to order. I asked the person behind the food counter what he recommends, and of course he recommends the special since it's the most expensive. Phil ordered a Hot Pastrami, and I got the Ox Tail Special and Hot Pastrami, since I figured the likelihood of me coming back was slim anyways since I'm rarely in this area.  Phil then whispered to me, "the guy just wiped his sweat on his hand..." and then I looked and saw for myself..he wiped his sweat with the top part of his hand. Now I'm not particularly picky in terms of cleanliness with food. As long as it's not spit on, poisoned, or tampered with, I'm okay if a little sweat gets on my food....okay now that I think about it, no it's totally not okay. I hope some of the sweat didn't drip into the food...  Anyways..after paying (my order was about $21..pretty expensive in my opinion..) we found a table and started eating.  The food was pretty good. Honestly for me they were good, but not mouth-blowing (mind blowing, but mouth blowing, get it?). The oxtail was delicious, and the sauce reminded me of a Filipino dish my mom makes at home. Some sort of tomato paste base with a lot of flavor. The hot pastrami was good, but the bread was mediocre. I really believe the bread helps make or break a sandwich. The sauce they provided to dip the sandwich in helped de-toughen the bread at least. The separate bread and butter that came with my ox tail however, was terrible. Rock solid, tasteless. It reminded me of the leftover bread that's given out at the St. Anthony's Foundation Dining Room that I volunteered in--and even the people there didn't eat it.  The table we chose was 'cleaned' but there was still rice and some sticky residue on my chair that I just put a napkin on before sitting down.  This place has a homely feel to it for many people I'm sure. It's like the MacLaren's Pub of How I Met Your Mother, or the Central Perk coffee shop of FRIENDS. But if you're in town and you're not a local, this place isn't a "must-go-to" spot in my book, but if you feel like checking the place out, you won't regret it (although your wallet might).  Overall, I give this establishment a solid 3.5, but I'll be nice on the Yelp scale and give it a 4.

cmAHVj0b5Wz5Tun6Op0ksw.review_text: I've been to Tommy's Joynt several times.  My bf loves it because he loves himself some meat and loves the low prices.  I enjoy the ambiance and the feel of the place, but I have some issues with certain things: - the mashed potatoes have the consistency of those made from powder  - the food is a little on the salty side for my taste - the bread is hit or miss, last time it was solid like a rock

bozvcy7kl2kJ2mBdKVxyUg.review_text: I've always wanted to try this place, it's a local monument, I was craving corned beef and cabbage.  They didn't have the cabbage this day so I got green beans and ... hmmm, I forgot already.  This place has a wide variety of meats.  Today's special was lamb shank with potatoes and carrots, there was a big turkey, and a big roast, which my friend had, it was not red like the girl said but, kind of over cooked for my taste, but it was some what late, I suppose.  If you're looking for reasonably priced home cooked meals that your parents might have served, this is the place.  Sometimes I drive pass Tommy's and there is a line out the door. Now I know that the buffet line is near the door, not just because it's busy inside.  It's just one of those place you have to try once in San Francisco.

pPi_DHfkWETrMClkrQ_G9A.review_text: Overrated. Cash Only. Not Veggie friendly. Boo!   Sorry. I went there once on a happy day. Everybody was psyched, then once I got there. "Sorry no veggie." Everybody had what looked like good stuff but me. I had a piece of bread with butter and some mash potatoes, which they priced at $9.00. Then while eating my sorry meal someone lays a Godzilla fart! Wasn't such a happy day after all. So boo!

mGBtIfGwyIcP359w4TmzVg.review_text: A friend told me about Tommy's and it was a definite go. Brought cash since they do not accept credit cards (website says this), and we were ready to chow down. Didn't have to wait too long on a Friday night, and with the bar near, you can stand in line and enjoy the wait. Refreshing? A bartender who really makes a drink. No skimping here, and ultra reasonable prices. ($4 for a dirty martini or Makers Mark & Coke?) Food? Delicious. Lasagna was cheesy and to die for. Mac & Cheese - excellent. The biggest meatballs I've seen on the sandwich they serve. Several side items were sampled and all were delightful. Generous portions!   The brisket was a little on the dry side. Sauce didn't do anything for it.  No big deal, just won't order it again. I am from the South, so I admit to being somewhat of a BBQ snob, however, the other guest was a CA native and shared the same opinion.   Tommy's Joint was a fun experience - and certainly worth trying out. The staff behind the counter were efficient and fast. Wait staff was friendly - always checking to see if you need anything.  Give the Joynt a try.

EzUqb6YbxbviDpyeIJdT8w.review_text: Simple and classic food.  Typical SF dive but with flavorful tender meats and gravy.  They have a bar if you want to grab a brew with your brisket.

V0gmCBiCIc9263ZPvnGGng.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is a true San Francisco treasure! You truly get a feel for the city just walking up the street to the restaurant, with its beautiful 1920's murals surrounding the storefront. It's a perfect place to take dates, family, friends and SF visitors for a lunch, dinner or late night meal. It is BBQ style home cooking that is hand picked and carved in front of you with your choice of all different types of meats and sides. Staff is always friendly and sweet. Tommy's is a true representative of classic SF cuisine!

Ll-msSQXtrV04jsFigK03w.review_text: The meat and potatoes of SF, literally. Love this place. I have loved everything I've ordered, and the sides are delicious! I only wish the bread roll was softer. Still 5 stars though. Corned beef juices mixing with the mashed potatoes.... Mouthwatering

e8MnzURBe8KNAEkpbMW-ww.review_text: Been going here since I was a little kid. What can I say about this place but to say its quality american meaty food without the expensive price. Everything here is good it all depends on what you feel like. My favorite is the bbq beef brisket or the turkey dinner. I love the big portion they give you. I always come out looking 6 months pregnant. The service here is friendly and it always feels like home when you come here. You can't miss this location because of its art work on the building and they open til 2am everyday so what more can you ask for.

3y8LIqkzCeBdrGfxY1tZuA.review_text: Most of Friday nights looks something like this:  Get home from work, walk the dog, and figure out what time I have to leave the house to meet my boyfriend and our friends at Tommy's Joynt. Get to Tommy's Joynt, I'm usually last but no one complains. Get in line and start to worry. What I am going to order? It all smells so good! It all *is* so good. Recently I've had the brisket, the turkey, and the corned beef. All good. The sandwiches are good. As far as I can tell, it is all good. Ask my boyfriend what he's going to get. His answer is always "I'll decide when I order." He's no help.  Get to the front of the line, decide on the spot what I'm going to get, and watch a crazy amount of roasted meat get carved.  always think, okay, he's done carving, but no! there's always more. So much meat. Choose my sides. I like to go "healthy" so I get the cucumber salad. Pay. Get water. Get pickles (but not too many! taking more than you will eat is bad form!) and find a table.   Stare at huge plate of meat and potatoes and feel really, really happy.  Eat. Feel happier. Package up my leftovers to go.   Go to movie at AMC. Hope I don't leave my leftovers under my chair. Again.

fzjHSd_g27KYT00i_PgUfw.review_text: What can I say that hasnt already been said? This place is great, the staff is always on point and the grub is consistently good. If you've never been, go.

Pf7FI0OukC_CEcCz0ZxoUw.review_text: Out with a group reveling in abject drunkenness? Did the wheels just fall off the bus?   Get your ass on over to Tommy's for a gratuitous meat-filled late night refueling stop before careening toward the inevitable crash into a booze-addled slumber. It just may save your ass the next morning.   Don't forget to pair the big heaping pile of meat stew with rice on your plate with a nice shot of Fernet Branca from the bar. Trust me on this. Your hangover will thank you in the morning.

SGnPTDlDpufduM4mHvT7TA.review_text: THE IMPERSONAL OLD STYLE BUFFET I was working in San Francisco and I've been passing Tommy's Joynt for years. I finally stopped in to this place that was reviewed by  "Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives' Guy Fieri,  and I thought it was  the most impersonal place I've ever been to. I walk in to this old style buffet joint and a guy asks, what do ya want? I get the Old Style German Recipe Kilbasa  with the sweet BBQ sauce. They slice it up to fit flat on a roll. Not too bad. Next another guy is like, ya want a salad? Sure, why not, I get a toss greens with Italian Dressing, not bad, the dressing is pretty dangy, but I like it.  I go to sit down in a booth and this sign is glaring at me saying, "only 2 or more can sit here!" I felt obligated to get up or I was going to get a bad customer ticket or something. So I got up and I high tailed it to the bar with all the other single eaters. I thought we were getting punished or something but I give credit to the old style food, but hate the impersonal touches to my experience, not much Joy in that Joynt!

vLNzXb4TzHdVaBLRyf5TZQ.review_text: FOUR STARS FOR THIS SHIT HOLE?  You have GOT to be kidding me!  I haven't had worse food in my entire life.  What is wrong with San Francisco?  My spaghetti was like chef boyardee.  I was positive I was going to find a roach in it.  The meat in my friend's sandwich looked like a piece of leather.  I've eaten at St. Anthony's Diner as a volunteer, and they had better food.  Seven dollars for horrible food is NOT A DEAL.  You could get better food at a homeless shelter for FREE.

owQQHvkry8AwuM0gt0mQQg.review_text: fresh meat, daily specials, you see how everything is being served, and can even point to what you want to eat, if you dont feel like using your big girl words.  also they have a full bar, and a dayum good irish coffee.   downside would be how crowded it can get, but explore the back to find more seating.

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: the colorful circus like outer appearance can be intimidating at first...leaving you wondering if this "joynt" is legit....is it chuck e cheese inside?....  buddy asked me if i liked to eat "meat"...and yes...i like meat....what kind of meat?....well...braised lamb shanks....spicy buffalo....corned beef...pastrami.....turkey legs....half chicken....sausages....bbq brisket...etc....get the picture?....meat~!...and more meat~!....meats can be served up as sandwiches or plated dishes with sides.....most items are roughly $6 to $8....  tommy's joynt is a rustic bar/cafeteria style dining.....line up and order your meals and items....grab your order...pick out your utensils and napkins....take your tray to one of the picnic style table and enjoy your hearty meaty beefy fillin' meal.....chow down...order a drink or two from the bar.....  bbq beef ribs...basically thick cut bone-in short ribs....slow cooked smoothered in gravy...plenty of mash potatoes....quite tender and tasty....a favorite pick....mix of horseradish in potatoes for little kick...$10.50 meal...but, well worth every penny...  while most meals are "okay"....it's cheap eats......quantity over quality....bargain meals in the city.......the $3 sausage sandwiches are by far the cheapest meals at tommy's joynt....

sXLAy83l7EwdZjsYFbaq0A.review_text: Are you hungry?  No. Are you really hungry?  Feed your tapeworm here.  This place is for people who really LIKE food & beer, and LOTS of it.  I just wish that they would put the au jus in a bowl - a BIG bowl, for better dipping of the yummy sandwiches. . . Hmm? Maybe I should have just used a straw to slurp up that wonderful au jus.  The Cliff Clavens and Norms of the world would love the large beer selection... I can imagine the beer conversation now:   "Well ya see, Norm, it's like this... A herd of buffalo can only move as fast as the slowest buffalo. And when the herd is hunted, it is the slowest and weakest ones at the back that are killed first. This natural selection is good for the herd as a whole, because the general speed and health of the whole group keeps improving by the regular killing of the weakest members. In much the same way, the human brain can only operate as fast as the slowest brain cells. Excessive intake of alcohol, as we know, kills brain cells. But naturally, it attacks the slowest and weakest brain cells first In this way, regular consumption of beer eliminates the weaker brain cells, making the brain a faster and more efficient machine. That's why you always feel smarter after a few beers."  I have to thank the old man for bringing me and another friend here - my goodness, he's getting some more stars for that one... I may just keep him. Among the other carnivorous delights, they have a Turkey sloppy joe! Have you ever heard of  Turkey sloppy joes?   Well, our friend devoured it, so I didn't even get to taste it!  Yeah, he HAS a tapeworm.

W2yFAIaDLSomVnVpcwCYKA.review_text: Came here a while ago with the babydadz and the place was kinda pack: Ordered BBQ brisket and mashed potaters(was just okay,I was waiting on the thick gravy but was given the watery drippings instead),cornbeef and mashed potatas for me(it was okay,could have been better if they pair it up with cabbage),lasagna was bland,and the worst part were the dinner roll which was hard as a rock(back of my mind thinkin this can be a deadly weapon for my monster in law at home! Lol) and the soda's with no free refill,even the waitress can't explain why they charge $1.25 each refill. All in all spent $30.00. Not bad at all!   Love the Lambshanks Thursdays though!

pzJubXjaNdLp_I98R6Eefw.review_text: 4.5  A friend suggested this place while in the city and boy oh boy this place is ridiculously delicious.   I'm not too big on big chunks and slabs of meat, so I always get a sandwich. Pastrami, to be exact. Their pastrami is heaven, with just the right amount of juices, sliced just right and stacked high. I like to eat one to two pieces of pastrami by itself before eating it with the bread. Just to taste the meat itself before combining it with something else. I also enjoyed their barbecue sauce, just the right amount of flavor!  If you're a fan of pickles, be sure to try their pickles in the barrel. I loveeee pickles :)  And if you like beer, this place has beers from a variety of countries, great for people who like to try imported beers.    Overall, great place for all ages with great food at low prices. A must try indeed!

8wKZ9gJYJtTdSVWgW7Or6Q.review_text: Good food - Check  Inexpensive good food - Check  Good beer selections - Check  Inexpensive beer - Check  Cool place - Check  Late night dining - Check  Locals and tourists - Check  Unpretentious - Check   If it's fine dining you want - you ain't gonna get it here since it's almost like a cafeteria style place. Food snobs beware and might as well stay away...we don't want your kind anyways.   They have daily specials hanging from a sign and their daily menu on the wall. (I recommend the lamb and pastrami sandwich) Go to the counter, place your order, grab the tray, slide to the cash register, pay the man (cash only), find a seat and enjoy your food.   Oh, they also have a huge international beer selection to choose from and they are cheap. How cheap? To quote Ice Cube: "Put your ass to sleep!" And they open late just in case you're craving for some late night munchies.   Bottom line: Next time you visit San Francisco, CHECK this JOYNT out.

ESpwFKguWoMuWH0pSgjL7A.review_text: I have mixed feelings about this restaurant. Though this was my first visit, I was dissatisfied to the fact that my meal was served at a relatively cold temperature (not warm, as one would expect). I opted for the "Daily Dinner Platter." At $8.50, I certainly would not complain of the price -- as it came with a choice of mashed potatoes or vegetables, beans or salad, and bread and butter. Moreover, you get your choice of meat (roast beef, bbq brisket, corned beef, pastrami, ham, and turkey). I opted for turkey.  For the exception of the mashed potatoes, everything else was near room temperature (bread and turkey). The food certainly would have tasted better had it been warmer! Thus, I would rate the food three stars.  However, the service was friendly, the food was cheap, and alcoholic beverages were exceedingly affordable (and strong). I'm rounding up to four stars.  Additional Notes:  - Cash only

YbZg36FoMgkKcTEPae5siA.review_text: This is one of my BFF's favourite places in the city.  We all went here for his graduation lunch.  The food is hearty, yummy comfort food.  The prices are totally within reason.  It was a bit of a walk from the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium, but it was worth it for the food.  If you want something filling, go to Tommy's Joynt.  It's been a San Francisco for many years and I'm sure it'll be one for many more.

TZk_8v1iytboYB9zkc4srQ.review_text: reminds me of german food with a mix of old san fran/americana cooking style. really delicious =)

qNDwIIYYH7afRgvoDZ8QGg.review_text: Oxtail stew over a bed of bowtie pasta, corn beef sandwiches, homemade slaw and a barrel of award winning pickles!! It doen't get any better than Tommy's when it comes to meat, meat and more meat. This place does meat the right way. From braised turkey wings to a slab of succulent prime rib...it's a man's diner for the on-the-go professional. You walk in a seemingly tiny door and as soon as your eye adjust, you see a full blown tavern of rustic Americana.   There are ropes directing a line to the carving counter, but it took us all of 2 minutes for the wait. They have a ton of daily specials and combo meals to choose from and when you finally decide what you want, you move on to the sides and desserts. The cashier checks you out and when you find yourself a seat (lots of additional seating upstairs), the beverage lady comes by to take drink orders. Be mindful though, she wont give you change if you were expecting any.   The prices are decent for the amount of food you're getting, the wait is short, and you wont have to worry about finding somewhere to sit. This is one of the best places to eat at lunch if you're down for a feast.   Be warned, this place isnt "fine dining" obviously from the picnic table clothes and such, but its a great place to be if you don't have somewhere to go in a hurry, or if you're catching up with old friends. I think you have to have a pirate streak in you to truly appreciate this place. I keep thinking that one day, Davey Jones will pop out of a corner and start singing Yo-Ho with the staff.

BoFWvsVPn5_4d8ElVAy_1Q.review_text: Never coming back again, the service was bad and the food was like nothing. First of all I was put off immediately because the server behind the counter was rude because I couldn't make up my mind and says "Oh, NOW he wants the stew!" Which brings me to my second point I had to get the stew because my family was already down here and they told me THEY DIDNT HAVE BUFFALO BURGERS!!! Isn't this place supposed to be known for that??? That is the only reason we bothered to come all the way downtown threw all the traffic only to find that there's no parking. No reason that anyone would want to come back after having my experience.

M0mONsg1ZJIKA30ad1qE1w.review_text: Salty salty salty pastrami sandwich with hard hard bread. huge portion though  I usually don't mind dirty tables and sticky floor, but the cups of water were smelly and had a layer of leftover grease on top   the whole experience left me feeling a little disgusted   not comming back again

tSbnlbdvpnoht1tT6uPAZg.review_text: Delicious sandwich with corn beef meat. Large selection of the beverages and crowd bar area. Seems like locals enjoying stop after work for beer and duchies dinner

eDalDbIeIeJlZrSW-cpIIA.review_text: If you are looking to spend $10-$12 for awesome food that will fill you up, Tommy's is the place. (Cash only though).  Most things here are awesome, but there are some things that won't live up to the hype on this site. First off, the mashed potatoes are nothing to write home about, and the stuffing is alright.   You cannot go wrong with any of the dinner plates or the daily specials. The corned beef and bbq beef brisket are astonishing, and the turkey is damn good, too.   Tuesdays are veal cutlets, which is my favorite special. I forget which daily special this is, but there is a ground chuck open-face sandwich served with a mushroom onion sauce, and add a slab of swiss cheese and it is arguably one of the best burgers in the city. For dessert, I always get the carrot cake.  Bottom-line, this place is bomb.

e-Bh0XDCOgYMaC-BmdxkAQ.review_text: 4th star is for their later hours, cuz after some drinkin' this place fits the bill and puts grub in the growlin' belly when choices start to dwindle.  And you can choose a beer from practically any country to go with said grub, cuz their bar is proper like that.  But essentially Tommy's is just cafeteria/hof brau fare where slow cooked foods sit under heat lamps waiting to get slopped onto a plate.  So anyone who rated this place under 3 stars came here sober.  There's a lot of mediocre fare here and this is what I've learned over the years.  BBQ'd Brisket but minus the bbq sauce.  They don't bbq but slow roast the brisket and just ladle a bbq au jus over it.  Get it plain, maybe with some regular au jus and it will kick ass on their regular roast beef cuz brisket is way more intense and flavorful than round of beef, granted it will not be reddish/pink.  But do sacrifice color for flavor here, it's worth it.  Also their Buffalo Stew is something else.  Actually it should be called Braised Buffalo Chunks cuz that's what it is.  No chunks of potato, carrot or celery, just chunks of super meaty braise-y buffalo heaven.  The meat fibers are thicker to remind you that it's not beef and the flavor lingers in the head for a few days.  So good.    Dad used to take me here after a ball game way back when, so yea, I might have a personal attachment to the place.  And really glad they're still around after all these years and going strong.   *chanting Hillshire Farms commercial slogan*  "GO MEAT!"

5TNCM-gaRt8ynP4Fim6JWg.review_text: This place reminds of the Dutch Goose in Menlo Park, a huge crowd pleaser for locals.  Why?  Free pickles, open till 2:00am, affordable but good quality, amazing sandwiches, delicious cuts of meat, and a old school vibe with great areas to hole up.  Get one of Tommy's sandwiches if you're new!

aFO_yCma7PImpdPkA8ZC-A.review_text: A San Francisco institution and a definite locals joint.  The last time I remember coming here was years ago.  Known for serving up traditional American fare, on a very empty and grumbling stomach I ordered a corned beef sandwich and some buffalo stew.  The corned beef sandwich was pretty tasty, not the best I've had, but the meat was quite tender.  The buffalo stew was satisfying but the chunks of meat were not as tender as you'd expect for meats that are slow cooked in a stew.  Came in starving, left very full, heavy and bloated.  Had to walk around for about an hour before I felt comfortable again.

HDofmxUbwB2ap0rfVxS4dg.review_text: I seriously doubt I'll add much to the 2,1013 reviews submitted up to this point but I will row in with my endorsement and declare that I'm a fan.  I'm a fan of the value-for-money proposition offered by a tasty pastrami sandwich on sourdough roll with swiss cheese and a side of coleslaw in return for $11.13.  I'm a fan of the staff who are polite and know their job is to serve and serve without delay.  I'm a fan of the thread-bare decor that adds a sense of history and color.  And I'm a fan of the very diverse customer base this eatery attracts whether prison-tatt youngsters, people from Nebraska who need to or want to eat here, old people, young people, Albanians, East Indians, black, white, you name it, they're here.  Oh yeah, I'm a fan.

JZ5-5n7ieD3mZUwb72JRng.review_text: Brisket after game. Always great food! Lots of locals and Giants fans alike.....

lWrDnoHn3g8GH1ppd6L_0g.review_text: I can understand why this place is popular: open late, big portions, casual decor, cheap food. My wife and I stopped by for dinner after a Giant's game and didn't know what to expect. I had the pastrami plate with mashed potatoes and beans. The portions were plentiful and the food wasn't bad. It was a bit weird having to order your drinks seperately after you paid for your food but the system seemed to work. As long as you're not expecting delicate food this place is worth a try.

q4cG5QVXJ3Vt5n-5dVSWuA.review_text: Was just there this past Monday with my wife, kids, and niece and we were not disappointed. The food is served cafeteria style where you get a tray, look at what's behind the counter and order what you want.  But none of the entrees were pre-made, only some of the deserts.  I ordered a German sausage (forgot what kind) on a roll. My wife go the bbq brisket with mashed potato, bread roll, and baked beans, which we both shared. My kids shared a bbq beef sandwich. And my niece got the pastrami sandwich with potato salad.  My family loved everything, especially the bbq sauce, which was sort of a hybrid of a gravy and bbq sauce.  I thought the sausage sandwich was just ok, but the bbq brisket was excellent.  the mashed potatoes were creamy and the baked beans were cooked perfectly and wasn't overly sweet. Even my daughter enjoyed her food and she doesn't even like beef too much.  The only down side was the service.  The servers were a bit pushy when I was thinking of what to order, and there wasn't anyone behind me at that time.  All in all, great place too eat with very good food and inexpensive too boot.

m07sy7eLtOjVdZ8oN9JKag.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is what it is. It's like the Buena Vista or Red's Java House. Institutions of cheap eats that draw the proletariat in like pigs in a pen. Oink. Over sixty years old now, it'll never change, and why should it? It's a damn shame there aren't more hofbraus in this town. Lefty O'Doul's is the only other one that comes to mind, but Tommy's is in a class by itself. What class, I don't know. Maybe Driver's Ed. No. P.E., definitely P.E. when I was the last one chosen for dodgeball because I acted all squealy-girly when a rubber sphere came at me at the speed of light.   But I digress. Jamie W. and I were starving after seeing "Up in the Air" at the AMC Van Ness. No hofbrau in that movie. Tommy's just as I remembered. Like a crowded lodge hall with heat lamps, slabs of meat, and the men ready to carve into them - all on the right. Still pretty cheap when I look at the familiar menu signboard (see photo). I went traditional and had the $7.75 Corned Beef and Cabbage with little boiled potatoes (see photo). It's quite a helping you get with three nice-sized slices of the corned beef, and they have horseradish with a mule's kick on the table.   Jamie had Tommy's Big Corned Beef Sandwich on a sourdough roll for just $5.60. All our meat came from the same, heavily brined slab of beef, and yes, it was good eatin', for sure. A mobile waitress makes the rounds picking up drink orders, and the formica tables are meant to be shared with strangers as you both compete for the pop-up napkins. I still like the neon sign that says "Hot Corned Beef Cocktails" (see photo), and also the big-boobed woman in the lavender-laced bustier painted in the mural. How do you not stick your head underneath her cleavage? Yep, Tommy's Joynt won't ever change.   FOOD - 4 stars...good hofbrau eats in generous portions  AMBIANCE - 3 stars...like a rotary club dining room  SERVICE - 3 stars...slow when you think how fast they serve 'em up at Katz's Delicatessen in New York  TOTAL - 4 stars...you can't knock good corned beef.

t1bmWSdcj65FB1peppSI_A.review_text: My boyfriend has been here once before, and after seeing it on Diners, Drive-in's and Dives, I decided i wanted to try it myself. My mom and bf both got the chicken caccatori over rice and mushroom sauce, I got the chuck steak sandwich with onions, mushrooms, and mashed potatoes and gravy over everything. YUM. We also got a side of the buffalo chili.  Firstly, i want to point out that this entire meal only cost $23!!! My mom was happy that it was about $100 cheaper than most of the dinners we go out to. I was happy that it was just as good as those more expensive places and definitely just as filling.   The only real reason I cant give 5 stars is because I guess since i saw the place on tv, i was expecting something out of this world amazing. It didnt meet those expectations, but if i didnt see it on tv, it would have exceeded my expectations of a small very casual restaurant for only $6 a pop. Im sad cos i used to live very close to tommys and never went in, now i moved a bit further but i can say for sure we will make the journey up there again  very soon.   O ya, service wise, we didnt interact much with the wait staff because there was no menu, no food delivery, and no check. You order when u get there, they make it for you right away and put it on a tray, you pay, and then take it to a table. Good for people in a rush or that dont like to wait for the whole paying process at the end, like me!!

AgbUnYWBYnkhhEOXphAZLw.review_text: OH YEAH! OH YEAH! and OH YEAH! My man took me out for a sweet date, we planned our night at Tommy's Joynt.   Can I get an AMEN AMEN & AMEN, the food was so good. I got the Saturday's special, sweet and sour ribs w/ rice YUMMY! Ribs were so tender and delish.  Baby got brisket so tender..... veggies..... so yummy! not salty at all just right.   And the price right, affordable and just loving it! dinner for 2 for less then $20.00.  The restaurant's decor is so rustic and fancy, you can see that history has ran thought there and stuck itself all over the walls.   Great for a date: YES!  Great for a quick family meal? YES!  Price is right? YES DEF!   Should you give it a shot? HECK YEAH!   PS.... BRING CASH! THEY DON'T TAKE CREDIT CARDS.

DlNSN5u0TJ9ZalDoCLdDgQ.review_text: Tips before attempting a Tommy's Joynt experience:  Day1: Get married to a cardiologist  Year 1: Have your first child with her (and/or your lover in the case of a female reader)  Year 11-16 (1): Go to Tommy's Joynt.  Bring cardiologist wife (husband) and a defibrillator (Philips is a good brand but he/she will know). Order anything on the menu. Go home before, after or during the cardiac episode.  Year 11-16 (2): Wait a few days and convince your son/daughter/illegitimate son/illegitimate daughter to become a proctologist.   TIPS:  (A) If you are rich, threaten to take your progeny off of the will if they don't become a proctologist. (B) If you are medium rich, try to apply to medical school yourself. (C) If you are poor, don't go to Tommy's Joynt.  Year 20-end of story: have your family alternate between your bottom sphincter and your smooth muscle that makes BoOm BoOm PsChhh.

W-k23QYJjbWmieyH6sWAMw.review_text: the brisket brisket brisket!!!!! Tender, juicy, tasty. GOOOOOD! Loved that the place was open late. Perfect for those late night studying hours.... such a filling meal. So goooooooooood. Wish I had discovered it sooner!

4OrFB2TDRsbokoYMhUf1EA.review_text: 4 stars definitely guys spot for food  they got meat and layers of meat sitting on more meat, you can't go wrong with whatever you choose, brisket regular or bbq, ribs, oxtail, chicken, bbq all of it is tender, heavy pretty much put you in a coma but satisfying your meat craving  for a week   they got different specials everyday, there choices of beer is also extensive, bring your boys and watch a game there the more the merrier, only thing that sucks is parking but if you can find something close it was meant to be. haha  food **** service **** ambiance **** metal signs everywhere, dark but comfy, definitely guys spot   cash only folks but they got an ATM located inside !!

3DU9zuZLFuN_8GRPJhTJug.review_text: Best lunch place I've ever eaten at!!!  Great selection and even better prices.  Atmosphere is genuine and relaxed.  I wish I went to SF more often because I would be a Tommy's Joynt regular customer.  A definite "must visit" whenever you are in San Francisco.

08mOpJRCpZe3D8UHszP4FA.review_text: My first time eating at Tommy's Joynt was Sun 3/30/08 for dinner.  We got there about 5pm and there was a line but it moves fast.  They have daily specials & lots of meat dishes.  This is just hofbrau food.  You order when you get near someone that can help you then pay..CASH ONLY.  Water & silver wear near the end of the line so grab them before getting a seat somewhere.  We got:  Braised lamb shank $8.25- pretty tasty lamb shank.  Boring potatoes & carrots.  I tried one tiny potato & it's just broiled & boring.  Carrots didn't try.  Comes with 1 sourdough roll.  Friend got a pastrami & roast beef sandwich on sourdough roll.  It was just ok.  Comes with a small container of jour which was fine.  Pastrami & roast beef were both dry. $5.50 + $1 for additional meat.  Side of cucumber salad just ok.  They have international beer-I don't drink beer so didn't care.  Saw some cops ordering food there, that's cool.  Total was a little over $17.  Separate bathrooms upstairs.  Women just one toilet & 1 sink.

lWP8MzKDY95PzNjk479wvw.review_text: Pro - Great staff, awesome beer selections and generous portions. Con - Atmosphere is not the most pleasant, food is meh.

X39YA5ejVcctjOFlDMkbAQ.review_text: The place has been around over 60 yrs (so i was told upon photoshoot session for japanese magazine two years ago).  I have been there for many many years.  I really like this place as much as I do those eateries in J-town.   I only eat anything beefy... nothing seefoody...  I really like bbq brisket... as well as wednesday special (ground chuck steak sandwich).  Oh, I like corned beef... roast beef.... oh, meatball sandwich...  anything beef...  oh, the power of beef... taste of beef...  The quality of beef, the way they prepare meal are great!!!  Yes, it may take sometime before getting food as you stand in line... but it is worth!  Other none beef plates are supposedly great, according to accompanying journalists who have been dining here for past two decades.  But I shall let you be the judge of it.    happy sandwich eating!!!

XWjS4swtZsAwn6-TSQrYLg.review_text: Yum - melt in your mouth brisket!  And anyone who knows me knows I'm picky about my brisket. No one ever took our drink order otherwise I would have given it 5 stars.

Z7kyIszuthXUjDlaX1-eqw.review_text: The true, original, only Tommy's, since the great depression. An awesome place that has a soul. Wonderful food, and great people there, both in the staff and in the room. What a place. Fabulous value. One of the must visit spots in San Francisco.

S79x1rpiwCMeDSPGYi3s9A.review_text: a late night freshly prepared non-processed meat or pancakes snack at dirt cheap prices with 200 beers to choose from? SIGN ME UP!   forget denny's, mel's, ihops, ijacks - i'm staying at Tommy's!

5X-YjDOjMyFJohnbP-8zkQ.review_text: Well knowledgeable bartender with excellent taste in all types of beers. I love the style of the daily food specials, only one meal on the menu each day like you are eating at mom's house but with a really cool environment. One of my favs in the city for beers and cocktails.

vpFL92TVASSFekmhjhcsvw.review_text: WTF!!! They don't hv buffalo burgers!! isn't that the whole point of this famous place.  this is the reason why we came cause nephew wanted to have a buffalo burger. we had to fight the traffic getting parking, which you know is a fucking nightmare down here.  then they gave us a salad was supposed to have a mix dressing and it just takes it all like vinegar that was gross!  the beef brisket had too much fat!! I just ate some other salad and I ate a bowl of mashed potatoes and two slice of the meat.  I use to come here as a child but damn has it changed since the 1970s!!  yes I realize I just told my age oh well!haaaaaa.  I do not recommend this place it sucks, and then they're going to take over the restaurant in westlate original Joe's that's the horrible.  do not come here its not worth it.  might as well go to the chicken coop or  hot broth, wait that's what this is..  this is the reason why you only get one star from me. I will never come back here again.

jEyb7v42sgIZZhwxnynFfg.review_text: I used to go here when I lived nearby in the Tendernob. Personally I loved the place - it is a classic bar in all senses of the word.   I guess this place has been on Diners, Drive inns & Dives. i know nothing about the food. This was beer heaven baby.

d-5gWThyELEJZdFKUx5Pzg.review_text: It's been such a long time since I've been here, but catching Tommy's Joynt on the Food Network's show "Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives" got me itching for the lamb shank again. I've actually had lamb (kebab and shank) the last few nights, but all that did was reinforce my craving for the Braised Lamb Shank at Tommy's. Picture this, two slowly braised lamb shanks on a bed of rice or potatoes and carrots drenched in its own gravy with a roll for $8.55. Where the hell can you get a good lamb shank dinner for that price? At any other restaurant you'll be paying $20 for just one. Okay, I forgot the sides. If you add a salad/coleslaw/veggie you'll have a meal for $10-$11 tops. Yes it is a no nonsense place, but what do you expect for a tradiational German Hofbrau joint? So next time it's a t-shirt and jeans night, and you're looking to spend and little less while getting more head over to Tommy's Joynt for the Braised Lamb Shank. Oh yeah, all the other stuff there is good too (see my original review).   MUST HAVE: Braised Lamb Shank (Sundays and Thursdays)

aMOQUtikM2CzotY9-FqkDg.review_text: Some nights....all you're craving is a little tommy's. Its not the best food you've had, but there's a unique craving for their food you'll have every now and then...and nothing else can quench that craving.  This hofbrau from the 40s, a place loved by Metallica, with its old America charm, cafeteria food, and broad selection of beers from around the world (and great ones from SF too) it really just hits the spot for that meat and carb meal.  Hit the carvery and get large and generous cuts of your choice of meat (my fav is definitely the round of beef) or dabble into their daily specials or those enormous turkey legs. Slap on some mash and oh so tasty beans (with lots of bacon-y goodness) or even some coleslaw and hunker down with a pint and feed that gut-loving goodness. This is simply just honest food. I love the atmosphere, the dark yet eclectic mix of beer steins and mismatched menu options strewn all across the room. This place just makes me feel warm inside, especially on a cold tiring day. You can tell that this place has been keeping those workers toasty since its inception.

uMhnFxxoLRjznTzsyihMgg.review_text: Been coming here for years now and today they decided to pocket a $100 bill from me that I accidentally handed them along with the two $20s I used to pay for our meals. I realized it after taking a look in my wallet when heading to my table. When I approached the guy at the register, he claimed he didn't have it. The perks of running a cash only establishment. Hope you guys feel good.

U_OpEU7tCCnSmCBv0Sg8GQ.review_text: Tommy's Joint was featured on Dinners, Drives and Dives on the food network channel.   I remember when Rachael Rae went to Oyster swan depot on Polk and the week after the show the prices at Oyster swan skyrocketted.  I hope this doesn happen to Tommy's Joint.  Please Tommy read this review...  My name is Simon and I approve this review.

6xQUjVLLN6LzikO-THfHDQ.review_text: I was born and raised in San Francisco but only recently tried Tommy's Joynt. I was disappointed. The prices were OK but portions seemed small (I'm a big guy). The food was good quality and cooked well. Nothing fancy. I had the brisket with some sort of Barbecue gravy on it. It tasted like canned brown gravy with ketchup. The dinner came with salad, a day old french roll, and a small scoop of mashed potatoes. My wife had the roast beef with brown gravy (without the ketchup). The place is dark and dingy. Dark is OK with me but the walls looked as if they were coated with a thick coat of grease and dust. The carpet appeared very soiled and outdated like it should have been replaced many years ago. The paint was peeling off the walls in large sheets. Service was good. I would not bring visitors to San Francisco there.   My advice to Tommy's proprietor is; clean the place up. Paint and replace the carpet. Two scoops of mashed potatoes and some veggies or something besides the salad. The french roll was good, but maybe because it was Sunday it wasn't fresh.

lmZii0clFiaYDXP19gQkew.review_text: Quite honestly I don't know what the hell I was thinking a few years ago when I gave this place anything less than 5 stars.  Just had the "Dinner Platter" today with a mountain of Turkey, mashed potatoes, stuffing, bean salad and a roll for $9.75, unbelievable!  Plus the place itself is so awesome, it's worth the price of admission just looking around the place, such a cool "trapped in time"/Old San Francisco vibe!

iGFfwcQRg_a5379SYcgHXg.review_text: I was looking for a place to grab something to quick to eat and I probably would have settled for bking but I'm glad the smell of beef stew at Tommy's lured me in. This place is pretty amazing. As soon as you walk in you get you are greeted with a slow cooked ham and and beef brisket. What I loved the most was I was able to eat a turkey dinner before turkey day. Thick slices of turkey cooked perfectly (that usually nvr happens) served with stuffing and mashed potatoes.  Heaven :*)

GSA18YuTR5Eb84Asb_wK1w.review_text: A friend recommended that we try out this place.  This place is great! Big portions of good food for a great price! I ordered the corned beef dinner and in addition to about 6 thick slices of great corned beef, I got a scoop of delicious mashed potatoes, a side of bean salad, and a dinner roll for $10.   They also have a variety of sandwiches for a little over $6.  The only thing I had to complain about was that it was more food that I wanted to eat at the time, but that's not really a real thing to complain about!   Also, the staff was friendly!  I will definitely be back.

cqCbKnOiYdY3DEEJykzy8g.review_text: Buffalo chili was barely passable, but the buffalo stew sandwich was killer. The sourdough roll soaked up the gravy nicely and it still had bite to it. I'll have that next time probably- but there's endless things to choose from. Not to mention a huge spectrum of beer.  So many cool bar things on the walls, layers- you can never see all of them. We were wowed by this fun, funky place and we WILL be back.

4QUmpPjbfqHFLjXGNNB22g.review_text: Where else can you go at  1230 AM for a plate of roasted turkey and mashed potatoes to go with your Gin and Tonic? It's a good old fashioned Hof Brau, with a large variety of meats and other delights. As my boyfriend and I sat and enjoyed our meals, I said in wonderment, "how the heck are they going to carve through that whole turkey before closing"? They'd pulled out a new one for us. And as soon as the words left my mouth, the place was flooded with a bunch of Phish Heads that had just left a concert.

KKTPRu5jSM-gFAU5RoM7Bg.review_text: My boyfriend, myself, and a friend went to Tommy's Joynt after the friend picked my boyfriend and I up from our car accident (see the review for Larry's Tow) and we were all hungry for a good and easy meal.  It's a place with character and a lot of meat (which the boy's really enjoyed, and so did I). Once you walk into the place, you notice a line swerving in and out, why? Because it's a cafeteria styled type of  place with a bar! So if you are waiting and you feel like you've been waiting for a long time, go grab yourself a drink and come back and order (well, have on person wait in line so you don't lose your spot)  All of our orders: 2 Thursday Specials - braised lamb shanks with vegetables Beef Stew BBQ Brisket  Great food and there was something for everyone - my boyfriend even stated that he would love to have his next birthday here and the friend said he would love to go to a birthday held here (wink wink, next birthday, here we come).

5CZDtRWuEw5-NQ5CN5Db-Q.review_text: Went here for lunch with the girls on Sunday. We were all friggin starving and were not looking for some wimpy portioned lunch. My best friend suggested Tommys Joynt..  I thought I had died and gone to heaven. It smelled SOOOOOOOOO good! I love the casual on the wall menu. I had the corned beef and mashed potatoes with a green salad. The corned beef was so good! It was almost as if my grandmother had cooked it. I was really impressed with the price to portion ratio. Definitely a lot of bang for your buck. The beer list was really impressive as well. I can't wait to come back!

UvmKLvE5_OCRrzFcuCFJYg.review_text: It's just a fun place to eat. Huge portions of meat. We had the lamb shank, roast beef, and corned beef. It was all good. This style of food isn't typical San francisco fare and I can see how it is almost offensive to some poeple, but I would still recommend trying it. Plus, it's a great deal for both food and drink.

OWnYWg8L67W-moQJkjrXPQ.review_text: I'm a native San Franciscan but I did not discover this place until my mid 20's.  Must have passed it thousands of times but never went in until one day we left a party early, passed by and said "Hey, it's open, let's get some late night grub"    And that's how it all started.  After going in, this is what Old San Francisco was probably all about.  Old wooden decor, a Hof Brau where you wait in line to order your food and Oh that BEER LIST.  One of the biggest Beer Lists I have ever seen.  You know what, not one of the biggest.  It is the biggest I've seen in my lifetime so far.    Just a cool, comfortable place to grab a bite and brew.  I guess the only thing that might be a downfall is that once in a while, there seem to be some seedy characters in there.  But hey, it's probably how the Old West was too so that just adds to the authenticity of the experience.    BBQ Beef Brisket!!!

A3IjhTtU0gYvQ3V0nL0Ymw.review_text: I eat here a lot because it's fairly close to where I live. The prices are great for all of the food that you get! Try the bbq beef brisket dinner... it is so good! The meat is tender with a lot of flavor. The menu is simple. I've also had the corned beef sandwich, salmon with rice, corned beef and cabbage, the braised turkey wings with rice.... all of these dishes are wonderful. They also have 30 beers on tap! Great place to chill out, have a beer and a meal, and watch the game.

69Y8T1cZoaZJKSYL9DsGGg.review_text: I like them a lot! i moved to San Francisco with my family almost 15 years ago, and I remember having ridden, or walked past Tommy's Joynt many times. It wasn't until years later when a friend and I were thinking about where to go to dinner and she brought up Tommy's Joynt that I actually ate there for the first time. At this point, I can confidently say that I'm a fan.  My favorite thing on the menu to get is the lamb shanks, available on Thursdays and Sundays. They are so tender, and so flavorful. The boiled potatoes that come with the meal soak up all the yummy juices from the lamb yet still have their natural potato flavor. If I'm free on a Thursday or Sunday and I have the stomach for it, I'm going to Tommy's Joynt and that's what I'm getting. Besides lamb shanks, I also like their chicken and rice, their buffalo chilli, and their turkey sloppy joes.  I only  have a couple issues with the place: The menu basically has no veggie items, so if you're bringing a group of friends, and at least one or two of them are vegetarians, you're in trouble. Additionally, their bathrooms are located upstairs, above the dining area, so if you have mobility issues, that's kind of tough. Other than hose points, I'd say if you're planning on going, be prepared to dine in a packed house 'cause that's what Tommy's Joynt is a majority of the time, especially on weekends.

O8RYLkWNmZYr2HgKWsmwiQ.review_text: The saying 'to have egg on ones face' means you have been left looking embarrassed or foolish.   On our third date, my future wife and I decided to stop into Tommy's Joynt for a beer. We found two seats at the bar and sat down to watch a little of the Giants/Angels World Series and rooted on the Giants. This was before the infamous collapse in game six and well before my wife would learn of my sick and twisted humour and I was still on my best behavior.   As we sat and sipped our beers and exchanged tidbits of information such as "so, where did you go college?" and "I'm a Capricorn" etc etc there was a gentleman seated next to my wife who took a liking to her. He was quite the conversationalist and actually ended up talking to my wife more than me. He was drinking nasty beer and eating hard boiled eggs. As the game went on he continued to drink more and more and became more animated. During the eighth inning and a solid Giants lead he leaned over and smooched my wife on the cheek leaving a little hard boiled egg on her chin.   My wife made the wise decision to ignore the nice man the rest of the evening, but the hard boiled continued to hang off her chin. I didn't want to be rude and bring it up, but looking back I really should have said something.   5 stars for being instrumental in helping me land a spouse.

IDYPYZ-lAwanusQTJf843A.review_text: OMG!!! THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!  After looking at Tommy's for years on end (its right smack in the middle of Van Ness and Geary, you can't miss it!), I finally went it there with a group of friends who highly recommended it. I walk in and see the hofbrau style menu and felt at ease. I love hofbrau style restaurants. Sometimes I just don't feel like dealing with a waiter, sometimes I just wanna grab a tray, grab my food and commence eating without all the sitting around and waiting. I ordered the BBQ beef tri tip sandwich and mashed potatoes. The tri tip was melt in your mouth tender. Seriously, you could cut it with spoon. Oftentimes I am disappointed with tri tip, because it will be tough or stringy, NOT AT THIS PLACE! I happily devoured everything on my plate. Then we started playing with the hot mustard... If you love hot mustard, you must definitely hit up Tommy's! We were dipping all kinds of stuff into it, and seeing how much we could eat before our eyes watered up and our sinuses burned. The bar is awesome, the food is AMAZING, and the atmosphere is really chill. The prices are VERY reasonable as well (a local hofbrau here in San Leandro charges far more for the same things). I highly recommend this place to all who enjoy good hearty food and a kickback place to hang out and eat!

GdJj1npaUyjSF_EZ4Nwu4A.review_text: Tommy's Joynt came in super handy on Wednesday when my baby and I took it upon ourselves to move him outta him apartment.   We were emaciated because we hadn't eaten all day and then moved his crap down 4 flights of stairs...Thankfully, Tommy's was open!    With the hundreds of reviews on this spot, I'm sure there's nothing much more I can add, but, just say that it's like eating a better version of my mom's home cooking (sorry viv!)...Had myself a side of cow with BBQ sauce, green beans, and a green salad. Very basic stuff, but i felt healthier eating this than a quick drive-thru at Jack-in-the-Crack...The green beans were a little mushy like old people's food, but hey, it's something you gotta expect at a Hof Brau....This is a meat lovers haven (such as me!)....  Of course, everyone knows now this is a cash joynt only, and luckily there's a convenient ATM right inside the front door.    I love the atmosphere of this place...there are plenty of locals and regulars and it definitely hasn't changed since I've been coming here for probably over 20 years.  I hope it never changes...I think some of the same people still work there, too! Awesome Tommy's! Keep it going....

HrVfgxaDGv6U9NfKSTsjFQ.review_text: I had stuffing, potatoes, and roast beef.  None of it was great, but i honestly didn't expect it to be.  The gravy was too salty.  The stuffing is mushy.   I liked the pickles.   I actually came here for dinner, which is much earlier than anyone should eat here!  Price isn't bad.

KXw5PSJqOHxKgLzmlAOZZg.review_text: ....gave the extra star because its a good price performer...you have to try it out to see if its your thing...definitely old school place....you sees what you get...plenty of food reasonable....the roast beef, turkey, ham, pastrami piled high makes real good sandwich...the lamb shanks, barbecue or spagetti not so great....all the sides you'll recognize from your high school cafeteria days...definitly not for those who like fancy...

LKlxo98EMCf6w9o-xwo33g.review_text: I visited Tommy's on a recent trip to SF. Thought the place was interesting . The food was great, I had the oxtail stew and was really impressed. The beer selection is first class too. But honestly the little, old, hot, cluttered building just wasn't my think. None the less, I would return in a heartbeat and plan to next trip.

ZSretWXlve11q9hP6SrScQ.review_text: Think back to those family dinners. Dad makes a pot roast. Mom opens up a fresh bag of salad mix and adds a splash of Italian vinaigrette on it. Cousin Bobby opens up a can of green beans and dumps it in a bowl. And for no reason whatsoever, you graced the table with a side of pickles, just because you felt like it. This is Tommy's Joynt. Your typical All-American dining experience for under $12 a serving. People love it. It's been a staple in the city for years. It serves you those favorite dishes you can't always have when you want it. It is what it is. An unpretentious, honest Joynt with wholesome meals.

UMzVMDf9CVCwbubOnO6Q5A.review_text: Thanksgiving and Halloween are both my favorite holidays. Halloween is about imagination, creativity and fun (and for some, being slutty). Thanksgiving is like Christmas, without the giving, commercialism, and unnecessary consumerism. It's all about family, being grateful, and eating till you can't breath. I love November because I have dreams about turkey, stuffing, mash potatoes, mac and cheese, and GRAVY. Tommy's Joynt IS Thanksgiving. From the red checkered table cloth to the mounds of meat swimming in ladles of gravy, it made me even more excited for Thanksgiving. I got the dinner plate BBQ brisket with a side of mash potatoes and it was seriously American food heaven. I told my boyfriend I'm coming here every month just so I can enjoy Thanksgiving EVERY MONTH.

ZwkqKwSASAVHCFsz3-oZmQ.review_text: Is this SF's answer to the delis in New York?  If so, I'm hopeful.  With a very laid back ambiance where people go to have a hearty sandwich and watch the game in addition to an easily accessible location, Tommy's Joynt has the right stuff for me to visit more often.  They have a huge selection of sandwiches and meat plates that I was curious about, though I eventually settled on the corned beef sandwich.  Compared to Schwartz's in Montreal and the ones I've been to in New York, it's right up there.  Melting in your mouth, the corned beef is cooked just right and loves mustard (though watch out for the spicy mustard since it's practically equivalent to wasabi).  Tried the girlfriend's turkey sloppy joe sandwich, which was also great, though closely resembled a pulled pork sandwich.  For those looking for a traditional sloppy joe, you won't get it here.

OQK28bwSw05DinW6UGOeQA.review_text: This was my first time to Tommy's, and it was a bit disappointing. I've heard great things about it, and was eager to try it. For starters, it's not exactly your sit-down-and-order restaurant. You simply order your food from behind a glass counter, pay for it, then you grab your own seats.  I went for the corn beef sandwich with a side of potato salad. The sandwich was overly simple: 1 piece of corn beef between a hard, distasteful sourdough roll, nothing else. It comes with a warm sauce you can pour or dip the sandwich into (maybe to soften the hard roll), but the sauce itself was very bland.  The corn beef may have been overcooked, as it was a bit gummy. The potato salad, however, was pretty decent. The upside of this place is the affordability, as my meal totaled to about only $9.

7tX7nTYGHr7sM2L8-wlMjA.review_text: It would take a Hannibal Lecter dolly/restraint contraption to keep me away from this meat counter. And the drinks are cheap and strong, just as I like myself.

9078t6D0VnSnIqmcpyyhpQ.review_text: Let me just start by saying I'm not a fan of stringy beef or roast or any kind of stew.  I think that is why I wasn't impressed with this place.  I actually love the sharing of tables and pickles out of the large jar and horseradish on the tables.  All those things add to the experience.  Thankfully we got here just before the dinner rush so I had a little time to look at the meats and decide what I wanted.  I went with the pastrami sandwich.  The meat was nice and red with a dark crust.  The bread was soft and yummy.  I'm pretty picky so I wasn't impressed with their sides.  I went with the bland mashed potatoes.  My brother ordered the roast beef, but it was a little over cooked.      Overall, the pastrami was good, but I didn't see any other meats that grabbed my attention.  Oh and soda refills are $1.75 so don't be like me and chug down your soda and expect a free refill :(.

MCm2nJs2tO0Hy_h1enIAQA.review_text: A hearty san Francisco favorite!  I've been living within a 10 block radius from tommys for 4 years and I think I've been there a good 25 times by now.  The food is just soooo gooooood.. Like mum cooks it with gravy and potatos.. Healthy? Not even a little - not a place to go when you're on a diet-  there's not a single healthy option.. But its tommys joint  so if that's an issue don't come here..  Thursdays / Sunday's lamb shank is one of the best dishes I've ever had it's simply amazing - and for 10$ whaaat?? For 2 huge lamb shanks.. Insane.  The pastrami is cooked perfectly - every time.. A rueben sandwich with sourkraut when they have it, best rueben sandwich I've ever had. Incomparably.   The turkey dinner - a big portion of perfectly whole roasted turkey, awesome stuffing and thick thick gravy.. Omg it's like a lovechild between Christmas and thanksgiving in Disneyland on newyears eve, getting laid... Yes- that good.   The buffalo chili is awesome also.!   Tommys also have one of te biggest beer selections in the city which goes great with the hearty food.   A must go place to visit if youre passing by san Francisco..

EJpLxWXUFK5nTJe5RnwSCQ.review_text: I'm a native of SF and love this place. Their lamb shank is the bomb, my husband loves the brisket and my stepson loves the pastrami. Great prices and great food. I get kinda bummed with the negative reviews because in all my years of living here, I would never give this place, of all places a negative review.

KV_uYHnsgA-hrh1A7BuIAA.review_text: The food is good and cheap. You get huge portions for such a decent price there isn't a way you can't like it really. The meat is cooked well and is tasty. The atmosphere is one of a kind which is fun. This isn't the healthiest place to eat but great for late nights.  Great HorseRaddish Sauce!!!

E5Fbnoe5f5a74A5auXjiBg.review_text: Fresh hot meat and a beer ta boot.  I'm pretty sure this is what the waiting room for heaven must be like.  The meat is mouth watering and the beer selection is vast and delicious.  The only downfall is it's a dive bar, but not your everyday, run-of-the-mill dive bars.  Tommy's is kind of a tourist attraction dive bar, in that at first it came naturally, but now it's over crowded with folks who just want the check-in.

HB0OEby4sXYE8hUqYY5Blw.review_text: Came here because of Yelp reviews. It does have lots of old western charm, like step into a 30s-40s movie scene of western bar/hotel. Staffs are very friendly. Food is very inexpensive. Cash only. We ordered 2 sandwiches and a side dish, totals $17 (dinner).  My corned beef sandwich is bit of too salty to me.

_i3uTqtUfyVZDryKzUGGiw.review_text: A seedy sports bar with a meat-cafeteria that carves a hefty slab sandwich and scoops plenty of comfort on the side.

d4XRbSDTcAffeIBPsONPHw.review_text: Good food and beer.  2 stars cause they wouldnt let my dog in to get a burger and a beer on his birthday!  Whats the world come to when a man and his best friend cant walk into a bar together?  Reminds me of the dirty south n segregation! "Dawgs gonna have to eat aut baaack!"  This is frisco, where anything goes, wtf?

6hQLwF5NU_57JA_AjBd7Ig.review_text: Still excellent after all these years. A bit more 'crowd control' but the food's good - and that's what counts. (Buffalo stew, June 2013)

eL9CR1oxghmW8MyP5duxbw.review_text: I have updated my review because I've now been to Tommy's several times for the food, and it is good, cheap, filling and plentiful.  Great Herb Caen style ambiance, too. And the "Corned Beef Cocktails" sign still makes me laugh.

DHs8No90RxNP6EQHHNEZvg.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is much like a Hoffbrau House. You stand in line and pick what you want. I'll give this place 5 stars because there's no place like it, it has great food, and its 'World Famous"! How can you not give it 5 stars-it says it right on the building!   I did my research online before I went..I decided to go for the Roast Beef sandwitch. Don't get me wrong...I love meat, but I wasn't in the mood for Turkey and gravy just yet...Its only April. I was not let down. I grabbed my sandwich, and a side of mashed potatoes w/ gravy and some macaroni salad. My BF got a Roast Beef sandwich too. The sandwiches were about $6.50 and the sides were $2.50 each. $19 total for both meals. We sat ourselves and loaded our sandwiches with horseradish and spicy mustard they have out on the tables. BE CAREFEUL-the horseradish will get you. Use sparingly, unless you want to clear your sinuses.   A waitress came to help us with drinks. We ordered a 'nutty Irishman' and a tall Paulsner Hefenweisen from Germany. I went to Munich last summer. I must say, its great. $4.50 for draft, $3.50 for bottles and $6.00 for the cocktail.
