The waitress was great. CASH ONLY for the bar too.   All and all, I can't wait to go back. Very casual with a rustic/tavern feel.   My recommendation: Roast Beef sandwich with Mashed potatoes. Skip the Macaroni salad. Try one of their 100 beers! They are great and from all over the world!

Eypq5gLLjCapBVVnMw_MyA.review_text: I wouldn't say the food is good per se. I would say it's open super late and when your stomach is a cauldron of booze sloshing around, a turkey enchilada has a way of calming your churning seas. And you can actually add more booze to the mix while you're at it.  So I think there's some clear utility there.

GO0GU6sTOdgtUpAwzj1Tbg.review_text: While It might seem like a tourist trap I can assure it is not this place has a lot of tradition.   Original setting with decent large size food.   My favorite thing is the buffalo stew in a cold day.

5zedlY3ie4YFTD5uGZXPsg.review_text: Not a bad place if you want a good sloppy joe or a pastrami sandwich, and with the amount of food they give you for the price its a pretty decent deal. The only thing I did not enjoy was the pushy waitress wanting ever so desperately get your drink ordered once you sat down at the tables. The location is also pretty convenient to get around SF as well too. I would definitely return again!

mrvQ9LTjEMrs5-5sOLixHQ.review_text: I used to love this place for its food and cheap drinks, and now I love it more because the younger kids that work there as bartenders  have been to my bar with great respect and are very kind. I love this place even more... Good food good drinks good people

mx-dFZZ75kGi9aQk0vY4Pw.review_text: Had lunch here today.  Really good corned beef sandwich for a good price.  I couldn't even eat the whole thing and I'm a big eater.  Also had the potato salad which was good but not great.  A nice, low-key place to get big portions for a good price.  I'll probably come back here again unless I end up passing out in a food coma.

sWQrST7UQEZb5WGej2lUXQ.review_text: The food is hardy and cheap, the place is dirty, and the people working and eating at Tommy's Joint look rough.  I had pastrami and a salad. My friend had chicken and rice. Uh La We is about all I can say after a late lunch.  If it wasn't for the fact I was starving to death after a marathon meeting nearby I would have gone to Mel's Diner across the street, but I had to try this place out just once since hamburgers and fries are not on my diet.  Just once is all you need to determine I am not losing my mind and Tommy's Joynt should be at the bottom of your to do list while in downtown SF.

yc-QI1dVIMWvjP9ZadqI9g.review_text: What a gem of San Francisco. First of all, we got four dishes and spent only $30. But I would have paid at least $40 for this food.  The corned beef with potatoes and cabbage was my favorite. It's nothing fancy--that's the best part. Keep it simple and rustic. The chili was super duper hearty. The ribs, well--the ribs can't compare to Texas ribs.  Then there was the enchilada. The pulled turkey enchilada. I mistook if for a pulled pork enchilada for the first 1/2 of this beast. It was so moist!  Go here and feast your heart out.

gjF9IHmY4mNAysaSIALmQA.review_text: A SF classic from what I understand. The food portions are generous but we found our sides needed salt and were a little bland. The hot mustard on the table is hot and delicious. I knew nothing about their signature pickle jar til I was there but damn, those pickles were tasty :-)  Nice people, ok food, enough hanging from the wall and ceilings for you to spend at least an hour looking around.

PzJMGL-kbjCWtJ1fEyqTIw.review_text: Great homestyle food, healthy portions, cheap prices, friendly staff and bartenders.  My only problem was that it was packed, and well - packed!  I had the lamb shank, REALLY GOOD.  The potatoes and carrots were ok, the gravy was ok.  A bit of pepper brought it to light.  Hard to please everyone, but the lamb shank itself was REALLY GOOD.  Great beer variety, a bartender that hustles, and all for a nice price.  Cash Only!  The only way to fly....  :)  I guess they consider vegans and credit cards in the same way.  An available option - but for the most part completely unnecessary in this life.  :)

qbpmxjeunJjolTT7fZEfvQ.review_text: Cool place, good food, shitty, shitty bar manager.  The pitcher of beer that we received tasted metallic so we asked for a different pitcher, like there was something wrong with the keg itself.  I drink this beer all the time so I know what it taste like.  The bar manager told me I was wrong, then he told me there was nothing wrong with the keg and refuses to replace the pitcher.  Finally, once he claims, it's a whole pitcher of beer, and I said yes, yes it is, why am I going to drink a whole pitcher of shitty beer, he offers to replace it.  After letting me try the next beer, which there is nothing wrong with it, he stomps off to get my pitcher and comes back, slamming it down.  Good good, good place, too bad the long haired, bad attitude, shitty bar manager put a damper on our time there.

Mppd6g6at6sK1YFfBr6JGw.review_text: If you're looking for something hearty and filling, this is it.  When you walk in, the seating arrangement looks intimidating.. just sit in the back or go upstairs. You'll get the TV to yourself and there's way less people up there. Unfortunately, you miss the bar stool flops..  Anyways, I always like the: -BBQ Brisket Dinner -Turkey Dinner -Polish Sandwich (mmm try their mustards) -Coleslaw -Green beans  Don't like: -Macaroni salad

50Y5cY2uEGFyteJy1s4c6Q.review_text: We love Tommy's Joyint but tonight was a real disappointment.  The Lasagna was tasteless and starchy!  Yukkkee

tGgTIueZy1JNTzQD9rkZLQ.review_text: 05.21.10  Turn back time for a second and imagine yourself, possibly in middle school.  You get in a cafeteria line, the lunch lady slops food on your plate, you put it on your tray, pay, and find a table, hopefully with the cool crowd instead of at a corner by yourself.  Talk about flashbacks.  That's what Tommy's Joynt did for me.  $8.75 roast beef dinner plate, with mashed potatoes, gravy, and potato salad.  Seems like a good deal, if I could have finished my meal.  Even when drenched in sauce, the roast beef was dry and chewy.  The potato salad was watery.  The only redeeming quality to the dinner was the mashed potato.  They have waiters walking around taking drink orders.  Seems quite inefficient to order food in line and then sit down to order drinks, but I digress.  I guess I didn't give it a good chance from the start...but what can I do when my friend told me he's seen rats there and that's haunted me forever?

zI7kWGZylRU8l9aUXI80Jw.review_text: Horrific....are you serious 4.85 for 2 meatballs slapped on an open bad bread with meat sauce? I expected better, yes no need for tips but still. It was a cool experience and the workers were nice. However, for this price I don't expect stinginess.

HYj_nLaZdOw41Hs-jHpnqA.review_text: AMAZING PLACE! My favorites are the chili and the beef tenderloin. It's super affordable and a good portion size. Don't be deterred by the line when you get there - it moves rather fast and beats sitting down at a restaurant and waiting for them to take your order. You help yourself to water, but there are waitresses that will stop by occasionally taking drink orders.

ZSiydwsztUeiN6mEUFBCjg.review_text: BBQ beef brisket, cheesecake and more... OH YEAH!

vsSzUpUa6PuMfzL8LgVDNA.review_text: I honestly love this place. I have been there twice and love the ambiance of this place with the picnic table type group seating (but with chairs not benches), the eclectic style and awesome food.  Since I m a big meat loving fan and this style of food and doesn t hurt that the food (at least the meat parts) is very good and they give heaping portions, so bring your appetite! I most recently got bbq brisket, with mashed potatoes and roll it was amazing and I was stuffed afterwards.  There is also a fully stocked bar with a really good choice of basically anything you want.  I have never left this place unhappy or unsatisfied and my life is much more happier after I have eaten here.

_z139NJsVhq7gT4Bl13QtA.review_text: Stopped by Tommy's Joynt on our last night in San Francisco. I saw them on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives and the reviews on yelp looked good, so we thought we'd give it a try.  This place has major character and the prices are so cheap! We only had to wait in line for 10-15 minutes, even though the line was out the door. You order food cafeteria style and their menu is posted behind the counter. I ordered the Turkey Enchilada with beans and my husband had the BBQ Brisket. Everything was great, and huge portions (especially the enchilada). The enchilada was stuffed with shredded turkey meat and topped with a sauce that reminded me more of gravy than a Mexican enchilada sauce. I think the beans were kidney beans and it also came with white rice.   My hubby loved his brisket. The BBQ sauce wasn't your typical BBQ, but was a thinner and more tangy sauce.  Glad we stopped by this "dive."

752L3RhkU4FIm35HfN3yUA.review_text: I was trying my best to love this place more!! The atmosphere alone gets 4 stars from me and I'm SURE the food is great...  sadly...  I was there on a day when they over-salted the Buffalo Stew.  :-(   It was actually hard to eat but I wasn't about to start a ruckus... The meat was very dry and chewy and I couldn't tell you if the sauce was any good it was SO, SO salty.  Mark my words... I WILL RETURN!!  to try a sandwich...

nVK5ZZ9IDjUX1WFJzzbYKg.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is probably the strongest new addition in the crowded raw/vegan farm to table genre that San Francisco has to offer.  It's so bright and friendly and just leaves you with a feel-good vibe.  As a bonus, all the staff is toned and attractive and looks like they just got out of the yoga studio.    Some of the best items on the menu are the "turkey dinner" and the "brisket."  All the dishes have these tongue in cheek names that are throws to traditional meat-eating fare.  Last time I was there I had the "buffalo chili" that is served on a steaming bowl of what I imagine to be brown rice.  Everything is served with what must be a gluten-free "dinner roll."  Amazing.  They also have a fully vegetarian bar and a few dozen beers from all over the world!  It's so great to be able to visualize the global village when looking at the drink menu.

JhHo2-fej5do28snWXSSnQ.review_text: Buffalo stew, cold beers and baseball games on the TV. What more do you need in a restaurant? I mean, you can eat buffalo here, people.   Its the kind of place where you might want to tuck a napkin in your shirt collar, under your chin. This is where Al Bundy would take Peg for a nice dinner out.  Also probably where Norm and Cliff ate lunch before heading over to Cheers. And I kind of like that.

Z0PbG7lIuiQDa6SOBS4ozw.review_text: Lacking in service after sitting down. Otherwise, excellent atmosphere and top of the line food

KVoYCx8tvlxxAqEi2jZ5fA.review_text: This place has quality quality meat! If you're looking for something that is filling but reasonably priced in SF, this is your place!  I had the Lamb Shanks and they were very tasty. The meat fell off of the bone and the gravy complemented it perfectly! The potatoes were yummy too.  My college roommate got the corned beef sandwich and that meat was so very tasty as well. They are known for their corned beef!

MGrNMMePj0kw-6LIL1SflQ.review_text: Janey and I dropped by at four am after a show. Dancing for four hours we were ravenous and devoured the salmon and rice plate. I know, ordering fish at a BBQ place?! The truth is, it was the only thing we could afford. CASH only people! We pooled our change and crumpled dollars together and that's all we could get, but it was still delicious! Now that tells you something

gtJ6CQne-0BCUMiXOBvq2Q.review_text: It's terrible that I have to drive 2 hours from home to eat at this fantastic establishment, but thats exactly what me and my husband did. The place looks like such a hole in the wall, but the food is so tasty that it received national recognition on the show Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives, hosted by Guy Fieri.  Of course, we had to try the legendary ox tail here over a bed of steaming rice pilaf. The meat was succulent and tender. It's got a really high fat content, but I'm one of those people who enjoys the fat as much as the meat. The sauce it was drenched it was slightly sweet, and really made the dish perfect. We also ordered a dinner plate of BBQ beef brisket with a side of mashed potatoes, all soaked in the best BBQ sauce I've tasted in a very long time. It's almost unbelievable how tender the brisket was. It was literally falling apart like shredded beef. To top it off, they slice it from a huge hunk of meat right in front of you. They definitely don't skimp on anything here. My mashed potatoes were heavenly. The best ones I've had that weren't made in my own home. Really fluffy, yet starchy.  All this amazing food for under $30 (cash only, but there's an ATM machine inside). It's a fantastic deal.

evnyfXDWW39FI3NUYU1fFQ.review_text: Was in the area to meet up with friends for dinner on new years eve. We were a bit early so we walked around and decided to get a beer at Tommy's Joynt since my trusty Yelp iPhone app told me people dig this place.  There was a line of people waiting to get food there...I dunno if it's because it was new years eve? or the food's really that good. well...it looked good...  we sat at the bar. the bartender's really nice. we only had one drink there though. If I ever end up being in the area it would be a choice place for a couple beers and to watch games!  Ohhh and I saw a signed poster with that guy, Guy, from Food Network's Diner, Dives, and Drive-Ins...he gave a pretty good rating for the place...if Guy likes it, me likey too!!

fm-axmyWFvlM8AMFVs6pwQ.review_text: Five star dining for the thrifty but how can they pile on the goodness for a great price. Basically, great value great prices. My favorite was the Turkey dinner with all trimmings. Going dark with the meat is the way to go. Brisket is just cooked right but strangely enough I love the boulders that they give out with your dinner. These little river rock-like breads are great for trailing the gravy or dig out the inners and use the shell to make a turkey or brisket-wich with the salad. You can get so creative on a busy night and throw it at a waitress so that you can get your re-fill of diet coke. J/K all in all the line is out the door the food is plentiful and the folks there are straight up nice. Everything a restaurant should be so tip kindly at this all cash establishment.

k7fUNPAGinUKwGf0EGkOJQ.review_text: We came here twice for dinner during our most recent visit.  The food is very good, they have long hours, and it's reasonable.  I had the dinner each time, first, the BBQ Brisket, which was great, and then the corned beef.  I had sides of mashed potatoes and green beans; later, salad and potato salad.  The BBQ Brisket was really good. The bar is also pretty decent.  It's not a fancy place, you select your food and pay "cafeteria style"- but for grubbing after drinking, and not making your stomach weird in the morning, this is a reliably good option.  Thanks Tommy's Joynt! PS- Cash only.

NcduWbcQg8psL1Iht8JBtg.review_text: love their roast beef sandwiches double dipped, i always get a few. ! their  lunch and dinners are good .they have roast beef dinners and lamb on Thursday and one other day. they do have potatoe salad which is pretty good .

mdCAsnSP3uCH2859UYW66A.review_text: ate here for the first time on sunday, and it was good. I had their special which was the burgundy beef and he had the bbq brisket. BRISKET was juciy and tender! my burgundy beeef was dry :( but the sauce was good. If i go back next time, im only ordering the briket!!!

At78xFTRNPfjR_pGD4ILKA.review_text: WOW!  This place is in your face and straight to the point.  This Joint will never win any gourmet food contests, but if want good hearty fare at a reasonable price, this Tommy should not be taken for a boy.  I have been there twice since moving to the city.  The brisket is tender, the roast beef is a crimson medium rare.  Believe it or not, the buffalo chili actually made me smack my mother.  Just about anything you could ever want as a comfort food, they have it.  Plus they have a bar with  HUGE selection of imports.    This really isn't the place to come for fillet Mignon and professional waiter.  It's cafeteria style, and right down to business.  Remember to bring cash though, they do not take credit.  An atm is conveniently located inside.    All in all, a great mid week/food with the buddies type of place.  This place can get crowded during peak hours so plan accordingly.  The next time you are looking for a plate with a slab of meat, covered with gravy/au jus/love juice, roll into Tommy's joint.

sBQHJzPlQYVdwjEeqtvgrQ.review_text: Me: "What's the best Sandwich" Server: "Brisket" Me: "Okay"   Best decision I've made in a while. Loved every part of this sandwich! I got it with the sourdough roll & it did not disappoint! It also comes with a lovely (and generous portioned) side of bbq sauce that moistens up the sandwich to your liking! The meat was very good, cooked almost to perfection (if I had any complaint, it would be that it could be a tiny bit more moist), and it went oh so well with the sourdough & sauce. I also added some pickles to my sandwich which made it even better.   They seem like they have a great selection of entree items to choose from, as well as daily specials. The atmosphere is very informal, a little on the loud side, and sort of just goes well with the food they serve. The bathrooms are upstairs and have an interesting vending machine - $.75 pleasure toys - random, but whatever.  If I am every craving bbq, this will definitely be my go-to place in SF! Love, love, love.

IWal1ziP1AlfcgDJj5CKFw.review_text: Stopped by for the second time in a week on Wednesday night to have a corned beef sandwich.  The slices were thick and a little fatty, hand carved in front of you.  It is served on a roll.  They put a pitcher of jus on the plate too, but I don't use jus on my corned beef sandwiches.  Nice option though.  The corned beef was hot too - all in just an awesome sandwich with a lot of meat.   $6 including tax.  Draft beer pints are only $4.50  Good beer selection overall too.  This time instead of clueless midwestern tourists there were clueless European tourists.  They couldn't figure out that you order and pay at the counter and the waitress service is for beverages.  Lots of cameras, fanny packs and perplexed expressions.  Tommy's must be in guidebooks.

zAIEb830WkTzWIUQbuzilQ.review_text: If you're ever hungry during the day and need something that can put you back to bed then Tommy's is your place! Affordable, plentiful, and great service. The spare ribs and mashed potatoes we're awesome, and the food coma that followed it was worth it.

GY9WzjOSTc7wEqaJyzLBwQ.review_text: I had the BBQ brisket. The meat was tender but a little too fatty. The BBQ was standard BBQ sauce so nothing special. I wanted the mashed potatoes but they weren't real. The guy suggested what looked liked boiled potatoes. They didn't taste like anything. My guess is they were canned. Didn't like the flavor of the coleslaw. The roll was good. I'm giving it a 3 instead of a 2 because I probably would have liked it better if I had just had a sandwich.

fAuVSJ7G4XSTKXlkH1MQQQ.review_text: hahaha...funny why anyone would not give Tommy's (and/or Lefty's) a solid.  They are so the STARS of that category.  Easy going, no pretenses, friendly, funny, go as you serve or serve as you go, TV, noise, histories...all of that!  What more can anyone ask 4?!  Say, enjoy yourself, casual, be a friendly "cool" guest, maybe you'll even get a tip of the hat here or there... Cheers!

-s4IChK4wC5gbBn8PW91VA.review_text: This place, for one, was supposedly established in 1947 (pretty sure that's what the painting said). If that doesn't say something about the place, I'm don't know what does. You get the feeling that it has history, like it's truly a staple of San Francisco.   Tommy's Joynt has been my go-to late night spot for a few years now. I always order one of their $6 sandwiches on a sourdough with a beer, never fails. The meat is delicious and the price can't be beat. I recommend the BBQ Beef sandwiches, but I was looking at their daily specials menu and it looked pretty bomb.   Tommy's Joynt is a great place to hang with friends and family, making it a great place for people of all ages.  Fun Fact: Pretty sure I saw 49ers Safety, Donte Whitner there one time. Pretty awesome

PQQRHNEwX6gn649d0-atiw.review_text: I wrestled between giving Tommy's 3.5 or 4 stars. I settled on 4. Tommy's is not a Gary Denko's or Boulevard's. It's an old style Hof  Brau, the likes of which have pretty much become extinct. As a Hof Brau, Tommy's succeeds. The food is decently cooked and filling. The staff is also quite pleasant, an absolute requirement for this style of restaurant. On my first visit I had the turkey. However, the star may be the brisket, which I plan to order on my next visit.

QPhKwoNEGYzIeidIOh-5gQ.review_text: Every time I come to this place I feel like a 55 year old man, with a beer belly (and I mean that in a good way).   For a couple beers and some meat and potatoes, this is the spot. They have a bar on one side and the food "bar" when you walk in. You can almost always find a table and you'll never be over dressed.

Z8Q6AZm63tM3eLz8vmdk9w.review_text: We recently made a trip to Tommy's Joynt. Hah, the deliberate misspelling of joynt bothers me a bit, but whatever. I'm not here to review spelling and mechanics.   I ordere the BBQ beef sandwich on sour dough bread. It's good, but I'm sure there are better ones out there.. somewhere. I guess it's pretty good for SF standards. Juicy, tender beef with BBQ sauce on the side. It's cheap food, so I can't complain much. I guess the only thing is feeling slightly guilty for eating so much meat... poor cows.   Finally, side note.. this place is cash only!

taPq7IxYskEWH7Vfc261pQ.review_text: Maybe I am just not used to these scenes, but I just felt dirty being in this place.  I guess Tommy's Joynt is classified as a dive?  It has two stories for seating, and you get served cafeteria style out front on the first floor.  The food is very American - sloppy Joe's, lasagna, country fried steak, those kinds of foods.  Prices were okay, expect at least $8 for a meal.  I got the lasagna - the portions were hefty but I didn't think the flavor was anything special.  In fact, I felt it could have used some more flavor.  The clientele here seemed really strange - somewhat seedy looking people who also tended to be extremely loud.  Not my type of crowd here.

uaQW0HU1MV2jJ7rdl9vYqQ.review_text: Grab your tray and stand in line for some of the best grub SF has to offer.  This gem is the home of Metallica and some of the best carved turkey in town.   It's Thanksgiving year round @ Tommy's.  Great lodgey feel, come here for some good cheap comfort food.  There is a dining room upstairs that you can grab a seat if the room downstairs is full, which is probably the case.   Tip: AMC is right across the street if your looking for a place to nap after your meal.

aZ6j5wyq4oda4h4IiLJwcw.review_text: Total meat & potatoes kinda place.  You walk in, get in line, pick up a cafeteria style tray of food, and feast.  Definitely a no-fuss place and the lights are probably dim for a reason.  But hey, good, inexpensive, quality food.  Oh, and cash only, so make sure you're ready.  I still need to go back and try the lamb shank.

hkHq1VJn38h_xjlOCcSnsg.review_text: Order the beef brisket -- its delicious and it melts in your mouth.  Awesome.  Oh, this is one of those places where you sit with strangers so be prepared.

vaWX1JUG28HVRG9FmJ78KQ.review_text: Tied for first as my favorite restaurant in SF. It doesn't get any better. Excellent beer selection. The food is off the hook. I usually get the bbq brisket, double meat, bean salad, mashed potatoes...but I've eaten pretty much everything they've had on the menu over the last twenty years. The bounty is a cool hangout, but also fine to take the family to. Be warned, it can get loud here, but that's ok. The ambience and food are worth it. When I go with my family, I usually eat upstairs. When I go to hang out...downstairs by the bar.  Did I mention the great prices?  Try the buffalo chili...delicious!

W_Rslro-7kRSGTcofKcwog.review_text: Ummmm love this place...Food here is good and served in generous portions by the same guys for like centuries. I ate here before I even lived in SF (came here twice on vacation previously), and the place has been pretty much the same forever. The meat dishes are THE best.  The beer selection is stellar, and both that and the cocktails are dirt cheap. The ambiance is perfect, and it seems like all the servers and staff are pretty cool. It's even better in the daytime, when it's not so crowded.  A true SF landmark. May TJ's live on into infinity!

lCRntv4-tXaM052bYxmCyA.review_text: Another classic joint in the city; I don't know how many times I've passed by Tommy's and just gave it a quick glance. I didn't think too much of it for awhile, mainly because I wasn't sure if I could venture into the place by myself.   So, last week, I came here finally, TWICE, with my younger brother. He had heard about Tommy's Joynt from the Food Network, and he was lucky that I knew the location of the place so well (he just threw out the question, "Do you know where Tommy's Joynt is?" since we were hungry and I guess his curiosity got the best of him). We came here first on a Tuesday, around 5 or so.   When we walked in, we were a bit confused about how to order, or if we were to be seated by someone or not. I think we might have stood at the entrance for a good five minutes trying to understand the concept of the place (and also trying to get our bearings with the menu, which is splattered all over the wall in colorful signs); finally, my brother asked the man behind the counter, "Uh, do we seat ourselves, or....?" and the guy smiled and replied, "You order right here."  We were indeed lucky that nobody else was waiting behind us; my brother asked the guy for a recommendation since I assume he felt overwhelmed with all the choices. The menu is indeed a meat-lover's heaven and a vegetarian's hell: meat, meat, everywhere. Daily specials are posted, although you can order these specials any day of the week as well (with the same price, I think). There's an abundance of sandwiches, classic entrees such as buffalo stew, turkey leg, and chili. Everything is under $10, which is a real steal! You could come here and eat dinner for less than $10; the bar is extensive as well with all kinds of drinks.   There are also salads, although they're more or less the less-healthy kind. The only menu item that seems a little over-priced is dessert: there are only four items (apple pie, carrot cake, cheesecake, chocolate cake), and they're all store-bought cake. $2.75 for a slice; not really a deal considering the slices aren't huge like the entrees. You're better off skipping the dessert here; focus on the entrees themselves!  My brother went with pasta dishes both times, once with braised oxtails, the other time with meatballs. I went with a knockwurst sandwich the first time around; on Wednesday, I tried the broiled ground chuck steak sandwich (the special for the day). Both meals were very filling; surprisingly, the food wasn't overly greasy. Ordering at the front counter was an experience in itself: they carve the meat fresh in front of you and show you how they prepare it all. It's a feast for the eyes indeed.  My brother loved his meals so much that he took home extra food both times we were there. It's not food that I eat much of these days, but I wouldn't mind coming to Tommy's for cheap and good food from time to time.   A small aside: the bathrooms are located strangely on the top floor. Follow the signs (like a treasure hunt!), go up the stairs, and ladies, be careful of the way the second floor seems to funnel into the men's bathroom by default; the ladies' room is located on the other side of the stall (you'll see what I mean when you come here).  The decor emits a long-gone era with the various memorabilia on the walls. Some may find the decor appalling/distracting, but it gives me a sense of strange nostalgia. I'm not even that old, but it's nice to see a classic place like this still standing around.   Cash only, so be sure to withdraw some money at your bank's ATM before you treat yourself to some food at Tommy's.

LdyVNZyPl6vR0THDPw5zIQ.review_text: buffalo chili and rice!  sitting in the dark! lots and lots of beers! a work out to rip a piece of bread! it's cheap! cash only!

DDYzPldx4_s8h0SYfA6enw.review_text: Sometimes the wait here can be atrocious. We arrived at 7pm on Friday (12/30/10) and waited about 25 minutes to be served... cafeteria style.  The food is good, and I will definitely return!  Expect about $10 for a dinner-plate, which consists of the main dish, one salad-type side and a cooked sidedish (such as mashed potatoes).  The cole slaw here is very sweet and unmatched in taste. Yum!

aBz6JLs2yIJ9uZO1PrXrfw.review_text: When I go out of town, I try to eat where the locals go and I think I did good this time. This place has some really good sandwiches. carved roast beef or carved turkey.  The selection of beers from around the world was incredible too. Great bar, really good martinis.

mxrAnnJDalCLB9A4bZzqRQ.review_text: Sooo good their cornbeef, their hot mustard maybe be a bit spicy. service is good - any beer you can think of they have, only problem i have is that the place looks like its going to collapse any minute, maybe need a face lift - but then again it won't be tommys joynt, overall exceptional food for exceptional price! AND they're fast about it

sAZVaG3iYthfmoh2jPyqqg.review_text: You can seriously have a full on comfort food meal and a beer for $10 here. There's so many things to choose from. It's delicious and filling. After you eat here you just want to curl up into a little ball and fall asleep.  Minus one star for the gross bathroom.

Z2AuC5sWT4mjPgt2ga7S0Q.review_text: Ok so I've been eating very healthy as of late and one night I'm dragged into what is called Tommy's Joynt.    Off the bat I had the feeling that I wouldn't like it.  The menu read Karim you will gain 10 pounds before you leave here tonight.   I sat down at a table with the friends and then got in lne to get food. I haven't stood in line to get food in a very long time and I was just a little nervous about ordering some of the meats I saw the cooks chopping up on the chopping block.  I got the Salmon. It looked it was slow baked all day  but edible. I also got a side of mash potatoes and some broccli salad.   Surprisingly everything was good minus the broccli salad and I'm still trying to figure out how that went so wrong.  I guess the only thing I didn't like is that I couldn't pay with a card! I've gottten to the point where I barely carry cash these day. Then to have to go to the ATM that wasn't a BofA atm kind of hurt my soul when I'm trying to hold on to money even $2 measly dollars.   But I had a cool time standing line and looking at the super crazy menus hanging from the wall and what nots.   Go check them out!

v4SKLl-nN77kIzg0OJkakA.review_text: Everyday a different dish, american food , this time meaning Not fast food. I tried the lamb ,and chili beans and were excellent. I try a beer which now is a fav, boont amber summertice. And the nicest part, is a relatively cheap food place.

8xubwsU_9t3QmHzxTghdlg.review_text: Tommy's is sort of like an Old School lunch line... Kind of like before buffets were the slopfest they've become. It's an old school smorgasbord of good eatin' and good company. Always some sort of crowd here. You should get there before 11 to get the best choice cuts of their hand carved brisket and roast beef. When the Lunch line style dining is over, you can sit in and order from their menu. Tommy's is like Cheers in that it's an old school spot with tons of memorabilia adorning the walls. Lotsa wood, with brass in need of a good polish. Everyone does not know your name here. SF is a transient city and Tommy's is at a very visible main location on Van Ness & Geary. The food is juicy good. Bring a bib.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: An Oldie BUT Goodie...  As much as I like dining with crisp white linens savoring on foie gras and wagyu capped off with a souffle, sometimes I crave something cheap, simple and down home. Tommy's totally delivers on this front.   I've avoided coming back to Tommy's for the longest time (almost 3 years) and as soon as arrived this past Tuesday, the same man who works behind counter said, "Whoa! I use to see you every Saturday night...2 spare rib dinners; one with sauce and one without." I didn't need to be reminded, but I was surprised that he even remembered me especially with the sheer volume of people that come in/out here everyday. This man (with a black mustache) has always been so nice and always wears a warm smile around his face, so I'm dedicating this updated review to him.   If you don't like meat, steer far away from Tommy's. It's a Carniwhore's Dream: Roast Chicken, Jumbo Turkey Legs, Buffalo Stew, Corned Beef, Brisket, Roast Beef, Pastrami, Spare Ribs, Oxtail, Lamb Shank, etc. There are static daily specials but being a loyal customer (now a return customer) for almost 7 years, my ultimate favs are the following:  *BRAISED OXTAILS (Monday Special): Three hunks of fall-off-the bone oxtails that are so soft that it literally melts in your mouth. As much as I love Chinese oxtails, Tommy's got 'em beat!  *BEEF SHORT RIBS (Tuesday Special): A thick cut of rib with meat so tender that it flakes off with your fork.   *BBQ SPARE RIBS (Saturday Special): Thick, fatty cuts of spare ribs with succulently juicy meat with a tangy and subtle smokiness.   (Please note: Consistency in meat texture varies, so go during peak times when there is a quicker turnaround with the meat and hot trays.)  I always opt to get the rice pilaf instead of the pasta because the rice soaks up all the rich, savory sauce making each bite ohhh, so comforting. Make sure to say, "YES, to the bread!" The sourdough roll is crusty with a great toothsome chew and with soft, pillowly center. It's SO good that it rivals most of the breads served at fine dining restaurants.   Everything is under $11 and portions are MASSIVE (enough for two meals). And they say, I'm not a cheap date? PSHHHHH!  P.S. - If you want a second date, I would advise avoiding Tommy's until later dates. Unless you want to test a gold-digger that is, than by all means...

rPyZueQcSHC5X_pFs7twHw.review_text: Came here because of the low and price and saw this was on Diners Drive-ins and Dives. They are definitely a classic joint that seems to be popular with everyone.   Food: It's amazing Truly one of SF's best places to eat when on a budget. Had the buffalo stew I believe and that was delicious so was the turkey sandwich and a few other deli meats.  Price: For anywhere this is quite affordable. Most items are under $10 with some just being over by 1-2 dollars. Not many places give this kind of food at such great prices.  This place was crowded when we came and its cash only if I remember correctly so make sure to have that on ya. I'd suggest the buffalo stew, it really good!

TCRqYuxk_jGqoRMDNlO3Dw.review_text: It's funny to write a review for such an institution! However, I decided to go there based on Yelp reviews; here is my voice, too:  I was looking for a satisfying French Dip Sandwich. Oh sure, there is a Quizno's across the street from my apartment. And I could have gone there, as I already have done on some sad and lonely occasions (three words: Jewish Christmas Eve). I went to Tommy's, though, because some very informed sounding ladies and gentlemen on Yelp made it sound amazeballs (plus it was only two more blocks away from me).  I went to Tommy's with someone who had never been. I specifically went there to have something decidedly meaty, starchy, comforting and delicious. I saw the menu with new eyes.   They really have everything I could want, in such a state. Meats in stews! Potatoes for any taste! Breads, beans, cheese, and more meat!! I ordered my French Dip Sandwich and a side of green beans (gotta think about how all that meat and bread will come out the other end, come on now) and feasted. The other guy ordered a French Dip Sandwich and potato salad, which was clearly made from scratch. In the words of the other guy, "That was the definition of hitting the spot."

IzJ36jX6V6ky5BtoN-Agng.review_text: Four Letters: M E A T !!!!!!!!!!!!  MEAT! MEAT! MEAT! MEAT! MEAT!  AND THE BEST PASTRAMI IN THE WHOLE F#$%ING WORLD!  I've been coming here for the past 15 years.  Its fricken cheap and delicious!  Its no fancy schmancy sit down restaurant, its a neighborhood casual eatery served "Hofbrau" style.  You walk in, the Hofbrau is on your right, bar is on your left.    Pastrami, roast beef, turkey, veal, chicken, sausages, ham, lambshanks, salmon, ribs, corned beef, buffalo, meat, meat, meat and more meat!  Sides include various various items: salads, pastas, rice, and the BEST mashed potatoes & gravy: The gravy has chunks of meat in it too!  I got the Pastrami Sandwich, and extra roll, and the mashed potatoes, total was $8.61 with tax!  Over the next 20 minutes, my mouth was was a metaphor for Heaven...other favorties include, Burgundy Beef, Buffalo Stew, Lambshanks, and Sweet N Sour Spare Ribs(not asian, but USA BBQ style!).  I took the menu, scanned, it uploaded it to YELP...check it out, nothing is more than $10!  :)  Oh Tommy's...why did I leave you and move to San Diego?  I miss you so much...

I_XzAL0oGQ1MdOxNxNl7Cg.review_text: As a recovering vegan (3.5 YEARS!), there are times where I just crave a giant slab of MEAT between sourdough.  So, I go to Tommy's.  The pastrami is my favorite, out of what I've tried.    Everything non-meat seems to be pretty mediocre, so I'd skip the sides.  Good place for a cheap, carnivorous meal!

fKBjJww2_QsNPqIA_a8ODw.review_text: How can you compare to Harry's?  This is SF tradition, just the barrel of pickle chips!  The cornbeef is melt in your mouth and the rye bread too die for.  Harry's Hof Brau is OK, but not as wonderful as Tommy's Joynt!  The turkey and dressing, mashed potatoes and gravy are great!

ahVwnO5O_AqY2PaZbnBW1w.review_text: I really like this place! My first visit was on Sunday. Watch out for the door cause it will hit you from behind if you don't watch it. The food looks good, they carve meat and serve mash potatoes. I haven't tried the food since I ate elsewhere, I just came in for a few drinks. They have over a hundred types of beer. It's awesome! Overall, I really enjoy the ambiance in this bar! It's not the cleanest but it's cozy. =)

bQiST5YdWLSH_yk56ccApA.review_text: This is one of Metallica's old stompin ground.  If it's good enough for them, it's good enough for you.  HELL, YEAH and tastey too.   Really good fresh carved meat sandwiches and great sides.  Place is cool and affordable.  I can taste it now. UHMMMM  GOODDDDDDDDDDD.

lYBkXpL2bZyUxWOKurByZQ.review_text: **NOT gluten-free friendly**  (must be able to order creatively to eat here)  I had been here sometime in the early y2k's, and it hasn't changed...at all.     The Joynt has been here since 1947 and has become a SF staple. My dad was visiting, and the one of two places he wanted to go was Tommy's Joynt.  Well, you don't tell your dad no!  The food is hofbrau and is served cafeteria style, the seating is plenty, and the bar is complete...so complete that it has the old grumpy European behind the bar.  I appreciate the traditional!  My dad had a pastrami sammich, while being gluten intolerant, I had some turkey, roast beast, and rice.  They had a couple of ciders behind the bar, and since I wasn't in the mood for liquor, it was nice to have that choice.  Tommy's Joynt is one of the classic SF eateries that everyone should try at least once!

9YnDosQSsDusvJzDQQlmug.review_text: CASH ONLY....however, you don't need a lot of cash.  Their portions can satisfy the heaviest appetites.    This is not a place for vegetarians.

DVnDB6C2m5xqEFnjfwCdDA.review_text: Wednesday, 9:30PM.  San Francisco's very own hofbrau is a carnivore's haven.  Quickie: +Fast turnaround after order +Large portions *Decent food *Mediocre  Suggestion: *Sandwiches are dry  And then...? Visit TJ's if you need to binge on meat.   ********** 1. Pastrami on sourdough      +Nicely seasoned  2. Corned beef      - Thick slabs of meat, desiccated though!

txrANKGe5_pxA9vw4XqyTA.review_text: Wow, I always pass this place on my commute to and from work but I never thought it'd actually be a legit, local spot for SF peeps.  After my workout at 24 across the street, I was starving and yelped this spot.  Decided to give it a shot due to the magnanimous reviews.  I was a little weary because the outside is very unassuming, but hey, I guess you can't judge a book by its cover.  I had the beef brisket, mash potatoes.  The brisket was so tender and the mash so tasty that I didn't feel bad eating heavy food after a workout.  There are also plenty of tv's in the place so you can watch football and have a cheap beer ($2.75) for shitty American beers.  I think my old man would like this place so I'll take him here the next time he visits.    It's worth to check out for sure.

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: Seriously, a Thanksgiving dinner at 12:30am while drunkenly stumbling through the Tenderloin on a Thursday? Can I get a giant 'w00t' up in this piece or what?  The fabled Tommy's Joynt has been around since the late 1940s. Apparently, it was a pretty poppin' spot to hit up after performances at the opera house down the street, as well as other live theater productions in the 'hood. It's cool to see that through the many faces this city has seen, it's still rockin' there on Van Ness like it was 60 years ago.  It almost seems too good to be true, but they're open until 2:00am every night, carving fresh meats for hungry passersby. You can grind on anything from sandwiches to full on dinners for less than $9. If you're really hungry, grab a dinner plate with turkey, stuffing, mashed taters, gravy and a slice of bread. Or if you're swooping up a quick bite to go, nosh on a sandwich as you walk out the door to catch a bus or hop into a cab.   Occasionally, the meats will be a little dry... but I suppose you could opt for a shitty 7-Eleven sandwich that's been sitting in plastic wrap for 26 hours if you're concerned about moistness. Personally, I'll take a dry piece of turkey over an expired egg salad sandwich any day.  They were featured on some Travel Channel show recently (Diners, Drive-Ins', & Dives, I believe)... so it's pretty dope to see an old school operation like theirs in the national spotlight.

KpGiwKcn53zq1pB-I9CBYA.review_text: School dinners. I like the place, cheap prices, definitely quantity over quality, but cheap beer, and a large bucket of pickles. Does what it says on the tin.

hcGgZ4PbKcM3K1clw7tEGA.review_text: They only take cash?   And the ATM is broken?  Well lets see what 20 bucks buys us.  Surprisingly, a lot of mouthwatering food. We both had Tommy's Great Big Sandwich and mine personally was corned beef.  It was huge, tasty and filled me right up. And for about 7 bucks a person it was just the ticket in the money department.  Basically now any time I need a huge amount of meat put in my mouth... I'm coming to Tommy.

T1kRNW8UyZkcs1K1O0Gb_A.review_text: Hell yes!!! Went to the symphony on Friday night and all the places around there were closed or packed, what gives??.  Hello, it is a Friday night. My genius pal Ana reminded me of Tommys is open, and in the car we hooped!    There is a god!! We walked in all gussed and up had pastrami sands. They were incredible. After dousing mine in au ju and horse radish, I horked down a small mt. of pickles. I have not gobbled anything thing down this fast in yrs. I am a big fan, will for sure go back as it was amazing.   2 pastrami sands $12.26  small mt of pickles, on the house as the barrel is a self serve and I LOVE IT!!!

aagG66l0Nb09YmIQo9kHsw.review_text: Title: "Stick To Your Ribs Food."  This is it. Homecooking as my mother made it for me.  Prices are reasonable and the place is like a museum.   My wife had ham with mashed potatoes. All very good and tasty. Can take unlimited pickles from a barrel. Salad and hard rolls all for under $10.  I had brisket (pot roast) with brown gravy instead of the barbecue sauce. All was good. Real home cooking.   Can take my own water. Self serve, cafeteria style. Cash only.   We shared a bowl of spaghetti with meatballs.  All so good, Liked it a lot. A stick to your ribs meal. Will satisfy most hungers.  Will keep coming back . They also have daily specials.

lNsZDf3Qmme_AF20Gs8KVg.review_text: Had this bookmarked from watching DDD and decided to stop by for lunch because I was in the neighborhood.  The pastrami was awesome.  The buffalo chili was good.  I just wish I had more people with me so I could have tried more.    The guys behind the counter serving up the food were friendly.  This is some good casual cheap eats.  Fill yourself up here for under $10.

MkEb-69hbQ0y4IJg6m18Bw.review_text: This is one of my all time favorite places to eat in San Francisco. The portions are large and the prices are low. I remember eating at this place when I was a poor/starving art student. The restaurant doesn't have the nicest furniture, but if you are like me, you go anywhere for great food. Everyone in the restaurant seemed super nice too. I would recommend the turkey enchiladas, beef burgundy, and the corned beef. Oh yeah and this place is cash only, so be prepared.

kv9Vg5FbJiFgcNQ_FOJ2Ng.review_text: Finally tried this place around end of last year after years of passing by during my high school years.  I know this is a cheap place, but back then I couldn't afford this and well I wasn't the adventurous person yet.   It was actually an unplanned visit.  We wanted food and some drinks.   I had the brisket and it was yummy and tender.  The sides were a-ok, typical overcooked sides.  My friend had the turkey  and of course, she couldn't finish it.  I noticed that food is actually not salty. The drinks are actually pretty good.  I liked it.  Not watered down.   It's one of those place you check out.

35CVnpI59bKN1rlCBgaSxQ.review_text: Like many other places that I've reviewed, I've been to Tommy's Joint many times before, but I don't know how anyone would give Tommy's Joint 4 or 5 stars.  It only deserves 2 or 3 stars at most -- it's "a-ok" as long as your expectations are in check but "meh - I've experienced better."   I give it 3 Stars for the "atmosphere" (red checker board table coverings (not cloth), dark wood  bar and architectural accents, old school signs and the beer and liquor bottles on the wall, and the people hanging out there) and the wide selection of domestic and international beers (forget about the mixed drinks unless they're on "special" which are over priced and otherwise ordinary) offered at the bar.  The food, as others have mentioned, is just cafeteria food, so calling Tommy's Joint a "restaurant" is a stretch.  If you don't expect too much, you shouldn't be disappointed.  The food is relatively cheap and filling and reasonably good considering the format.  Add a unique beer and you'll have a fine time, especially if you share a table near some out-of-towners who are there because they saw an ad for Tommy's Joint in a tourist mag or just happened to be walking by.    But don't be deceived. While Tommy's Joint is an SF "institution" (opened in 1947 a few years before I was born), it is NOT all that.  It's just a cafeteria with a little panache and, if you keep that in context, you'll have a fine time there, but don't go overboard and give it a better rating than it really deserves just because it's "different."

Ppk0C_BkEq1g1xJvmlem1w.review_text: Can't believe I haven't written a review on this spot, been coming here for years! Anyway, first things first, CASH ONLY. If you're like me, you don't carry cash very often, but on the off chance I do, I come here.   This place is open super late, I dare say 24 hours, I can't tell. I'm usually too drunk from the bars when I arrive that I don't know what time it is. The food is real good. It's not perfect because it's been sitting for a bit but it gets the job done. You either get pastrami, roast beef or brisket. Ya heard? Get one of those with a side of mashed potatoes and something else and you got yourself a hearty, meaty, hot meal. They got fruit salad and veggies and other sides, etc etc. That's not important. What is important is the meat. Brisket is cooked very well and the potatoes were perfect with the gravy.  Do note that this is a quick way to get some decent grub. The food will not be perfect. I'm sure a lot of reviews are skewed by lots of drunk people coming after hours and if you are in that mindset, this is the greatest thing ever. If you aren't, it's okay depending on how fresh the food is when you arrive. It's a crapshoot. So the food is good and I am a fan but temper expectations a little. Not many places will give you pastrami for under $10 after midnight. The bar is also cash only. Go drink elsewhere and come here for after hour munchies.

t7CPtPQzDDwbLDSSCXhyhg.review_text: I went here a couple weeks ago and WOW. This is like meat-lovers heaven. I only had a meatball sandwich but they had everything from oven roasted turkey, sloppy joes, lamb shanks, ribs, and more! All the meats looked tender + juicy and VERY tempting (if I were more hungry I would have gone w/ the oven roasted turkey plate w/ mashed potatoes+bread MMMmmmm!) The sandwiches are kinda messy but totally worth it. There's a full bar and all sorts of crazy road signs+beer decorations around the place so there's plenty to examine. I left here feeling warm and fuzzy + full which is good. I definitely need to come back here. If your thinking about stopping at Tommy's, bring your appetite!

hWzFphZ3sdxX6XolsXC1Jg.review_text: To be honest, I don't really like Tommy's.  It's super cramped, the food isn't that great, and I have a hard time figuring out what my food options actually are, because I'm getting pushed through the line so fast I don't have time to really look over the salads and sides.  Maybe it's better if you treat it like a bar?  It's super cheap, but it's really not worth it in my opinion.

73yY6xvCkbWwP4QMS8YSxQ.review_text: It's crazy how they cut the pastrami and turkey meat write in front of you. Add some cheese to it and some of the mustard and you got yourself a great and filling meal.  Be weary of the hot mustard on the table, it's great but the hottest mustard I've ever eaten in my life. Pastrami is thick, bread is good. It's meat-eater haven to say the least.

7WCJKEcpi1O7IQz7BuxVwg.review_text: 10/22/2013 A lot has been said about this place on TV yelp etc so I decided to finally stop by. I only enjoyed a Big Corn beef sandwich on Rye with mustard and mayo but that was enough to say a little something about this place.   For starters, delicious sandwich. The rye bread played well with the tender corn beef that had just the right amount of flavorful fat. The mustard and mayo added that extra touch to make the sandwich savory. Great sandwich for $6.   The place was cool, bar, nice seating arrangement, nostalgic decor, features that makes a  great Joynt. The customer service was cool too, wasn't asked to leave after business hours were over. I finished up my sandwich, drink and made my way out the interesting street of San Francisco.   P.S Bookmark status.

olMvJFXQMMU-trU9D3F05w.review_text: I'm not afraid to say that I found this place by watching Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives, but damn am I happy that I listened to that dude with the bleached blonde hair.  A sandwich lover's heaven. Meat is juicy and warm and sliced as you order. I've had the roast beef, turkey, and brisket so far and all three were terrific. I've gone with the roll each time because it looks to me like you get more bang for your buck that way.  But guess what? That's the best part about the Joynt. Prices are super low.   Great beer selection as well.  Laid back atmosphere with good people to chat with while munching and sipping a pint.

IdnbvI-jYalwwSdLldiw0w.review_text: Meh. I wasn't that impressed! Maybe it's just not my type of food, but I don't think this place lives up to the 4-star rating. I got the buffalo stew which came with a roll (I think all things come with a roll). The stew itself was on the salty side, and even though it came with rice, I felt like I needed to add a little bread into each bite to counter the saltiness. Bf got the brisket plate and that also came with choice of salad and mashed potatoes. It was good, but nothing I'd make much of an effort for. Friends raved about the beans but I didn't have any myself. They do have a good beer selection (& price) but I don't think I'd come back.

8J6h7PhCjcS-Hmzw4l6esg.review_text: After a 20 years of saying "never again" I returned to Tommy's Joynt for lunch with my good friend Don. I swore I'd never come back not because the food or service was bad but the last time I ate at Tommy's I saw a big grey hairy cat running around the back of the dining room. When I mentioned this to the staff they laughed because it belonged to a customer who seemed to be a regular. That was enough for me to say, "Never again". That was then, this is now. My friend Don wanted to have lunch at Tommy's so I decided why not? That fat grey cat is probably not around any more???  Showed up at 1p on a Sunday, most of the tables were taken and hardly any line to order food. The Brisket was calling me, about 5 generous slices and about 5 smaller slices were put on my plate with a choice of baked beans or salad, bread roll and butter, mashed potato and I asked for the bbq sauce to be served on the side; for $9.50 with tax that was a good price.   I settled in at a table for two at the back where it was quiet and dug in. The Brisket was cooked perfectly, moist and flavorful, beans were nice and I could have used a bit more mashed potato. The bread roll was a hard white roll, I prefer whole wheat. I asked for the bbq sauce on the side because I didn't want to mask the taste of the brisket with the sauce and I wanted to see if the brisket and sauce could hold their own. I poured a bit of the sauce on the plate, it seemed watery but tasted nice, not too tart or sweet. When I tried it with the brisket I was pleased with how it enhanced the brisket flavor and didn't just cover it up; I think it's safe to say they each held  their own.  I liked the idea of having a drink waitress to avoid getting in another line at the bar. The bar has many beer selections and any bar that serves a good pulled guiness has my vote!  I'm Glad Tommy's is still serving up good food and I'll definitely be back.  That fat cat was no where to be seen!

aaky3gNWWj-89MXe5Vi7oQ.review_text: I look forward to coming here whenever I get a chance. In fact I plan on going there tomorrow!  The first time I came here was with my boyfriend and his family. MAN this is the most delicious and affordable place I have ever been too. The decor will keep you busy while waiting in the surprisingly fast line. I always order the beef brisket plate and its Delicous and i mean DELICIOUS the meat is always cooked to perfection and it just melts in your mouth.   For the price you pay you get ALOT..you can go to other places and pay twice as much for half the food. This is a great place to go to and was even featured on Guy Fieri's show Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives.. If you are visiting or live in the San Francisco Bay Area this is definately a place to try out.. may i recommend the tender and melt in your mouth beef brisket? :)

hZxmfGMDiWEm81kYBaMWsQ.review_text: People call me a foodie, but I can really eat anywhere. So its with that in mind that I have to give Tommy's a less than stellar review. Of course we saw the place on the Guy Fieri show, which, whatever. It wasn't just wasn't that good. My hubby loved his beef, but my veal special of the day was covered in so much sauce and glop that I had to scrap 90% of it off. The sides were flavorless and institutional--I know its all about the meat here but come on.  And this is also the kind of restaurant where the person sitting at the other end of the table (who has been staring at you during your entire meal) waits for your husband to go to the bathroom so he can ask if you're going to eat your beans.  Um yeah. I won't be back.

PNFfiOtXsLGe91Zqf9sUxQ.review_text: Definitely recommend the ROUND OF BEEF.  It melted in my mouth!  I love the fact that they have beers around the world.  This place is a must go!

WyIOfgdoI-OEPcUPEvCYbA.review_text: Count me as another long-time-Tommy's-Joynt-fan who has never written a Yelp review on this amazing place!  I guess it's such an SF institution that I've taken it for granted .... sorry 'bout that Tommy's!   But this is THE BEST place to come for late-night eats.  A bad meal here is a rarity -- actually, never happens, it's all GOOD!   I'm a huge fan of their Buffalo Stew, but also like their Turkey Sloppy Joe -- and, tonight, Beef Burgundy.  Side salads are as fresh as can be, great bread, excellent apple pie -- and, yup, those legendary complimentary pickles.  As long as I'm in SF, which I hope is a long time, you'll find me going to Tommy's.

jHmmA9EIhztfDu-MZc1YRw.review_text: The hubby comes here for the open-faced turkey sandwich. I come here for the nostalgia. If i'm craving hof-brau, I go to Harry's in Foster City.

BVKJF0OYYy9uqOEmEL37bw.review_text: Really people, don't go here expecting healthy California Cuisine, it is far from that.  What it is, is good hearty grub.  Meat on the bone kinda place.  Great for your late night needs as well!

HgJeLA9RLBzXrxXvnE0-Eg.review_text: I came here after a local friend who highly recommended it and said it's Metallica's favorite restaurant. The place itself has a lot of character, a lot of cool decorations on the wall. The food was just ok. We had a pastrami sandwich and lamb shank to share. The pastrami was cut thick so it has great texture. But there's too much fat in our meat. The portion for lamb shank is very generous - 2 shanks in one order! It's nice and tender but kinda too salty to my taste. Overall, I'm glad I've come here to check out this institution. But maybe once is enough.

uQGJgjf9ubj9AOYwVVkETQ.review_text: Tommy's Joynt; it's either you love it or hate it.  I love this place.  This is your no frills, eclectic, I don't give an F and won't renovate, cafeteria style restaurant.  It will someday, if not already, be a San Francisco historical landmark.  Yeah, it might be hard to overcome the dingy inside but that's what makes this place what it is today.   Two entrees that you can't go wrong with are the pastrami and brisket dinner plates.  If you want something salty, go with the pastrami.  If you want something more on the slightly sweet side, go with the brisket.  Entrees come with mashed potatoes (or a baked potato for an extra buck), bread (which may be a tad hard but dip in the gravy and it'll soften it up), and a side.  They have a bar with a wide variety of brews so if you know your stuff, you'll probably like their selection.  Their shots are reasonably priced.  Tommy's Joynt may not be for everyone, but a true San Franciscan enjoys the food and the ambiance of this joynt.

ukufz-1z45IUMxfy55LYzw.review_text: Our favorite place in the city to get a late night meal or fulfill your holiday meal craving (turkey with all the fixings, corned beef).   Our favorites:   -Corned beef dinner 9.25 -Sweet & Sour spareribs -Baked chicken  -Bbq brisket dinner 9.75. Tip: a side of brisket is charged as a sandwich 6.49.  They have a room in the back you can reserve for a large party (20-25 ppl).  No korean beers at this joint. However, they have tons of other alcohol to keep u liquored up. My favorite is their Irish coffee.

_VjAjQZDlWum7lo2iTWvOQ.review_text: This place is an institution. I have always wanted to try this place after hearing that this is the place to go. The place sticks out like a sore thumb, and the inside decor is just as loud. Awesome!!! I love those kinda places. I stand and try to figure out what I want and after 5 minutes decide on the pastrami sandwich. You go up to the counter, they carve your meat for you and place it on a fresh bun. The pastrami was cut a little thick for my taste (more like corned beef or brisket). The side of au jus on the side and mustard at your table and pickles in a barrel. Perfectly going with you sandwich.  I ordered a side just on a whim (cole slaw) and it was mmm mmm good. The bar seemed pretty cool. I almost would like to hang out here on a weekend night but I don't know what the vibe is like (more restaurant-y or bar-y) at night.  I took a star off cause the menu was confusing, being that there were hanging "sandwich boards" all over the place. You kinda have to search for the right menu.

FBM-NXoNDJX0gC4w0jHMFw.review_text: This felt like college over again...except you don't need to "swipe" your meal points to eat here.   I ordered the BBQ Beef Brisket Dinner plate... -I chose vegetables (green beans) instead of mashed potatoes...my only bad choice of the night! Go with the mashed potatoes. -I chose the beans over the salad...great decision! I don't like beans...but I really enjoyed the beans here. -The brisket was the most tender, flavorful piece of meat I have ever had. Drool... -All for $8.50  Nice selection of cheap eats and adult beverages...highly recommended!

YS-QM_Ob1pT7oLtztZa0nw.review_text: Very good carved meat sandwich. A cool joint to visit in the city

p08F3g2_lSSdzyjnVcvt4w.review_text: This place is really run down and tables are very dirty.  But I find myself coming back here often because beer selection is good and service is fast and it's convenient for parking.

pDfL8xt8F8ls0-kQIG_ADg.review_text: Cops, city workers, suits, blue collars, and tourists snapping away with their cameras is the range of folks you'll see at the tourist trap/local institution.   The fuss is all about Tommy's hof brau menu. Beef roasts, turkey roasts - real hearty meals which go perfect for cold SF nights. Perfect man food eats right here, perfect for guys night out.   I came here with the boys and ordered up a roast beef dinner ($8.50).  Plenty of juicy beef slices, slathered with mashed potatoes and gravy, a bread roll, and your choice of salad. We washed it down with a pitcher of Guinness $16 and it's easy to see why this a SF man food favorite.

LHTsHRVgnhkBwagj81kHkQ.review_text: Wow who knew?   Well actually my pops used to tell me how great this place was and I never listened...hmmmm common thing for me...  The best cheap eats is what the Guardian said and they were right...this place is crazy good..8 bucks and you are eating and drinking and happy.  Get your short ribs, turkey, sliced brisket over mashed potatoes, order some Lithuanian Beer- what?   Crazy beer menu.  Great Selectioneh

TxtOwp2TrZ7zgr4lho_KiQ.review_text: I like Tommy's Joynt, but  mainly because it's cheap and you get huge f-ing portions (as in let me serve you the whole damn farm animal). This is what I ate:  Corned Beef - I like the salty cured taste of corn beef, but they drenched it in ocean water gravy. Salty+Salty = salty balls explosion in your mouth. I still ate all of it though, since I'm not particularly picky about what I shove in my black hole.  Mashed Potatoes - It was aight  Complementary Biscuit - Cold, dry and hard; I prefer warm, moist and soft (or warm, moist and hard)...  Salad: Necessary to counter constipation. And I anticipated my ass was definitely going to pay (literally) for shoving that salty cow down my throat.  All in all, A - O.K...for the price.

ti4lRf8rv9KICw6msOJT0w.review_text: this was my pre-thanksgiving dinner for 2007.  if you like meat. and you like meat. then you probably also like meat. and you'd like tommy's joynt.  word on the street is that metallica likes this place too, could be a rumor and i'm not going to research on the web.  did i mention there's meat here? oh, and a full bar! i don't go here enough.

Vq4wz0wm6PrCDhw23AgJ9w.review_text: Talk about jumping the shark.   A shell of its former self, Tommy's used to be a go-to spot but in recent years it seems the Joynt has been lacking in food quality, across the board. Once in a while a bad meal, fine, but the last three visitis in a row were nothing to write home about and I can't figure out for the life of me why. Poor management? Different vendors, etc?  Meatball Sandwich tasted like somebody took low grade ground beef and poured tomato sauce from a jar over it. I don't recall this sandwich being so bland in the past.   Way Less Potatos A dinner plate used to net you a hearty mound of mashed potatos but the most recent visit was about a tablespoon full and then they drenched it with turnkey gravy even though i asked them not to.   Corned Beef Again, tastes like the meat is not from the same source as in the past  Beef Brisket Was dry and overdone  If i can think of one thing positive to say it is regarding: Price is still reasonable but I think an increase at this time would be nothing short of an insult.  I can no longer recommend this place and I certainly will not steer any ou-of-towners/visitors their way.

yIZHEdIjR0goGI2AgpbFjQ.review_text: After reading some reviews on Yelp, I had to check this place out. I got the lasagna plus two sides, which quickly raised the price. The lasagna was pretty good, and so was the potato salad.  The place was a bit loud and crowded for my taste (I didn't know about the quieter room upstairs). You carry your own food and find yourself a seat, so it felt like a very loud cafeteria.  If I ever go back, I would try their meats.

uHmVBa-zNy2YVgkArD8b7g.review_text: I love Tommys Joynt! I know there are so many good restaurants in the city but I always find myself coming here.  The food is great, I usually get roast turkey, stuffing and mashed potatoes.  The drinks are really good here and pretty cheap.  I love the vibe and everyone is always super friendly here.  Always a good time

Wh2Y4k8MPPvBAGoRu4WCNw.review_text: I have honestly never been to a place that serves sandwiches like this! (Maybe I've been looking in the wrong places.) For that reason, I really like coming here. They cut the meat right in front of your face so you know it's fresh. The pastrami was DELICIOUS. So juicy! I also got the bbq beef sandwich, which was alright. Beef was a little dry that night. I've only been here a few times, but the most recent time, I came at around 1am. I found out it opens late. Good plus! It's close to a bunch of bars and lounges on Polk St so if you leave a little early, you can make it here in time to get a late night snack before it closes at 2am :) I'd definitely come back here again.   Oh yeah, CASH ONLY! There's an ATM inside that charges you a $2 fee.

PdiC9pfBxS98lZvzx5l0tw.review_text: The ribs r e best in the city. Hands down

SWL3gYpSvV78La8DG2L3jw.review_text: This is a 5-star hall of fame place. I wish to GOD we had this in Lafayette instead of Bo's, which is great in its own right. The prices are awesome here, the portions are huge, and the food is TASTY. Plus, kudos for serving Thanksgiving dinner...YEAR ROUND. A plate of Turkey + all fixings for less than $10. Good atmosphere, lots of seating, fresh food served fast. God, drooling just thinking about this right now.   Don't miss this SF Treasure if you are in the are and want some no frills tasty food without the pomp and circumstance that accompanies so many places in the City. This is the place where the lights are turned low, the food is served hot, and there will be no pretentiousness. Just some serious chow at seriously fair prices.

reeagFQbNm6bFFotCU-n3Q.review_text: It took several years of living two blocks away from Tommy's Joynt before finally dropping by.  I hopped into a line that snaked half-way around the restaurants.  The line moved quickly, but I wouldn't have minded if it went slower to buy time for me to admire the decor.  When it was my turn to order, and needing to satisfy a carb fix after hitting the gym, I ordered  spaghetti to-go.  The pasta was overcooked and the sauce was completely insipid.  Strike one.  On my next venture to Tommy's Joynt, I decided to try the special -- beef stew.  The meat was gummy, and again, the dish itself was completely under-seasoned and tasteless.  I resorted to dousing it with Tabasco in order for me to get over the texture.  Strike two.  Given my previous two experiences, it was almost a year before I would return.  This trip, I ordered the roast beef with a side of mashed potatoes and au jus.  Under-seasoned.  Again.  After adding a sprinkling of salt myself, it was at least edible.  Strike three.  Will I go back?  Maybe if I was drunk, starving, and only had $5 in my pocket.  However, given the restaurant options along the neighboring Polk Street, I'll take my business and stomach elsewhere.

fSybAPY1P3YNqJDA_-WRhQ.review_text: We went for the much talked about BBQ Turkey Sloppy Joe's. Heaping portion of BBQ turkey on top of a jumbo white roll cut into 3 pieces with mashed potatoes on the side.They looked like BBQ but were lacking in any BBQ taste whatsoever! Amazing actually, How do you make BBQ sauce that looks like BBQ sauce and has no taste at all? The turkey was not shredded as one would expect but was mostly tough dry chunks. The mashed potatoes were cold. I tried to find some justification for these tasteless turkey slops in the fact that they are served up at a bargain $4.25 but it quickly came to my mind that for the same price one could get 3 McDoubles w cheese and a medium fries at the McDonalds on Market and New Montgomery and have a more pleasing experience for the palate.  Reminded us of what prison food must be like.   Simply dreadful!

A7FNqfL30IjpcQ6fQffoOQ.review_text: Meat, meat and more meat, for the die hard carnivore. I recommend the buffalo stew in an open face sandwich paired with one of their many microbrew offerings.

6aJNIB8yGHDiwrzyxlExRw.review_text: Went in here for the first time, and was shocked at how it looks inside, definitely not what I had pictured in my mind.  Personally if a place looks dirty to me, I can't get past that to eat the food, and that was the case at Tommy's.  My husband had some corned beef, and thought it was ok.   CASH ONLY

J609G85QHctqMUNVXB1icg.review_text: Dirt-Cheap, great home-style American food. The brisket and turkey are stellar. If you want a cheap night on the town but don't want to sacrifice quality, this is a good start :-)

e2MIDX_YWVVQl7-t-SJf-w.review_text: Ate here.  Went to a movie.  Thought I was going to have a heart attack and die during movie.  Seriously.

4zuokuzf9TVRnBQR-IETKw.review_text: I go to this traditional SF joint after late parties or clubbing in the City for their great quick and fresh meat and potato dishes and their massive selection of beers from across the world!   This place could be packed with people and yet it is somehow absolutely quite, even though when you look around you see all people are talking! So the ambiance is a total peaceful San Francisco ambiance, which is exactly what you'd want after some partying earlier!

JKIkdVqAJLEXTq92gF98bA.review_text: The fact that you still have to wait in a relatively healthy line for food at 10:00 on a Friday night will tell you all you know.  I always thought of this place as more of a locals type of joint (or joynt if you will), but there were a number of tourists here who were talking about how they had this as a destination to eat at.  I have yet to try their sandwiches (which I hear many good things about), however, the pastrami dinner plate (with mashed potatoes and potato salad) was quite filling, and almost made me regret ordering the bowl of clam chowder on the side.  The soup was a little better than I would have expected, as the serving was pretty generous and it really hit the spot on a cool SF night.  I found the potato salad rather disappointing, and thought that the mashed potatoes were okay, but nothing to rave about.  The meat though was awesomely tasty - well seasoned and quite moist (which was a concern).    In addition to the cafeteria/lunch counter food they specialize in, there's also a bar with a chalkboard with a huge variety of beers from all of the world to choose from.  From local brews to the obvious national names to international selectrions, you can find beers available from China to Denmark to Africa.  Crazy!    Service wise, it's not a true full service restaurant, but I thought that there was something left to be desired.  After being scolded before for getting our pitcher at the bar, we were left hanging for a bit waiting for our next pitcher to arrive, so maybe they were just overworked.  However, despite that and the mediocre sides, they are still deserving of the four star rating!  The prices here for both food and drinks is so reasonable!  Dinner plates run at $8, the soup was $3 and the pitchers were about $16.  Not too shabby for a solid, filling meal.

cufhYFdyrUAt4SWe-m0grQ.review_text: Unsurprisingly, one makes bad decisions after a night of drinking. You might make an ass of yourself on a karaoke stage. You might make a tearful 2 am phone call to an ex-girlfriend. You might go home with Lola. Or, you might make the worst of all decisions and come here. Yes, this was a baaad decision. Piles and piles of meat at an ungodly hour of the morning after a night (days, really) of carousing = why, dear Lord? Why??  I am not a beef eater (these jokes write themselves), so I was a little repulsed to look at all the carnage behind the glass wall. I will, however, eat the stuffings out of a bird, so when I saw 'turkey sloppy joe,' I knew all would be well. Heh. It's a gigantic plate of food. In a more sober setting, I would have been embarrassed to take it all down. But, the midnight hour is all about letting it hang out and that's what my belly did -- over my belt buckle. The larger-than-dinner sized plate was brimming with turkey sloppy joe, gravy, bread, mashed potatoes, and God-knows what else. The first few bites were good. Then, it got a little harder to chew. Then, I started to feel like that kid who caused the blueberry pie vomit chain reaction in Stand By Me. Oh, this is not gonna be good.  Somehow I made it to my hotel room to go to bed. But, a restful night of sleep would not be for me. You see, my stomach was pi!ssed at what I did to it and was determined to make me and all of those around me for the next 24 hours or so, pay. Ugggh. Oh, Lord. Why?? Whhhhyyyy??? Rosemary's baby had taken up residence in my gut and no good was going to come from this. And, no good came from it.

hKA-ugs84PxeXTIUjR2TKg.review_text: I love tommy's joynt!!  I went there with my classmates after an event, and I was blown away!  A buddy of mine kept reassuring me that I would love everything about it.  And of course, He was right.  The beers, the food, the atmosphere!  My friends got food there and I picked at each and everyone's plate.. the lamb shanks are delicious!  We all had random beers, I cannot recall which ones, but what can I say after 3 beers into it.  On top of the good time my friends and I had, the service went out of their way to put together a few tables to seat all 12 of us.  We also came in with giant poster boards and random crap and they helped situate our junk so it was out of the way and safe.  Thank you Tommy's Joynt, I'll definitely be back!

VH7nJ2DdP5onNpSUWy0lRw.review_text: Walking into this place, it had a bar and old school feel to it.  My friend and I didnt know where to start ordering and when to pay. The service was below average (all they really do is slap food onto the plate for you). I tried the ribs (10.50), mash potatoes, macoroni salad, potato salad, and cole slaw. The marinate of the ribs were average and nothing special about it, actually it needed more sauce to it, but the tenderness is extraordinary. The mash potato and cole slaw was tasty. The potato salad was average. The macoroni salad was nasty and had a weird taste to it. I wouldnt mind coming back here to try other meats, but it's not my first choice to come back.

nKoV0AUfH2C57oN--WDLsg.review_text: There is no place like this place so this must be the place!  I've been going to Tommy's Joynt for over 25 years now!  It's my favorite place to get a bite.  Lots of nostalgia for me.  - Great food, large portions (BBQ brisket dinner ftw!) - Full bar with Chimay on tap!!!!!!!! - Amazing atmosphere  Although it has gotten busy since it has been featured on TV, they still turn it out!  This is the place for down to earth people to get real food.  Affordable enough that you can buy an extra sandwich to share with a homeless person on your way out.   Share the love with someone less fortunate - It's a harsh world.

jTQ6o-C04GdP9bXXJycSCQ.review_text: Unlimited Pickles!  1. Be hungry. 2. Point to desired food though glass counter. 3. Have servers put the food on a plate. 4. Pay cash. 5. Grab water glass and fill. 6. Get plate of pickles. 8. Sit at table with random people. 9. Eat! 10. Be finished before people at Mel's across the street even get their food.

JLZs2s5Z6AtvE6Ry2AovTg.review_text: An extra star because they are open super late when you get that late night hunger. And trust me, everyone else knows this, so don't think you'll be rolling, stumbling in by yourself.  you'll have good company.    love the corned beef plate. CORNED BEEF.  Wow, so yummy and so meaty.  A little fatty at times but so tasty and easy to cut off the fat.  the spaghetti is also really homey and enjoyable.  Don't come here because you're looking for a fancy, gourmet meal, but come here when you want some down home comfort, tasty hearty food.  Bathrooms are a little weird upstairs but they work so I can't complain.  Small booths or shared tables.  CASH ONLY (but there is an ATM on site I think, but it's not a major brand or anything).

JMIP3HUge7XlqYGthznjZQ.review_text: Thursday special was not so special. Sent the shanks back for steak and mashed potatoes. Definitely better, but the lingering taste of lamb was too severe. I would stick to the full bar & extensive beer selection.

Oesu7CvaKjxv_NXlOdB77Q.review_text: Everything that can be said about this place, has already been said. Excellent pastrami and corned beef..especially  the corned beef, in all it's unhealthy goodness. I love it.  They also have some really great buffalo chili, every now and then!

bH3Z5fqmsBXttVu7FTYpiQ.review_text: I would give this place 1.5 stars if I could. One star would be for the service, which was pretty good. The .5 star would be for the beer selection, which was quite impressive.  Overall, I don't know where people get "world famous" or "the original" from. There is nothing original about this place. The pastrami sandwich I ordered was ridiculously plain. The meat was scarce, and somewhat seasoned. The bread was cold and hard.
