My gf ordered a brisket place and it came with mashed potatoes and gravy, a bread roll, and baked beans. The bread roll was so hard I had to break it myself. The baked beans were literally out-of-the-can quality. The brisket was somewhat tough and not too much flavor to it. The mashed potatoes...good god. The boxed Betty Crocker mashed potatoes are probably loads better than this.  I am assuming anyone who gave this place more than 3 stars was intoxicated or under the influence of drugs. Any person with any sense of fresh, high quality food would tell you there is nothing that comes with this place. It does have good value (in san francisco standards), but the best thing I can put it is the following:  I was so miserable with my small, almost meatless sandwich I went to Walgreens and bought a similar "Italian sub" sandwich for $3.99. The Walgreens sandwich had a better bun and almost the same amount of meat. Overall, the Walgreen's sandwich was more edible.   Truly disappointed.

v2JbRxUd18qL80IcYJOQtg.review_text: It's an experience.  A bit new wave and a bit old school, it's like the last 70 years are plastered all over the walls, ceilings and shelves.   Great beer and service and good,cheap food. I had the $6 turkey sandwich with bean salad.   Turkey was a bit dry but helped out with a great au jus.    Inside and out, it's kinda psychedelic.  When I picture Tommy, I think of Tommy Chong (with his joynt of course) although Cheech is the one from Cali.

VmlShd8k2tq7-O4TVx5R1Q.review_text: favorite thing in the menu: TURKEY LEG with gravy!   best place for late night munchies.

iAjFEU61Exi83ANxDKar0w.review_text: Finally got around to grabbing a bite here recently and... I LOVED IT. Check out this video to take a look at the place from all angles. freakingdelicious.blogsp… I would reccommend this for anyone who doesn't care about the extra frills and just wants something tasty to eat. Check it out kids. You will definitely love it!

7g5KwEzdu4eR70LdP9T8gA.review_text: Best sandwiches!! So bomb! Cafeteria style where you tell em your what you want for your main dish and pick your sides. I got the BBQ beef sandwich and my girlfriend got the pastrami sandwich. I got a side of potato salad.  They were both very good and tasty. The meat was cut right off the huge slab and piled high on your choice of bread. They also have dinner dishes but I will always go with the sandwiches. Nothing against the dinner dishes, I just want that sandwich again. They also have a full bar and the bartenders a really friendly. I got the Tommy's famous rum punch and it was good but strong. Cash only!! Line can be long but goes by fast. I am going back no questions asked the next time I am in San Francisco.

dfYNTBw--CYlZbFz581kYQ.review_text: A lot of people love Tommy's Joynt but it's not my favorite... the food is too greasy and meaty for me. I also don't love that a lot of it is served from behind a glass counter more cafeteria-style than freshly prepared.  This spot somewhat has split-personalities. People come mainly to grub or to hang out at the dive bar. I'm more into the dive bar portion but will only stop in if I'm looking for a very quick drink right in this location.

Zn6_1t5LujJZLkkMOBgntg.review_text: By far the most food I've ever received for $18 dollars, incredible.  Everything was standard tasty fare, nothing I freaked out about though.  Except the house pickles in the barrel are, amazing.

VqOVUpvSDzc2rNSa0abYSg.review_text: I'm a visual person. I like cafeteria style layouts because nothing is more disappointing than ordering something on the menu and having it suck. Here it's all laid out so if it sucks it's all on you. They also have a great bar here too.

he9pKRROydfj84JAWypuBA.review_text: I love Tommy's. For years, I have enjoyed this unique eatery. Good food at a fair price. Great location. Plenty of history, personal and otherwise. The missing point is for the bathroom, which is not my favorite.

57AuIG17wCxnhnrF86kr6Q.review_text: Only been here once but it was great. Everything was fresh and they are generous with portions. YUM!

DAIF6BwUEBCPqPvhNby9IQ.review_text: Delicious, large portioned, comfort food. They have so much stuff that I just want to order everything, especially when it's all sitting right in front of you waiting to be sliced, scooped, or spooned. My mouth is watering at the thought of the large slices of ham, roast beef, or brisket accompanied with a scoop of mash and drenched in warm gravy.    I just don't like the cafeteria style seating. Plus, the chewy/non-toasted bread kinda ruin the sandwiches or hot dogs so I usually don't order them

oHBsvNTPaIN2cDftR7cjDw.review_text: 3.5 Stars  Cheap and good sandwichs but nothing memorable.  I got a meatball sandwich and it was nothing special..  I'd eat here if I was walking around here and maybe shopping.   Actually I'd go the Mel's I haven't been there yet. :P

A02ryK2u5hA_ANkErNjuCA.review_text: As a neighbor establishment that I've frequent countless times in 20 years, this place has deteriorated over the years and I don't understand how it seems to still retain it's popularity. Even though it has been "revered" on previous episodes of Guy Fieri's "Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives" this place has lost it's cache as anything noteworthy worthwhile. I never understood how a place can serve "canned vegetable" and instant mashed potatoes" and get by with it, when there are so many other great options for the price in SF. The meat options that my co-hort (a many time return patron from out of town) noticed the decline of quality as well, as his meat (3 items) as well as mine were all dry and some were even grisly and tough. I had brisket, which had a brown gravy that was nastily sweet and unappetizing. The worst part of the experience, is that now there are no wait staff to ask you if you want anything to drink, and not realizing this, we finished half our meal and had to ask the food preparers if anyone was going to be coming by to take our drink requests, and they said "you have to order from the bar", which I never had to do during previous visits since they used to have staff that came by periodically to check on you. All in all, it was not a very pleasant experience for the money and you definitely can get more value and service elsewhere.

kZJWAY828P8QZTqVYzhTCg.review_text: I walk in at 1 am last night & the aroma of my childhood wafts into my nostrils stimulating my memory & my taste buds. It smells like a home cooked meal in there.   For as long as I can recall, nothing about Tommy's Joynt has changed-it's the same guys carving meat & ringing you up (no credit cards) & the paraphernalia that decorates the walls are as random & interesting to look at as ever. The wooden benches get more rickety with each passing year, but the droves of locals either don't seem to notice or don't mind.  The bf ordered a roast beef sandwich (he drowned it in beef au jus) & I had a pastrami sandwich (which was mostly lean.) As drool worthy as my sandwich was, the pastrami had more of a beef brisket quality & had none of the spices & flavors that I associate with a good pastrami. We shared a side of mashed potato & gravy (i think its turkey gravy.) The food, people & atmosphere is comforting, unchanging & undoubtedly San Francisco.   Total: $14.73  P.S. the hot mustard at the table is super duper hot, like wasabi-thru- the-nose-hot.

IDVX4Is4CanREchBmpFXoA.review_text: No vacation to San Francisco during which one lodges at one of the many not-so-swanky hotels or motor lodges on Van Ness is complete without a trip to Tommy's.  This place is great, starting with the old-fashioned San Francisco Gold Coast ambiance, right down to the hearty meat and potatoes they will ladle onto your platter for 3 or 4 bucks.  It is true hofbrau, one of only two I know of in the City, the other being Lefty O'Doul's.  They have a full bar too.  Last time I was there they only took cash, so don't give away your 5-spot to the panhandlers sprinkled generously up and down Van Ness.

tXb_ce3q91rTe6voTC_eYA.review_text: I went again with a friend and as we were standing in line we saw the guy behind the counter take some water from below the warming trays, splash it on the counter in front of the trays then quickly wipe it with a dirty rag. THE DIRTY WATER POURED INTO THE FOOD!!!!!  I won't ever go back.

Pn7fIdQopYXVqaepJiAJPg.review_text: I had seen Tommy's featured on Diners, Drive-ins & Dives many months ago, and thought..."That looks good; I'd like to try it." They corn their briskets and make their pastrami in house, and have been doing it since 1947, and still owned by the original founding families. But, since I rarely ever get to the Bay Area, I didn't give it much thought after that.  Well, I happened to be in San Fran for 2 days & 1 night, and of course, always looking for good food! While searching Yelp for some ideas, I saw the high reviews for Tommy's and took a closer look. As I read the description further, I realized that this was the place on Triple D, and it was literally just across the street from my hotel. I had to check it out, and was glad I did.  I had the fresh carved pastrami on rye, with a side of cole slaw; $8.65 + tip/tax. It was a nice portion of meat, which was tender and flavorful. Add the hot mustard at the table, throw some of the slaw on the sandwich, and it's a great meal. They also have a great draft micro beer selection, and full bar.  There were many other things on the menu that I'd like to try if I ever get back...and I will.  Sure the place is old, and the line to place an order looks like the line for an amusement park ride, but they move fast and the food is good. Also, they only take cash, but there's an ATM at the start of the line, so bring the debit card and enjoy.

Sv9CH1f9o1qqtIRMQ1dWmQ.review_text: Classic, old time bar-eat in- take out lounge. I wouldn't call it a restaurant. It's all self serve. Food is decent, give you a good proportion for the money. Look into the specials daily. Basically you walk in and there is a line for lunch and dinner. Fresh and hot. There's two levels of dining. Serve to get your own water and utensils. Not bad. Cash only. No cash?, ATM on site! $$ Try their corned beef and cabbage and their buffalo stew.

U9rRgcFBrrIZbKrBFNOUlA.review_text: About $10 for a fantastic BBQ Beef Brisket dinner plate and sides? Yes please! No frills kind of place. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

ahRGG_f9YI10ZdRHFi5C9Q.review_text: Amazing food and very enjoyable atmosphere. Lots of fun stuff on the wall to look at if the line is too long. Beef brisket is awesome

BENBj_EQBQImwoZst7HdqQ.review_text: Stopped here for lunch on Saturday. Ordered a BBQ beef sandwich with swiss and sourdough bread. It was tasty, fresh, and moist with ample meat. Reasonably priced too considering most other sandwich places. There is a lot of other stuff on the menu but the sandwiches seem to be the most popular. Beware of the hot mustard on the table - it brought a few of my friends to tears!

v5mB-L31CGZJcuIl4GkFHw.review_text: As true to old-world carvery goodness as it was in the 1850s, and they're still using the same buffalo stew recipe.  A late-night treasure, long may they thrive!

bgRo57llCQXy5QJIubKY6w.review_text: Awesome beer selection!!  I ordered the pastrami sandwich and it was really good.  Each sandwich is served with a side of juices and that's pretty delicious--although I do wish the juices had a tad more flavor. My fiance had the roast beef sandwich and it was OK.  I don't think it had enough salt and it was a little overcooked for my liking (i like it pretty pink).  The decor is a little dark and dirty.  I felt like I needed to not touch things.  But, the beer and food won me over.

mLHgb6eufSegCbLkqPS-EQ.review_text: Tommy's has great home style cooking.  The wait can be really long on certain days or at certain times, however the food is worth it and there is so much crazy novelty items on the walls to look at that you don't really know that the time is going by.  Food is served cafeteria style, and servings can be pretty big, especially the dinner plates and the sandwiches.  The Corned Beef plate is to die for, and i usually get it with mashed potatoes.  Serves as very good hangover food as well.

kwmToyRa85G49WxbsYB1Aw.review_text: I ordered 2 lamb shanks to take away. I was very pleased with the quantity of food but was quite let down by the taste. I am not from SF and if this is real American food, authentic or whatever, then I am pretty dissapointed.   But the lamb shanks were soft :)

9-xMmYQpZKv8eWZoyHQUcg.review_text: Late night after movie food, I had the spaghetti and meatballs cause I'm a sucker for that, but friends got the lambshank, everything hit the spot leaving us all pretty satisfied, will come back and try the buffalo stew.  Also, didn't mind the interior, but I knew what not to expect.

sKUfzoFYfGWI3qiGqB8jNQ.review_text: Amazing! Delicious home cooked goodness! Best late night food in the entire city! Minus one star for being completely ignored by the waitress and having to walk to the bar for my cocktails. Plus a star for amazing homemade pickles and sandwiches to die for!

KavFgapR_cJZaA_Kvfqsvw.review_text: This place really does deserve 2 stars but I'm giving it 1 star to even out the rating.   Let me be VERY CLEAR - I don't understand people who actually LIKE food like this, It's just not MY idea of good food. It's like a cafeteria that serves dried out chunks of meat served with a ladle of gravy. I felt grossed out eating anything from here. You can say I don't appreciate the "uniqueness" of this place, but please remember that "uniqueness" is not always good.   My bf wanted white people food and made me come here. As soon as I walked in I knew what I was walking into and I was NOT happy. But I gave it a try hoping that the food was better than everything else about this place and the verdict? It was just as bad if not worst. I couldn't  even eat anything on my plate after a couple bites because it was just so disgusting. The only thing that I managed to eat was the green salad with ranch and I spend $18+ for both of our meals.  So technically you can say it was the most expensive godddd damn salad ever.  My bf ended up eating his and mine plate because he knew this was his bad idea and he didn't want me to be mad at him. LOL   Anyway he didn't like it all that much either, but at least he got full right? well that wasn't the case with me. I just got drunk because I had 1 beer on a practically empty stomach and stumbled my way out of here.   The final judgement:  They do deserve two stars because they have a large selection of beer and it's a good price. And I guess they are kind of a landmark in SF, but the food here is just EWWWWWW.....that's the only word that comes to mind when I describe this place.  Don't believe everyone else when they tell you how good stuff is, it's really not good at all. Prices are cheap, that's their motto but I think it's still over priced for the quality of what they are serving you.   ewww ewww ewww......

dr1ks8YlVN48oGzAf4fo_g.review_text: Great food, lots of choices, quick service & cheap prices - my kind of place.  Oh and did I mention its open until almost 2am?  So, on those nights where you leave the bar a little early, but not early enough to catch in-n-out before they close this is a great decision.  Also good for lunch & dinner, but best as a 4th meal.

VmNv--Z2RciQaSOqT__Z1A.review_text: Great place. Not your typical restaurant. LIne up buffet style for great food. The bar is a full bar and I was happy to see the wide variety of beers they have. Have a seat and enjoy the ambiance. Cash Only for the buffet which is really good.

oHzggeI-W2Ir-hcJ05jXrQ.review_text: It doesn't matter if you're a local or a visitor, everyone should make a special visit to this place!   Other than the food that's served in generous portions, the succulence of the meats, or the tastiness of the soups, the restaurant itself has festive and kind of odd decorations that deserve as much attention as the food itself.   Don't let the long lines detract you; it's crowded because Tommy's Joynt is a San Franciscan treasure, and like everyone else has commented, the line moves fast and seating is plentiful!

oZsZqZ8tSRQeZw1q9Nsn8w.review_text: This place is great and conveniently located a block or two away from the AMC theater. I've been here twice. The first time, I got the corned beef sandwich, which was pretty standard but nevertheless delicious. The second time, I got the cajun bacon burger. I'm not sure what made the sandwich cajun, but the burger patty was probably the best I've had in Davis. The burger patty had a really nice crust on it and was cooked to the perfect medium rare. The waitstaff here is also very attentive. All in all a great place to eat!

TnAl8UBeFzOxYmqTCPfbXQ.review_text: I love trying any place Diners Drives Inns and Dives are featured in and this was one on my list. I had an early dinner here yesterday with the boyfriend and ordered the pastrami sandwich on a sourdough roll. It came with a side of au jus, and it was AMAZING. Boyfriend ordered the beef brisket with a side of mashed potates and sweet beans. I actually liked his dish more than mine, and he liked mine more than his so we ended up switching. I think its a must to try if you're from San Francisco!!

R4b9uTzOI-9d0ussqSqR5g.review_text: I had their spaghetti with meat sauce and that was yummy. their sandwiches are less than stellar though. too oily.  the atmosphere inside is quaint...not exactly homey but not uncomfortable. it gets a little crowded at lunch and dinner hours.  don't expect anything less than fattening fat food here though.  no cards, cash only.

lYC-DFT7VOdxSM6oY2Vm1g.review_text: I drool at the mention of tommys joynt. My coworkers and I always go there if we are nearby.  The food is always awesome. I love all the different meat. 5th star comes from having San Miguel beer.

dTdltcr2EC5oMZ1rs795PA.review_text: meatball sandwich for $4.25.  seriously for $4.25 its far more than worth it.  the brisket looks incredible and so does the corned beef.  let's not lie, everything looks freaking good.  i want to live here.  and eat this.  and die a happy man.

aIISk4lrzKp6rQJpgwj_fg.review_text: Ahhh, the days of getting off school and goin to Tommy's for some comfort food. This was back in the days... not way back... but OK, way back haha! But how blessed was I to have this place to go to after school? Even more so blessed I wasn't huge in high school!   Brisket, turkey & gravy, spaghetti and meatballs, meat loaf, creamy mashed potatoes. Oh, and roast beef and pastrami sandwiches with gravy! Mmmm! Hearty servings and warm good comfort food. It's a long time standing restaurant for a damn good reason!

8dz7yulTbzCVh-b9u71pjQ.review_text: I've been going here for about 24 years.  The place is totally unlike any other.  Ok, it is a bit dark and dingy, so if you are looking for an upscale fine dining experience you will definitely be disappointed.  But if you are looking for great food in San Francisco, you will love this place.  Plus, I just love how unique and unusual the place is.  All of its flaws somehow disappear.  It is like your favorite old coat that might no longer be perfect but you love it for all its years of faithful service.  That is Tommy's Joynt.  And that is why I'll still be a loyal patron 24 years from now.  And, for the record, my wife and I came here on our honeymoon almost 23 years ago.  So there is that sentimental draw as well.  Proof of how good the place is?  There is pretty much a line all day long.  Few other restaurants can make that claim.  This place is definitely a restaurant classic.

WZwqwr4QCG7wZCDkxudYUA.review_text: Untouchable no others words are required only closest restaurant was the North Miami beach Rascal House now deceased

lEBBezR8EXj8L0DWwc8MtQ.review_text: Ok I haven't done this in a while, but recently my husband and I went on a week long vacay up and down the coast in Cali with a side trip to Vegas. This was one of our stops, like a lot of people we saw this on the food network so we decided to go in and try the food.   The food was ok. I got the turkey dinner my husband got the pastrami. The prices were not bad since we were on a budget. The guys serving the food were friendly and making us laugh. That's why I gave this place 3 stars and I was generous.  Now for the bad. The cashier (old man) had an attitude on him and wouldn't even look at us till he was done counting his quarters. The food got cold quick, and seating was limited but we didn't mind that too much. The one that pissed us off the most, there was a waitress/hostess walking around being friendly and asking everyone around us "How's everything, can I get you anything?" but us. She acknowledged people that got there before us and after us, but acted like we were not there. She brought people waters and beer and we had to get up and walk all the way to the front and get our own. Really? If you don't like your job, find another one. Last con the bathrooms, I understand it's an old building and things are done a certain way. But after hiking up these San Francisco streets the last thing you want to do is hike up a narrow flight of old wooden stairs to wait 10 minutes for some lady to get out of the one toilet restroom the got.  Would I go back, Hell no, didn't like the treatment and for ok food I rather just go to a fast food joint.

yR_Eyjp58p-bAwORI-B3Jg.review_text: Came here today hoping that the food would have gotten better from the last time I was here (about two years ago).  The last time, I got the corned beef and cabbage with potatoes.  Back then, the corned beef was very dry and salty and the potatoes were dry and bland. Also, the customer service we received that time was bad because after we told the server that we would not be ordering anything from the bar, they never came back by our table at all for the rest of our meal.    So, today, I decided to go back and give Tommy's Joynt another try (mostly because a co-worker of mine was particularly impressed with Tommy's Joynt, after having had a meal there about six months ago. So, we got there and decided to order lunch to go, because the place was actually kinda crowded (go figure?) and parking was hard to find.  I ordered spaghetti and meatballs because I thought it would be a pretty safe choice.  How bad could a place screw up spaghetti?  Apparently alot...  The spaghetti noodles were mushy and the sauce was strangely orange and thick, like it was made with carrots and then thickened with flour to make it go further. The sauce was more like the consistency of gravy -  no taste of tomatoes, no taste of carrots (oddly), no taste at all really.  Kinda reminded me of baby food.  The meatballs were seasoned well enough I guess (at least I could taste salt, pepper, maybe some garlic), but when I bit into them they were dark pink in the middle, like they weren't cooked enough.      For the side dish, I had the asparagus salad, which had an unexpected taste.  I think they flavored it with tahini, because it had a strong sesame flavor and reminded me of hummus.  It could have been alot tastier, but it seemed like it was just thrown together and so it was just kind of blah.    The only thing that actually tasted good was the plain cheesecake that I ordered for dessert.  It was very uniform in appearance, so I'm thinking that it was probably commercially prepared, not by Tommy's Joynt.  I finished all of the dessert, but sadly, wound up throwing most of the rest of my lunch away.  Damn, I hate wasting money.  Normally, if a meal was at least decent tasting, I'd take it home and have another meal from it, rather than waste it.  Or, at the very least, if I didn't like it that well, I'd give it to one of the dogs in the building. But, I just couldn't see myself eating anymore of it and didn't want to be charged with "animal cruelty", so in the garbage it went.    Now, I am just totally confused with the other good reviews of this place, especially from the other Yelpers who had the spaghetti and actually liked it. What is wrong with you people?  There was a time, long ago, when Tommy's Joynt gave huge portions of tender and tasty cuts of meat.  I believe those days are gone and not likely to come back. All of you Yelpers (who gave Tommy's Joynt such a high rating) will have to do a whole lot to try to convince me to give this place yet another try, after today's dismal experience...

dUjWYjb8F-bWeKsS_lMfBg.review_text: This place looked exactly like any mountain touristy venue with plastic red checkered table cloths where one would expect good entertainment to the tune of, "I'm my own grandpa" sung by the Barleen Family and mediocre food served by an impossibly friendly waitress.  ...a place designed to make city folk feel like they were experiencing backwoods charm for the price of, like, $15-$20.  Except, except, except...it wasn't overpriced and every bite of cholesterol laden yum was worth it.  Oh, and while it did come with the impossibly friendly waitress, there was no comical traveling family of banjo players...I know.  It's a damned shame.  Were I still a vegetarian, I would have thought this place sucked...a lot.  Since I'm not, I can tell you that my corned beef and mashed potatoes and gravy were a drunk girl's dream come true.  Like the first sound of a baby's cry after a difficult pregnancy...only it tasted better.  The apple pie was just OK.  It's cash only, which I hate...but worth it.  I will definitely come here again when I feel like eating 3 days worth of calories in a single meal.  It kind of reminds me of Butter with its sort of carefully sculpted lowbrow theme designed to let San Franciscans pretend for a moment that they don't live in one of the most pretentious cities on earth.  I dig it.

2P8QdQgb6iX9IvAW7h59LQ.review_text: I was here for the first time a week ago on Friday. I went back again two days later, and nearly converted a pescetarian (sp?) back to omnivore-status with some of the buffalo stew on rice. Damn it was good. I wish I was still an almost-local so I could come here more often :(  Five stars for the food, minus 1 star (because yelp doesn't have half stars) for the funky ambience.

eo0tmepvnDLQfpY2O78o_A.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is the best restaurant in the World.  The buffalo stew is like my aunties back home.  Its worth the long lines.  Go check it out.

xSJr86JwAZk_iwFSifc0zQ.review_text: "Tommy's Joynt, like mom used to make"   First of all I'm filipino, chinese and german so no nostalgia of mom's cooking there. Second of all, mommy only knows how to re heat what grandma makes, so unless they change it to "Just what Mommy lola (lola is tagalog for grandma btw) used to make then no nostalgia will be achieved. You lie, Tommy's.   Second of all, now that we've established Tommy's is a liar, we can now conclude the food ain't all that either. Master (ultimate food connoisseur) is freaking in love with this place and I am never one to question his prodigious tongue (wink,loljk), he once told me "I can't get enough of this restaurant, I could eat here everyday and never get sick of it, if it was a woman...it'd be you" awww, of course I felt obligated to love the restaurant version of myself. Pfffft, no. One sentence: Everything is fucking dry as shit. Oh, and I've had everything believe you me! (I was forced to come here three times a week for several months, I'm pretty sure I had everything) I've had the sandwiches because I initially started off only ordering sandwiches then I thought ok if the sandwiches suck I should get their specialty, nope, that didn't work either. Mind you that includes the fucking apple pie and if the apple pie is that unsatisfying let me tell you I'm never trying the fucking chocolate cake or carrot cake, sandpaper scraping my tongue will go down easier. AND DON'T DENY IT, if it's not dry it's because it's completely drenched in it's agreeable sauces. THIS BETTER NOT BE WHAT MASTER MEANT WHEN HE SAID THE RESTAURANT WAS ME, I AM FAR FROM DRY---DAMNIT.   Each time I've been here I've taken one bite and took the rest to go because I need the help of some Mary Jane to perform magic tricks and make it disappear in 2 spoonfuls.   That's not entirely true, I will tell you there are three things that save this place from ruin.  -Decoration: AUTOGRAPHED PICTURE FROM METALLICA, just one of the many highlights they have covering every inch of every wall and ceiling, upstairs and downstairs! I do fancy an invariable rusticated atmosphere every now and then. The bathroom sells sex toys .50 too! I think the conversation went like this : "MASTER GIVE ME FOUR QUARTERS YOU WON'T BELIEVE WHAT KINDA VENDING MACHINES THEY GOT!!!!" =) I spent a dollar and got two things, cute but nothing I utilized in the bedroom that night.  - Cheap STRONG, generously poured alcohol. Oh God bless, God bless! The hot buttered rum is what I imagined the butter beer in Harry Potter to taste like, and the cheap cheap AMF! 95% Adios 5% sprite, $8.00 but it's served in a pine glass on droids. Iono though, something isn't right, I'm a featherweight and usually get drunk and stay drunk especially with drinks this perceivably strong but I sobered up within half an hour. Drunk sex after this place never happens.   - Ok, I lied, the lamb shank is fucking amazing it's the only thing that isn't dry and the roast beef has potential for magnificence, provided you let it sit for ten minutes in it's marinade, and I never had anything bad to say about the damn good potatoes or bread, I always wish they'd give us a whole basket of those little sourdough pieces of heaven so I could let them absorb the sauce like a sponge and just devour them. MMMMMMMM  The real rating is 3 stars, I gave it 4 because I'm being biased, it's the love of my lifes love of his life, and I love what he loves and coming here with him makes the dry roast beef worth swallowing. It takes swallowing pride to a whole new level don't it ?  If I am no longer writing Yelp reviews after this, master has probably read this and buried my body in barbados for talking shit about his ALL TIME FAVORITE RESTAURANT !

ar1TzD9ZxKQsR5iSaSL0NQ.review_text: I was on a plane, coming home to SF, and a tourist couple sitting next to me asked where they should go in the city. For some reason, I'd forgotten everything--the museums, live music, comedy clubs, the ferry, the parks-everything except for Tommy's Joynt. Ridiculous helping fail. But, if I am eating dinner in SF, I like eating here. And if the couple did go, well they probably had a good time :)

_zjJkD0iXeO2vAfh-jCubA.review_text: Had to try this place since I'm a Diners , Drive Ins & Dives fan...... It did not disappoint. I had the lamb shanks and they were great ! Only $12.00 !!! My wife had the pastrami and that was great too !!!   This is a must stop when your in SF !!!

ABIU44l-g4Ipa8lzMGp7JQ.review_text: Food was plentiful, tasty, served fast and what more can one say. Reasonable in a city that is not known for its sensibility where money is concerned.

3N5BvyGPnbCIW9Tzb8Tw7A.review_text: I've lived in the Bay Area for over 10 years now, but only got to Tommy's for the first time a few months ago. Now I feel like I should have gone sooner. As someone who lived in NYC for many years I miss a real good deli place where you can get a great sandwich or piles of meat with starchy sides. In SF Tommy's seems to be the place to go. Great food, good portions, and just the kind of divey atmosphere to fit the bill. I had a corn beef sandwich and it was the best I've had since moving out here. I should also mention that they've got a great beer selection. Now I just have to find an excuse to get back there...

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: I would like to say the only reason why I came here was because I saw fatass Guy Fieri pigging out on TV. However, the more practical reason would be I just finished a movie at AMC and Tommy's was right across the street. Nonetheless I came here to see what the hype was about.   Walking in, you take a look and it looks like a cafeteria off of some interstate highway in the Midwest. They have all sorts of items up on the wall and the tables and booths are set up in a community setting. Menu is relatively simple with a daily special and everything is pre-made sitting in steamed metal pans so you can see how it looks. I had an order of their lamb shank and beef brisket. The first was stewed perfectly and quite excellent in flavors. The latter was pretty average. Prices are reasonable considering what you get and no service. This is not a place to go for a nice dinner but it is a good place to go for late night, home-cooked fast food.

wfNsQDBrjSeh0X2g9-KFig.review_text: I went to this place ,at a recommendation by twenty something people.  My husband and I do not care for this place.  The food is below average in taste(very bland), portion size small(take away the SUPER LARGE size bread and you have nothing). I got a beef broth to pour over a turkey sandwich? It is dirty and unpleasant place.  I am still wondering how Tommy's is still in business after 40 + years?.    I will say this much if you are a struggling student or starting on your own.  Tommy's is the place to be for cheap and I do mean cheap bland food.    I question a place were the Bar open first.  You do need to drink first before ordering and sitting down  and eating the food.

4JbYscM9v-8BFst5nBBV4A.review_text: This has to be in my top 3 all time favorite places to eat in SF. Great options, great prices, nice staff too.   I stick to a few dishes: Buffalo stew, Turkey leg dinner, BBQ beef sandwich or the Burgundy beef.  Ive had the corned beef sandwich a couple times and remember liking it as well.   There is an amazing selection of beers. You wont be dissapointed. I find that a tall glass Boddington's goes well with above mentioned meals. In case you were wondering.  Go ahead and ask the bartender what the sign behind him means. He'll thank you for it :)

ZECUkJd_e9bqtfFMFA6M2w.review_text: This place is a great value. Sandwiches and dinner plates with various meats are the specialty.   Ive been here many times but my most recent visit consisted of  Corn Beef, Mashed potatoes, Potato Salad Beef Round, Mashed Potatoes, Cole Slaw The bill for all of this was only 17$  This is a Hofbrau style restaurant. You tell the Carver which meets and prparation you want and it is freshly sliced/plated in front of you. Then you choose your side (for dinners) and pay the cashier at the end of the line. Seat yourself where ever you like but upstairs is usually a safer bet.  The drink selection is pretty good considering the size of this place. Order the drinks later when the waitress comes to your table.  My favorite thing to do is catch a movie at AMC Van Ness then head to Tommys afterwards.

HR-aBhU77uWsGLL_Jq9s5g.review_text: I love the vibe of Tommy's. My vegetarian roommates and I used to go there Fridays for their amazing mac n cheese, but as a meat eater I am a huge fan of their smoked turkey, grilled chicken, and buffalo chili. The mashed potatoes and salads are always good. You can get beer from all around the world here. Tommy's is some serious San Francisco soul food.

yqHko4dqtMYbYxKx2NQiNw.review_text: Reminds me of Sunday after church food. Had the Burgundy beef on one visit, all beef hot dog and sauerkraut on another. Others in our group had the pastrami, the lamb shanks, and meatball sub. Everyone agreed it's just plain good food. Not fancy, but food like you'd cook at home (if you're from the Midwest where meat is king and portions are big) The atmosphere is unpretentious. And the folks there are just plain nice! Not overbearing, not over-solicitious, but helpful, available, and dang if there weren't always smiling whenever we were there. We'll be back!

YAGHdQk_9sdSUVI02DpfWA.review_text: Love this place! its fast, cheap and open late. the food is great and they have a bar :) Pastrami Sandwich with mustard and lots and lots of pickles! is a must

77STTiXFySEFv0wtqc0Exg.review_text: I have been there one time so this review is based on my visit including feedback from two friends who dined with me.  Me: Beef ribs with mashed potatoes and gravy Friend 1: Turkey dinner with mashed potatoes and gravy Friend 2: Corned Beef Dinner  We all loved our food and the prices were great.  The beer selection was very good. There is not much service there because you have to wait in line to order and pay and then seat yourself.  the waiter/waitress will take your drink order.  The place is old and has alot of history.  This is a gem in SF and enjoyed it for what is was.

GnUBvuoUTfXGfX3x-BxFBQ.review_text: Stopped in around 10:00 on a Thursday night.  Little confusing on the 'lunch-line' type menu ordering (then your drinks you pay for with a waitress) for first-timers.   Food was "ok".  Had the BBQ beef, roast beef, and the kids had the frankfurter (originally to be served plain on a plate - had to ask to be placed on a 'bun' which turned out to be sliced on a sourdough roll).    The cole-slaw was decent.  The pickles (all you care to eat) out of the barrel were delicious.  Overall - ok.  Nothing I'd be running back to frantically.  But for a late-night eat it was fine.

kQEhf_GzcQhaWTIYVwy7zQ.review_text: I grew up here and must have taken the bus past Tommy's Joynt 1,245,786 times at least on my way to play the Journey video game at Pier 39.  I always figured it to be a joynt for adults, a bar more than a place to eat, and hell, I didn't have money to eat out anyway.  Then, tragically, I moved away from 1990-2010.  Now I get to see The City with new eyes and I get to play catch up with some of those places that have miraculously survived the .com boom/bust.  Tommy's did not disappoint in any way.  The look and smell of the place was pure nostalgia, it smelled like GOOD FOOD the second I opened the door.  Ever notice how fancy restaurants don't smell like food?  What's up with that?  Anyway, I got some meatballs on some creamy mashed potatoes and my friend got a pastrami sandwich.  Conversation ceased as we ate and ate and ate.    The really cool thing about Tommy's is the cheap buzz, drinks are unbelievably inexpensive, even a Long Island Iced Tea was only $6.50.  I got a margarita for $5.00 and was woozy after drinking only half.  Strong like you would not believe.  I'll be back to Tommy's, looking forward to it!

GoTHT_RwFZ0V9clYP2_mjg.review_text: 1. Food is very good and every day there is a different specialty 2. Nice waiters and Food Servers 3. Has a bar and a lot of diff beers to choose from 4. The free pickles are bomb 5. Spacious and rarely ever have to wait to sit down.

4pzr6KuS85859EICMI7MDw.review_text: Whenever I'm having a bad day, have no groceries or am up late doing homework, this is the place to pig out at. I usually go for the corned beef cabbage plate, because it's the closest to home cooked I've found so far, and it's huge. Servings are fat, the salad is pretty bunk, and the rolls are just OK. After driving past this place countless times, I'm glad I finally went in one day after a party in Civic Center Plaza. Sometimes it's late, and I don't want diner food from the Grubstake, or pizza for Seniore's, or Korean from Arang, or a burger from Nations, and that is when I come here. No culinary genius here, just good and reliable grub.  When you walk in, you feel like you've entered another world, or gone back in time. The decor is cluttered and is total sensory overload, but it has some rustic charm to it. A San Francisco classic.

eF1Z8MB1LnQzj_Jylrm1oQ.review_text: They have the best home made roast beef sandwiches. Iv been coming here once every two weeks for quit some time know different times, and every time people are friendly but a little bit of wait. It's worth it or maybe it's my timing but I also like there potatoes with Garvey on the side.   The best part is that if you don't want to eat you can come in and see some sports on tv. They also have a bar here with a varieties of beer and beer tap. I Will be coming to see the game

WYjQuMqnCW6Y2Ih2onMIJg.review_text: This place is great if you go knowing what to expect.  What it is not: romantic, sophisticated, overly clean, quiet, fine (or even medium) dining.  Don't go here on a date!!!  What it is: the best place in town to get cheap, meat-based meals.  It is tacky, loud, and crowded with long lines to get served at busy times of day.  The lines go quickly, though, and the food is great.  I highly recommend the turkey dinner and turkey sloppy joe, both of which are probably about $6 or $7.  As a note, most of the side dishes, desserts, salads, etc. look pretty poor.  Stick to the basics: meat, potatoes, beans, veggies.

xoWBO-Q8eggololQumtC_Q.review_text: This place serves rotisserie and BBQ, more like a comfort food type of a place. The food is pre-made and you purchase them before sitting down. Although the food here is not the greatest, it is the perfect late night place.

vAqzzMSzrMBO2mAgn4b4HA.review_text: I love Tommy's Joynt! Its a great haufbrau type of place. It has lots of meat dishes to choose from and a huge selection of beers. There open late till 1am or so. The best thing is the amount of food you get and the price you pay!

C3YtFWNwLpfKTY1qE04dGQ.review_text: Absolutely love this place. Everything we have ordered has been delicious. The guys on the line are the sweetest and never get our order wrong.

Lzr1Vzbw6gMMKEiPSggxjg.review_text: Tommy's is classic and the prices can not be beat.  If you were a fan of the old Cole's in Los Angeles (yelp.com/biz/coles-los-a…) then you are going to love Tommy's.  For $10 or less you can get a decent meal and a beer.  They aren't going to be winning any culinary awards, but if you are looking for affordable stick-to-your-ribs food in an unpretentious setting, stop in and get in line!  And bring cash.

Cfo08zrATMf9m9Qh1UtcXA.review_text: i've been soo many times here and always left with a smile on my face. brisket, turkey, corned beef are no brainer dishes. free pickles are good touch to a bbq.  spicy horseradish is great companion to these heavy delicious plates. interior also what i would like to see from a bbq place.

RvVNfrVXso5NClIPbWl95w.review_text: Tommy's Joynt should be called Tommy's Cheap Ass Good Eats.  So you know, I am writing this review based off the fact of how inexpensive this place is to eat at.  Had this place been even medium priced it would have dropped their score a minimum of one star.       I am not a huge fan of old school buffets or cafeteria style eating.  I don't like the cattle call line waiting that goes on here but I don't like it anywhere.  And TRUST, you will wait a bit no matter what time of day it is.     I had the meatball sandwich and it was okay.  Truly nothing special until I got to the register.  It was like $4.85.  For that price it was a good sandwich and I will be back to try some other selections.      Love the old school bar and decor.  This place has personality and if it didn't you wouldn't come here.  It's just like Jules said in Pulp Fiction, "That would have to be one charming ass pig."  Well, that's my thought about this place.  Employees are not overtly friendly but not rude, the place is mostly clean but not dirty (Dusty maybe), the food is okay but not great but the price is right and the ambience is very old school SF.  So I describe this place as one, "CHARMING ASS PIG."

qwhbAL5zgg-mpvuW07yBdA.review_text: Went back the weekend before Christmas. This time my brisket dinner was perfect. Left  with a happy smile and a tip and always excellent customer service.

FFe-oLdU10voepAwaj2pSA.review_text: The bourbon steak was okay. I thought it was actually a little too salty, but it was good other than that.

cQ1OvMRYd_3mvnrhWz2wQQ.review_text: The Turkey sandwiches are pretty good and the staff is friendly. Biggest gripe is that  they charge for soda refills which is bull.... soda costs them .05 cents per serving. So a refill or two doesn't cut into their bottom line. They are also cash only.  Also the hot mustard is really HOT. No joke. Like crying my eyes out hot. So watch yourself if you put it on your sandwich. Your face might explode.

mcWAn7S3jDkjJI0W690qSQ.review_text: My Uncle Tony went to Tommy's decades ago and just raved about it. He loved the corned beef and cabbage! He was definitely a 'regular'. I had the perfectly cooked chicken & mashed potatoes dinner. What a great experience! Home-cooked style meals that are off the chart good! My Mom had the beef stew dinner and loved it to.

Cbw1IKmtlycJeZgxLImcUQ.review_text: this is a great place to go for comfort food. really good portion size at a really good value. roast beef plate with mashed potatoes were oh so yummy! Definitely go only when you're hungry though!  went after seeing this on DDD. was worth it - guy did good!

azeMW7pibmDUOG1RbpBX5A.review_text: Get the PASTRAMI sandwich! Pastrami, Pastrami, Pastrami!  I didn't know that was what it was suppose to taste like ....absolutely amazin!  The cook and servers were a little on the unfriendly side but who gives a ish when they serve Pastrami like that! Great price and good portions.

pDQQ5BxhzxeyhOUekYAoCg.review_text: Always been meaning to try this place, but being that it's located on one of the busier corners of SF, I was always turned away from the limited meter parking. But lucky us, there were plenty of parking on this particular Saturday. When you walk in, you're pretty much right in the line for food. I had the meatball sandwich and the chili, and my boyfriend had the corned beef and cabbage, their Saturday specialty. Mmm mm, both were super delicious, and you can really taste the freshness in it.  The place itself is a little dim, but it's ok, as long as you've got good food in front of you. The drink service is a little funny as well. You order it when you get to your table, which is your choice since there is no assigned seating. The server will come around, take your order, and bring your order while simultaneously collect your money. This place is great for a quick delicious bite!

8nA58KujKHy1k57IuKqocw.review_text: I took my daughter here today for lunch. Her Dad and I went there before we were married... it was great then and still great today. This place has been here forever.. ok, since 1947 anyways! we both had the BBQ Beef Sandwich on a sour roll. It was filling but it was a lot of bread. I would have liked more meat, the sauce served in the little ceramic pitcher was good but sticky! One of those little pkg'd wipes would have been nice. I used an ice cube from my daughters soda & a napkin! She had a salad with Italian dressing. She didn;t like the dressing but I did. It had a strong balsamic vinegar flavor. I had the mixed veggie salad. It was ok. I wish I had looked closer and realized they had pickled beets! Bummer for me.. I did not know their pickles were home made!! I didn;t get any!  One reason for not looking closer is if you haven;t been in here before or in a while, it is kind of overwhelming. The "menu" is on various boards and signs behind the counter. Kind of hard to take it all in. I guess there are paper menus but I didn;t see them and the guy behind the counter just pointed behind him when i asked about a menu.  Good bar service.  It was fun to see the window open and the underground kitchen in the back! Cooks handing out big pans of meats from down below!  I ordered some of their "famous" buffalo stew over rice to go. Having that tomorrow for lunch. I'll post my review on that once I eat it... taking into account that is from the day before.  CASH ONLY with an ATM machine right in the restaurant for you! How nice.. for them. I'm not a big fan of cash only but a conveniently located, additional fee, ATM strategically placed.  Walk in, order at the counter, they dish it up, pay, then sit down and someone will come take your drink order. I know when I went there a long time ago, we ordered from menus at the table. It would  be nicer that way. I kind of felt rushed to order and didn;t feel I was seeing everything available.. tho no one rushed us at all. I just felt that way  6/20/07: I warmed up the buffalo stew and it wasn't very good the next day. Kind of dry, how buffalo can be.. but maybe it would have been a lot better if eaten right away. Before the rice soaked up the liquid. It definitely looked really good. Maybe if taking to go, ask for the rice separate.  3/1/08: My daughter has since had their Buffalo Stew hot and it was delicious! Oh and those PICKLES!! They may be the best part of the meal! Love eating there because we can eat platefuls of them!!!

Dg9UFLHQdAQdrztQTJ3-nQ.review_text: I have always (from the cradle) and will always (to the grave) have a profound and deep as bone love for this establishment.   Tasty, heaping, sloppy, warm fuzzies-giving, affordable, traditional family food.  Cuts to the core and fills with joy.  Bellissimo.

qLMT6tS074Opsaz4qkbjVg.review_text: Went there because of triple D, even though I've passed this place hundreds of times in the past. It was an interesting experience, not really socially acceptable for children though. The food was good.  The best part was that it was cheap. about $34 for 5 of us and the portions are huge.  I got the lamb shanks and they were really good. I'd go back but probably without the kids. It's basically a bar with a bunch of semi drunk people throwing the F bomb around and condom machines in the bathrooms. Didn't want to try to explain what those were to my 7 and 8 year old that can now read a little to well. wife had the corned beef, she thought it was too salty, and I agree, but it was so good and tender. i'm getting that next time.

ou9Et0VwC0AfTeUOUSp9MQ.review_text: Trash! First off, the neighbor hood it's in, wasn't a good one. But, I'm not from San Fransico so..... At any rate, I had the Buffalo sandwich & to be honest the meet tasted like it came out of a can. Second the servers that serve you don't say much on the food and we where rushed to hurry up and eat because they were closing..... I wouldn't go there again..

tvFO96Y1_T7clh0pnigwTA.review_text: Very unfortunate, but there are only two things I really remember about this place... I mean I have a very hazy memory about it being an eclectic and possibly fun place to take out-of-towners who like meat, but it's all overshadowed by two things... damn these two things.  First is a vivid memory of a big bucket of all-you-can-eat pickles. Which I LOVE, LOVE, LOVED! Oh those salty, crunchy delightful little pickles are so totally worth enduring bloating, water retention, and endless thirst.     A good thing, right? So why only three stars?   Because unfortunately the second memory is of the biggest most vile, disgusting, and stinky avalanche of diarrhea ever seen to come out of a baby which was a result of eating at Tommy's.  I don't know if it was the beans or the spaghetti we fed our poor baby, but it came out of her like her chocolate soft-serve lever was broken.  Who knew a baby could hold so much poop!  I'd like to try Tommy's again someday... but it may be a while before we actually do.  Like the baby may be a full grown adult by then... and I'm so old and senile that I have mild alzheimers.

bSKzxR8zT9dmO_uo0yGPqw.review_text: my favorite go to spot when I feel like eating cow or pig....did i mention they have $4 jamesons. always. and they're open late. always. pastrami and lamb shanks are the beez kneez.

yOXxe6kn99UPWi_naitL4Q.review_text: When I first moved here, I drove/bussed past the place multiple times. From the outside, it looked like some kind of bar for gay bikers.  The building looks like a giant tattoo. I never thought I'd have an opportunity to see the inside...  Turns out, this place isn't a gay biker bar (although gay bikers are welcome, of course). It's pretty awesome. They got Okocim and Zywiec from Poland and cheap. And delicious roast beef sandwiches.

OrdJuv0n81GgfAL_BAPNsA.review_text: As we continued our trip further north and into San Francisco, we tried to keep away from the seafood, as that is all we had eaten since our trek from Monterey.  Again, my hubby had heard of a place in the heart of the city that served sandwiches, open faced and dipped, stuffed with freshly carved meat.  So we came and found parking right in the front...that was a sign that we needed to eat here! lol  You stand in line and they serve you cafeteria style.  Menus are posted above their counter area, but you better know what you want or else!!!  lol  He got the brisket, my son got the beef stew with rice pilaf, and what did I get...?  The clam chowder...!!!  :D  The food is good and hearty!!!  You pay for the food at the counter, but you can't order drinks.  Once you find a table, you then have a cocktail waitress help you and you pay for them on a separate tab.  Very smart since this is probably the only way they earn tips!  Great atmosphere...reminds my of a dimly lit log cabin with Scandinavian influence.  Lots of locals frequent the place.  Their facade is awesome.  Graffiti at its finest!!!

CiYRhDyFbsDbWR45uv822w.review_text: I hate this place.  I've been here three times, and the food was terrible each and every time.  At least their bar is okay.    For the price of their mall food service, there should be a mall behind 'em.  Enough said, before I get more disgusted with 'em.

i0C4bhHjTVaAMKvz6G7fOw.review_text: Been here twice over the past two weeks with my super picky, meat-a-holic 18yr old bro. It's the only resto that he's requested to repeat and we've taken him to a bunch of places. Last night's beef burgundy was off the chain! the two salads I tried had a strange vinaigrette on it was was kinda fishy smelling. I love the bean salad but had to trade it for the brussels which had the same vinaigrette. i'm sure it was a fluke and just my taste buds. my man's bbq beef was amazeballz. and per usual the mashed potatoes were on point. love this place.

RQEdZiiRHr365MhWpL5PtQ.review_text: People seem to love this place, and once upon a time I did too, but it's not that great of a value and the food is incredibly low quality.  The reason it's cheap is because the meat is processed, the veggies are canned, the salad dressings come out of a plastic tub, the sausages are probably not even really even mostly meat now, you get the picture...  I've tried a lot of food here over the years, and it doesn't rate higher than prepared food or frozen food from Safeway.  If the food at the movie theatre across the street wasn't so expensive, I'd probably opt for their crappy pizzas or chicken tenders over Tommy's when going out for a movie.  I'd get Mel's over them as well, but quick counter ordering at Tommy's is great, and you can have a drink while you're in line.  The people that work here have been working here forever, and basically no one is customer service oriented.  They're all pretty unpleasant to interact with and don't seem to care that much about their jobs.  The restaurant itself is just so dirty and has a strange smell to it.  This place needs a spring cleaning.  I don't find much motivation to come back here anymore.  It used to be fun and special to me, but it is just fading with the times, losing quality, and now losing my business.  I'll stop by for a cheap drink before a movie, but that's it.

M1cMsRL4L7IUr9RILDywEQ.review_text: I decided to give Tommy's Joynt a shot after seeing it on DDD and seeing that yelpers seemed to like them as well. There really isn't missing Tommy's Joynt, it's at the corner of Geary and VanNess and stands out like a sore thumb. Their specialties are hot homemade dinners and hand carved sandwiches. The place works cafeteria style as you order by the counter, slide your way down to the cashier to pay, then carry your meal to a table and enjoy. Make sure to stop by the barrel of free sliced pickles on your way to your seat. In addition to the regular menu they also have a special meal each day of the week (that's the same every week). They also have an extremely long bar with the most impressive beer list I've seen in awhile.  Living in NYC and visiting the west coast for the first time I had to try their pastrami. I can certainly appreciate that they homemake all their meats and that they hand carve the sandwiches instead of slice them but there just wasn't any comparing to Katz. The sandwich wasn't that big and the meat wasn't as juicy as I'm used to. What saved them was that they gave me a cup of hot au jus that made every bite I dipped in it amazing. It was too bad the cup wasn't wide enough to really fit the sandwich in it and I didn't want to make a mess by pouring it over everything.  After re-watching Guy Fieri at Tommy's Joynt I realized that getting a plate (not a sandwich) is definitely the way to go here. You get a nice large portion, a side, and some sort of gravy or sauce to keep everything nice and moist. I think getting some hand sliced turkey with gravy would have been great. So although it wasn't the best pastrami I've ever had I still enjoy the food and the set up at Tommy's and highly recommend checking it out.

dbaZUumaG21x_6lXz8hRlw.review_text: I'd forgotten about Tommy's Joynt. I hadn't popped in here in maybe 20 years and was happy to see that it hasn't changed, which means the food is still good, still reasonably inexpensive and you get in and out quickly if you're in, say a hurry to make a crazy art performance in the south of market, which we were.  How many places sell corn beef and cabbage? Tommy's does. How many sell good corned beef and cabbage? Tommy's does.  This is a meat lovers paradise. I was hapily told they even have buffalo stew here.!!!  Not only have I over looked Tommy's for the last time I think that now I've rediscovered it, I might just move in - there's plenty of room upstairs. I'm small I can sleep in a chair....

FRoSuqfC5AY0ZWlw1AryIA.review_text: Crappy food and 100% overhyped.  Have you ever read amazing reviews about a restaurant, tried it out yourself, and immediately regretted your trust in the Yelp community? This is one of those instances. Why, Yelpers? WHY?! (But it's okay Yelp, I still love you!)  I ordered the Beef Brisket, expecting it be melt-in-your-mouth good from previous reviews. Um, no. In fact, it was crumble-in-your-mouth-BAD. The beef tasted like it was severely over-boiled and lacked that juicy flavor. So disappointing.  Their lack of decent presentation definitely didn't help the situation. They serve you your meal in a prison-like cafeteria tray. I am a big believer in the importance of presentation because it makes the food taste better.   I wanted to stop eating the moment I took that first bite, but since I felt bad wasting food, I finished most of my plate. The only reason I was able to eat most of it was that I ate it with the delicious horseradish sauce that was on the table. YUM. Now, THAT deserves an extra star alone. But still not enough to drag me back to this place.  I would highly, highly recommend against coming here. If you're craving very good beef, I'd suggest House of Prime Rib. Of course, it's much more expensive but well worth the money.

ki2i0kGBowKsT9ZmuJ9Djg.review_text: I recommend that you go out drinking with close friends & end up at Tommy's Joynt.....

rhROLqZmn8HiSJGUn8cB-A.review_text: Well let me start by saying if you have a complete meat lover you may have a different experience at this place. I heard about this place from a friend and wanted to try it out after watching gone girl at the AMC across the street. I ordered tommy's sandwich with turkey. All i got was bread and turkey and sauce - no toppings ? Bread was kinda hard to eat. They surely give a lot of meat but i prefer my sandwich to have some toppings and they didn't seem to have any there. The server's aren't friendly either. Overall if you want just bread and meat for 8 bucks then go here. Else go over to bite on sutter and leavenworth, their sandwiches are much better than here.

auFIMZlqvOwqfU1oYNx7Uw.review_text: is this even the same place? granted, i came a few minutes before closing time, but it was awful. i ordered a $8.95 dinner meal of roast beef, canned green beans, burnt baked beans, and a hard roll.   $9?!? i'd rather get 9 $1 banquet meals from safeway. that would have been tastier.  The meat was cooked well done, with hardly any flavor to it. adding A1, worcestershire and ketchup did not help at all.  They were out of mashed potatoes, so I got green beans, lukewarm and directly from the can.  The baked beans were extremely burnt with the taste of the burnt beans at the bottom circulating through every bite. One of my friends said it tasted like licking a chunky ashtray.   Everything was disappointing on every level, and even if it cost only $3 i would still have felt ripped off. its open until 2am...1 star for that.

Xtl17kvxxYA2AdYjc-JG7w.review_text: As good as it gets for a sandwich joint or a Hoffbrau style restaurant.  The food has always been hot and the servings generous and tasty.  We now make it a point to eat at Tommy's Joynt every time we are in the San Francisco.  Love it.

ZGBaby3K0ye7msmgut45AA.review_text: Ya dude, this place isn't all that cracked up to be. The meat is ok and at best, mediocre.  The service is gruff and to the point, but in their defense, the prices are fair. I had the beef burgundy dinner plate.  It came out to a little under $8. It was a massive plate of beef, sauce, and rice.  There was a little hard roll on the side that was ice cold.   Meh.  Not that great but I'll be back again.  It's kind of overwhelming if it's your first time visiting Tommy's Joynt.  The menu is extensive with various meats and there are signs all over the place.  And like I said, the staff leaves you little time to decide on a choice.  Better to stay in the back and decide on what you want before you join the extremely long line.

4H6fXlz4rOHRa1vPOFqRdQ.review_text: Great place for meat! I had a huge pastrami sandwich, the pastrami was a thick cut, I usually have shaved pastrami and now I'm a fan of thick cut. It has a light smokey taste. I thought of Toonce and ordered a German sausage sandwich as well, good stuff but I didn't enjoy after stuffing my face with pastrami. The establishment has a dive bar feel to it since it has a bar with all kinds of alcohol! Good stuff!

QduLZonSWLofu108PNhtFg.review_text: This place is great value for the bucks. You get a hoffbrau style sandwich or dinner plate. I been here twice . I had a pastrami sandwich the first time and the cornedbeef sandwich the second . Both were off the chain !  Rumor has it that the heavy metal band metallica sometimes bellies up to the bar in here . So that's kind off cool , need a quick bite to eat in the city? TRY TOMMYS JOiNT !

__qs8Agz1geNfwR6Rqyyqg.review_text: Lucky enough to stay at a hotel rite across the street fr this joynt. Its a dive bar which serves good food also at a nice price. Menu was really busy,but i stepped to side & studied it and ordered turkey,mash potatoes w/ gravy,and salad and took care of my hunger. They also have variety of beers and i tried this draft called fat tire and my night was complete.

dTcYw_RuYUm-j83emwDnUQ.review_text: History, character, and a whole lotta scaries... Hof Brau's still in the booming restaurant business. I don't know or get how this is possible..   One thing I do have to give this restaurant is that it's been around far passed my parents time. The first time I stepped foot in here was at the age of 13. As a 13 year old girl, I wanted to only go to the best restaurants where there were pretty people dressed up in their 9's. But no, my fathers who name is Tom, TOMMY, Thomas, wanted to go to Tommy's Joynt. Wow, was I a brat... I complained of the bench seating, the trays, the people... What a close minded youngin I was.   Now I have to thank my dad for introducing me to all sorts of diversity... From glamor restaurants to a delicious hole in the wall.  I've been back since, just to try it and to find what my adult-like reaction would be. It is not just a so so restaurant that used to give me the scaries, but it is a piece of history with good food.

Hd6Y63qcx0jMjd76smpn8Q.review_text: Love this place. One of the places I crave for once in awhile. Yummy food. Huge portions. Good prices. Great atmosphere. I always order the brisket. The staff here are always friendly. The only hard part for me is carrying the heavy food tray to the table. The counters are way too tall for me lol

fCUWiOjxTjUyJWKTd6BJ6Q.review_text: I dropped in because I had seen it on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives and was excited to try it for myself. I got the pastrami with a side of coleslaw and a slice of cheesecake---all of which were fantastic. The cheesecake was simply wonderful. The prices seemed very reasonable.  What wasn't cool was the wait. I can understand that the place is going to be busy, but the queue was wrapped back and forth at least four times. After waiting a good twenty minutes, I was unable to find a seat. There is very little one or two-person seating, and the tables that are available are very close together (making it difficult to move around). I ended up finding a table in the back (up a set of stairs) that was half-pushed out of the way.  If it wasn't for the seating issues, I would probably go back to eat. If I were looking for a quick take-out and was in the neighborhood, I would go back for sure.

NhcHLDJDqyC621vZ834PKA.review_text: I live nearby and have eaten here at least a dozen times, including Thanksgiving dinner. Great service, efficient, reasonable prices, great food, great atmosphere and great beer. It hits all the expectations I have in a restaurant/bar, and I will definitely continue to go here. If you want to be filled up for under $13, take a trip to Tommy's!

9niZb3V242BIG7FRu1J6NQ.review_text: Tommy's is a great place to go when you're hungry. The portions are extremely generous and the prices are low. The hand carved meats and turkey are excellent; the house specialties, like BBQ Turkey Sloppy Joe's, are stand-outs.   Tommy's is a must visit. The vibe is non stop, the service is straight up, and the meal... well, you better get in line asap. PS. Bring cash money. No credit cards.

ubV4Oxqqvd6X4JZTehfM5g.review_text: We happened to be staying across the street at the Opal Hotel, so it was natural we'd wander in. Little did we know we would be eating and drinking all of our meals there for the rest of our stay! Their buffet has great variety and never disappointed me, and they have a great beer selection and more tequila varieties than you can shake a stick at.  The ambiance and the staff make you feel at home.  Now I know where to go when visiting SF.

lrp5aQP31ar3JDlbwccfHQ.review_text: After driving by this place ever since I was little, I FINALLY gave Tommy's Joynt a try. It wasn't what I expected, but in a good way. I came here late at night after a show and it wasn't too busy. I ended up ordering the Turkey Sloppy Joe, which was ok. It wasn't quite like a sloppy joe, but it was still good. And for under $5, the portion was huge. I will definitely come back, but will try the BBQ Brisket.

0wFEhEe5RE7A7kLbufoRXA.review_text: I would vote this place "Best Meat and Potatoes Joint" in SF. They have a vast selection of Meaty offerings to make any Midwesterner feel at home. The place is well known for being able to order a sandwich and a drink for under $10. There selection of beer is very impressive. It's very much a cafeteria meets bar environment.  I always enjoy going here on my lunch, and the line is often out the door, but their speedy chefs keep it moving and get you seated faster than you'd expect. I work in the Financial district and often will take the Geary bus down, or grab a ride with a Friend, if that is any measure of my meaty likeness of this classic staple that's been in business since 1947...

UkUxwhaXq-BmA5h6NR1GHA.review_text: So this is the infamous Tommy's Joynt, huh? For me, it's just aite. The food is good but I don't think I'll have cravings to come back.  What you walk into is a dimly lit place with beer inspired decor covering the walls. Look to the left, a full bar...nice. A sign with the daily specials hangs above the food line. Cafeteria style hof brau, I can dig it. While waiting in line, I read Yelp reviews to help make my decision. I read the braised lamb shanks were good. I look up at the sign, it's Thursday, lamb shanks day. Perfect. I told my friend about the reviews and before I could spit out I'm ordering the lamb shanks, this guy blurts out he's getting it. Grrr, I hate ordering the same thing, especially when it's my first time somewhere.  I opt for the bbq brisket of beef. The server grabs a big hunk of brisket, cuts 6 slices, adds a scoop of mashed potatoes to the plate and puts it on a tray. I got the accompanying sauce on the side. Along with the entree came a choice of salads, coleslaw please. Friend's tray consisted of a plate with 2 shanks, carrots and potatoes in a stew-like sauce. Friend didn't want a dinner roll, I do. Friend changes mind...copy cat. Friend: Can I get a roll too? Server: You said you didn't want one. Friend: Yeah but I changed my mind. Server: I asked you but you didn't want one. Friend: Well, can I get one? Server: Rolls eyes and plops a roll on a plate.  Haha, wtf? That was way too much conversing for a roll.   Dinner came to $19 and change (thanks for treating, dinner buddy!). A good price for 2 big, hearty meals. We take said trays and find a table adorned with a checkered covered vinyl tablecloth. Along with a napkin dispenser, atop the table were 2 types of mustards (hot and mild) and horseradish. Water is self-serve. At first, you will see a white appearance to it. I was assured by a worker that it was just the water pressure and sure enough, the water quickly became clear. Any pickle fans? Well, next to the water is a big container of free pickles...only take what you can consume (one of my dad's favorite saying when I was growing up).  My meal was straight comfort food...hearty and very filling. The beef was so tender that you didn't need a knife to cut it. However, it didn't have much seasoning. It definitely needed some type of sauce or S&P to add flavoring. The mash was made with real potatoes (no flakes) and it had a nice, smooth consistency. The sauce I had on the side kind of confused me. Sweet, tangy but it had more of a consistency to gravy. Whatever, a fork full of meat and mash dipped simultaneously into the sauce solved any confusion. It was good but I've had better. Props to how the meat was cooked because brisket, I hear, is the hardest type of meat to bbq.  The lamb shanks was the better choice of meals. The meat was tender and succulent. When the meat falls off the bone, it's usually a good sign. The sauce was very flavorful, not being overly salty.  If I happen to run into this place again, that's fine with me. If it was my choice, I'd go elsewhere as there are many other restos in the area to choose from.

B9_M5qoWA5tHXQWHfoW0tg.review_text: Hey great place for some late night eats! at great prices in the city.  I had the Buffalo Stew! which was was tasty and unique. Where else can you get Buffalo in the city! I also tried the corned beef and spareribs. Which were also good and tasty. Good portions on their servings. I little bit salty though, but overall delicious food.   Lively atmosphere even at late hours, great place to "hangout" with friends. Highly recommended!

7wE9-V_U8SFeigW5y86iIQ.review_text: Hmmm, all I can say is freaking AWESOME!! Wow! The food is perfect and reminds me of my country home. The price is fantastic as well. Beer selection is awesome as well. I highly recommend.

yNW3fTr7lpm8LhIIfoxyow.review_text: Well, I seem to be in that small minority that think that this place is'nt as great as others have clearly written on this page. I just don't think this place warrants a 3-4 let alone a 5star rating? In the words of Tim Allen's tv-wife, "I don't think so Tim"! What further perplexes me is that since this place is a cafeteria sytle(served) eatery and at the same time its not that cheap. Not really. Same line as The Hoffbrau. Although the Hoffbrau is a tad bit better than this place, but not by much. Anyways, Tommy's is that old school SF hangout and the clientle is probably decsendants of the past. And they don't care to pay top dollar for cheap food.  This round was my third one in purchasing the leg of lamb with side salad and bread&butter. Total cost with tax is a whopping $14.03 and that was a mistake on the order cook as I had previously asked him to serve me the special of the day and he apparently confused it with the "house special"-which was/is the lamb shank. The special at the time was beef tips with rice pillaf and was priced at upper $8bux or so. That would have been the cheaper meal as I prolly would have been charged around $10bux out the door. Much cheaper than what I ended up eating and paid. And yes, the rub in this one is that the lamb shank was overcooked and not meaty at all. If anything, that lamb piece I got was anorexic and at $14bux, you get ONE piece? And so yeah, Tommy's relies on business from tourists and local city drunks that don't care for taste and care more for quantity and not quality. The side salad is always drenched in dressing. Should order the dressing on the side.

djWl0HKJwEwWlY-0vo7oRA.review_text: Monday - Oxtail & Thursday - Lambshank = Happy Me! SO FREAKING GOOD!  The oxtail has got to be my ATF (all time favorite) dish. It's cooked so tender, fall off the bone good, drenched in an amazing sweet oily sauce that's like crack. *wipes drool off face* I usually get the pasta with it and use the bread roll they give you and dip it in the oh-so-good sweet sauce. It's a little on the sweet side, so if you're looking for something savory, go with the beef brisket instead (which is cut when you order and cooked medium-rareish usually).  The lamb is awesome too! You get 2 small lamb shanks in a savory gravy sauce. Very tender and I just love the gamy taste of lamb. Other dishes I've tried are the turkey leg (okay) and the buffalo stew (very, very salty when I had it and a bit dry and too chunky).  This is a very casual place that's cafeteria style, but there's a cocktail server that comes around to take your drink orders. They have a million beers to choose from and a full bar if beer is not your thing. The place gets a little crowded during dinner time and it's a good place to watch the game.   Staff is friendly, but the cocktail servers can be a little spotty depending on who. Some have forgotten our drinks altogether and some are super nice. Pricing is very decent. Get a full meal that'll fill you up for $10. If you're a meat lover, you MUST try this place!

S0NfyyNa4HofB9SIOiOgvA.review_text: Great place, but not for those looking for anything low calorie. Heavy on the carbs but delicious.

xFbvPljRiYopjLF6G37Xfw.review_text: This place kicks mega-meaty ass. I can't possibly top any of the 500-plus reviews already posted (ya damn Yelpers, you), so I'll just say this: From my cozy perch inside a booth tonight, eating my turkey dinner with stuffing, gravy, mashed potatoes, green salad and bread 'n' butter (for $8.50, bitches!), I heard the following conversation between two worse-for-wear men in an adjoining booth:  MAN NO. 1: It was in Cambodia. Phnom Penh. This guy wanted me to go to an opium den. I didn't. MAN NO. 2: Murmph.  Precisely.

pdq8mplROSDvKyMtRxUHag.review_text: I haven't lived in the Bay Area for all that long... but in the year and a half that I HAVE lived here, I'm surprised as hell that I'd never tried this place before.  Yes, I've passed by more than a few times and have seen this building a few more, but for some reason, I never looked at it with any curiosity or interest thinking the whole time that it was some overdressed San Francisco bar.  Well, today, a co-worker told me that we were going here for lunch.  I complied.  To Order: BBQ Brisket of Beef Sandwich (w/ mayo and mustard) --WHAT an order.  At under $6, it was definitely a good price for the quality of food.  The brisket was perfect.  The gobs of fat were sliced off by someone who looked like a butcher, leaving behind the flavorful portions of meat and sparse shreds of fat.  I enjoyed every single bite. Turkey Leg w/ Stuffing and Green Beans --At under $6 for this meal as well, I couldn't get over what a STEAL it was.  Ever been to a theme park and ordered the giant turkey legs?  Well, this was one of them.  GREAT taste, large portions, and eye-catching (especially when you open it up and your co-workers are sitting around... jealous as hell).    The folks behind the counter were friendly, giving us smiles the entire time.  The atmosphere seemed very friendly and upbeat.  I felt like I could sit in there amongst friends for hours and still feel like I'm in a fun-filled environment.  Maybe I'll make this happen for sometime in the future.  This spot definitely warrants at least a second visit.  5 Stars for wonderful food and GREAT prices.  P.S. - don't forget to fill up on their pickles!

WaQ7KcZd3wVozXiDFWIDVA.review_text: Great BBQ brisket!  Mashed potatoes and peas were just so-so.

6eXpHzfFCEnRvelmTqs7ng.review_text: I like the vibe. Staff are very friendly, honest, and give generous amounts of meat. I had the corned beef sandwich. This is the first time I've had corned beef. I don't have much to say about it, since I have nothing to compare it to. Sandwich was $5.

H8OA3UDsbfLQCc4SjDtyyQ.review_text: great big sandwiches at great small prices. cant get a better deal than this. i got corned beef sandwich on a roll for $6.00. it was massive and delicious. they hand carve all the meat right in front of you. i also got a side of beans and coleslaw. the beans were lukewarm but the coleslaw was crisp and fresh.

gS7S5XUuLhLfEucs7wx0VA.review_text: This place is PURE AWESOMENESS!   There are important milestones in a man's life: Earning a college degree. Tying the knot. Becoming a homeowner. And then there's Eating at Tommy's Joynt. It's a rite of passage. A birthright for San Fanciscans. A milestone. Slice of heaven on earth.   Sample the BBQ brisket, the corned beef, the braised lamb shanks, or the braised oxtails... and be blown away. Okay ... this is all hyperbole, but in all seriousness, this place is pretty freakin good. Lines usually aren't too long and the food is served cafeteria style. These people do a mean sandwich. They don't mess around.

xMSDosWZGitXSmCty779Ow.review_text: I miss working in San Francisco and having lunch from Tommy's Joint delivered to our office via Waiters on Wheels :(  My new found favorite is their ox-tail stew.  My mouth is drooling just thinking of it.

Q2Iest8oggBub6nVBFEcNw.review_text: Ah, late night food.  A staple of the college years.  These days I generally avoid it because I don't think my body could take it.  But occasionally on Saturday you'll find yourself in an apres-show situation and realize you haven't eaten since your 3:00 lunch.  And that's when a place like Tommy's becomes invaluable.  Especially if you also find yourself in the pouring rain.
