The menu here is essentially meat, bread, and a few vegetable sides.  In other words, a lot like a BBQ joint except there's not much BBQ flavor, more like a stew and dinner roast type of thing.  I had the buffalo sandwich, which was basically a buffalo stew ladled over some pieces of bread.  Simple, steamy and filling.  It was lacking in spice but there were several types of mustard and horseradish at the table to give it some kick.  The other big thing on the menu here is the beer--there's a very large selection of bottled German stuff.  The atmosphere, with the long shared tables, red and white checkered tablecloths and gold rush memorabilia, is sort of a cross between a German beer hall and a drastically more authentic version of Claim Jumper's.  All in all, not a bad place to warm your bones and fill your belly, and for a good price, too.

CnNNqr7NzHDQ-G9jz4k7Mw.review_text: I love Tommy's so hard.   The BBQ brisket of beef is tender and juicy, the portions are hearty, and SWEET JESUS the house margaritas for $4.50! And and there's always room to sit so you don't wander around with your tray like the unpopular kid in the school cafeteria. This also means that I don't have to find myself sitting elbow-to-elbow with a bunch of idiots, but can nest comfortably upstairs and away from the masses.  I tried this place for the first time a little while ago and have started coming in regularly. My only regret is that I didn't try it sooner.

qcmg-jf6ZtaA6HpHhp0A_g.review_text: Came here at 5PM on a Sunday before the line got too crazy. Have always wanted to try this place because I hear a lot about it. I must say they do have quite a bit of options, which is good but is also confusing. You stand in line and order your food from the windows - very cafeteria style. I guess the people there are so use to working quickly because they talked so fast I had no idea what they were saying. I just kinda nodded and went "uh-huh". I felt rushed and I had so many questions since I wasn't sure what to order so I don't feel like I made the best possible selection for my meal.   I ordered the Corned Beef dinner plate with mashed potatoes, a mixed green salad, and also came with bread and butter. The bread was waaayyy too hard. I tried to bite into it and the damn thing hurt my front teeth. I ended up digging a hole in it and just eating the soft center. The bread was not that good. The mixed green salad may have been alright had he not drenched my salad in thousand island dressing. Seriously, I was trying to have a nice healthy salad to offset the rest of my meal and instead felt like i was drinking salad dressing. The mashed potatoes were decent although the one scoop was pretty tiny.  The corned beef was a nice portion but a bit salty. The first few bites were okay but if you ate too much, the saltiness became too much. My friend ordered the half chicken with rice. The chicken was a big portion and was pretty juicy and fell right off the bone. The rice was not enough. You pretty much only had a chicken plate.   Would I recommend this place to a friend? Hmmm not really. I guess it's one of those places worth trying just to say you have been there and know what it's about. And I'd probably come back for a quick fix that will hit the spot if I were to be in the neighborhood, but it is not a place I would go out of my way to make a special trip for. I think the quality and service is lacking. But I guess that is the norm for this type of establishment.

POVYlNFZm8WtREIDpuuLvQ.review_text: Great food, inexpensive, good portions, free pickles! Excellent location. I had the roast chicken and rice with broccoli salad. There's something for everyone here.

r2-fuL5SE-BzJv-7lni80g.review_text: Like many others, I was intrigued by the outside decor for a long time before venturing in.  My first roommate in San Francisco took me to Tommy's and I cannot thank her enough.    The pastrami sandwich is one of the most delicious things I've ever tasted.  Seriously.  You may be tempted to order something else, but you'll regret it.  Nothing is better than the pastrami.  Plus they have a billion types of beer.  I love love love this place.  Don't forget to eat some of the delicious free pickles in the back!  Also don't forget to bring your cash, but don't worry, it's super cheap.  Kitchen closes at 1am.

5CXIyYCit2qa2d-MlXGobQ.review_text: Ambiance-not my style Food-good if you like A LOT of homestyle type meals  I had the turkey, mashed potatoes, and cucumber/tomato salad-Not so bad, reminds me of Thanksgiving back in the midwest (thats where I'm from :)  ).   Also tried the beef brisket, baked beans, macaroni salad-everything but the mac sala was great.  Rum Punch- gross

Kmrxlnndu3zvB8e6wnboQw.review_text: I guess it's decent for what it is....whatever Tommy's Joynt is....There's a full service bar on one side of the restaurant and a cafeteria-style hot foods counter on the other side.  Hmmm......  I questioned the authenticity of Guy Fieri on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives after frequenting this place.  The food is overall too salty and lacks any special flavor.  The bread is hard as a rock and barely edible.    There are a couple of ups, though. 1.  The beer selection is great 2.  It's cheap 3.  It's open late 4.  The cabbage side dish  But if you're expecting to actually eat some decent food when frequenting a restaurant, then I'd look elsewhere...

MsOuhK9Yg-qkFuHC4htP-w.review_text: Portions are so big and taste so good. I tried the special of the day (sweet & sour spare ribs).  I almost ate the whole thing, but they give you 4 huge ribs. The sauce they pour over it is so tasty and goes good with the rice.  There is a big barrel of pickles that is self serve, the pickles are sliced kosher dills that are crunchy and good.  Also there is a bar that has all kinds of beer.

8AWBMbMcesaqSWQ91pNOLA.review_text: This place is awesome, one of my favorites in the city, a landmark that I direct all visitors to.  What shall I have.... perhaps some MEAT!!!!  For my side? Hmmmm..... no side, how bout some more MEAT!!!!  The pastrami sandwich is my favorite lunch choice as it isn't too heavy, but is really packed with flavor.  Otherwise, I make a point of trying everything on the menu.  Buffalo stew, thanksgiving dinner, lamb chops.... all delicious.  Warning: CASH ONLY.  The line gets long, but the staff is super efficient.  This was our Tuesday spot for a while at work until our designated driver moved back to Florida.  Damn him!

eMqTYse8CAFaItDmonWrcQ.review_text: Tommys Joynt is one of the "Last of a Dying Breed" of Classic Hofbrau Style Restaurants.  They serve up the most tender hand carved cuts of your favorite freshly smoked meats, right in front of your eyes! Their selection is amazing and their daily specials are to die for!  I love the sides and usually trade a side salad for green beans.  The rolls are especially chewy, filling and delightful!  The entire restaurant exudes an air of classic Americana from a time when Meat & Potatoes were a staple of every working man's diet.  AND ITS AFFORDABLE!!  Combine this with the full bar, cute bar girls, nostalgic decor and convenient downtown location - makes this one of the best restaurants in San Francisco!!

kvtcuRIMUqLHD1X1mDi7lQ.review_text: I walked in starving, expecting delicious food (after reading previous reviews) and left somewhat disappointed. I think I expected too much.   I ordered the BBQ Beef Brisket and it is a bit too fatty.   The potato salad was bland.  But... the free pickles were amazing!   I won't be coming back.

yO8tAwXJWv_MCON2UUAbiw.review_text: Melt in your mouth pastrami is not even the word for it. The sandwich was great.  I wish they had rye bread. Other than that drop what you are doing and get your ass down there. Because Tommy knows what he doing. ON POINT

N0mVci8y9eC4PJJmaZ9ymA.review_text: I really wanted to like this place a lot more than I actually did. But, since you can't be choosy when you want to eat a meal out on July 4th, we went in.  They serve meat. With a side of meat. I'm pretty sure the desserts were made of meat, too. Everything tasted like meat.   I had the spaghetti and meatballs, but the spaghetti sauce was strange. It reminded me of a not-so-spicy Cincinnati-style chili (which, in case you didn't know, they serve on spaghetti). It was a heck of a lot more meaty than it was tomato-y.  My partner's turkey sloppy joe was apparently good (I don't like sloppy joe, so I didn't try it) and her mashed potatoes were good (but again, tasted like meat).  It was cheap though, and a lot of food. I have to give it that. I think next time, though, I'll just come here for beers and their totally awesome pickle barrel.  Those pickles rocked my frikken world.

msHUlHTw9NlsYgwDm1k8sA.review_text: After hearing from several people that this place is good and even seeing it on food network my bf and I decided to try this place. I know that this is like a landmark joynt in san francisco, but it wasn't that great. I wish I had a better experience and a tasty one at that but...tommys joynt failed to impress me. It's like elevated cafeteria food and  cheap like cafeteria food also.   My food was lukewarm and the meat was tasteless, I got the beef round dinner mashed potatoes, gravy, potato salad, and a dinner roll. My boyfriend got the special which was sweet & sour bbq ribs with rice. My bfs food was too tough and hard to chew off the meat from the ribs.   Maybe being inebriated next time i go will raise my opinions about this place. Otherwise the sober me will stay away.

nRxjaVrNn7Q9m2N5mBCewQ.review_text: Solid cornbeef sandwich. (Good) Cash only. (Bad) Hot mustard and horseradish on the table is good. (Good) Pickles you take yourself,  and are good.  Slight crunchy. (Good) Ox tail is sweet. (ok) Rice taste like uncle Ben style. (ok) It's really hot in here. (Bad) Bathroom are up stairs,  small, even hotter and dirty. (very bad) Place is very interesting, with lots of random stuff every where.  Very bar feeling. (and they do have a bar).   If I wanted to get a good sandwich this is a good place to go for it.

jy_RGAeAvNeCv5BxZsUWFA.review_text: From the outside this place looks like a tourist trap so I avoided going there for years but finally got talked into trying it in the mid 90's  This is a pretty interesting place. It's a cafeteria inside a hole in the wall bar. You stand in line for food but once you sit down there is table service for your drinks.  This place is all about meat. Now that people are all talking about Bison I grin to myself knowing that Tommy's joint has been serving it for at least ten years. If you are a veggie I don't think you can even eat here.  They have an excellent beer selection on paper but invariably their most interesting sounding offerings are out of stock.  If you are going to a movie at the AMC and like meat this is a good place to go for dinner.  You veggies that gave Tommy's joint a low score should grow up. That would be like me going into a vegan place and complaining that they don't have meat. If you chose to ignore the omnivore  tradition going back to our pre-sapian ancestors that's your choice but don't demand we all cater to your kooky choices.

l_mlQJXB2ZNySfIN6istGw.review_text: Certainly a dive, but with a certain charm.  Most would probably either love it or hate it here. Total hof brau ambiance:  Dingy carpet, dim lighting, crowded tables.  Every once in a while I like a nice roast beef or turkey dinner, and they have a good deal here.  Always fresh and hand-carved.  Had the lamb shanks once, and it was a bit too greasy for my constitution, unfortunately.  Props for having Chimay on tap.

f5AumnmaDSE49GtHiRJGaQ.review_text: I have never been disappointed with any of the food. Although settings your expectations should also be appropriate. You don't come to the joynt to get 5 star dinning. Concentrate on the amazing meats that are perfectly cooked. The au jus that is made thick and with a hint of vinegar but turns sweet when protein hits it. The salads and sides are a reminder of old California cooking of places like the original pantry or the very first time I are at Harry's ranch before it was rebuilt into that very nice but more expensive restaurant. It is nostalgic, beercelent, easy and fun.

mMhsMvHPagrTJVX-2gMxnA.review_text: I got the roast beef sandwhich on sourdough. It was OK. The horseradish that was on the table was great! Cleaned out my sinuses. I hope to try this place again. The day I went they didn't have any sides that really spoke to me. Tons of beer to choose from.

kHqnbaZAHTp2n0yR9Ho_Dw.review_text: This old time hafbrau is truly one of the SF's greatest treats.  It's always fun to bring in a first timer and see their head spin around trying to take in all the side show circle decorations that adorn this place.  Every time I walk by this place my mouth starts to water as the smell of that oh so sweet juicy meat come wafting out the door.  One can't help but to look for an ATM to grab some cash and jump in line and order up a generous order of meat that is guaranteed to help boost your cholesterol levels through the roof!  For me it has to be the brisket!  I like everything on the menu but that oh so yummy brisket just calls my name, saying eat me, eat me, and I can't help but to give in to the sweat call of that naughty siren.  Top it off with some baked beans, coleslaw for my two sides and wash it down with anyone of the hundred beers that are available and I am one happy hombre.    This place is good when you're starving, cold, hot, sick, drunk, stupid, or just plain bored.  You can't go wrong with Tommy's.

ODsM6-_BvHt6-cqNylJn7g.review_text: This place is a real slobber knocker of a place. Good food, good people, with great prices. You're not getting five star food, but that's kinda the point. This is a great place to chill out, have a real hearty meal, and enjoy life.   Lot most Hof Braus the food is pretty standard. Meat and potatoes kind of place. Still has an awesome bar, and the bartenders are very gracious people. If I lived in SF, I would visit this place more often.   I think the reviews speak for this place. Give it a shot, or you will be sorry.

Rrmb6UQUR-U3an6wy2h9wA.review_text: I'm not sure what to make of this place. It reminds me of Sam's Hof Brau in Sacramento, buffet type layout and you just point and shoot. Perhaps I should have heeded everyone's warning and just had the pastrami sandwich, they're supposed to be famous for it in the city.   Instead I had the bbq brisket sandwich, which was surprisingly tender. I think it could have been boiled for a long period of time. Bland. Bland as the dickens. It comes with a sauce, which isn't bbq sauce, it's like a weird cloyingly sweet hickory syrup of sorts. Had to salt and pepper the shit out of my meat. And all on a sourdough hard roll that had a good crust and a chewy interior.  This place has great charm and I refuse to believe that their food isn't good and because of this, I shall return. Good prices though.

zu3iiSQflDNPkKo781Cx4Q.review_text: My favorite restaurant, I will never go to SF and NOT eat at Tommy's Joynt.   Great food, great beer, not over priced, friendly people, always a good time! This place also holds some history as it is the place Metallica asked Jason to join the band. If I lived closer this would be my nightly dinner.

3Rn993btYslL-3D902Bxlw.review_text: We brought a friend for lunch today and my man ordered the same corned beef and salad, they were out of cabbage, huh?  This time my friend and I ordered the same thing, red wine beef stew over rice, or something like that, and it was good, just like those rolls they give with the lunch plates.  We also ordered 2 buffalo chilis again, I like it alot, but my friend reminded me that the one we had at Zippys in Hawaii was better, it's been a long time since I been there.......Anyways, we had tons of pickles and just kept on eating.  Geez, that corned beef sure was tender though...and back to the bread, I love that kind of tough bread, it is so good!!!  It must be the pickles and bread that brought me back again...lol

D6h_vcc1U_q7z_3iZXVWMQ.review_text: I love Tommy's Joynt.  It has everything you could ask for...Fresh roasted meats...ham, turkey..roast beaf...pastrami...and thats just for the sandwiches...They also have every beer known to man ...my wife swears she's in heaven everytime we go there.  The meals are great too...I've been to alot of Hofbraus but Tommy's beats them by far.  Reasonable prices...great food...beer..and more beer.  Great place to eat!!!!

9pDyntrRn1jjDaO_rJzzsg.review_text: Pastrami Dinner and sooooooo many pickles is the only way to go!!!!

6wQNz4Cb8ROPkzM3AfHWug.review_text: After another visit I have to give the fifth star to Tommy's Joynt due to the fact that they've been consistently awesome for as long as I can remember. There are few things in San Francisco that haven't changed since I was a kid and this is one of them. A strict meat and potatoes establishment that never tries to reinvent itself or add any pretense to it's decor/menu. The daily specials have stayed the same since forever and when I was especially broke the turkey sloppy joe sandwich with extra gravy and mashed potatoes (under $5) is a true working man's meal. They haven't changed anything in this place for as long as I've been coming here and bless them I hope they never do!

ysTqD4nVrkxo3b9MniK2lQ.review_text: Hi all. I may not be the best judge of this place. I only ordered a salad and a clam chowder from here and it wasn't good.  If you like MAN restaurants and humongous portions, than this is the place for you. I met my friends here for dinner. It was only 2 days after Thanksgiving and i was done with comfort food, The place is noisy but has nice lighting. It's definitely a guy restaurant and not good for first dates or second or third.  Enjoy?

jjuxiwKoiz8voegbWEJVMg.review_text: Tommy's Joynt merits 3.5 stars - it's a great place if you want a quick bite of hearty comfort food at a pretty decent price for SF.  And I mean quick!  My bf made the comment that this place is faster than fast food - it's hofbrau style, so you wait in line, order your food that gets put on a tray, and go find a table to sit at.    I ordered the buffalo stew with rice and beans which left me a little hungry, despite all the other reviews of hefty portions, and I think there could have been a little more buffalo.  I only saw little tiny chunks in there, and that was a tad disappointing after all the hype on Yelp.  My bf got the roast beef sando which is literally 4 slices of roast beef slapped in between bread, with au jus on the side.  He thought it was rather plain, and some of the beef was grissly.  The sides we ordered, however, were pretty tasty - the baked beans and potato salad are definitely must-tries.  I'll be back, but only when I'm feeling like gorging myself on a 1,000-calorie meal and only have 10 minutes to do so.

oB1Ol_i9ooZwvQShyIxyrA.review_text: After all these years at my job, a group of co-workers and I finally decided to try this place out. When I entered, I felt like I was lining up for a ride at Disneyland.  There was a few people in front of us and you can tell that they have their ordering system down packed! I went "light" and ordered with a beef brisket sandwich (with cheese) since the guy behind the counter said it was their most poplar cut of meat to order.  Their bread was ok... didn't have that fresh baked taste that I was looking for.  But, their au jus sauce that comes with the sandwich is SUPER good! I poured that sauce along with the spicy mustard-which could be VERY spicy if you put too much. It made me turn red, cough and "put some hair on my chest." haha! Thankfully, not really! Make sure you get some pickles out of the barrel on the side next to the utensils!  Tommy's is definitely a place that serves good ol' comfort food.  CASH only!

tdJ_TquO1CjvUdviaXnf4w.review_text: Ok so my first time in San Fran I am cruising around with the top back on the rental & what do I see....a bright blue place on the corner with carnival attraction type painted advertisement....I'm expecting "see the 2 headed boy,only a quarter" but it's a bar/reasturant....line was 2 people from out the door but went really quick....food was damn good & value for the $ can't be beat....we ordered 2 corned beef sandwichs on sour dough with a side of Mac & cheese & beans (yes I'm a fat ass) & the bill was $20...sat down & ordered drinks from a waitress while feasting on all you can eat & fish out of a giant pickle barrel pickle chips....place is a must eat when in the Bay Area & DD&D were there too....so if your parched & starved from hiking up those giant ass hills swing by Tommy's Joynt & grab a sandwich & brew!

awmRirDC7WWig6R07XZ_oA.review_text: Its very hard to decide what to eat for an indecisive Libra when there are thousands of options posted on the wall.  I can't decide and I always end up with a sandwich plus coleslaw.  The best thing here is the large caldron filled with crispy pickle slices.  The worst thing here is the buttermilk listed under beverages. sick.

5GUISjb0_SBB7tr57OE6Jw.review_text: Yummy, hearty, served cafeteria style type food.  Meat and potatoes type of joint.  Everything is good!

swPzGhlwdYxOTW4CoTCC7A.review_text: I went one time and dying to go again. I was confused in how to order but once we did, it was a great experience. There is definitely no need for fillings in your sandwiches. The meat was super tender and juicy, full of flavor, plus they offer the juice of the meat in a tiny bowl.

aQWma2pz0CI-7HoVIlOfjQ.review_text: Tremendous value.  My personal favorites are braised oxtail on Monday, short rib over mash potatoes on Tuesday, lamb shank on Thursday, and the turkey dinner platter any other day.

dE9YaRaUtkDm-xJrW3BSPg.review_text: was waiting for a doctor's appt down the street so i stopped by for a sandwich.  decor is what i would describe as quintessential or stereotypical american kitsch (and i dont mean that in a bad way).  lots of seating for an sf establishment.  got the corned beef on sourdough roll.  corned beef was tender and the right amount of salty.  sourdough was pretty fresh and average tasting.  the au jus was really different from anything ive had before.  much too subtle, not salty, not sweet, and it had a mild tea-like aftertaste.  i dont know how else to describe it.  it added only moisture but not taste at all.  bottom line: i would stop by for another sandwich if i were in the area, but i wouldnt go out of my way.

8oFZEpX00zZS1Dku2aKfcQ.review_text: This place is definitely a find!  Some friends and I wanted to grab a quick dinner before heading to the theaters and the only other real option was Mel's (meh!) so we walked across the street into Tommy's Joynt (with the crazy murals and flags).  We walked in and oh my goodness, is this place CRAZY or what?! It has so much character and was not at all what I was expecting. In addition, the food they serve definitely brought me back to the south for a quick second, especially the way they serve it cafeteria-style. There was a pretty hefty line when we got there, but it went through fairly quickly. Also they ONLY TAKE CASH (but ATM is available inside).  My friend and I both ordered the BBQ Brisket Dinner Plate and my other friend got the Buffalo Chili with rice.  BBQ Brisket Dinner Plate - comes with some hefty slices of brisket smothered in BBQ sauce, choice of green beans or mashed potatoes, choice of salad or baked beans, and a sourdough roll. The BBQ sauce was a bit too sweet for my liking, but they had horseradish, hot mustard, hot sauce, the works to bring in the kick that I wanted. The horseradish was crazy! it definitely cleared all three of our sinuses! Green beans were just fine, can't really mess them up, and the baked beans, again on the sweeter side but again was able to tweak them to my liking using all the various condiments available. The sourdough roll was mehhh but it wasn't a crucial part to the meal  Buffalo Chili with Rice - they put rice on the bottom, then poured the chili (which looked like the baked beans mixed with some other ingredients) on top. My friend definitely ate it all, so I'm assuming it was pretty tasty.  HOWEVER, I learned that we had come here for the wrong reason entirely. I know now to come here for DRINKING purposes solely. Not only does it have a crazy interior with random stuff stapled to every part of its walls (including the ceiling) making it mysterious and like you're in the middle of a crazy twisted game of Clue, but they have a ridiculous listing of alcoholic beverages. Over 100 types of beers (AHH!! my heaven!), but I also saw a list of 20+ liquor/liqueur coffee beverages (YUM!).   Honestly, if this place had outdoor seating, I think I might have found my drinking mecca in the city for lazy afternoons; unfortunately they don't have a patio (probably a good thing for me so I'm not constantly drinking during the afternoon on weekends!).  But I'll definitely be back for drinks, and then to try some of the other crazy food dishes they have randomly. I think with drinks, they'll pair amazingly.

APv0NMsIBT9HsyGuUFTDVA.review_text: Incredibly reasonable prices, all sorts of options.  There's usually a line (good sign!), but it moves quickly (woohoo!).  Lots of seating; we've never had a problem finding a nice private nook after we've picked up our food.  Like another reviewer mentioned, it does have sort of a nice dive bar vibe.    Meat lovers, you'll enjoy this spot.

aB9vk1deuxlgo-HKFI5JOw.review_text: We had dinner here for the first time because of the reviews and appearance on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. Walk in, get in line, order, carry your tray to a table, wait for a waitress to come get your drink order. My meal was great! I had the open-faced meatball sandwich and a side of carrot salad. My husband's BBQ sandwich looked a little lack-luster ... it needed a little more oomph to it instead of just meat on bread. Overall, good food and a great price in a usually expensive city! I think our whole meal with two sandwiches, two sides, a beer, and a daiquiri was less than $30. Make sure to bring cash, that's all they take!

QaQPAP0LifakyYLqibI_9Q.review_text: Great post-hockey game food ... no BS, great food, great prices, and Metallica used to come here. Can't get any better than that.

SgNMSoVk0DMoMciABsr72Q.review_text: Had lunch here today turkey with all the fixings, I ate every bite. Dressing, mashed potatoes and gravy with a local pumpkin ale.  Not as good as home-cooked but still very good.  The only thing missing was the green bean casserole.  Very reasonably priced will definitely eat here again next time I'm in San Francisco!

Yi5JKaD1VY4Edeww92PZWA.review_text: This place is great!! Stopped by after seeing a movie, and was so surprised at the food selection. I was definitely expecting more of a dive bar scene, but this place is actually homey and welcoming. The food was SO good. They have such a wide selection of comfort foods and generally delicious things. I ordered the corned beef and cabbage, and it was the best I've ever had. Beer selection is pretty good, and the decor is really neat. Will definitely be returning for that corned beef.

6JOVvlJKaNnnb4j4N8bvDA.review_text: Bad roast beef and manager gave list of excuses for bad QC  We ordered roasted beef, and it was very chewy.  I asked for the manager for explanation, but all he gave me was a list of excuses for bad quality control of the food.  He didn't try very hard to fix the problem except bring us two small pieces raw roasted beef.  I was looking for tendered and cooked roasted beef.  He didn't even apologize for anything.  The manager was suppose to fix most the complains, but I think someone needs to complain about the manager not doing his job.

sSFgHkCaj94jad4jhBqd1g.review_text: When you've gotta get your gut filled with homestyle food, get to Tommy's!  We live just down the street from this gem, and when nobody is cooking in our family, it's Tommy's for all.  CASH only, and don't dally in line or you will get scolded!  Missing the dessert is a big mistake.  :)

rqosVYSCDEWsAHEs4nYyyw.review_text: Well worth the stop if you are near.  Quality of the food is great.  Pastrami to die for.  The buffalo stew is more like a pot roast in a thick sauce...good but skip it for the sliced meats.

fNo0d3ED0MgAonwl-yJ1cg.review_text: This place is awesome!!! The food is great. The atmosphere is authentic. The prices are unbeatable and the portions are huge! I recommend the meatball sandwich. It was incredible. However, they don't take cards. Luckily, you don't need much cash to get a great meal.

yZM8bO0dbhffVp6RCTFN5w.review_text: A great way to get hot meat inside you late at night if you haven't been able to do so at the prior bars!  The cafeteria style serving line and buffet-looking salads scared me.  I decided to try a plate with a little bit of every carved meat.  There are some disasters but what I liked, I really really liked!   Pastrami: Seriously the best pastrami I've had on the West Coast after moving here from NYC.  It's packed with flavor.  It's tender.  It's juicy.  And it's served warm!  Corned Beef: They avoided the common pitfall of overcooking and making it stringy.  Nice subtle spices, firm texture.  Yummy!  Brisket: The humble base that both pastrami and corned beef derive from.  Could have been a tad more tender, but was still full of beef juicy goodness.  Ham: It was decent, but not remarkable.  Perhaps I'm spoiled by the crispy outsides (a la Honey Baked Ham) that this one did not have.  Roast Beef: Too rare and not enough flavor.  I like when a roast beef slice possesses a gamut of well done to rare as you move from the outside in.  Turkey: Pretty nasty.  Tasted like cold turkey slightly reheated.  A bit too dry.  Baked Beans: AMAZING!  Sticky and firm.  Very savory too.  Best baked beans I've had outside of Boston and Montréal.  Mac & Cheese: Yuck!  The pasta must have been boiled for hours because it was mushy.  The "cheese" was bland and tasted mostly like cream.

jGxppLVueuazmDQXmiRPgg.review_text: Went here today for the first time with my fiancee. We've heard really good raves about this place from his sister & brother-in-law & WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT IT WAS FOR ME! My fiancee actually liked it. He got the BBQ Turkey Sloppy Joe with a bowl of Clam Chowder, I on the other hand got the Meatball Sandwich with a bowl of Clam Chowder. The food smelled good & looked good but that's honestly where it ended for me.  I had a taste of my fiancee's BBQ sandwich which came with Mashed Potatoes & it was good. BBQ sauce was more liquidy (is that even a word) the I liked but the overall taste was good. But when it came to my meatball sandwich & the clam chowder the taste went completely down hill. My meatball sandwich was placed on extremely chewy french bread, the sauce had no flavor and the meatball itself was actually kind of hard. OH & THE BIGGEST THING IS THAT THEY ONLY GIVE YOU 2 FREAKING MEATBALLS.... 2!!!! Anyways finished that in a hurry because I was hungry but honestly I wanted to go back & complain. On top of that the Clam Chowder was watery, didn't have enough clams & WAS SPICY? (huh) who in the right mind makes spicy clam chowder?   Anyways I've give this place another try because I just heard that we got the wrong things. His sister-in-law said their best thing on the menu is their Beef Brisket so the next time I'm there I'll be sure to order it.   LAST the bitch taking drink orders is a straight bitch. Giving us attitude when we asked what kinds of drinks they have. If I could I would've dropped my meatball sandwich on her head. FUCK HER!

T5SE9Mh_aOlOGmIdUnsITA.review_text: If you like meat, you should come here.

vDg_PGXANkxHsIk54vMwug.review_text: A San Francisco landmark.  Metalica actually hired Jason Nuested(sp?) in this place....probably because the buffalo is good here. Great food and a fun place to eat. If you have never been here, it's a must go at least once.

rBr-dKg-gZm3hTBXgZ76uQ.review_text: Oh the food.... the yummy food.... delicious food... I love food... and if it's good, delicious, yummy food.. even better!  I had the BBQ brisket dinner plate. The juicy slices of meat were placed onto my plate with BBQ sauce poured over it. I also got the mashed potatoes, a roll, and a nice salad to complete my dinner plate.  The meat was cooked wonderfully and it was mouth-watering tender. The BBQ sauce was something I wasn't expecting as it turned out to be a very sweet and had a tangy flavor to it. I noted the extra selection of condiments on the table and used the horseradish and hot mustard to add some more flavor to my liking. The pickles were also a lovely addition and I grabbed as much as I could eat from that barrel.  A very homey environment with some good food. Great place to eat during a cold city night.

nBkzQ16FeUd2clVywhQ0JQ.review_text: Hmmm... Tommy's Joynt. Solid spot. Seems like one of those places that; the more you go there, the more you like it.   At first I was a little overwhelmed by the menu, ton's random choices... it's cafeteria style. I had the meat ball sandwich. (I give it a B, B-). I'm not exactly sure what my girlfriend got... it was kinda like a thanksgiving bbq sandwich... weird I know. But it was pretty good.   The place has ton's of charm, and booze if you want to get trashed. Good service, good price... huge portions... neither of us finished our food, and we tend to eat like a couple of fatties, so that rarely happens. I'm not gonna say this place is "can't miss"... but it is worth a shot.

MVQCzaDxDr0JFefXrE38qw.review_text: Conrad L. suggested that we have lunch at Tommy's Joynt because he once had the braised lamb shank and it was super good. We met up for lunch here on a late Sunday afternoon. This place is a very old establishment. I have driven by here countless times but never stopped in. In fact I never knew it was a hofbraus until now!  The first thing you see when you walk in is a huge sign that says CASH ONLY. You order up at the counter and pay the cashier at the end. We both ordered the braised lamb shank served with a side of potatoes and carrots, with a heavy portion of gravy. He ordered two shanks and I opted for one. You also get a piece of bread as well. I figured I'd be full with these huge portions anyway. I was absolutely right after chowing down the entire platter.   The restaurant is mostly self-service with the exception of drinks. A waiter comes around and takes your drink order. You can also order your drink directly from the bar but why bother when someone will come by anyway? They have a comprehensive list of drafts and a full bar.   Super cheap prices, good food, and being open very late makes this a great place.

H5TEwR-OD0XxILGNaewohA.review_text: This is my happy coincidence San Francisco moment.   Enter the hung over Canadian, in desperate need of a meal, a drink and a nap. Across from the hotel lived Tommy's, and with a mural of a dapper gentleman on the outside, the recommendation nod from the taxi driver and the promise of a decent beer list, this place became an easy choice.  My delicate demeanour would not be disappointed.   This place is buffet style comfort food. Nothing to write home about but the buffalo stew was decent. The table service is non existent and it's cash only.  But who cares? They have a great beer list and their vibe is laid back enough to handle the space cadet that is Jody Hungover. They introduced me to Red Branch black cherry cider and that alone is worth my four stars.   This isn't the spot to hit if you're looking to impress, but if you're seeking a spot to have a bit of hair if the dog, in a funky atmosphere that quickly fills with an amazingly eclectic crowd and pay less then $8 for a decent craft brew? Solid choice.

hrW5Yd09FZibc7fzDP4xeA.review_text: A San Francisco Classic!  I'm not sure what others are talking about when they say it is pre-bought food.  If you look at the fresh cooked meats like turkey, roast beef, ham, pastrami, etc, you'll know it is fresh made in house.  The bread is also very good.  Of the sides, I like the potato and tomato/cucumber.  Reasonably priced as well.  Being on triple D has brought an unwanted crowd, but u guess that will ensure it will be around forever, which is a good thing

BJOEe7TKRvhNGZH4S5V2zw.review_text: Been coming back here for over 10 years. Love love love their bbq brisket sandwich! The bbq sauce is so good. Their prices are decent too! And the employees are always nice.

npH2HOSQ1hs6ASMSs3IoWA.review_text: I'd like to give this place a 3.5 star review but since they don't have that option, I'll round it up to 4. The servers are nice and cheery, and their cafeteria style line moves pretty quickly. They have a huge assortment of beers on one side of the joint and the food on the other so it's easy to get a drink while you wait for someone else to get your order, or you can set your food down and then grab a drink. The food is kind of so-so for me. You can tell the meat would be great and mouthwatering coming straight out of the oven (like on Food Network's DDD) but my lamb shank was way past its freshness. My boyfriend's roast beef looked great being carved off of what looked like a steaming half of a cow but it dried out once we got it to the table. The sauce on pretty much every dish is scrumptious, and that halfway makes up for the not-as-great-as-they-should-be meats. But love the little sourdough bread roll that comes with the entrees. It was a great food experience since I've never been to a cafeteria style restaurant with decent food, not to mention this place has been around forever. However, I'm not sure I'd come back, given the choice.

JxvPY8dd0dcxRfOWjBg35w.review_text: I've been coming here for over twenty years. The decor is funky old-school San Francisco, and the patrons are too. There are few better places for juicy meat sandwiches in a dark classic setting.

gLxOJ50gJ9dJplaew3h5Qw.review_text: I haven't step in Tommy's Joynt for a very Long time, maybe like the 80's perhaps. Still the same very good Hoffbrau style place where time stood still for ever!! Very glad to stop in here to grab a very satisfying pastrami sandwich on a sour dough for less than $6 buck!! Freshly sliced meats in front of you to order and then go and have a seat on a  cafeteria style table and enjoy. Not a place for fancy Soma type food here, just really good for old school eat and go Joynt.

0SCScUy2687KIP80nrnOUQ.review_text: I was so hungry when I came here I ordered 2 plates!  Spaghetti and Meatballs and the Roasted Turkey plate.  I just have to say the food here is ridiculously AMAZING!  The spaghetti was topped off with meat sauce and the meatballs were put to the side of the plate and just tasted like absolute perfection.   The Roasted Turkey plate came with stuffing, mashed potatoes and cranberry sauce. Another delicious plate.  Also tried a side of coleslaw which was also delicious.  Their setup is a little weird.. you have to order drinks from the waiters.  Other than that I loved this place!  Parking can be somewhat of a pain but I got lucky and found a spot right next to the restaurant.   I am definitely coming back here.. (after I burn that 5 pounds off I got from coming here!)

ttC21tYWje99-twhibbs3g.review_text: Good bar; better bar-b-que; best hofbrau. Portions that would have won my heart back in my pre-weight-loss-surgery days. Fun atmosphere. Tasty food. Late hours. One thing or another to appeal to each and every one of us. It's a little bit of every good thing.

Znfroh-8FJ6sJe8BDcP74g.review_text: So I don't understand the good recommendations. You all must be drunk. Guy is wrong on this one too. Had roast beef sand it was tough and dry. My wife had corned beef mostly fat. Mac and cheese was ok but a small bowl for 7 bucks?  Service was indifferent. I would not go back

k4FJIKo4owqkVfgg-u5Ngw.review_text:
I luv Tommy's Joynt.  
 It's one of the last "San Francisco Hofbraus".  
 There's nothing fancy about this place. 
 It's all about hearty comfort food and alcohol.  
 If your a carnivore like me, you'll appreciate the meat selection.
 Carved before your eyes or prepared as the days special. 
 A classic staple in theCity.

YKT0lqXc8U8HqH8Zqitynw.review_text: I was in the mood for a turkey dinner, so I dragged one of my friends here for lunch and ordered the turkey plate. To be perfectly honest, it was sort of bland. But it was still comforting in a way, and for the price, it was 'aite.   Tommy's Joynt is better than most hofbraus in that the turnover of food is so fast, that it always seems pretty fresh. Parking wasn't a problem here, despite the fact that the restaurant was packed to the gills at lunch. The line also turned over very fast.

0in2lZcHmh6VqFq7_0nhUg.review_text: For a sincerely true, classic 50's style hoff brau, Tommy's Joynt is SF's long standing tradition and is as good as it gets here.  This is where you go for a true hot pastrami on rye or brisket or corned beef. This is not subway, or Gary Dankos. You're not going to get a taco and a pizza here... you're gonna get real decent basics done right. After a movie or a concert, this is the optimal place to satiate a good ol fashioned appetite with really budget conscious pricing.  Do try the chili at least once or the Buffalo Stew. Enjoy the decor and the international visitors. Don't forget to grab your fork before sitting down and look at the menu board BEFORE you get to the counter. You really don't wanna hold up the line.

BxpV9RzOXa_76Zg7aOqdrQ.review_text: One of the last genuine Hof Brau style places  left in San Francisco . It's always been fun, packed with locals of all walks of life. Parking is difficult , but it's worth The effort. CASH ONLY!!

EX-GktlqwQ1ejQ2j1E7v7g.review_text: LOVED IT. Cannot wait to go back. Brisket, mashed potato and pasta were to die for.

zjFWisC8jehHwtKW12ah5g.review_text: the plan was to grab a drink then head to a movie at AMC.  $5 for a vodka/soda.  needless to say i didn't make it to the movie.

TZ6J6N17kfM7vwo1lc7avg.review_text: I get some grief from friends about giving out too many 5 star reviews, but I am fairly picky about where I go, so the ratings kind of make sense to me. Tommy's Joint remains a 5 star American/San Francisco CLASSIC! There was a time when this type of place could be found in every city of the US, but as we became more "sophisticated" these old greats have been pushed, unjustifiably, to the side lines.  The Hof Brau style of my youth is now kind of a novelty, and some people are returning to this tried and true old-school style of eatery, and thank god!  Where else can you get a good and fairly inexpensive drink, and then suddenly decide, "hey I'm hungry.  Where can I get some brisket and mashed potatoes, or a sausage and kraut?" Well right over there, eight feet from your bar stool! And the price is right, about $9.00 all in! Every type of person you see on the street in SF is in Tommy's; business men, tradesmen, tourists, hookers, street people, and young movers-and-shakers. They ALL seam to be having a good time, and isn't that what it's all about? Right on Tommy's Joint, let's ALL help them go another 100 years!

ZLVaLX6E4olh6h5o6ihjLA.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is a true "San Francisco institution". It has been owned by the same families since the 40's! That totally blows my mind.    I remember my Dad telling me stories about eating there when he worked his summers home from college as a carpenter in the city and I always wanted to try Tommy's for myself.  When I finally got around to going to Tommy's it was like stepping back in time and I loved it. My boyfriend had the plate of stewed pork with an asparagus salad and I had the pastrami sandwich (comes with au jus) and a side of mashed potatoes and gravy.   Old school food, old school prices. I can't wait to go back!

R2p221627ZK5IhFBVI0OzQ.review_text: Love the sloppy joe and drinks. I haven't tried much else here. I prefer this place when it's not so busy it can get obnoxious but for a huge $5 sandwich and a bunch of sides I don't think I can stay away. But where's Tommy?

_WHJzZTmIPJI1vH5xq9Mrg.review_text: Cafeteria style line, huge drink selection and meat meat MEAT!!! A very casual dining experience for the carnivorous........ but vegans fret not! Their pickles are free!!!    What to watch for: Sweet & sour spareribs, Oxtail and braised lamb. Corned beef & cabbage is good. Seeing as they're the only place I know of to serve buffalo stew in the city, thats usually pretty decent. You can clean it off with the sourdough stone they give ya!

61bTYL8qeeio9L4BJr9ENw.review_text: Been going to Tommy's Joynt for over 14 years and the only thing that's changed are the prices.  Obviously, inflation's a bitch, but I think it also has to do with the whole Diners, Drive-ins and Dives show.  Ironically, we were driving home from work oneday and decided to hit up Tommy's Joynt, we found parking right up the street and were walking in and low and behold, there's Guy Fieri's red car and a big sign saying they are currently filming and that if we came in, we may be in the show.  Being camera shy, we turned around and walked back to the car.  Anyway, we usually get the brisket plate, it comes with mashed potatoes, a choice of salad and bread and butter.  They have two different sauces, one more of a gravy and one a thin, sweeter sauce.  This is a great plate, good portion size and the salads are pretty good too.  Last time, we went at lunch and I got the pastrami sandwich, which was humongoid!  It was pretty good, nice, thick cuts of pastrami on a sourdough roll.  Very happy with my choice.  They have a full bar, crappy wine, though.  Soooo, good food, historical landmark, but kinda sad about how pricey it's gotten.

vR3viZ9hsFNDnX03aGRMGg.review_text: A solid meat-and-potato type spot. Most dishes are a grip of meat with sauce and carbs of some kind. They also have a few types of salad (I counted three or four) and a bar. Sizable and tasty portions for a reasonable price. A couple tiny complaints: the drinking water is lukewarm, and the toilet chamber is cramped and hookless - a definite con for those who like to drop their deuces shirtless.

5U7TL7snFYmyHuO59OYEpw.review_text: TJ's is pretty much staple pub grub for when you get the munchies, or want to pad your stomach before a night of debauchery.  The food itself isn't amazing, but it's cheap and you get meats that you won't find at the competition nearby at late night hours (buffalo, turkey, lamb, etc.).  One of my fav things to order here is their Irish Coffee.  Drawbacks to TJ includes ventilation (a common problem with a lot of places in the area)--on hot days, the second floor can get humid and uncomfortable.

O2qAlgUHKft3Lm-hPqO7rA.review_text: When I first moved to San Francisco, I often passed the brightly painted facade of Tommy's and assumed it was some sort of theme restaurant. For this reason, I never went in.  Recently, a friend was raving about Tommy's so we decided to head there for lunch. I was skeptical, but one step inside the unassuming, friendly, down-home dive dispelled my fears. I ordered lamb and potatoes, and ended up getting two gigantic legs of lamb that were hanging off the plate. Seriously, they give you more food here than you could eat in a lifetime. It's cheap too! Tommy's beer selection is amazing as well. I ordered a Cooper's and had a great afternoon watching the game with locals.   My friend has since moved away, but I will continue heading to Tommy's. Check it out!

_-lZSxi4hrOfyV09Zr5MNg.review_text: I've nicked name this place's food as "Down Home Cookin'."  I have NEVER been disappointed by the food here.  Whether it's the meatball sandwich or the corned beef, you will not leave this place hungry.  It's got a fun atmosphere - a little loud at times.  I recommend heading upstairs and getting a table to avoid some of the noise.    I'm a fan of their Rum Punch - strong and effective!  Servers will visit you to make sure you have a fresh drink to enjoy.  If you're in need of a new place to go with your loved one, this is the place.  Oh, and be sure to bring cash and avoid the line at the on-site ATM & its fees!

-EAf5mOJr8opG3t4KZqXUg.review_text: The special for today was ox tail, but i had to go with my usual-Bar-B-Q turkey sloppy Joe's with the mash potatoes, don't forget the side of potatoe salad: de-lish! Parking can be hard on the street, but they do have good rates with the garage across the st ($3-per hour) getting to the bathroom can be a challenge when it's busy (only room for 1 in the stairs-=P) but you will not go wrong with there food!

y3T4TGpuFzyS9ipNa7u3Xw.review_text: Had lunch at Tommy's Joynt today for the first time.  Native San Franciscan; drove by this place a million times, but never had the opportunity to try it.  Not bad, especially if you're a meat lover...great bistro.  Only thing is...I prefer vegetarian meals.  BUT, if I'm ever craving for some meat, I wouldn't mind trying this place out for dinner.

G5LXEaxhQMF_BVjNHkVr7g.review_text: You want modern bistro fare? Gastro pub stylings? How about some of that slow food movement? Get outta here, you're in the wrong line! Tommy's has been serving up meaty, comfort food since the mid-forties, and has stuck to that formula.  Sure, it's a tourist attraction, but it's worthy of local attention. They have carved roast beef, turkey (why wait for Thanksgiving, right?), brisket, spaghetti and meat balls, chili, they do it all here. You just get in line, order at the counter and then find a table or booth in the deceptively large surroundings. A waitress appears quickly to take your order -- while they have a full bar, I'd go with one of their many international beers on tap and/or in bottle (why, they even had a stout from Sri Lanka!).  Call it a throwback to another time, I'll call it an original slice of San Francisco that will outlast us all.

Ng0xtiaMVpRrX_Vdmsay5Q.review_text: I come here for one reason, and one reason alone: meatball sandwiches at 2:45 in the morning.  I don't know how much research has been done on the matter, but I have conclusive evidence that meatball sandwiches taste approximately 68% better between the hours of 2 and 3 AM than at any other time of day.  I don't even like meatballs, but get a couple drinks in me and I'm ready to buy 'em for me and my 12 best friends.    Last time I was here, I noticed that there's a vending machine in the ladies' room that sells "Pleasure Kits" for 75 cents.  Which of course begs the question, how much pleasure can one really buy for three quarters?  I mean, that's pretty inexpensive.  That's why I like Tommy's Joynt - it really makes you ask the hard questions in life.

B_vxin-nv-Ka24JnL_nFwA.review_text: I just love this place. We've stopped in for an early dinner a couple of times and the food is just wonderful. We had the lamb shanks one Thursday and I can't wait for Thursdays, just in case we're in the neighborhood. There's a menu full of 'old fashioned' drinks and they have a great selection of beers on tap. It's cash only, but there's an ATM on site. The atmosphere is eclectic--anything from teenagers scraping together the $8 to buy a huge turkey sloppy Joe (fills the entire plate) to the usual crowd of older folks stopping in for early dinner.   That said, I have one complaint. And it's not great. This place really needs a good cleaning. And the employees need to wear hairnets. I found a hair in my salad last time we were there and I almost tossed my cookies. Then TWICE, yes two freaking times, an adventurous fly found it's way into my hubby's beer. I'm not sure about the electrical soundness of that building, either. There's exposed wiring and old Christmas lights that aren't working. I hate saying this, I just don't want to stop coming here because I keep finding bugs and hair in my food. Gross. Just typing that is creeping me out. So, please clean this place and give the employees a quick lesson in hairnets and whatnot.  And fix the wiring before this place burns down and we lose a fun and yummy place to eat!

3UtTalOKNJ2Iz5CHoLdA0Q.review_text: My boyfriend and I had 40 minutes to spare before our movie started at AMC 1000, so we crossed the street and chilled at the bar in Tommy's Joynt. The beer is CHEAP. $2.50 for a half pint and $4 for a pint of draft beer. They had an extensiveeee list of beer from all over the world. Their list is written on a huge chalkboard above the bar. There are daily specials also, which is nice. I assume a lot of tourists visit here because of the special thrown on Diner and Dives.   I would looove to eat here one day. Everything on the menu sounds so good!

L_ttVsoTvlncZRfSdaAldA.review_text: This is the only place I eat at when visiting the city. I looove the ham dinner. Big servings with cheap prices and a fun environment.

GaUhyYQwdYVvzMs2urEP7w.review_text: Tommy's Joynt had me hooked from my first visit.  They serve up gigantic meaty entrees cafeteria style, with a variety of traditional american sides and a giant selection of bottled and draught beers from around the world.  If you are vegetarian avoid the Joynt at all costs, Tommy's specializes in tender, slow-cooked shanks of meat.  I doubt that even their vegetable side orders could be classified as "vegetarian."  The portions at this place are huge, and at a very affordable price.  If you skip the drinks and the side dishes you can easily fill yourself up for under $10.  Beware though, a fat-intake induced food coma is practically a given afterwards, there is no lean cut of meat here.  Personal favorites include the BBQ beef brisket, the corned beef sandwich, and the breaded veal cutlets (special, tuesdays only).  Every time I come I can't help but order a side of stuffing with gravy, and I always snag some dills from the bucket-o-pickles.  Don't let the crowd deter you, the guys behind the counter move that line FAST.  Help 'em out with that and use the ATM before you get in line, Tommy's Joynt is cash only.  There are three more rooms for seating upstairs, so I've never had trouble finding seats for family sized parties.  Only downside, after getting situated it can be tough to catch your barmaid's attention, but cut the ladies some slack, they are always busy and moving fast.  If you're that thirsty there's nothing stopping you from walking to the bar yourself to order from their impressive selection of beers from around the globe.

sd4E5iKUZotDEeiF3cC81Q.review_text: Came here last week in celebration of finals being over, and boy did we choose the right spot. ***CASH ONLY**** MEAT LOVERS UNITE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I walked into the restaurant to find myself merging in a line that led up to the meat gods of all time. You tell them what you want and they'll cut/plate right in front of you. I got the roast of beef dinner plate and tried the BBQ beef brisket. May I say, HOLY MOTHER OF COWS. They were both super juicy and absolutely melted in my mouth as it met with the palate of my tongue. Roast of beef dinner plate ($10.95): 4 stars! Thinly sliced pieces of roast beef were served medium rare with whatever side you chose in which I got the mashed potatoes, sourdough bread, and beans which were superbly amazing. The price with what you got were insanely jaw dropping. Most of my friends did not even get to finish their plates because it was so big. yelp.com/biz_photos/tomm… BBQ Beef Brisket dinner plate ($10.95): 4.5 stars! Chunks of marinated bbq briskets looked too thick to be chewed on, but right when it went in my mouth, it literally serenaded my taste buds making it fall in love. It was very flavorful and extremely tender. Definitely getting this next time I come! You basically choose your own seat wherever you find one after you order and enjoy your meal with good music that soothes you as you eat. The bar was easy to access with waiters who came to ask you what you wanted to drink.

5K0zhCxKNdWrZfi-3_lBYA.review_text: This is officially the diviest dive bar I've ever been to. It's also a guilty pleasure for me and a few of my friends. If you're not fond of red meat and booze it's probably not the place for you, but Tommy's Joynt has both in abundance and they are delicious.

F_5_UNX-wrAFCXuAkBZRDw.review_text: My friend and I went to Tommy's Joynt for lunch when we found that Brenda's French Soul Food was closed for the day.  I ordered their brisket while my friend ordered their roast beef.  I must say, that was one good brisket!  My friend also introduced me to their pickles which also very good.  It's very cozy restaurant, prices are cheap, and you get big portions.  I would definitely come here again if I'm ever in the area.

43pZlf78N8ADsz9lyH_pnw.review_text: I don't even know where to begin.  How about the fact that this place has 1,500 reviews and remains 4 stars!?!?  FOUR STARS FOR THIS SHIT HOLE?  You have GOT to be kidding me! Seriously?!?  I mean I could eat off the floor and it would taste better than this "Joynt". Don't listen please don't be fooled! This place is nasty, bad cold disgusting food, decor is old dusty and paint is pealing off the walls. Bad service. Its bad folks period!!!!   I would never in a million years recommend Tommy's Joynt or say that it is anything close to a San Francisco Landmark.  Unless we're associating SF with horrible food.

2oz4z-puG0VOeEbpts2XAA.review_text: I've always wanted to try a place that was featured on Diners Drive-Ins & Dives, so I was super pumped when my sister suggested Tommy's Joynt when we were in San Francisco.  It's a made-to-order sandwich place, so you can totally customize your sandwich. I went with typical turkey and cheese (I originally wanted ham, but they were out of it at a little after noon). It was a great sandwich! They turkey was juicy and the bread was hearty. They also have a lot of choices for sides. I went with coleslaw, which I thought was good, but not amazing.  My favorite part was the spicy hot mustard on the tables. It's very spicy and a bit horseradish-ey, but so good! It definitely took my sandwiches to the next level.  Tommy's Joynt certainly satisfied our group! If I lived in San Francisco, I'd be back for sure.

7SaMJ4bbzb4UgxmCe7xgZg.review_text: I was so happy to see a hof-brau on Triple D that I had to go. My boss and his wife came over and we showed them the episde and talked them into going that same night, we live about 45 minutes away.  I had the roast beef, some of the turkey and sampled the buffalo stew and the ribs special. Everything was exactly how you would want it. The only thing I didn't care for was the stuffing, but since I don't like stuffing I can't really take points off for that. The stew was kind of bland, but we got the wrong thing. We should have ordered the buffalo chili. The prices are very reasonable and the parking, across the street at the hotel was pretty darn good too. Overall a very good experience and I can't wait to go back.

S0Pji5ZPQwlolC7vlq1lug.review_text: Tommy's Joynt has been around since 1947.  As my mom said today, "They've been around longer than I have!"  And today was the first time either of us ever set foot in this restaurant.  We had just finished watching the latest Cirque du Soleil 3D movie at AMC Van Ness and were heading over to catch the bus to head home (or somewhere close to home to eat lunch) when my mom spotted Tommy's Joynt.  She said she had heard they have really good corned beef sandwiches.  Except we were planning on having corned beef for dinner tonight.  We stood on the street corner debating and finally decided, "What the heck!  Let's have corned beef for lunch AND dinner today!"    Yup, we decided to live on the wild side.  There was a swervy line all the way to the door when we stepped in around 12:30pm on a Friday afternoon, which took about 10 minutes.  You get up to the cafeteria-style counter and order.  I decided to get the BBQ Beef Sandwich on sourdough while my mom had the Corned Beef Sandwich on sourdough.  Two sandwiches with no drinks plus tax was $13.02.  The portions are big and the meat is tasty.  I preferred my mom's corned beef to my BBQ Beef.  I thought my beef was a little on the dry side, even after pouring my BBQ sauce on it.  The restaurant smells delicious.  Everyone who works there is super friendly.  You get your food fast and it's inexpensive.  Plus, there was a steady line of people coming in the door the entire time we were there.  After we came home and told my lil sis where we ate, she told us the thing to get was the pastrami. =\  Next time, Tommy.  Next time.

GxzervFlGqSF6S-8LfIY3A.review_text: If you crave old school hof brau, carving station scene then look no further.  This is flavor town on a bun, on a plate, on everything.  Everything comes in big servings and is cheap, cheap, cheap.  Did I say cheap?  Bring your cash because you will want two plates, a pitcher of beer, and a cup for the pickles in a barrel!  Locals and tourists - this is a must stop destination.  Pastrami, corned beed, lamb shanks, roast beef  ........

85jlaU_BsUCPWQbikzXg0w.review_text: Great sandwich! I ordered the BBQ beef, and they have a whole roast on the counter and they carve pieces of meat off for you and put it on your sandwich. It was great and the sandwich tasted great. This place was packed with people in line, but the line moved fast.  This is an old building and there are loads of really neat, fancy decorations.  The atmosphere alone better than 5/5 stars.  The lasagna and potato salad were only 3/5 stars, but the sandwich was 5/5 stars.  Get the BBQ sandwich.  I'll definitely be back.  Be sure to have a beer too!

nww7Ig3YesFMWWwsd_qVtw.review_text: Everytime I go to San Francisco, I make it a point to drag my friends here. Their beef brisket and buffalo stew are just delicious! It's a pretty neat bar, I love the atmosphere  and I hear members of Van Halen like to frequent.

pdxDb8cTEy7XMj7HmLhy4A.review_text: Very interesting place. Order at the front, grab and go off and sit in the restaurant style. Atmosphere is like Buca Di Beppo's, enclosed brick, good for groups/parties, lots of red in the atmosphere/color palette. I had a turkey sandwich, it was dry, but it came with a little cup of water based gravy which was good for dipping... solid party place for under $10pp.

A5S0h5ACmIfRQMLchv8XPg.review_text: Awesome place!  The food is so good.  I am mainly talking about the meat...so juicy, tasty, tender, and in big portions.  You get a big plate of meat for only $8.50 and 2 sides with unlimited pickles!    The service may seem bad, but the guys are really nice and attentive.  It's one of those place that I've gone to in the middle of the night after clubbing, but I'm willing to go back during the day.  Loves it!  Also, the interior is kind of crazy too.  Random stuff everywhere...so interesting :-)

cMxMVGdYEzIZnQXW7RZ46g.review_text: We took my Uncle here because he loves Diners Drive-ins and drives on the food network. We were all excited to meet in SF. for lunch. He even took a picture in front of the building. The food was good but I wouldn't say I would go back. Harry's Hofbrau in San Jose has similar food. I will say the prices are great!

XYc6FmCJlEeGgdreWYHd_Q.review_text: I've been here a hand full of times. Always see familiar, friendly faces. The food is great. I always get the BBQ brisket dinner, mashed potatoes with gravy, and baked beans (although the beans are just OK). Great to come here before or after going to the AMC movie theater.  Bring cash.

8k3aO-mPeyhbR5HUucA5aA.review_text: the corn beef is great here. the main attraction before was the endless kinds of beers you can try here.

oZ4zwTAR2C9kGUL2aCGccQ.review_text: When you walk in, the sight of huge portions of seasoned meat is arresting, and the awesome smell of the meat grabs your nose like racing gas. Generous tequila shots to rev up your motor.   Convienant if you are doing reconn around Geary/Van Ness. That's all I've had.

TicIgBsaBWr9ttf2piY0JQ.review_text: I started coming here last year and each time I entered this place, it felt like I just walked into a dimension of disarray.  My eyes are wandering around the room at the many antiques scattered all over, my nose is seduced by smells of the various hot and ready meats, and my brain is struggling to figure out if I just walked into a time machine.  This Joynt has so much character, it leaves you in disgust for trying other cookie-cutter places.  The menu is scattered across the wall, which would trap a novice into deciding what to order by what looks good.  That would be a dangerous decision my friend because you will end up ordering enough to feed 3 people.  During my last visit, I had the lamb shank with a side of mashed potatoes.  I had a smile during the entire meal.  The bar also features an extensive selection of beer, foreign or domestic.  There are two televisions for sports.    I would definitely come here again...and again...and again...

xoUe_94jhKAQZf9jsnbhWw.review_text: There serve a good portion of food on a plate and sandwiches. The restraunt doesn't look that appetizing on the outside but the food is actually pretty okay. There's also a bar on the left side of the place when you walk in. A lot of grown men are watching football and drinking beer. For a teen, I didn't feel that comfortable. There are wooden chairs, and small tables with cheap table cloth.  It's like a self serve place: you order your food as you go down the line towards the cashier. Then you pay, take your plate, and find some seats. You get your own water.  Don't recommend kids here.

EHwNw8KOy8PbkCz46mdhhA.review_text: If it wasn't for the great bartender (even though the beers were a little pricey- even for SF) I would think of giving it two stars.  I went for a work event and everyone told me how great the food and bbq was.  Being from the south, I was hopeful.  Maybe I'm biased from southern food, but I thought it was a bit bland and tasted like it had been under a heat lamp for a week.  Good atmosphere- homely bar style, and granted I haven't found any better bbq in SF yet, but I'm going to shop around a bit more.

JGCl9_pVdard7b316lhsmw.review_text: Reviewing this place raises a difficult dilemma for me.    I want to give this place 5 stars just because the menu might as well be titled "A Great Big 'Fuck You' to Vegans."    However, the food is really and truly only great in the sense that you know this is the type of stuff your grandfather used to eat every damn night of the week.  A big chunk of beef, lamb or pork served with a potato side-dish.  Wash it all down with the bottled beer of your choice.  For the occasional visit this place is a really refreshing break from the usual SF fare.    Also note: Tommy's is cash only!

TWT0RnNOCPZT_JmR43iozA.review_text: You know those little mouse traps they make in the shape of boxes that you put against the wall and then the mice crawl through, eat some poison... and then you know the rest of the story.........well, if Tommy's Joynt were named veggie house with the same menu can you imagine all the vegetarians walking through and well you know the rest of the story.  This place is a MEATFEST! A carnivore's wet dream! I personally recommend the lamb shank, which is a daily special on Thurs, I believe, but sometimes they have it on other days, but really, you can't go wrong with anything here.  And they have about a hundred different beers.

gJTknzE8KYeqGwYLif42CQ.review_text: Dude. This place is pretty neat. I've always passed by it and never thought of it as somewhere I'd want to try. It looks quirky on the outside, but on the inside it's freaking awesome. I came in super drunk on a Friday night around 2 am. Maybe I was wasted or maybe it was just that good. Who knows. For $10, you get HELLA food. We ordered the BBQ brisket with mashed potatoes and the turkey dinner. Holy shiza. You can't beat that price for everything you get. Bonus, they make everything in house. WHAAAAT?! I highly recommend this place for late night eats and I will definitely be back.

tpz0iEFgkdIm4c1fxBhkGw.review_text: After coming here for many visits in the past with my movie watching buddy whom unfortunately moved away - I decided to go it alone and get some hearty dinner before heading home. Ordered Ham Dinner with mashed potatoes and gravy, coleslaw, and a swiss cheese sandwich for the next day. I went home to enjoy my meal, and everything seemed fantastic, but within a few hours, I seemed to be ill from it, spent all early morning and day making restroom trips to get the food out of me in the most violent manner. Because of this, I became severely dehydrated, fatigued, pains in my stomach, intestines, headache and lethargic. I wrote Tommy's Joynt on Facebook to inform them of the issue, but since I never got a response, I felt this review may get their attention.  Based on what I expelled, copious amounts of a gravy type sauce mixed with coleslaw material, I felt that the holding temps of the food, the ingredients as well as sanitation may not have been up to health code standards. While I am much better now, I feel that I can never dine here again - drinks and cocktails maybe, but as for food, I'd skip it. The hot bar is just too small, things are too close, too much potential for cold things to get hot, hot things to get cold, and most of all, cross contamination to happen for me to willing to risk this type of illness again.  It hurts for me to say skip a San Franciscan tradition but in this case, at least rethink other pub like places before this one.

rv9dsMjyzyW2A46C7jv1Mg.review_text: Yes, this joynt is dirt cheap. Not the best BBQ or comfort food in the world, but the food is consistent and the service is fast (except for the waitress taking your drinks. You have to flag her down). I would have given this review a higher star rating but after coming here for several years now, it just doesn't do it for me seeing how there are so many amazing restaurants in the city. The dark and dive-like atmosphere of this place can turn many people away but you just can't beat the price. My regular order would be the brisket with a side of mash and salad for under $10.  The Good: Cheap dinner The Bad: Dark decor

1P9BpFZ_d3PGCdytDTYJCw.review_text: All things taken into account, Tommy's Joynt is amazing.  Being in San Francisco for a week, the unhealthy homestyle fare here really hit the spot.  The portions are huge, the food is cheap, and the classic atmosphere is dang awesome.  Also, the quickness and no-frills ordering style in the cafeteria line fashion is so convenient.  I was so excited when I walked in and saw many of my favorites on the menu for the day.  The goodies were everything bad for you, and to complement the fatty meaty items, they give you bread and all sorts of assorted starch.  My least favorite dish was the sweet and sour ribs.  They were flavorful, but they were slightly dry.  This mishap was quickly corrected by the other crazy good foods that I stuffed into my stomach.  The buffalo chili was spot on with flavor, meatiness, and complexity, and it was served over some rice.  The corned beef and cabbage was as good as any New York diner's CB&C.  The beef was ridiculously fatty, and the skinned boiled potatoes were a great addition to the greasy goodness.  Now the enchiladas... my goodness.  They were "supposedly" turkey, but I could have sworn that they were filled with pulled pork.  They were moist, meaty, and just so good.  The sauce was a tad bland, but that did nothing to detract from the glorious turkey meat.  I bet you they used 100% dark leg meat soaked in its own fat and shredded and soaked in more of its own fat.  Sure, Tommy's is all famous and stuff now, but if you are looking for a delicious, thrifty no frills meal, this is your "Joynt."  It is in a convenient location, and it serves grade-A comfort food.

4lPVAaaQldYRMDml7CEC5g.review_text: Oh Dear.  Not for vegetarians.  Not for people with a sense of taste.  Or smell.  Or self respect.

33EbNwaXO_WEELb-CIWHOg.review_text: Great drink selection, good vibe and lots of options for food but you have to know what to get as it's crazy inconsistent. First time I came here, I got the beef brisket meal with mashed potatoes and beans and loved it. The beef brisket was tender, and nicely covered in a tangy bbq sauce. The potatoes were a perfect, hearty compliment with chunks of potatoes to give it nice texture.  I came back today and got the corned beef meal with potatoes and beans expecting another masterpiece meal but was astounded by the pure saltiness of the corned beef. And it wasn't the "delicious spiced corn beef" saltiness, it was the face cringing "holy shit they just served me a patty of salt with bits of beef in it" saltiness.  I ate the potatoes to balance out the flavor then quickly realized the potatoes tasted like green beans.  GREEN BEANS! wtf? I like it when mashed potatoes have an additional taste like garlic, truffles or bacon (really anything with bacon..you could serve me bacon infused water and I'd give you 5 stars) but green beans? It literally tasted like they used green bean water to create the potatoes. And it had the consistency of "instant" potatoes with no chunks so I was so confused by this 2nd trip.  So yeah weirdly inconsistent food quality. I'll go again as I'm thinking maybe it was a fluke and it's one of the best places in the area to just grab a drink.   Which brings us to the biggest positive about this place. The beer, alcohol selection, and environment is great. Fun place to just hang with your friends and grab a few beers as they have a good number of beers on top that aren't your usual blue moon, lagunitas, stella, etc . The waitress constantly checked up on us to make sure we had a beer to enjoy and she even called us "honey". I have a soft spot in my heart for that word being from the south =)

5X-oZmluK1w6dc57b2JSxA.review_text: I LOVE this place! The vibe here on a Saturday night is always fun. This might be due to the fact that when I've been here, it's been girls night out and we're headed to or coming from a concert.   The food here is good, filling, comfort food. I LOVE the beef with mashed potatoes and gravy and a salad with extra beets (YUM!). On Saturday nights, it's fun to sit at a booth near their basement kitchen and watch the amount of food (whole turkeys, whole roasts, etc.) that come cranking out of the kitchen and are carried to the food line.   My girls and I are known for coming here for dinner, heading to a show, and then coming back for a 1am snack/cocktail and chat away until they close.  On our last visit, I debated if I wanted to get a plate to go so I could have a 4am snack once I got back home to the east bay.  By the time I decided yes, the food line was being closed down and those beloved beets and creamy mashed potatoes had been put away.  Darn it!  My only complaint is waiting forever to get drinks. Usually we're almost done with our meal by the time our drinks come. However, you won't find a more economical cocktail anywhere! Cheers!

vFYCJ_SCd5vMQ6XX85_kKA.review_text: Mmmm...when you're craving carved meat on a thick sourdough with dipping sauce, no frills, this is the place to go. I asked the carver for his recommendation and he said beef brisket. Oh yea, that hit the spot. Slap some horseradish on that baby and we're in meat heaven. In the time I wasn't lost in my sandwich, I looked around and saw some happy people chilling out at the bar watching football. With such a relaxed atmosphere and extensive beer/cocktail selection, it's a great place for a lazy Sunday afternoon.

D2epirooWNjvwTI6MFhNGw.review_text: Mondays. Why? Braised ox tails. I am a huge fan. You know what else? They serve Heineken Dark. Yes, you read that correctly. HEINEKEN DARK. Such a yummy dark lager, my latest love.

ZMtUu08q6o0D1aCwPnK9eA.review_text: Three of the four stars just for the fact that they seem to be the only place in the neighborhood still open after 12am (although, being a tourist, there might have been others I didn't find).  I liked the atmosphere inside, everyone's nice and friendly, and the food's not bad either. I had the Turkey dish (don't remember what it's called anymore). Eventually, Tommy's became our goto place to have a few beers when we didn't feel like going back to the hotel at 1am.   PS: every night we went there, there was this homeless guy outside singing 'change please' while shaking his change cup. Anyone else noticed the poor guy?

OMoBzr4FhDkk7yV8zYtmiw.review_text: Long before the "Load" albums and "Some Kind of Monster," there was a point in middle school where I wanted to have James Hatfield's babies.  So, taking a restaurant recommendation from Metallica doesn't seem like a far stretch.    For those of you from the South Bay, this is Harry's Houfbrau but with an incredible liquid "BBQ sauce" for the brisket and veggie sides you actually want.  $10 a plate for some serious American down home cookin!

PUXRWnwneHAhuhXjOmvenQ.review_text: I was very disappointed with this place. The food was mediocre at best. It was inexpensive & the drinks were cheap, but not worth it. You pay for your food first then sit & pay for your drinks.

HSiz-rO_OsdKx7NWXqTihw.review_text: It has a very niche and hometown feeling inside. I was visiting from out of town and definitely felt like I was in a true SF establishment. There was a big line, which I took as a good sign.   Once inside, you walk along a cafeteria-style counter and order items from under the glass. Having never been there, I asked the first cook what their best item was. He suggested something that I couldn't understand but I took it. It turned out to be their baked lasagna. Their baked beans were advertised as a "staple" so I ordered them too. The lasagna was sub-par at best and the beans were decent.  Their big item is a huge turkey sandwich so I'm not sure why he didn't suggest that. Everyone else seems to have had good experiences so it must be worth trying again.

DVxe-VM2NZfRSaEXslzDjA.review_text: Awesome food and even more awesome prices!!!  Don't miss the Beef Stew. It's makes the perfect meal on a cold wintery day!    The guy with the handlebar moustache and red checkered chef's hat should become a S.F. landmark! I just wish it were easier to read the menu on the wall......I have to read every lil'l placard and poster on the wall to figure out my order.  But it's still worth every bit of effort!  Couldn't ask for a better value meal

zLiMsSMhcr_lVXdmDy7_NA.review_text: Aside from the cheap meal and generous portions, I don't really understand what makes this place 4-star worthy.  I felt as if I was in one of those movies where the kids in school stand in a cafeteria line, waiting for the unhappy server to unexcitedly scoop up their unappealing-looking food and plop it onto their plate/tray.  Pay and then take their tray and find themselves a table to seat at in the smelly cafeteria.  Actually, that's pretty much the experience here ... you walk in, and there's a queue.  Once it's your turn, you let the guy know what you want and he'll scoop it up or cut your meat and serve it to you on a plate with a plastic tray beneath it.  As you make your way down the line, they'll ask you what else you want to add to your sad looking tray and at the end you pay.  Cash only though!  Now... I had the Beef Stew and Rice as I was feeling some dense food, but unfortunately it was not very appetizing.  The beef was overcooked, not tender, and very dry.. the stew that it was sitting in had a very salty, tomato base.  Grain quality of the rice was low, meh.
