I also got a quick bite of my friends' plates, and in a sum ... only the Sliced Corn Beef w/ the Hot Mustard on the table and the BBQ Brisket were decent.  Corn beef was a little salty, but paired well with the mustard and the BBQ Brisket was a little sweet and reminded me of Chinese Cha Siu.  I question the quality of the meat, but I guess you can't be that snobby about it for the price.  I wouldn't necessarily recommend anyone to come back, but I guess you can give it a try if you're looking for some quick, cheat eats.  The service here however was on point and great!  Despite it being self served water, the waiters still brought us our drinks!  c:

a4r7b9qJI_1HwfVul-ns5A.review_text: I passed by this place many times wondering what the heck the inside looked like when the outside reminded me of an old school circus. Finally, I got the opportunity to eat lunch here when my friends wanted to grab some food after the SF Ski Fest over at Fort Mason.   Walking in, there's an area sectioned off for a line right by the entrance -- that's where you enter the queue to order your food. The menu is all over the place and according to my friend: everything's good. I decided to split a BBQ beef sandwich on sourdough bread with one of my friends. It wasn't huge, but the portion was perfect since I wasn't really that  hungry anyways. Food was decent... Nothing amazing, but a far cry from bad. Prices were pretty cheap seeing as they give fairly reasonable sized portions of meat.   One of my friend's got the Sunday special and another got the turkey sloppy joe. Everyone seemed happy with their food. The staff is pretty friendly and were nice enough to change the channel on the TV to watch the football game.  At old joints like this, I'm a little weary about what the bathrooms are like, but I was pleasantly surprised that it was fairly well maintained, although nothing like a newer restaurant.  Would I return? Probably only if someone else wanted to go here... Otherwise, I wouldn't suggest coming back because there are better cheap eats out in the city. However, I do see how this place has become a landmark! Definitely worth trying it at least once. I mean, how many places carve the meat right in front of you after you order?!

I55DjBOhDqWRShbeE-pSBA.review_text: Easy on the wallet, not on the belt .  There really isn't a whole lot not to like at Tommy's- you can tell from the line of hungry men that gather near the door around lunch time. Speaking of the door, it attacks unsuspecting patrons at random moments so take caution when standing in line if you are anywhere near it.   The prices are spectacular considering the massive amounts of food that are heaped on your plate. Key pointers: -Delicious home meals like pot roast, roast beef, corned beef etc.  -Not for the faint of appetite.  -Not a great date place as you are more likely to un-button your pants from being stuffed rather than for other -ummm- well, you know, more strenuous activites. -Gets kinda' packed, so be prepared to get to know your neighbors real well -Easy on the wallet -Cafeteria style for food: waitresses only take care of thirst issues -Good(but packed) place to watch games. -Super casual -Good beer

2eCOKSmVA8jEmXe32yDnZQ.review_text: No point in writing a review. Its all been said. Its great at what it is. The staff is cool, most of the waitresses are cool--one older loud one, not so much.  Lasagna, if your lucky and its there, is the best...meatballs and BBQ beef is great too.  Oh and the cheesecake is yummy.  Alcohol selection is amazing

Ulxvb9kgIMKfT9XXTgU3xQ.review_text: I really, really, really want to give Tommy's 5 stars but I can't do it.    I've eaten there 30+ times over the last 10 years.  For late night food... after drinks, a 12 hour work day or a late movie this place is 5 out of 5 stars.  In the normal comparison of restaurants...this place is just 2 stars.  I ate there again tonight and as typical the roast beef and turkey had big chunks of gristle.  This is very typical.  The food was warm but not hot.    They don't give you enough meat on the sandwiches and give you too much meat on the "eat in" dinner plates.  This is a simple case where they could reduce quantity 10% and increase quality 10%.  Everyone will say this place is old school SF, it has so much history...  I would say... time to clean the place.  Everything hanging from the ceilings and walls seems like it's covered with a light coat of dust or grease.  The plastic table clothes are nasty.....maybe that's why they keep the lights down?  Again, there are some good and not so good things about this place.  I'm writing this review after many visits and would go back, but this is not a choice during normal hours....and getting less and less likable after hours.   So I averaged the 2 and 5 start ratings: 3 stars.

aVGSnXBXFuLXAihXZSf7DQ.review_text: Maybe you remember a TV Ad campaign asking "Where's the beef?" (I'm assuming you are over 25 years of age here) Well, the beef, it's at Tommy's Joynt. And it is tender and delicious. Walking into this place is like a set back in time. The prices are reasonable, the men at the cutting table are great, you seat yourself and a waitress comes around to take your drink order. There is also an old time bar available as well. Seeing as I pass by this place in the morning and the smell the BBQ sauce being made, I chose the BBQ beef sandwich and a green salad. This place is for the people. I'll be back because I want to taste everything else. They even had brussel sprouts.

jisQEtwfrOKBmssWoiXljg.review_text: One of the best spaghetti and meatballs I've had. VERY hardy.The meatball sandwich is just as good. If you like meat, you've got to come here.   It's like a cafeteria. You wait in line, check out the food displayed, tell the guys which ones you want, pay, find an empty table, waitress comes by to take your drink order.      Dont be intimidated by how it looks from the outside.

t1NmJ-g09NijXqycgF-evA.review_text: Get dinner here, put it in your bag, sneak it into AMC Van Ness for movie noshing.

jgQvNjX1kRSERgyjDodHlg.review_text: For all those subpar reviews! Don't listen please don't be fooled! This place is nasty, bad cold food, decor is old dusty and paint is pealing off the walls. Its bad folks period!!!! The service is a joke and cooks are subpar at best. This place is not San Francisco its a place that people who enjoy buffet style food like. You know tourist from Kansas city, Chicago, and Arkansas. They don't know better. I wish I could get chef Ramsey to walk into it!!

GgRe5cp_zSZKs1Ar4HSu2Q.review_text: Cheap food, served hot and quick. Great selection of beers and mixed drinks. Also, really quirky atmosphere that transports you to another time and place.   The food at Tommy's Joynt is rather hit or miss. Maybe because it's traditional American food? I enjoyed my turkey dinner and, later, the turkey sloppy joe on our second visit but my friends didn't really enjoy their selections. That was a real shame.   Otherwise, I would definitely go back if only because the food is cheap and filling - and for the funny things tacked on the walls.

ixZIknpdVX4IALjOCVk8fg.review_text: Update, because it's that good!  Unlike a lot of my reviews, I wouldn't change a single sentiment expressed in my previous review from a long while back.  Tommy's is a great place to bring a group of friends, grab some beers from their massive selection, and purchase some incredibly delicious food for mere chump change.  Hell, I even found out during this go-round that they serve a mean turkey enchilada.  This dive is crowded, loud, and sometimes rowdy, but not so crowded, loud, and rowdy as to turn away this hearty mealer.  Do it.  Do it now.

AkOzwpi2397h58rr1FjNfQ.review_text: The first and only other time I came here was over 10 years ago and I remember I wasn't too impressed. Guess I was never a big red meat eater. Fast forward to today, I finally found an acceptable excuse to go there and it was still just okay.   I should have tried the sloppy joe or the meatball sandwich or the buffalo chili, but I had the roast beef French dip. The bread was nice bc it was dipped in warm au jus, but the beef was not as juicy as I would have liked and it wasn't warm.   The sweet ribs, the corned beef, the mashed potatoes, baked beans, carrot cake, all decent. Don't get the clam chowder, as my sister said " tastes like fish flavored potato soup ".   I like their fast and friendly service. There was a line when we got there, but as we waited for the rest of our party the line disappeared. Then while we ate the line went out the door again. Popular place.   Hafbrau, order first, cash only, seat yourself.

1DYd_hmQ5o35qtrtdo9KSQ.review_text: Food was excellent, atmosphere was fun. Good prices.

Ipog-1zgwdK2WhKXbXYc9w.review_text: Pros: Interesting dark wooden atmosphere with old pics on wall           Reasonable prices $6 sandwiches           Friendly service at counter and drink service           Free pickles  Cons: Got the turkey, spaghetti and brussel sprouts which didn't have that much taste (low salt?)  ***************************** Tried serveral restaurants in different cities from DinersDD's show. Some restaurants go thru a 20 step process to cook a dish like making their own mayonaise or salad dressing or cooking their own cornbeef for cornbeef hash. Others like here do it simple with tradition and atmosphere.

PydcGbsiaZSmNJCVbTHCcA.review_text: Ordered a bottle of Cab. Waitress brings a bottle of opened Merlot and drops it at the table on the run. There were 4 of us, one drinking white wine and 3 of of us drinking Cab. Without looking at the label I pour into 3 glasses and we all take a sip. This isn't a Cab at all, it was a Merlot. We waited for about 15 minutes before we see the waitress again. We finally get her attention and ask her to bring the bottle of cab that we asked for, she takes the bottle of Merlot back to the bar and brings back 1/2 bottle of Cab, saying that we poured out the wine, even though we had very little out of our glasses. I said, should we have poured it back into the bottle? I asked to speak to the manager, and it was his decision not to give us a full bottle of what we asked for. I said that this was a bad choice he made and what a low class JOINT. Walked out not even ordering any food, wouldn't give them the business. I know the place is an icon, but a low class icon.

_UB1WXP6gZ1wU_Gall-y2w.review_text: Awesome food!  So much to choose from. I had the lasagna. I am with 10 people and we all had something different. There are dinners and sandwiches and basically comfort food. The pickle chips are homemade,  delicious and free! Really good, good down home cooking when you've had your fill of seafood.

D1UB_6eQcQtdjjlG-IxAYw.review_text: Great home food at great prices. Portions are huge! Spaghetti and meatballs here is different since it tastes more like meatloaf and gravy over noodles but it's delicious. We also tried tri tip, corned beef and cabbage and a turkey dip all of which were delicious.

Ci09Eo4ElA_NMDeMVzbJ8Q.review_text: Directions:  They only accept Cash.... Suck.  Order anything with roast beef, with the jus. It's the best jus ever! Order a beer.... there are so many yummy beers!

bjTs-nRhS8M3gLs3lWSZaA.review_text: I heard both good and bad things about Tommy's. However I went on a friend's suggestion and was surprised. I didn't really know what to expect with this place other than it was a local favorite and an SF institution.   The array of animal flesh before my eyes made them go wide with childlike wonder. Seriously. I am definitely a meat and potatoes type of girl.   I can see how people would love this place and I can see how people would not like this place at all.   I LOVED this place! I hadn't seen it on TV until well after I'd actually been there. Everything that I tasted both on my own plate and my boyfriend's plate was tasty - not out of this world good but like something that my mom would make. Definitely a good place to go for comfort food :) I had the roast turkey dinner plate and my boyfriend had the corned beef dinner plate. Pretty hard to screw up corned beef and turkey ...   I would definitely come back and try something else :-)

d1VXeXMq67_QgdvWY1tcKQ.review_text: Delicious, cheap, well-portioned food with a great affordable beer selection.  Yes, the food may have been sitting out all day under a heat lamp, but at least you know it's been, and it still tastes delicious and they charge accordingly.  One of my friends described this as "church food" - I like this description - the type of stuff you might have at a casual potluck or something.

7Xpb51viDdOaV_89olxp5w.review_text: Husband is on a hofbrau house stint after having frequented Brennan's in Berkeley three times the week of St. Patrick's Day (they were having a special). These plate dinner establishments are genius. And, who knew-- even though the name is German, hofbrau houses originated in the Bay Area! The epitome of local food.  Anyway, this place is clearly a steal for the amount of food vs. prices in SF. A $10 bill will get you a hot plate full of meat and sides. We went with pseudo-Thanksgiving dinner: scoop of stuffing topped with plenty of thinly sliced white and dark meat, and lots of gravy with mashed potatoes. All the food was fresh enough; it's refilled frequently as there as always people here. Although, the apple pie we had tasted sadly store bought.  A few random perks! Carrot and raisin salad instead of broccoli salad. Steamed vegetables really are just frozen mixed veggies (corn, peas, carrot cubes, green beans). Free pickles, serve yourself. Dark saloon seating with booths that fit two people very nicely. Line moves fast; but cash only. Not much for vegetarians, obviously. Maybe a $2.50 swiss cheese sammich??  Food and drink served until 145am means that we may be back here for late night grub one of these summer evenings...

AR8GVHifrT7EQlETHo9ltg.review_text: The carved fresh off the bone hot roast beef sandwiches are awesome. Served with mustard. Grab some sides if pickles and there you have a meal fit for a hungry man with a hankering for no-nonsense man food. I had lamb shanks over rice. 2 big tender succulent shanks per serve. Melt in your mouth.  This is a quintessential San Francisco experience as enjoyable as a cable car ride. The servers are just as gruff with attitude but heck! It seems everyone in San Fran has attitude! Its located at Van Ness at Geary.

1E-qee5VF4vRkZTeeFYurw.review_text: Definately an experience that has become a tradition amongst my friends.  The food is quite cheap but if you are dieting I strongly suggest you reconsider.  This place is CAMPY but very authentic - you can tell much of the clientele has been coming for at least 20 years.  Once a month is probably all your digestive system can handle but try it once and you will be back.

Uj5jTPjUT03sRpbBLLZd5A.review_text: The food at Tommy's is the bomb!! i love how its just pure meat. you can have a small salad but thats just the third wheel on this meat truck!!! its a resturant not a truck. just making it clear. the decor is great, i notice something new everytime i visit. in my humble opinion the pastrami is the best.

-PW3KNBskNObtSTC2zW5VQ.review_text: World class hof brau dive joint. Always outstanding food. Roast beef french dip, brisket,  spaghetti,  buffalo stew, try all the sides. Lars ulrich and james hetfield made history upstairs deciding to let jason newsted join as bassist back in the day after cliff burton passed. Then jason jumped up on the tables to celebrate (vh1 metallica behind the music) that's how I feel every time I eat herem EPIC FOOD THAT WILL CHANGE YOUR LIFE

BzLUyHSJrl-lUVWw9rqlvQ.review_text: 3.5 Stars  After years of driving past this San Francisco landmark, I finally had a chance to go after the Giants 9th inning win on closing day. We got there at 6:15 pm right as the dinner crowds were beginning to line up. I got one of the two metered parking spaces right in front of the restaurant. This is a Hof Brau style order you food of the line pay a find a seat. There were about 8 people ahead of us in line including one of the ushers from the Giants game.   I heard that the turkey was good, so we ordered the turkey plate and the Roast Beef Plate $9.25. Good price,  good portions, tasted good. Paid for the food found the last remaining seats near the line of people. Drink orders are to be ordered from the waitress. Waitress? What waitress? Finally after we were almost done with dinner and getting our own water a waitress came bay to get out drink order.   Food was fast, decent taste, great price. CASH ONLY. Since we sat right next to line people were asking what we ordered. The problem for the people in line after us, was the seating availability. The tables were taken and the bar was full. I just don't get the concept and flow. You get your food, condiments, and pay. But not drinks. Then a waitress come around to take your drink order and you pay again. Minus stars are for the drink service.

tuXEsjHFhjVNSWgdufiBwg.review_text: UPDATE: Over a year after my last visit to Tommy's I was excited to make my comeback! Regardless of its touristy vibe, this place still rocks!  Zack is still behind the bar with his mad pouring skills, sharp wit, and ready smile. But look! What's this?!? A pretty bartender named Nicole?? Off duty, she sat with us and plugged her ipod into my musical purse. We huddled around the weak sounds emitting from the wee speakers and busted our bar-stool move.  Nice lady, that one. Zack's nice, too. He took the untouched half of my sandwich and offered it to the homeless man outside.   Between all of that, and the fact that once Zack's pouring skills finally knock you over, you have interesting stuff to try to focus on firmly nailed to the ceiling...(think a backwoods TGIF) I realized how much I had missed this place.  ORIGINAL REVIEW: Somewhere between the evening ending of Lovefest and the late night clubbing of the after party, there was Tommy's Joynt. We needed to keep our blood alchohol-ed and our spirits high.  I'd seen Tommy's muralled and olde-fashioned lettered walls often as I went through SF.  It reminded me of Cheers.  But, no one there knows my name.  It seemed that they were glad we came.  I don't think the people were all the same.  We sat at a looooong table with a couple from Canada who were going to a 49ers game and then on to Vegas to be married, and two guys from Eng-er-land. (YUM!!! Love those Limeys!)  We all were soon drinking together and laughing.  The man from Canada started making Irish jokes as soon as he realized my family tree's roots came from the Emerald Isle.    "What's green and has an asshole every three feet?" he asked. "What?" I replied, warily. "A St. Patty's day parade!!! HAWHAWHAWHAW!!!" he seemed so impressed with himself until I asked: "What's it like living in America-lite?" He laughed harder.  Good men can give and take a joke!  The drinks were nicely leaded, and though the service was a bit slow, the atmosphere was great.  I'll go back to strap on the ol' bottle again soon.

V0AAsahk8748VyU3alkz2A.review_text: Good food that was very affordable! Meats are fresh and everything was just plain ol comfort food!!! Thanks to triple D.

oSPmeVF2VIDNlXOFn0sEUQ.review_text: I once broke up with my BF for about 18 hours. For no good reason really, except that I was feeling smothered.  Or maybe i felt like I wasn't getting enough attention. Or maybe I just figured, hey i'm young, i want to see what's out there.   And so in that 18 hours, I of course was asked on a date, and I of course accepted.  And believe it or not, this lunch date was at Tommy's Joint  (classy dude for a classy gal)  I'd been craving pastrami for weeks, for some freakish reason and was overjoyed to find that Tommy's Joint not only had pastrami but they also had the biggest most amazing pastrami sandwich in all of San Francisco.  Being a fat eastcoaster, i'm used to large portions. San Francisco is really great at skimping on quantity, especially when it comes to sandwiches (and attractive straight men, for that matter), so finding a GIANT hunk of meat and bread at Tommy's Joint came as a pleasant surprise.  HOWEVER, I only ate half of my sandwich, despite wanting the whole thing, because my p--ssy date only ate half of his sandwich, and i hate being THAT girl.  I have regretted the decision ever since.

WwB6wB0ad3s-WJc9p7gfVQ.review_text: Ox tail, corn beef, turkey sandwich, and tri tips. Plus a potato salad and beans as sides.  The food is so-so: cooked right, flavorful. The turkey a little dry. Just don't order the potato salad here - it really was not that good.

1cI6RYkKUnzIZpVILf9edQ.review_text: Took my parents here as they were in the hotel next door and id been before.  Great food.  Everything is good here.  The bar is great and I just can not complain in anyway.  Oh and the guys making your food seem like they would be assholes but there not, there cool as hell and very friendly and helpful.

BYr1FLwyhWcZGadTpC0Utg.review_text: Any time I go to San Francisco i always hit up this place,everything on the menu taste awsome. Great environment,good prices on Beer and an awsome selection of beer, this place is just a good time.

kDHjKu-zW1PqK2xWigjQ9g.review_text: More mediocre food. I would find something else.

R4yyWRhvlHYVrPh9Y_EoZA.review_text: Food was good.  You pay for drinks separately to the waitperson; I assume for the tip perspective.  Cost was reasonable, although soda refills aren't free.  I have nothing against rustic/nostalgic/aged or whatever you want to call it, but the upstairs dining room walls and ceiling were more of a dirty, abandoned building look.  Made the place seem unclean.  With better surroundings, I'd probably put another star on my review.

DEP6Zo9-gYM50_xYqxNPoQ.review_text: Tasty, cheap, comfy. In that order.   The food taste like Grandma made it, they go light on the salt but that's a plus in my book (you can add salt but cant take it away) the bar is fully loaded and its cafeteria style. You can see the food before you choose. oooooh and the pickles!!!!! yes yes yes the pickles! made in house and so damn good. Some of their stuff i can go without (like their potato salad) but others i crave. Different day have different specials and the lamb shanks are awesome. Its worth the wait in line and the climb up the rickety stairs to sit down and grub. The drink service isn't great. The guys dishing up the plates can be crabby too. But this place isn't about service its just about the food, drinks, and history.   A cheapish and easy date.... Tommys Joynt and AMC 1400 across the street.   Check it out, but don't tell the tourist!

VCROW1kVZhf1XYzBwQ8B-w.review_text: GOOD MEAT GOOD CHIILI REALLY CHEAP pretty unique dining experience Order only one plate per couple, or you'll be drowning in leftovers.

kIFja02Dxs7KdUHj_rY0nQ.review_text: I can't believe I have never wrote a review about Tommy's before! I've been coming here for 8 years, since when I first moved to the city.  The brisket plate is my ultimate fav! It's so soft, tender, melt-in-yo-mouth! I always get it with mashed potatoes, beans, topped with their special bbq'ish sauce.  I've also had the corned beef and pastrami before. They were both amazing, too.  This place is a total man-cave. They serve any kind of meat you can possible think of. The ambiance feels rugged with weird but interesting decorations all over the place, even the ceiling. There's a sports bar with all sorts of beer & liquor available. The food is served cafeteria style. You stand in line to order, they cut the meat right then & there, then you pick your own table to sit at. There's a waitress that comes around taking drink orders if you fancy.  Rock on!

oW2bCSJ5bIHyRnoZvkHwDg.review_text: I believe I was inebriated, and i know it was affordable.  It's a tradition, and experience. Go, just to say you have been.

IU86PZPgTDCFwJEuAg2j7g.review_text: So after a night of heavy boozing with the CM team, those who were in it to win it hit this up for some food to soak up all the booze we had consumed in the previous hours.   Never really knew of any places that you can get a full on turkey dinner at 1:30 in the AM backed by a whiskey ginger until now. It's pretty quality late night grubbin if you want a change from the run of the mill burrito.   I don't remember too much else from the visit, because the night quickly slipped into a barrage of shots, turkey sammiches, and karaoke performances.  What I do recall was certainly on the higher end of late night pub grub so if you find yourself drunk in San Fran past your bedtime give it a shot. You won't be disappointed!

De8tuYPKZwpT-syR1sylOQ.review_text: This place is great.  To say it's unpretentious is an understatement.   I have never had a bad meal here.  It's fast, hofbrau style food that is super reasonable.  Two meals last night and drinks for $22 bucks.  Great place to fill up before a movie across the street if you're in a hurry.  Especially on a weekend.

lo10cXVyPi8WW9b2pJqY4A.review_text: This place is soooo good never tried the sandwiches but the salmon is delicious their sides are soooo amazing too

4ohEUObG716U9GNlMK7eNg.review_text: I always feel like a bad-ass when I enter Tommy's.  I'm reminded of old-school banditos bursting open the saloon's doors, guns drawn.  I shot the sheriff, damnit!  I don't fucking ask for directions. I am "Legends of the Fall."  Shit, I could wrestle a hungry black bear, or take out a six-point buck with a mouth dart.  At the very least I could massacre a one-ton buffalo with nothing more than my vicious rhetoric...while in my Prada shoes AND without breaking a sweat. This is the definition of a man. And yes, I do realize that this paragraph is entirely useless.  Print out this review, crumple, and use it as kindling if you see fit...  ...but please know your freaking meats, chief...and don't hold up the damn cafeteria-style line, or you're bound to be harpooned or beat down with a huge renaissance faire turkey leg.  I'd personally recommend the Beef Brisket.  That's all I get, and that's all I'm gonna say.  I am quite sure everything is carnivorously delicious, but once you find your meaty utopia - there's really no need to venture further, in my opinion.  This is the essence of man.  You see it, you like it, you buy it, you eat it, you go home.  Rinse and repeat.   Get er' DONE!  They have more beer than I care to recite here; at least 100 in all...they even have shit from the Philippines? There's more crap on the walls than you'd find in the Louvre...useless crap too, like pictures of Buffalo, shovels and frisbees.  I would advise that you immediately flee the Joynt at even the slightest sign of a temblor - because you're going to be impaled by something...a pitchfork possibly.  Or a decorative broom.  There are enough potential projectiles to take out half the insurgents in the Tenderloin.  I have never ventured into their restrooms (when nature comes calling real men urinate on trees and in back alleys) - but someone once told me that they even have one of those old-school condom machines.  Masculine, yet charming! See?  Even the mightiest of warriors can be conscientious.  Besides, who wants another mouth to feed?  More Beef Brisket for me, I say.  Useless, just useless!  Happy holidays.  I wonder if they serve reindeer?

SLWc3Ac7_LK4_bd9MDaRXQ.review_text: I love this place.  My dad used to always drag me here when I was a kid, and I was too young to appreciate how awesome this place really is.  I just started going back.  BBQ Beef Brisket with mashed potatos and baked beans is amazing.  Amazing beer selection, the inside looks really cool, and the food is pretty cheap.  For me that's perfectly enough to warrant 5 stars.  EDIT: It pains me to do this but I have to knock this down a star because despite the amazing beer selection it was $4 for a Miller Lite on draft, and it was in a pretty small glass....I was heart broken by that because I love this place so much otherwise.

bQrwY3epsiwbkHoB54toLg.review_text: I've completely enjoyed each one of the 3 or 4 trips I've made to Tommy's. I love the atmosphere; it's kind of dive-y, but I still feel comfortable and happy inside. I really like the beer selection. The first time I came a few years ago I tried some beers that have since become favorites. But the food...fuck, I love it. Tasty meats and sides that have never done me wrong, only right and very filling. The buffalo stew is so good. So is the corned beef. It's been awhile since I've been back. I should probably change that soon.

nzTxhgoZtdcOp0R1TSZL1Q.review_text: Love the beer selection from local to Peru to Kenya! The braised lamb is awesome! Fun place for good food, drinks and friends

nWomdvEV6L6GDtUzrTQUCQ.review_text: WTF! Green beans from a #10 can. - the vegetable? Baked Beans from a #10 can - THE baked beans?  The line man did not understand what I said - 3 times,  was careful to restate the order - he did not care and threw the plate up top.  The 2nd line man got the order right. ... ,  maybe the 1st knew the product I ordered was $#!%.  THE worst meal in SF ever!  Doubt that DDD experienced the green beans or the baked beans - maybe should add some more liquid smoke to those items too.  Would rate Tommy's Joynt a 0 if I had the option.  Oh`` don't forget to add another $4.50 to this BS - check your bank statement.  Could go to a big box store for the total cost of this $#!% and eat for a month.  Shame on you Tommy's Joynt!

RhjMTy88G_S8HWZc3vJJ5g.review_text: Tommy's is a classic staple on Van Ness and Geary that offers cafeteria style bbq that is more often than not tasty and satisfying.  I have had some issues of being overcharged, but if you speak up, they refund you without question.  The food is affordable, but their side dishes rack up at about $3 a pop.  Their beer prices are about average for San Francisco at $5-$7 per pint.  Regardless, I'm sure I'll be back again and again since Tommy's is a nice default spot for a beer and good grub on Van Ness.

EQIABu3tSBa8Hg4Mr7WSvQ.review_text: THIS IS THE PLACE TO HAVE A FEAST! Tommy's Joynt is great anytime of the day, but I love this place after a night out at the bars or just for late night eats. It has a lot going on in the inside, stuff hanging from the roof, pictures on the walls, and a lot of different type of people inside. Servers were nice, food was good and cheap, and it's a definitely a unique place to eat.    Cafeteria style serving where you line up, order and watch the meat cutter hack away. There's booths and also cafeteria style tables where everyone just sits down and eats together...it's pretty savage. They have a bar section too with a ton of beers, didn't head that way, but a cool option to have at this place.  I ordered corned beef on rye which was delicious and tried a piece of my friends pastrami which was tasty too....can't go wrong with any of the meat sandwiches in my opinion.   Open until 2am everyday...add this to your late night eat spots!

s97XDprEGHENr4phN2W9zw.review_text: Tommy's is a great place to go when you're hungry. The portions are extremely generous and the prices are low. The hand carved meats and turkey are excellent; the house specialties, like BBQ Turkey Sloppy Joe's, are stand-outs. If you are a vegetarian, you will have to settle for some of the many salads and sides .   Tommy's bar features beers from all over the world and an amazing variety of cocktails.   The walls are full of posters, ads, and other memorabilia. There are large screen TV's, but people watching is usually more entertaining.

_FFLOTcMzMmqdnS0kKoUsw.review_text: If LA has Canter's, we have it's more awesomely down-and-dirty, no-frills brother named Tommy.  This place is all about standing in a line, picking out your awesome pastrami sandwich, getting pickles out of a barrel, and ordering a nice beer from the bar.... and just having a good, solid meal without the fuss.    Yes, the booth can be a bit sticky and if you're OCD you're probably not going to get any pickles from the barrel, but it is what it is and it's awesome.  Best things there:  Buffalo chilli and pastrami or corn beef sandwich!

2Qfa3o72sq04_MCUxy3Shg.review_text: The price? Good.   The turkey sandwich? Good.   The beef gravy? Good.   My name is Emily D., and I am not a vegan anymore.

-FbIQRjcfpb5tBrKun5kBA.review_text: Walked in here having high expectations after watching this restaurant featured on triple d.The place definitely has character but the food is not what I expected.I got the pastrami sandwich and my gf got the brisker dinner.The bread was hard and I had to resort to just eating the meat.my girlfriend got a sourdough roll that I should've gave to the Giants so they could use it to play.The meat looks like it just sits there all day under the heat lamp.would definitely never come back here.

3qmc6RH-qJfAVTYxe3kX8w.review_text: Just awesome! CASH ONLY. I have stopped by a few times and the experience is always great. This hof brau is full of locals & visitors alike and the main floor seating is set up as long shared tables giving a very casual vibe- there are two rooms upstairs as well. There is a huge selection of delicious meats - I recommend the BBQ Pulled Pork or Pastrami Sandwich- and then your choice rice or potatoes and veggies or salads. Prices are very reasonable (about $8 for meat, salad & potatoes) and the portions are quite large - 3 of us split 2 dinners an that was plenty! The bar is very reasonable ($7-9) for mixed drinks and they do not skimp on alcohol or flavor.  Highly recommended!

sBrntPYK_MUNUlb6g8XnBQ.review_text: This place is wonderfully coordinated.  The decor, the menu and the format match perfectly: varied classic hofbrau dishes are served for intensely cheap prices in a cafeteria-like setting (but think 1950s working-class beer-hall cafeteria, not high school cafeteria).    I really wish I could give this place a full five stars, because it is always an excellent dining experience--everything fits together just perfectly, and it is oh so cheap to eat here.  I kept on coming back again and again expecting to find the perfect dish here, but the food always remained a little too believably 1950s for that.  Which is to say that, while the corned beef and cabbage with potatoes they make is remarkably good, it's still corned beef with cabbage and potatoes.  Don't expect any gastronomical surprises here--but do expect hearty, filling food.  But really, we're talking burrito prices here, so anything more might be too much to ask!  The beer selection is similarly good but not perfect--while there are a number of solid, flavorful beers, there was only one IPA (Big Daddy) and only one Belgian-style ale (Chimay).  While arguably a beer-snob lineup would not fit in a joint like this, it would have been a welcome addition.  Edit: ah, hell, I am going to give it 5 stars anyway.  It might not be everything, but it is worth coming back to time after time.

UiX4CR188mjByb8GeI8jYQ.review_text: With 1032 reviews of Tommy's Joynt what can I say that hasn't already been posted?  Absolutely nothing! This is a solid place to get some good food for a great price.  While enjoying said food you may also enjoy a remarkably good selection of beers from around the world or mixed drinks if you feel so inclined.  When I said beers from around the world I'm not just talking about the usual imports from Germany and Belgium.  They often have esoteric selections....  How often will you see a brew from Armenia or Guatemala?  The service is good but be reminded that they only accept cash.

ytwUQ1QGWC-iSKggP4QPEQ.review_text: I came here for a late lunch with my brother and his family.  There was something for everyone on their menus along with daily specials.  You order at the counter and the man behind it puts your meal together.  Pay for your meal and drinks (cash only) and then you are seated at your table.  Don't forget to grab some free pickles from the tub before you sit.  Turkey Sloppy Joe - hot plate of moist turkey chunks, served with mash, covered with gravy, and some bread.  I'm a sucker for Thanksgiving type meals and boy was I happy.  The gravy was so darn good.  I'm glad I had bread to sop it all up.  Meatball Sandwich - a hot open faced sandwich served with two giant meatballs covered in marinara sauce.  Good tasting meatballs and great marinara.  Corned Beef Sandwich - on rye with hot mustard.  The corned beef was soft and flavorful.  Good enough to rival some of the corned beef that I've had from Jewish deli's.   Everyone was full with smiles on their faces (kids included).  Great, affordable, comfort food.

2UvehWv0DR8qbRvo6zqDGw.review_text: If you love a large variety beer and a phat amounts of meat, this place is pretty good.

rppH7VHTUP_bauFy2iGSiw.review_text: #1 thing that makes Tommys what it is, is the big portions at a decent price. I usually come here once every other week during lunch or if im up late and dont want fast food.   I usually order the bbq brisket plate with mashed potatoes and gravy, with bbq on the brisket. And a salad.   But on tuesdays i always have to order the veal parmigiana with noodles. Definitely hard to finish in one seating

NK-zIxHMuTnLRU0RhoZWqw.review_text:
Very quick and convenient. It's like a meat convenience store - They even have beer. Their meats are so tender it makes me wanna roll around a bed of meat. O' tender meat how I love thee.
  If you're in a hurry and want meat, you can't go wrong with the beef brisket. JONASAPPROVED

ZFLwiIfkBgzgNcQbBvmjjw.review_text: My favorite =)  cheap beer/booze, great food, unpretentious atmosphere.  go here! its the besttt

nzZbErJJiCSTDb3JEQMsRw.review_text: As a meat lover, this is honestly one of my all time favorite places to eat. After living two blocks away for a little over a decade, I finally decided to try it a few years ago, and since then I've never looked back. When I first tried it, I was kind of a noob and just got a plain ole' sandwich, but for a simple bread, meat, and condiments kind of sandwich, it was really good. When faced with many options of meat, as a beef lover I tend to choose brisket. The meat is tender and the fatty part definitely adds to the flavor, but if you don't want too much fat, just ask them for a lean cut and they'll gladly do it. Their sandwiches are nothing special, really, but it's a good hearty lunch meal.  My usual meal is a beef brisket dinner plate, which comes with two sides: baked beans or mashed potatoes, and your choice of salad (potato, bean, etc.). Not only am I a beef lover, I'm also a potato lover, so I'm sure you can guess what I order. I don't know how else to describe this plate besides heavenly. The sauce they drizzle over the meat just enhances the flavor, and the potato salad counteracts it with a cool light flavor, along with an occasional crunch of celery.   Another one of my favorites is the lamb shank special, offered on both Thursdays and Sundays (it's that good!). The meat just falls right off the bone, and doesn't have that gamey taste that lamb sometimes has. It's drenched in sauce, which actually goes very well with the complimentary bread you receive. The little potatoes that come with it complete the meal.   Other favorites include Monday's braised oxtail special, and Saturday's spare ribs. I think the best thing about their meat is that it's so flavorful, and it really just falls off the bone. The carbs complement it, and the chefs here just know all around how to put a meal together. They have a bar as well, which boasts beers from all over the world, but as an under-21 diner, I have yet to try it. It's a very classic American bar kind of atmosphere, but they have upstairs seating if you'd like something a little quieter. Also, it is cash only, so come prepared!

fKN1WhWWuqlIKPL2NjAJ0A.review_text: A friend's father highly recommended this place, as he visits here every time he comes through SF. The atmosphere is a bit dark, but very eclectic and interesting to see. I spent the whole time just taking it all in, and it totally made for great conversational pieces. The food was also good, although I'm willing to bet it's better to go when this place first opens at lunch. The bread was stale, but I'm not complaining really. And the buffalo stew I was told to try out turned out to be pretty good. Would've like it to be more on the spicy side, but good enough. But the menu they have here is pretty deep. If you like meat entrees, this is the spot.

s9WK4BVK3aSJ609dKhv_pA.review_text: The best place in S.F. for a home cooked meal at a great price with ample portions and condiments. Quick service. Tavern style atmosphere.  Good price on pitchers and good selection of draft beer.  Definitely a favorite, not to be missed when in town.

lsZmt8AMGhQ86hLROMo5tw.review_text: Where to start.. This is a carnivore's utopia. I had heard a lot about it before I moved to S.F. and it definitely lives up to the hype.  Cash only (ATM inside), TONS of seating with a huge ground floor area including long bar, and large size upstairs in back. HDTV's throughout.  Most of the time I'll get the BBQ Brisket dinner plate. The bbq sauce is not intensely flavorful, but the flavor it has is excellent; moderately smokey and very sweet, while having a nice thick consistency. Tender, delicious meat and nice large portions. Quite a bit of fat, which I personally love, but it should be said.   The mashed potatoes are good but not great, made a lot better with the bbq sauce. Most of the time the sourdough rolls are quite hard, but only on the outside, the inside is always soft and delicious. Grab extra butter if you like more than one small packet. Haven't had many of the greens, but any time I did they were average. However, the green salad is great and I love their blue cheese dressing.  Excellent pastrami sandwiches as well, and they have great sweet mustard and hot mustard on every table.  Great selection of beers from around the world, too. You only order food in the line, and once you sit down a waitress will take drink orders.  BE SURE to grab some of the free house-made pickles just past the free water machines (though its not cold, for cold water go to the upstairs one).  Be ready to get full, for as little as $8! Parking can be tricky during peak dinner hours and during big sports events, but this place is easily one of my favorite pig-out spots in this city!

5eGBEkNYIsCE2KTCdeaqMw.review_text: Great place for some late night grub. Awesome selection so you wont get bored of eating the same things. Lots of different types of brews to enjoy with your meal

gASKLdxkmKZT8VMcrzAAXw.review_text: Ok, was told told this place is the shizit. Well, I walked away disappointed. The food was ok, not the greatest, not the worst. I actually went here many times and had there BBQ beef (way too sweet for me), pastrami (this is great), and turkey (very thick slices and a little dry). The bread that they give you is hard as a rock, not sure how I was suppose to eat it... maybe soften it up a little by soaking it in my glass of beer??? I dunno. Price is decent, but they have a huge variety of meat to choose from. To me, the atmosphere feels like a high-school cafeteria all over again.

6eJvaBcUuN93_8L4c1RzfA.review_text: Just went in to grab a beer and watch the Pac-10 tourney, but it was so worth it. Huge selection of beer, the smell was to die for and they actually carry the games you want to watch. On top of that, the bartender had no problem changing the channel to the game when we requested.   Awesome! Next time I come, I'll have to try one of their famous sandwiches.

ctU-R89nKL2-A8ze9I-6AA.review_text: My first experience with Tommy's Joynt was walking back home from class and noticing the incredible smell coming out of the doors. When I went there I wasn't disappointed. It has an almost cafeteria feel to it, with a single line you get into with the food dished out to you, and then there are tables you can sit in or you can grab a booth, although they prefer you to sit at least 2 in a booth. I had the ham sandwich and it was really good. It comes with this really great sauce you can either dip your sandwich in or pour onto it. The only bummer thing is that its cash only, but if you don't have the cash on you they have an ATM machine in the restaurant. They also have tons of TV's in the middle of the place by the bar and table section. You have to try pretty hard not to see one. Overall, its a good time.

nyQXjYdTRLPIGecPUw-CHQ.review_text: I'm admittedly not a fan of the hoffbrau's.  For those of you that don't know, hoffbrau translates into: gray meats with gravy.    A typical scenario looks like this: entire a dimly lit restaurant where you may be greeted by meats rotating on spickets and being cooked under lamps.  You'll want to join the queue immediately upon arrival so that you can pick up your gray meat and gravy and grab available seating (preferably close to the bar).   I enjoyed the BBQ Beef sandwich (I'm not a fan of gravy) and had some potato salad on the side.  I washed both of these down with Hoegaarden brought by our lovely waitress.  Everything was delish!  Tip: cash only and find seating in the back up the stairs.  We got there at 8pm and found seating right away but it had filled up by the time we left at 9:30.

jFDF-uUcfH3Q7_umzJSu4Q.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is by far my favorite cafeteria style restaurant. I always tell my friends about it whenever we talk about food and being cheap. My biggest fears with cafeteria style restaurants are the meat being dry or not seasoned correctly; this is one place that I know I wouldn't need to worry about it. My favorites are their beef brisket and their spare ribs. There's a reason why there's always a long line. The only bad thing, parking in the area is pretty tough.  Whenever I have friends from out of town coming by, Tommy's Joynt is always on my list; 5 stars!

yVADQ5oYC6aNCp_TbQCKEg.review_text: This place is straight grub. Nuff said.

hmc1TOcXPPL30S6_Hlscpw.review_text: I can't even recount the number of times I've driven by this place. I always thought it was a paint store since it's the outside is so colorful.   Anyways, I came here with some friends for dinner on a Friday night. The setup is you line up and order your food at the counter. (Cafe style) Then you pay and look for your own seats. (They take CASH only.) Once seated, a waitress will take your tray and you can order drinks from them.   Let me first say that they have a pretty good selection of food. Between my girlfriend and I, we ordered a corn beef dinner plate and a turkey leg dinner plate. The portions were HUGE. You also get to choose a side and you get a dinner roll too.   The corn beef was super moist and delicious. The potato salad was one of the best I've ever had.   The turkey leg was really good. The turkey leg was overall moist, but the outer skin was a little dry. The side salad was good too.   The hostess at the door was super nice as well.

lm93YIqHcsHIycDBK45Xzw.review_text: The coolest cab driver we had during our trip suggested that we try this place. He dropped us off and we tipped him a decent amount (after we tried the food we all agreed that the tip should have been much bigger). The set up is real neat. You walk in, get in line, order your food and whatever carnage you want is sliced in front of you. We got the pastrami and corned beef. The buffalo stew was a pleasant surprise. Beefy and perfect for a chilly night. We took advantage of the Anchor Steam on tap.  Pastrami - Solid. Moist, tender, and flavorful! Corned Beef - It was tender and nicely marbled with fat. Had the right amount of spice.  Given its funky exterior, we were all expecting a run-of-the-mill meal. They do it right here. Eat your meat, drink your beer and be happy.

n_-wbei9Xz2D3jNJyzxkAg.review_text: Nothing to complain about. It is what is and its done well. The meat is tender, juicy, and goes so well with the horseradish they have available on each table. Just don't be a fool and devour a spoonful. You'll end up in tears, trust me.  I've had the corn beef sandwich and also a plate with the delicious mashed potatoes but don't remember which one. Everything was tasty and not too salty. The food was great, the service was simple, the setup was easy to figure out. I like this place a lot. Also the beer is relatively cheap for a very touristy crowd (usually half the folks when I go).  It's always busy here and for a reason. Don't miss out if your a local. You should be a ashamed if you've never been....unless thats because your a vege#(%*& blah blah blah. Your missin' out. I guess you could have a side salad and some pickled beets. For me though....I ain't passin' up on no freshly sliced, juicy, tender, moutherwatering corned beef. OH HELLLSSS NAH UH!

YG5EroFMYByZODecz3U_kQ.review_text: Tommy's Joynt rocks my socks off.  So many places look the same these days. Not Tommy's Joynt. It's practically a historical San Francisco establishment -- and it remains true to its roots. The look and feel of the place brings you back to another era.  The staff is always friendly, no matter how busy it is. There are delicious specials every night of the week. As a Tommy's Joynt regular, my faves are: - beef brisket - spaghetti with meatballs (seriously!!!!!!!! best meatballs ever) - mashed potatoes and gravy OR potato salad - braised oxtail over rice - pastrami  Oops, I accidentally listed nearly every dish. You really can't go wrong with anything so long as you're a carnivore.   TIP: Check out the condiments station and load up on free pickles and mustard. Yum.

zpb17M4OG4Agjn3dK32CEw.review_text: As Ladi D said I guess its just the guy in me....but this place is great. Give me a place where you can eat buffalo chili, and turkey sloppy joes and I'm as happy as a clam....mmmmmm clams.   The food is super cheap (sandwich and a beer for under 5 bucks during happy hour). The selection is awesome and the sides are to die for. I wouldn't take a girl here on the first date as its really a 3rd date kinda place (you know...when you know that she digs your mo-jo) The portions are obscene, so don't be afraid to chicken out and take some home. (better that, than forcing it and falling into the inevitable food coma).  Luckily Tommy's is in 4 blocks of my apartment.

YfcYGwZQ0fSCbMcahlTTRQ.review_text: This review in no way means to slight the tremendous selection or the fabulous quality therein of cooked meats at this establishment. The lamb shanks with mint jelly and the brisket or corned beef sandwiches with "go here when you are sick cause you will be able to breath for a week" mustard are all astonishingly satisfying. And where else can you get buffalo stew? (I'm sure some yelper can easily answer this, don't wast your time, I've already accepted defeat)  However, there is one thing I get here every time consistently without fail... The Irish Coffee. What separates this beverage from the best in the city with respect to ingredients or quality? Nothing. But, it is EXACTLY the same preparation as the one served at the famous Buena Vista and costs... (drum roll)... just over half the price!  Now, as a Jew, I cannot pass this up. My Jew-dar goes off every time I'm within 4 blocks of this place. So please, go get wired and drunk on a belly of vegan nightmares.

rl2OqJN_nPYBg1fqZHt6kg.review_text: This "joynt" was good. Really big portions. I felt like I was eating thanksgiving dinner. The food was not as great as the rave about but it's a place that I think everyone should try! The ambience was excellent! Super friendly place!

W1aoIa2kporqWPGpgNHq3Q.review_text: Memorable experience visiting for San Diego. Good food, interesting atmosphere.

qeqscJwLj21PPu48Zv0szw.review_text: First time here and I'm definitely sold! Food was on point! Came here not knowing what to expect nor did I expect to leave as satisfied as I was! I ordered the BBQ brisket dinner plate, it came with like a half plate full of brisket smothered in bbq sauce(TO DIE FOR!), mashed potatoes, a side salad and a dinner roll. The portion was HUGE! Pricing was very reasonable, only around $10-12.   I will definitely be making a stop here as soon as my diet is over!

IucvvxdQXXhjQ4z6Or6Nrw.review_text: Everyone once in a while, you go to a place and you go "WOW, that is amazing food!!!". I had that reaction at Tommy's. I have heard about this place from multiple people and had just never gotten around to eating here. Finally did this week and was blown away. Actually my friend and I had gone to the Peruvian restaurant across the street. Noticed that there was no else there, took it as a sign and bolted to Tommy's which on the other hand was jam packed...for good reason. It took a good 10 mts of standing in line before we got to order. The good thing is you get your food right away.  I tried the bbq-beef which was so flavorful and tender, it was literally falling off the bone and melted in my mouth. Also tried the knackwurst (garlic sausage) sandwich which came with delicious au-jus sauce. The sandwich which makes my mouth water as I write this was only $3.50!!! This place rocks. And they have a nice bar too.

RJudD1HeR0hJUxuGHDOjEg.review_text: I've now gone to Tommy's Joynt twice.  On my first visit, I got the buffalo stew and mashed potatoes. It was excellent! The portion was fair and I perceived it as a good value. The stew may be a bit salty for some folks, but it was just right for me. The potatoes weren't anything special, but were still good. I got a beer to wash it down. The waitress was friendly, and it was a great place to catch some of the Giants game.  I got the BBQ brisket sandwich on a sourdough roll my second time there. The brisket and the BBQ sauce were very, very good. The sourdough roll was alright. Still, it was a pretty big sandwich for $6, which made for a great lunch.  I'll be back soon!

x0CtVq6YIGnfAFTzL3LL_Q.review_text: Haven't been here in a while, but I just happened to catch D/D&D w/ Guy Fieri, and Tommy's Joynt immediately came to mind... and lemme tell ya, I haven't been to this place since I got married, and I really miss how easy it was to figure out what to eat... hmmm... meat... maybe, meat?... looks good... I got it, More meat! This place got it all... but what dishes I miss the most is the corned beef and cabbage, the beef brisket w/potatoes or rice, the roast beef... The Buffalo is OK, I just never preferred it.  Non-carnivores are better off staying home, unless they plan on drinking dinner (j/k :D) If in the area, go.

EPSnRZwpjcKPGHNGxBbLVw.review_text: I would describe this place as a German cafeteria food place.  I think the food there is mediocre and has very reasonable prices.  Around $5 for a turkey leg meal.  They also have dinner specials everyday for around $7.  They also have a bar with pretty cheap priced drinks, but to me this isn't the type of place I would get drunk at.  It's more of a cafeteria/restaurant. I usually come here whenever I just feel like eating out and low on budget.

976vkaTfhDeC8Qm6z4JFaA.review_text: One of my stops on my Triple D restaurant list: If Guy tried and liked it... it's probably good!  Been here numerous times  1. Meatball sandwich- bread is excellent. meatballs HUGE, sauce is tasty. 2. Mac & potato salads- on the sweeter side, so I personally didn't like them 3. Corned beef & cabbage - YUM 4. Spaghetti & meatballs - meatballs are always tasty, but this last time I ate there, the noodles tasted bland w/ the sauce. a little disappointed. 5. my other half - ordered the roast beef sandwich w/ au jus on the side. he wasn't impressed. a little dry.  6. friend ordered - pastrami sandwich-- can't go wrong!   get your own water, bring cash, if you come on a THURS, come early for BRAISED LAMB SHANKS! off the hook. they have daily specials every day of week, never change!   bar options: pint of beer or half pint (such a cute glass!) drinks are pretty cheap/dive prices. but also, dive sized glasses! BRING CASH!

RZYC4qZNR0qWwaqip_iaqw.review_text: YUM!   The food here is AMAZING! Its an interesting eclectic place but a warm environment. To bad its a CASH ONLY place. I always enjoy getting the dinner plates. Believe it or not but I took my girlfriend here on our first date. I figured that if Tommy's Joint is good enough for me and good enough for her then I found myself a good woman. Man... How I miss this place.

fquTEV93jh82JYob6u0CEA.review_text: Awesome food, great service. But they could definitely benefit from a few more vegetables in the dishes and a few more lights in the back booths. Overall a good experience though.  Will go back again.

jDphMiXXj34FUAzb514i4A.review_text: The best BBQ I tried in all of San Francisco! That's not saying much, because S.F. is not really known for their BBQ, but this little joint was amazing! When it comes to meat, I am quite a critic! I look at texture, taste, rubberiness, and the sauce. I went for dinner, thus I ordered their Dinner Plates, which comes with a choice of 6 different cuts. I ordered the BBQ brisket, and it was amazing!  Before we get to the meat, lets start with service! The service was very good. It was my first time ordering, so I was very indecisive,  but the workers were very patient. They helped me step by step, asking me what sides and entrees I would like. Then while being seated, they helped take our trays and turned on the T.V. to watch the Lakers game! Earned a star just with the service.  Now the food... which was amazing! They mash potatoes that comes with the meat is amazing. The gravy is a very mild sauce, with a hint of parsley in it. It goes great with the meat overall! Then you have the choice between a bowl of beans or a salad. I chose salad with ranch, which was just a typical salad.  The meat was very, very well prepared. They give you a good portion, enough for a meat-eater like myself to be full by. Most the cuts were very easy to cut and went down smoothly. But this is where my 5 star dropped to a 4. The last 2 cuts of meat were like rubber! I tried cutting the meat but it felt like trying to cut a cow with a baseball bat! It just wouldn't cut! So i tried stuffing the whole thing in my mouth, but was a complete failure! I had to chug water and swallow the cuts whole!   Overall a wonderful little BBQ joint that should be visited by any San Francisco noobie.

plOtZruZJ-rxF7VCgeS40A.review_text: Delicious cafeteria-style comfort food!  What could be better?  How about a full bar with a wide selection and surprisingly low prices on the beer?  Indeed.

3oIlTsI7GpQ57CGMekknyA.review_text: Okay.  Here's the story:  A cabbie in Indianapolis told me he had the best margarita--ever--here.  On trying one of Tommy Joynt's margaritas I thought to myself that's the last time I listen to an Indianapolis cabbie.  But the thing is, I confused Tommy's Joynt with Tommy's Mexican Restaurant.  Positive Spin:  I'm gonna have to try another margarita at another place called Tommy's.  Anyways.  Tommy's Joynt comes across as an institution.  Not an impressive institution but enduring.  If its dusty, beat up decor is accurate, the place has been around since the 1930s.  Folks have stood in line for take-out in the same fashion for decades.  Lunches and dinners of the same stick-to-the-ribs food have been served to well-used tables and booths for scores.  A slightly harried waitress appears to have been there for quite a while, too.  Ultimately, only mediocre margarita aside, Tommy's Joynt didn't work for me.  I had the experience but I could have just as well done without it.

Z4SJfcKfnJfJzIdegIV_gA.review_text: Tommy's is a meat lovers mecca.  Stepping into Tommy's is like stepping out of San Francisco and stepping into the Midwest.  Beef is king.  Vegans beware, if you even breathe the air in front of Tommy's Joynt your diet will be instantly defiled.  Tommy's offers up all kinds of meaty goodness, and it totally won't stretch your budget.  For around 10 bucks you can have a big plate of meat, some excellent side dishes, and a beer.  You really can't beat that.    Their beef brisket might be the best this side of the Rockies, and if they have the buffalo chili on the menu while you're there definitely give it a try.  Tommy's Joynt is pure bliss.

OCEkK1RPzorsge2phxt7HQ.review_text: Tried this place the first night while in town on business for a five day trip and went back a second time.  That's how much I enjoyed it.  Food is comfort food and was very, very good.  Great selection of super cold beer on tap and you can see the game on one of several big screens.  Decided to walk the couple miles back to my hotel the last night, which I wouldn't recommend.

58zhqwfGYEl92MZusTsYJg.review_text: i discovered Tommy's back in 04 while the wife was in a conference. ever since then if we were in SF it would always include a stop at Tommy's. i don't know if it was the time (dinner) or just that particular pastrami but the experience i had previously compared to now wasn't the same.   back in 04 i came in right before the lunch rush and had conversation with the carver. i said "hows the pastrami", carver: "the Best in the world", me: "better than Katz deli", carver: "i worked at Katz on east houston...yes its better". so i ordered the pastrami on rye and sure enough it was really good, it was flavorful and juicy. it was so good i brought the wife back for dinner the same day but don't know about "best in the world". the best is on the corner of east houston and ludlow.      i don't know what made this visit so bad, and what made it even worse i ordered two, one on rye and the other on a sourdough club, and both sandwiches tasted like cured/brined rubber bands. maybe it was just this one time because how could it be. i go to katz and it doesn't matter if i haven't had it for over a year it still taste the same as the day i first had it. the pastrami while waiting in line was sitting in the steamer which is always a good sign, you never ever want it sitting on the carving block drying up. also, it wasn't the time from when we got our order to when we ate because it was less than a minute. it was just bad dry tasteless pastrami.    wife ordered the roast beef with mash and it tasted great and it made me rethink about my order. i should've ordered the wednesday special which looked killer and it was by far the most popular. how do you make sure you don't have tasteless dry meats, you add loads of gravy of course.       and whats with the drink hostess and the attitude of "its a bar!" we asked a question of what do you have. if you were a guy i would've told you Fuck Off!    ** the bathrooms could use a major remodel. this isn't the 70's or 80's anymore, california does have cleanliness healthcodes. spend the money whoever owns Tommy's and make sure every hour someone cleans the bathrooms. ive been to places that has been around longer than Tommy's (Katz and Canters deli) and their bathroom looks like i could eat in them. so don't use the excuse of we've been around forever. i was going to give it three stars from past visits and the roast beef was actually pretty good but the hostess and the bathroom got you a 1 star.

llQ_ifkyIaHqD_23vo1w2w.review_text: old school ,good food, gerat simple drinks

brHWG0DXDuS1CdCKUgED6Q.review_text: Wasn't so sure about this from the description but as a person that likes to try local places when I travel this one measures up well.  Food was good and the the place was interesting to check out.  I would definitely recomend to those wanting to get a good taste of the local flavor.

YUSuPOSrJyRwyMTU7smV2g.review_text: We just visited Tommys Joynt for the second time and it was just as good as the first!   The last time we went on a Sunday and I had the Lamb Shank special, so delish... its what dreams are made of!  This last time I had the corned beef dinner plate, meat was salty and juicy, just how corned beef should be! It was a late night dinner for us and there was no way I could eat everything on my plate! I felt guilty for taking extra pickles, there were two that I had to leave on my plate because I could just not eat another bite. Those pickles are amazing!

LFha-r2VljAzN13YwySTXw.review_text: I can't believe I forgot to review this place because everytime I drive by, my mouth automatically waters.  Salivation during my recreation is a state of being which thus creates situations!  I'm always thinking "I'll try something new" and end up ordering their corned beef sandwich. Doesn't matter whether or not I'm drunk or sober... I love coming here. Especially because it's open late as well!  Most def the to-go place in the tenderloin. Make it happen and try it out. There's a reason why it was featured on food network!   Warning: Cash only, highly addictive

YQoY_ygdtOaYgmdj3cNi1Q.review_text: It is filling.  It is cheap.  It is open late.  It has a convenient location.  Sure it is cash only and cafeteria style but what more can you really ask for in San Francisco?  Their $6 sandwiches or ~$10 dinner specials are the perfect cure to a crazy night out before catching the 38 or 38L.  Sometimes I even stop and grab a bit here when I'm craving something late night besides a burrito.  A San Francisco classic.  5 stars.

Wp6Mqnhjz3nEcxK_H7FK-w.review_text: Never have I been so happy to be a carnivore.* Great food, full bar, friendly staff. A San Francisco classic and one of my favorite places. Nothing else to say here that hasn't already been said.  *I know, I know. Technically I'm an "omnivore." It's called an expression. :oP

AS-6FLwDQK6IMW0_dQoJHw.review_text: I'm a regular here. If you just want a damn good brisket, corned beef or leg of lamb (when it's available), stop on by. If you're looking for organic, grass-fed, non-GMO then get the hell out. If you want some sodium nitrate ridden, steroid injected USDA prime beef with unhealthy white bread then grab your balls and walk on in. This strikes me as the kind of place that Dennis Leary would be proud of.  Just remember to bring cash. They still haven't gotten the memo on credit cards.

ctreiuMywB38xuUhZvuVEQ.review_text: Better place than this?! It's impossible to find in San Fran. I was this evening first time in my life here and this was totalllllllllyyyy DOPE!!!!! I love this place from this moment!!!

BOETp4Xhi8apbdCyWG8O_w.review_text: Great food great service my style beats house of prime rib an the rude barkeep I'm gay and I think she hates gays

UbjyZF2DEsnBxK2ul2Fg7A.review_text: Food is good but the place is disgustingly dirty. There's years of built up dust and food stains on the walls. It made lose our appetite. We won't be returning.

nM0kdXhtguAVvaYrv4C66Q.review_text: This place was so good it makes me sad that I dont live in SF.   My Boyfriend and i were all dressed up and were going to go to a nice fancy dinner... got there and thought "i want real food!!"   So we headed to tommy's  and it did not disappoint!! the corned beef...amazing! the turkey dinner... so homey and friggn good!!  The perfect meal before you pop the question..how could i say no when he just took me to tommy's  The only beef i had with tommy's is that they still after all these years dont take credit/debit cards!! WTF tommy? They instead have an atm...so you get charged by your bank and the ATM!! not cool

C5TksSflQwHyYKiTiuYpkw.review_text: Great all around. Excellent prices. Awesome drinks. Not a fucking hipster hangout. The braised lamb and roast beed are to die for and I love the homemade pickles!!!!TAKE A SMART GIRL WITH YOU SO SHE APPRECIATES IT.

ysCBsXWPB-LAiewVS3jZfQ.review_text: For weeks I was Tommy's across-the-street neighbor, passing by it countless times dismissing it as divey pub food.  It wasn't till I found myself starving for anything open past midnight did I venture in here for some late night grubbin.  Since then, I've become a semi-regular at Tommy's each time I'm in the area, not simply because the the place is nearby or open late, but because the food is actually solid hangover food.  The initial hesitation in coming here was purely looking from the outside in.  Tommy's is not a trendy or amazing eatery, but it does the job as a cheap haven for comfort food lovers served cafeteria style.  What kind of food exactly?  Meat and lots of it.  Presentation is not one of their strengths.  The execution from the first scoop to the final "plop" on the pate makes for an unpleasant and almost unappetizing experience.   Often dry and a sloppy mess, it wouldn't be so much of a stretch to compare the look to prison food.  \Jamie Oliver's food revolution clearly never made it here - he'd fail miserably trying to convert this Joynt.  If only prison folk ate so well, the buffalo stew over rice is awesome at 1AM as well as their meatballs.  The hearty BBQ Ribs deserve some recognition, best enjoyed with a side of mashed potatoes and gravy or even turkey legs (enhanced chicken drumstick!) with a side of potato salad.  The brisket and corned beef is also quite nice - tender, juicy, and perfectly complemented with side of horse radish.  I'm still not sold on their coleslaw, salads, or their overcooked lamb shank.  I've had subpar results with their sloppy joe combos, especially the turkey (which is awesome on it's own but does not go well with the sloppy joe mix).  A good way to rebound any fail on this end would be with a pastrami sammy, one of the best things they have to offer.  Don't expect the cleanest interior or amazing service.  Beyond the cafeteria service, the communal style dining via the picnic tables makes for a fun, yet casual touch.  Scoring napkins are almost a luxury here when they haven't run out yet.  It's a cash only joynt, which may be a problem for those who are credit lovers and ATM haters.  The prices aren't bad for SF standards, at about $8-12 for a good bit of food and a solid selection of well and beer drinks.  Just be sure to come in hungry, since the service and griminess of the place are enough to make enough folks head for the door.

35PnyEl7ZFyjXcWguvls9w.review_text: This joynt is classy!  Nothing says 'good eats' like a dripping roast beef sandwich and some potato salad.  Sort of reminded me of an old LA landmark - Phillippe's.    Tommy's is a cross between a dive bar, a historical landmark, and a deli all rolled up into one.  My hotel was right across the street and when I didn't want to deal with the crowds at Mel's Diner this place hit the spot!  It's also a good place to sit down, relax and have a beer.  Get plastered then order a sandwich to soak up to alcohol.  I wish I had stayed in town longer, there were so many items on thier menu I would have liked to try.

jz7eL8ikTIWdtm6tSSPLGg.review_text: It's massive beer list and delicious Polynesian style cocktails gets it 1 star  It's delicious buffalo stew and cheese cake get it another star.  it's awesome prices (4.50 for a pint in this town is increasingly rare) get it another star.  it's local credentials give this place another star.  and it's lack of hipsters and a real SF crowd (i.e, not your usual crowd of flannel wearing jackasses pretending like they're clever or somehow worth the gift of life) filling the benches makes this a place that deserves an easy 5 star ratiing.

wjoHf2mbA3EpKPKnbk7QpQ.review_text: Been here a couple times, because my boyfriend claimed this is the best spot to eat at in SF.  and I have to admit, he wasn't too far off.  And i was so excited when i seen it on the Food Network.  I've gotten the briskett plate and it was AWESOME.  YUM.  and the price?  you can't beat it.  the atmosphere is great too, get a pitcher of beer and your food and good company and youre set.

EaR-CRJYwhir3Brh4XkGsA.review_text: I lived in SF for three years and never made it to Tommy's so I figured I'd better hit it up while I was in town. Especially after learning that Metallica used to hang out there. Sweet.  The place lived up to its billing - good, cheap homestyle food and what seemed like an endless beer list. The food is served cafeteria-style so you have to zig-zag back and forth in a line that reminded me of the security check at the airport or an amusement park ride. You know, with the ropes? Only this one is tiny. Three turns in a space about the size of one-and-a-half bathtubs. One couple was pushing their giant baby stroller through it, which seemed strange to me when they could have just left it in one spot. I mean, the line is that tiny - they would have been within arm's reach no matter where in line they were. Oh, and on my first turn through the line, what do I see? Guy Fieri's mug staring back at me from a poster on the wall. Goddammit, that guy is everywhere, making the lines ridiculously long at all the restaurants I want to try.  After being herded through like mini-cattle, you get to the counter where you order anything from corned beef & cabbage to meatballs & spaghetti (that's what they call it). Most of the dishes involve roasted or braised meats and they have a daily special board that looks like it hasn't changed in a decade or two. I passed on the Saturday special - sweet & sour spareribs - in favor of pastrami on a sourdough roll with Swiss cheese and a side of stuffing with gravy. The sandwich was pretty solid. Nice, big, hand-sliced hunks of pastrami on a chewy roll - add some hot mustard - tasty. The stuffing was just ok. Same with the mixed bean salad. It appears the meat is king here and the sides are just for show, which is fine by me.  The servers are quick with drink service and the barrel of all-you-want-as-long-as-you-eat-them pickles is a nice touch. They should probably expand the counter up front where you order. I saw them bring out a couple whole roast beefs but there was seemingly no room for them. Some questionable things happened to make them fit - nothing that turned me off but the squeamish types should probably look away when fresh meat comes out from the kitchen.  I will definitely make a return trip to Tommy's. It's probably the best deal in town.

EUQNMT_lU1_oromNfNeWzw.review_text: Get a sandwich after a movie from here... mmmm... brisket. The best part? the big barrels of pickles.This place does not disappointed for the type of food they serve. Every time I leave satisfied and full.

47w3jjQXCFYgEpYVRXbPwQ.review_text: The old old school.  Tommy's Joynt is a disappearing aspect of the Bay Area's eateries. Started in the 1940s the place has all the ambience of an old school Hofbrau with a big bar, a food line with delicious pieces of meat like ham, corned beef, on this day spareribs, and sides, along with all kinds of paraphernalia hanging about.   The dining selections consist of sandwiches of dinner plates. I had a corn beef sandwich, which is served with a small cup of jus, a side of potato salad and a slice of apple pie. The sandwich was huge and tasty. The pie was great as it had a nice taste of cinnamon in it.   This is not for someone that is looking for a modern fine dining experience. This is for those that love meat and want to sit down in a piece of history and enjoy their meal with other like minded people.

zA70oms1M-83WavPYIHKng.review_text: Tommy's is a bit of a hike from Union Square, through a sketchy neighborhood, but we did it because we saw it on Diner's, Drive-In's and Dives.  Having just arrived on a flight from Portland, we were starving.  Tommy's hit the spot.  It's cafeteria style, very informal and kitchy to boot.    We both had the lasagna and although it wasn't outstanding, it was decent comfort food.  I also had a side of fruit salad, which was pretty good.  There were many other things I would like to have tried, including the mac-n-cheese and the sandwiches with hand-carved meats.    It was cheap, cheap, cheap for the amount of food.  The server was nice and gave us detailed directions for taking the bus to Fisherman's Wharf.    Tommy's is a great place for a big, comforting meal at a fair price.

-X6NbB699wt1Z2atOPgmBw.review_text: I tried the pastrami and open faced turkey sandwich, and left this place not a fan of either.

XBA2OF7Euo-wm5FkCyOqKA.review_text: After a quick day in the city to run an errand with my mom and friend we drove by Tommy's Joynt. My mom asked us if we were hungry and we both chimed YES!  This place is awesome. It's like if Ron Swanson became a restaurant.  The pastrami is awesome, the corned beef was soooo good, and the meatball sammy was tasty too. The corned beef was probably the winner of the group. This place is awesome and perfect for those days I literally feel like eating a horse. If you a vegetarian? Don't bother coming! Sorry vegans this place ain't for you. It's all meat..... ;)

GrktSJ7Bv9t37gwDLIlAwg.review_text: I think this goes for a lot of people who first stepped in Tommy's Joynt, but I couldn't believe I've never been here of all the years I've lived in the Bay Area. It's a San Francisco institution for goodness sake.  Anyway, I got the turkey leg. It was bigger than my face and smothered in gravy. It came with a side of stuffing, a dinner roll, and salad. The turkey could have been softer. It didn't exactly fall off the bone. The stuffing was so mushy, it was almost like mashed potatoes, but good nonetheless. I can't believe I finished the whole thing, except the dinner roll. John got the turkey dinner. It came with mashed potatoes and salad. He didn't finish it of course. Kevin got the burgundy beef. It looked good. I will probably get that next time. We stocked up on the free pickles. I must say, those were some damn good pickles.   Overall, it was a good dinner. It was super cheap and super filling. You definitely get your money's worth. However, the food itself wasn't that great. Do come here if you're hungry for a lot of meat and other homestyled comfort food. Their beer selection is also really good.

K5g0jFF88R2tSKYUzXpT8Q.review_text: Tried the Buffalo stew when I was in town.  Good stuff I liked it

gC5YpAcrmHLHom5oGEMgrQ.review_text: Was expecting WAY more from a place this busy all the time. Bratwurst was cold and ha zero flavor, there mashed potatoes were obviously instant, there baked beans were...ehhh...not as bad as the mashed potatoes, and everything for the most part was very bland and flavorless. Now let me get to the seating. I dig a good old country style-seated place, but the tables are so close together and close to the bar that every other bite was interrupted. I would never come back here, not recommend it to anyone. The only thing good was the coke.

Rd_uDqGgts7aKo_pdPhX1A.review_text: -shank you for coming.... One of the best lamb shanks I have had in a delicious gravy -CASH ONLY and cafeteria style except for drinks -hearty brisket sandwich with a savory Au jus is crazy good - great prices for such fantastic food! Drinks are so  cheap as well!  If you're in SF, I would hit this place up!

qBB9ySOTg8ZoLAKHlL7CtQ.review_text: We wandered in here for a casual pre-movie meal last night, and thought we'd found an affordable, home-cooked type place. I should have known it would be gross the moment I saw that Guy Douche (as my friends call him) Guy Fieri poster up. I guess if you like his style - sloppy and "there's a reason it's so cheap" food. I mean, I'm from Texas so I can get down with some home-style cooking and my BF was in the military for years, we aren't picky. But this was not worth ever returning to.  I gave two stars, one for the affordable prices and one for the really nice waitress who asked our drink order.   I ordered spaghetti and meatballs. The noodles were mushy, like they'd been sitting in water for hours (I think they had). The sauce was literally like water, almost clear in appearance and taste.
