They forgot to put any meatballs in there, even though I tried to ask if they could add it, guess they were in a hurry to get me through the line. It literally tasted like mushy water.  My guy ordered a "buffalo sandwich" and we aren't sure if they messed up the order or if it was really supposed to be this, but he got meatballs on bread (swimming in the same watery sauce). If it was buffalo meatballs, they should have stated that on the menu...   I think my BF put it best, "What are we? Soviet sailors on some death-ship? They just move you down the line.. bread, *plop* on some soupy sauce.. Next!  bread, *plop*... Next!"  Don't bother unless you're some tourist and you just want to tell all your fat friends you ate at Tommy's Joynt.

x6kU-FdFaUQC-fUzfPVclw.review_text: Excellant carvery style meat and potatoes :-) Great selection of beers. Perfect for watching a game while having a bite.

K6AcdIRMgwkD2Pv_iJkceQ.review_text: Oh SF you disappoint me. This is the place where Yelp was invented and what is supposed to be a foodie town with almost no equal. 4 stars over 1400 reviews so you cannot possibly steer me wrong. So let me start with an early demolition of your beloved landmark.  I set my GPS destination for a sure bet with a good burger but I got caught up in the mix of all these 1000+ review restaurants with high ratings. One stuck in my mind because of the name I didn't want to go to it. But somehow my GPS misguided me and along the way to my surefire good burger I pass by Tommy's Joynt and spied numerous patrons through the windows. I thought to myself, it's crowded, it can't be bad, let's try it. So I make a U-turn at my first chance and head back and park right next to the restaurant.  On my way out, I was greeted by a bum who wouldn't let me go in. When I got in, it said form a line to the left which on a rainy Monday night was non-existent. So I walk to the counter and ask them for what's good. He said try the roast beef or corned beef and I said why not both? He said OK and so he started sawing away at the thick bark on a somewhat tasty looking chunk of roast beef. My eyes turn to the sides and I saw what looked like whipped potatoes, so unappealing because they've lost their entire heritage and looked like cheap oatmeal. Craving something green, I opted for the green beans which were a pale shade of old Christmas tree. Next up was the salad and I couldn't decided between the wilted pickled greens that were crisp probably a few hours ago or the potato salad which I think were the safest bet so I picked the potato salad.  I found myself a lonely seat back at the bar with an old man behind the bar. I asked him kindly for a Chimay Red which he happily exchanged with me for $6.50. This place is cash only like so many other places in SF and it's probably the only way they survive with all the taxes here. Humorous was the sign near the register that said tip was included in the price of the drinks, but not humorous to Uncle Sam.  I dug into my food and found myself hacking away at the tough bark of the roast beef and cut off a piece as if I was going to eat it but realized I would be seeing the dentist the next day should I try. I discarded it and proceeded to add some horseradish from some questionably sanitary containers to my plate. Thank goodness for horseradish because it made what would be a barely palpable bite turn into a nostril burn that made life interesting for a few seconds. Then after it wore off, reality hit and I was eating warm Oscar Meyer cold cuts on a plate on top of a rickety old bar in San Francisco with a disturbing old man behind the counter. I turn to the green beans for some relief but they would not relent and gave me a taste of cafeteria food at Leisure World. Squeaky on your teeth and strangely soft, it's a wonderous world we live in to have foods transform into the most unlikely tastes and textures.  I can accept why people would eat here and possibly enjoy the food, but I cannot imagine why after 1400+ reviews that it can maintain a 4 star rating. I can see that the bum on the sidewalk that wouldn't let me in might rate it 4 stars on a good day but I expected more from you San Franciscans because you're supposed to be foodies and know better than this. You have mislead me, wasted my time here, disappointed me, and hurt my tummy with this garbage. Hometown buffet would never be rated 4 stars in SoCal, how could you do this to me?

fPtlf-qommJ3mZXvurkMiw.review_text: The food here is good old fashioned hofbrau style eating. There's a large selection of meats and side dishes and I've never been disappointed with any of it. The staff was friendly but the interior could use a good cleaning. The dining area decor is unique and full of interesting people. This is a must try location when visiting the Bay Area.

WFVBNj0fdsfrzL-qkd83fg.review_text: My home away from home, been coming here for over 10 years, back when I was a starving student, and even today their prices and portions are some of the best in the city. Now that money isn't really much an issue, I still find myself coming here at least twice during my stays in the city (and even find a moderate hotel within walking distance).  My only complaint is that more people are catching on and the lines often either spill out the door or around the bar itself. Still, worth the wait, 100x better than Mel's across the street, and they have daily specials as well.   Keep in mind the owners like to keep the line moving ala the Soup Nazi, so know what you want by the time they take your order, or you may get the evil eye.

DC7-_NWBHSJhmIsZUT_KoA.review_text: It's a staple.  After driving by here about a million times I finally had time before a job site visit to grab some food.    The pastrami was delicious although a tad dry.  However the au jus sauce made it perfect.  My buddy had the turkey it was really dry.  I guess that's what happens to food when it's served cafeteria style and made to order.  Other items looked really fresh and moist so I guess we just chose poorly.  It gets crowded but people eat and leave in a timely manner.  I may need to come back and grub more and enjoy their beer selection, I thought it looked decent.   If nothing else, come here to eat at a legendary spot and enjoy the ambiance of a fun and different restaurant.    Parking can be tough but it seems if you are willing to walk a block there is always  a street space semi-nearby.

D5uMny1pAVWhNGDvFDPp8g.review_text: I don't come here often but when I do I am always a happy camper. trends may come and go but Tommy's has stayed as wonderful as ever.  what tommy's joynt is: -a meat line of slowcooked meats, food is served cafeteria style. -a place with a huge selection of beers -a place with CHEAP food, 5 dollar sandwiches and 10 dollar meals -excellent pastrami and corned beef, better than so called "authentic" new hipster places -hugh portions, for me a plate is really two servings of food so I always go with friends and we get different dishes and share -specials long before it was cool to eat oxtail and lamb shank Tommy's was serving them up and I like how they are prepared here better than a lot of places especially the so called "new southern" restaurants. -an all cash place, no plastic taken  what it is not - a good place for vegetarians/vegan/food issues -a hipster joint, it is not designed by an architect, it is not faux-authentic and it's not trying to be anything at all. It doesn't have large communal table to create an atmosphere, it's because that's what fit there.  -a food snob place-I don't know if the meat is organic and free range and I don't give a crap- the meat is tender and tasty -a white linen restaurant. for goodness sake, you line up to get your food, the only thing the servers do is take drink menus. Don't expect French Laundry service at a meat and beer place.

oZ9Kxz182Wme8dM_ZUeQsg.review_text: Food is OK, no home run hitters here. The beer selection and bar are really great and not over priced. (ie. pitcher of draft is $13.00...sweet!) Atmosphere is nice, but to be real, I would stop by again only if I were in the neighborhood. I wouldn't go out of my way as there are many sandwich places around the area. However, if stews are your thing then it's OK. Grandma's stew is better, but for the price it's good. At very least it's a "have to try" kinda place.

rDTr5r0xEMpQpkPphe66KQ.review_text: I ate at Tommy's and got my first Meat Hangover. youtube.com/watch?v=hWgI… (I'm the guy at the end.  The first part is Joe.) **************************************************­********* Update - 07/25/07 I just noticed, from looking at the video again, that I had to remove my shirt to eat at Tommy's Joynt.   kudos.

xbJ_k4RlqSNragaUYQQt9w.review_text: Great food! I loved the atmosphere and the prices are really good.  I highly recommend the Turkey Sloppy Joe.

ly30QtLYbWs-LJGpLu2zIw.review_text: A MUST!! There's a reason why this is a landmark in San Francisco! Parking is a little difficult but well worth it. Has booze so you can enjoy urself. Food as fresh as it can get. Food is great! This is a must in San Francisco!!

Q-4-4zdmeeywwKhMw-_dxg.review_text: Hungry at 10 PM & driving down Van Ness. How about good old Tommy's, my husband says. How bad can it be, I think. Well...How can you ruin a turkey sandwich? With dry turkey, stale "sourdough" roll...and nothing else! OK, you can put your own mayo & other stuff on it, but still pretty inedible. And the moose stew or whatever it was was tough & gamy. This is one of those so-called guilty pleasures that turns out to be no pleasure at all.

fSR_UX9kSeU4oOkrP4zacg.review_text: Love this place. Even my uber frugal dad and meat hating mom loves this place. Affordable without sacrificing taste defines Tommy's Joynt. My all time favorite is the BBQ Beef Brisket with mashed potatoes. The meat is so soft and the bbq sauce + mashed potatoes makes it delicious. Writing this review makes me want to go back.  I have also tried the roast beef, corned beef, sweet and sour spareribs with steamed rice, and sausage sandwich. All are good, especially the sweet and sour spareribs, but the brisket still reigns supreme.   What I recommend:   -- BBQ Brisket -- Sweet and Sour Spareribs -- Baked Beans for Side -- BRING CASH

sN3Z-O_grIJMgKB5_135DA.review_text: Best hofbrau type dive in SF

qIDy9zJfCuqxy6A3exPe_w.review_text: Good sign when you want to try everything on the menu. Beef brisket, meatballs, lasagne, BBQ turkey sloppy joe, buffalo stew.  I've seen Tommy's every day on my commute back when I lived in the Richmond district. I finally had my opportunity when I had time to kill before my movie at AMC across the street.  I knew it'd be a hole in the wall, but I didn't know that the prices would be dirt cheap. Felt like I was in a time warp ordering a $5 BBQ turkey sloppy joe. It was doused with gravy and delicious for the value. If I had a larger appetite I would have ordered the buffalo stew or brisket. Good thing is, it's very close to where I live so I will be trying the other menu items ASAP!

zXU2m1svVduzvf_jYLF-UQ.review_text: I was really excited about finally checking this place out, and maybe my expectations were just too high.  We ordered sandwiches and sides and while I know it's soooooo wrong to order on wheat when they have sourdough, my wheat bread was dry because the bag was open and I don't think wheat is ordered enough for them to go through it before it dries out.  The mayo was pretty gross so I had to order fresh stuff for my daughter.  I ordered potato salad on the side and it was flavorless.  My daughter did have a great side green salad though.  The meat on the sandwiches is VERY generous just as everyone says so that was a bright spot.  We actually couldn't even finish all of it.  $6.00 for a sandwich piled so high with meat is pretty insane (in a good way) especially given their location.  I'm really glad we went there because I've been wanting to check it out for a few years, but can't say I'll go back.

Ri1nrLjmtQoDLnULZal3PA.review_text: It maybe inexpensive but the food is worse,  I had the ham and it had big areas of chewy inedible fat in it, the sides were meh and the cocktail waitress who they said would get my drink was never seen,,,, I wount be back

LolhwUktBqAZqz0XatNQUw.review_text: Used to live in SF Bay Area and went here often.  It is my first stop whenever I visit SF, I just need my Tommy's fix then I'm good to go !

6roF2jxbZbg0oXra1SxEcg.review_text: I was really surprised by how mediocre the food was, when other Yelpers gave this place such a great review.   I got the roast beef dinner plate and found the roast beef to be tough, dry and flavorless. Probably the worst roast beef I've ever had, and that includes cheapo roast beef I've had at places like Hometown Buffet! The mashed potatoes tasted like they came out of a box, and the bread roll was hard as a rock.   I really wanted to like this place because I love meat, and I loved the idea of hearty comfort food in an unpretentious, cafeteria-style environment. I was very disappointed. Would not come here again and wouldn't recommend this place to others.

-3-MINMZygE9bin-k259kg.review_text: I don't know what I was expecting when I came in here.  Yelp told me there were free pickles and it had a lot of character.  Both of these are true. Meanwhile, it has incredible food, an awesome bar, and cheap pitchers of good beer. Even with the positive Yelp reviews, this place exceeded my expectations.  Can't wait to go back!

DYbTjypf9bc3TzcfQclCTA.review_text: Been going here since the 1950's and love it.  I just want to say they make the BEST coleslaw.  I've tried it in a lot of places but they make it like it should be make.  The other reviews say the rest.

rVWebsft_jx629iCO6vQ5w.review_text: The vibe of this place made me feel like I was transported into San Francisco in the late 60s. It proved to be a wonderful joint to eat/drink and socialize with the multitude of people rolling in after long debaucherous nights on the town. The sandwiches were delicious, and though the line was long, all I had to do was grab a drink and wait for it to thin out a bit. Expect some greasy goodness in a fun atmosphere filled with all kinds of late night dwellers.

XMPw095g3wiBaabzilp_Fw.review_text: So I love triple D but the fact that this place was on the show and I don't even think its good makes me question Guy Fieri - yes it's good drunk food but past that no thanks - they have extensive beer selection but the food is mediocre at best

5ZstHAyigwlBmDMQIc17PA.review_text: This is one of those resturaunts where you cant judge it based on its outward appearance.  There was so much here, I really couldnt choose what to have. I broke down and had their Sloppy Joe however. I also sampled their potato salad, and their turkey enchilada. Everything was SO flavorful. The sloppy joes were SO good. They were SO sloppy - it was like the bread they were on soaked up all the goodness of the juices they were in. I literally cleaned my plate, by swabbing it with a piece of bread. So delicious.  Their potato salad? Good ol classic San Francisco Potato Salad. Yum yum yum. Cleaned that plate too. I cant get enough of the food here.  And to make things worse off (actually better off), you have an endless supply of homemade fresh dill pickle coins. SO DELICIOUS. I helped   myself to a few cup fulls of these pickles along with my meal.   DEFINATELY would come back.

yZaqAq6MqOQJuldn8zmMrw.review_text: I came here for lunch for three consecutive days, and I'd have to say that I was satisfied with every dish.  The only dish I didn't really like was the Turkey Leg, but that's because I'm not a big fan of it. (Why did I order it again...?)

7XvUlAuIRF9IhWAvlr5U7Q.review_text: I was reading someone else's review of this place, and I believe she said that it smells like they use meat flavored air freshener.  Well I have to agree with her, and for the exact same reason, that's why I give it 5 stars.  Mmm big thick sandwiches, buffalo chili, beer, and wierd ass cocktails that are 3 bucks.  What could go wrong?  Main course is an awesome value, sides were a little expensive though, so stick to the meat, beer and free pickle jar and you'll be just fine.  Think I'm gonna walk over there and get a corned beef sandwich right now!  UPDATE 11/4/06:   Lowered my rating from 5 to 4 stars on this place.  It was uber crowded one night when I got a good ol' pastrami sandwich, but there were plenty of seats at the bar.  I tried to bring my tray over to the bar, but wasn't in the mood for any booze.  The bartender gave me real attitude and told me that I had to wait for a table.  Still I love the food and the beer selection (when I'm in the mood for a beer).  Plus I ended up sharing a table with this guy from Norway and expanded my cultural horizons.  Update 12/10/2006  The buffalo chili is frickin amazing!

bLLpAJ5ia_Bq170E0jZdOQ.review_text: Ugh...  Can't talk. Having a meat hangover. Take my advice! Do not try to eat your ENTIRE plate in one setting! Eat half, and save the rest for a midnight snack.  My favorite two dishes have to be the tender lamb shanks and beef brisket dinner... (I'm having a Homer Simpson moment now)...  The only downside with this place is it can get quite packed. So plan ahead!  Also, don't forget to try the Carrot Cake!!!! Excuse while I go back to my meat plate... yum!

AzHfRD6txIx48br6spNDpw.review_text: Affordable, wide variety of food and drinks, and tasty, who could ask for more?  We showed up around 10:30PM on a weeknight and there was a line. It went a little slow but it wasn't too bad. There were still plenty of food options and the service was prompt once it was our turn to order.

C_zTKghVxC-fBN5UwirtjA.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is a San Francisco institution. I go there every time I am in SF.   My very first time at Tommy's was back in college, our coach would stop there to feed us dinner. We thought he was crazy, but we grew to love the place. I had the buffalo stew my first visit, over 20 years ago, I fell in love with the place instantly.   This is how i describe this place to first timers, "they have everything you want to eat, and it's all good.   You want home made cooking here is where you go: roast turkey, roast chicken, roast beef, lamb, Buffalo meat, Stew, Chili, home made gravy, Dogs, Deli and Hot sandwiches and the sides to die for, Cole slaw, baked beans, mash potatoes and gravy, three bean salad, pickled beats, rice, tossed salad with made from scratch Ranch.   The ambiance is like an old, old wild west bar crossed with a NY style deli. Don't expect the place to be clean. But it's an important part of the experience. Food is served up fresh and hot cafeteria style. Friendly service. Prices are very reasonable.   This is a full bar as well, they must have over 100 beers on the menu. Many on tap. Not being a drinker, I can not comment on the bar except it is extensive.   Food I have had; Roast Turkey, Stew, Corn-beef and Cabbage with potatoes and carrots, Roast beef, BBQ ribs, ALL GOOD!   Comfort food all the way. A must try!

Ea3yuCDzi1I-PcS-NSAk-Q.review_text: Best roast beef sandwiches! Children like it a lot!!! Good job!

dR-nXFsZESpQMsieXvHcWw.review_text: Why so many people love this place is beyond me.  The hofbrau/cafeteria style way they serve food may seem like a good idea but sub par food in what smells like an old basement is not my thing, even if it is relatively cheap.   I kind of wonder what people are ordering when these reviews talk of amazing food. Out of the five people I came here with no one really enjoyed their meal and we got a pretty wide variety of what was available at the time. Off night maybe? I doubt it, yeeck.

K7cSNUWDTdNC50aM9kkiOw.review_text: Dinner was great!  Braised Lamb shanks are very good a must try, the atmosphere is pleasant.  Cannot wait to visit sometime in the near future.

6bdwuXFCqCDXu-69FtAaAw.review_text: First time I've ever eaten here and I've got to say that this place is the bomb! I had the bbq brisket dinner plate and for 9 bucks i got the most tender literally melt-in-your-mouth brisket EVER, mashed potato, a yummi sourdough roll and salad.  I tried my friend's round of beef dinner plate and that meat was just as delicious, cooked perfectly.  This isn't a super fancy restaurant- it's mostly self serve, you order your food and you bring your tray over to the table and eat (pour your own water too).  I didn't have any alcohol but looking at the prices of alky on the menu, it's definitely not gonna hurt the pocket books!  I think i've just found an "favorite" dinner spot!

y1H_xolljEaLLSAZt2frMA.review_text: awesome iconic place to get spaghetti at 1 in the morning

TDKgyBSk344hfQbv4kijDA.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is unique, delicious and cheap.    I ordered the turkey sloppy joe and will probably never order anything else.  The turkey was tender and flooded in savory better-than-your-gramma's-gravy.  The sourdough bread was fresh and formed a barrier preventing the sloppiest joe i've ever seen from over flowing onto floor.  Once I had paid for this cheap feast I navigated my way through the dimly lit hof brau and found a seat by the bar. Here I soaked in the crazy atmosphere which reminded me of the coolest attic ever!  Once I had finished my meal, I performed my post meal stretch and planned my next visit.

DEne4NSGx1yunoiekck2Qg.review_text: I've heard many good things about this place, yet I've never tried it. I came here with the bf last night for the very first time. Before we arrived he was telling me how the set up of the restaurant was and I was a bit confused. Once you step in there's the ordering station, their menus are hanging on the wall behind them.   I ordered the BBQ beef brisket and the bf order the corn beef. Although the briskets were good, I wouldn't order it again because it's a bit too sweet for my taste. I enjoyed the corn beef more.   This is a pretty cool hang out around since they have big tables for large parties, and additional upstairs seating also. They have a full bar so it's a pretty neat place to hang out after work or just to catch up.   If you don't want to have a sit down meal, you can order carry out as well. Just remember this is CASH ONLY.   I will definitely come back again!

ecjYbZa4Qbh3pgstYBph0Q.review_text: I tried the sweet and sour ribs, served with rice, on a Saturday around 4pm. There wasn't a line and the service was fast. They gave a HUGE portion of ribs that lasted me two meals! All for just $9. I've posted a picture of it too, check it out!!   The barbacks were super fast about noticing you're done with your food and taking away your plates to clear the table. They also seem pretty friendly. Water is freely and conveniently available in special water spouts. Side note, I noticed drinks were cheap! Like a glass of wine for $2-3.   Overall a good experience and I'm down to come back to try more of their cheap, large portion food!!

si_JzsBn0s98cKPf4T1qhw.review_text: I've came here a few times and I feel that they are pretty consistent at what they do.  I've tried their roast beef, pastrami, buffalo, and brisket.  There is usually a good line, but they are pretty efficient so the wait isn't bad wait at all.  Overall thoughts: I enjoyed the pastrami most, then brisket takes second place. This is definitely a 'no thrills' place as you go down the line for your order of a home cooked, hearty, filling meal.

uHNZi6YF8UpMBsRCe6pHgg.review_text: I always get the corned beef on a roll.  Its fresh because they slice the meat right in front of you and you also get a side of "juice".   It goes well with a pint of anchor steam but i'm usually halfway through my sandwich by the time the waitress brings out my beer.  After Jason Newsted auditioned for Metallica, they took him here to tell him that he made the band.  Everytime I go to the city, I make it a point to have lunch here with my family.   However, since my brother married a vegetarian, that made it a little more difficult, since this menu is all about meat.

oiNtrZYuwAbzdiEGp5EM_Q.review_text: You go there for the Meats. Who cares if you get so-so sides.  I have been there about 8 times in the last decade or so. The first thing I ever had was the Turkey Sandwich over 15 years ago. It was good but not spectacular. I never tried anything else other than the turkey for the last 7 times I've been there. What a shame!   Tonight was an Enlightment of the Brisket. It was Sunday night/ Monday morning and Mel's closed 15 min earlier than posted. Fortunately the waiter at Mel's told us to go over to Tommy's. And I luck out to behold Brisket Nirvana.   My friend and I hopped across the street and found that they still had a fair amount of patrons at 10 till 1AM. My friend ordered Roast Beef while I was thinking Brisket. I pointed to the Pastrami next the succulent Brisket which I thought was a rare slab of Brisket and the he server quickly corrected me.  I was about to order the Pastrami Dinner since that looked pretty good. Then he said that the Brisket was better. Okay, 'So Brisket it is.'  And he drizzled it with a good helping of BBQ sauce.  It's by far the best piece of beef I ever had. I think I've had enough beef to able to tell how it should be done right. The meat was tender and  easily sliced into with the steak knife. Slice, bite, slice, bite, slice...    I was an efficient machine with the circular motion of my left wrist. Savoring my meat even more as I briefly pause to cut. I didn't remember needing to chew on it much for it almost melt in my mouth.     Okay, maybe a little exaggerated, but I had a great cut with good portions. I almost wanted to chew the fat on the side. Plus their BBQ sauce fit my palate well . It wasn't overly sweet like most. The flavor complimented the meat well without overpowering it.   Don't forget to add a little Chili Sauce for some kick. Now I wish they have Sweet Potato for sides. Then I'll go there every week. Can't wait to go back to try the Lamb Special.   Oh yeah, my friend who ordered the Roast Beef said he will get the Brisket next time after I shared some of my portion.

FKImWRd56eV0pG4g1xLduw.review_text: Been here twice now.  Today's delectable sandwich was corned beef.  The sandwich was delicious, the environment reminded me of the midwest in ways most positive, and the place FELT good.    Parking is easier if you navigate to the south and/or west of the place.  Found LOTS of places that way, where north and east are crazy for parking.

t6aSujq-7pmXPENqp1rsoA.review_text: Hallelujah holla back!!! Tommy's Joynt. Talk about a great place to go with friends, eat a great meal, have a few drinks, and make new friends.  The people are great there. The staff, the customers, all just having a good time. Needless to say the ambiance is only part of the reason why there always a line to dine. My favorite food item has got to be the BBQ brisket but its all good. I also enjoy the barrel of sliced pickles. I don't think I've ever went to Tommy's Joint and left in a bad mood. Even if I was in a bad mood when I went in. In my opinion this place definitely embodies what is San Francisco.

becChstN1Nelt61S8j8exQ.review_text: Love this place!  I have to come here alone because my friends are too fancy for it.    The food is soooooo tasty.  Like a Sunday church buffet where your down south grandma cooked everything.  YUM!

Fk-bn7EmUienGYNAsUfEww.review_text: Didn't get a chance to have dinner at regular times or miss that home-style taste? Well, Tommy's Joynt is open until 2:00AM! Good sized portions for a fair price. The only down side of Tommy's Joynt is their shortage on popular items... I wanted cabbage with corn beef so many times, but so many times they ran out of cabbage.

5E3_w9b-KwbLQCtK8w7cfQ.review_text: Awesome cafeteria style dining is going the way of the buffalo. That said, this place is keeping it alive. Beers galore, great brisket, turkey, buffalo chilli, etc. Try everything. Daily specials, gigantic menu. What's there not to like? I regret living so far away. And if any restaurant made me evaluate my current location, it would be this place.

_DY9Gooz0LXUKP8sInSEsw.review_text: Meat and Meat and more Meat... and some poultry:)  It doesn't get much better than Tommy's Joynt. On a cold night in the city this meat and potatoes haven really hits the spot. My brother, myself and one of our guests had the beef brisket plate. It was cooked perfectly. Our other guest had the turkey leg and was very happy with her choice. This place is definitely a little divey but is really charming and inviting. The prices are awesome and the line staff is friendly. I will definitely come here again when I'm in the city.

gsw_VesYmovAP0enUrGknQ.review_text: Having been nearly a life-long resident of the San Francisco Bay Area and never been to Tommy's Joynt, I finally had the chance to try it out for dinner a few days ago.  The exterior of Tommy's seems like any other run-down, cheesy touristy restaurant on the Van Ness corridor, which I think is why I have never tried it before.  The interior is not that much nicer, however it's definetely one of those few restaurants where cheesy and run-down is good.  Tommy's boasts a cafeteria-style "kitchen" (you grab a tray and run down the line as cooks pile food onto plates and serve you), along with a full bar.  The food is decent homestyle cooking - turkey dinners, bratwursts, corned beef, stew, etc.  Not fine dining by any means, but if you're in the mood for some heavy-sitting comfort food, this is definetely the place.  I had a turkey dinner (gravy, mashed potatoes, stuffing, choice of salad) which was not very impressive, but okay.  My husband had a pastrami sandwich and buffalo-style chili, both were quite good.  The atmosphere is very relaxed and you kind of get that old-timey saloon feel when sitting at the bar - probably because nothing has changed in the place for 60 years.  But, that's what gives Tommy's Joynt a unique charm.  Basically, if you're in the neighborhood and need a decent, yet cheap, place to eat, or if you are entertaining out-of-towners, go to Tommy's Joynt.  But don;t go out of your way.

MIfBh6Br2lJDozVNDDg1ZA.review_text: It is what it is.  A dive bar with good hand carved meat at good prices.  If you expect more, you'll be disappointed.  If you want a quick sandwich or hand carved meat for a good price, there are much worse choices.  I actually thought the ribs were good also

TdAJ2z5vnZwxtjSNcTYHJQ.review_text: Would give 5 stars if I didn't have to stand next to bums smelling like piss every time I go...

YKI_mSqAIenGaCQYZcDCoQ.review_text: eh i was here  5 years ago the food was good. i recently went and ehhh i felt they may have lost their passion for food.  i work  near there and sometime the food is bland and flavorless the salmon and clam chowder is good to bad its only fridays

xL5Uo6TemnV3xvmpX-Gaog.review_text: Sandwiches here are huge and to the point. It's literally a generous amount of meat in between slices of bread. Depending on what you get, you may get some sauce on the side.   I shared a hot pastrami and bbq beef sandwich with a friend. We were both only able to finish half of one type and we were full. That's how hefty they are. They also have complimentary pickles in this ginormous jar, so feel free to help yourself! They are housemade pickles and they are delicious with your sandwich.   There are also condiments on the table for you, so you don't have to request any! I used the hot mustard and horseradish in my sandwiches. The hot mustard has a pretty strong kick to it and the horseradish is serious business, use with caution.   The service was really friendly and the food is quite enjoyable. Their sandwiches are also very reasonably priced, $6 for a huge sandwich. What's not to like?! Craving a sandwich right now....

GABWrw5Et9jubriKwMUDbw.review_text: This is as san Francisco as you can get. Stand in line. Order your food. (for us it was buffalo chili & buffalo stew sandwich with a side of stuffing). Sit down. Order Irish coffee(s). Eat.

2tIN9jTDxEoF-gSRSnUkPw.review_text: Tommy, did you have an off day? Is lunch time not the best time to visit you? How did my prior venture into your chambers blow me away but my recent revisit left me hanging with an overwhelming amount of mixed confusion in love and disappointment?  Your sides were still on point (let's be real, nobody ever eats the sourdough...hard as a rock!) but your bbq brisket that once blew me away did not do the same. It was overcooked and dry. Where did the fatty bits that made this dish bombdotcom go?   In regards to the Buffalo stew, it's not THAT great. In fact, it was quite dry, gritty, and...just average to sum it up. The stew itself was delicious and hearty but the meat was overdone.

2Oh2eUHcP7Cn3AwldLFIgA.review_text: Tommy's has been a hit or miss with me, though thankfully, lots more hits than misses.  I love their BBQ beef brisket plate (sweet, tangy, and savory!), and their buffalo stew is also drool-worthy, both in stew form and sandwich form.  Their service is counter-style, though you get table service for drinks.  It's pretty basic, minimal service, more self-service after you get your food, but the food and quirky atmosphere is enough to overcome all that for me.

zNJKX5RXeaqGeS4rVIEAvw.review_text: This place is consistently awesome! Good food, great prices and BIG portions. Oh and did I mention CHEAP drinks? Cash only so hit the ATM first. It's a SF staple and I've been going since I was a kid with my dad.   Their Saturday night ribs and Thursday night lamb shank are my favorite meals. Salmon is tasty too as is the meatball sandwich!  The only down side is it closes earlier than I'd like. Their meatball sando is what I crave after a night of dancing and barhopping but they're closed up after midnight. So Mel's Diner across the street has earned my business a couple times.

OK5B_PHxTDlLfhmIV2MxPw.review_text: It's been a while since I went to a Hof Brau. That's basically because there just aren't as many in town as there used to be. There was Sam's Original on Turk and Mason, and one big place in Fisherman's Warf that are gone.  Tommy's Joynt is a very good hof brau. The meats are cooked well. The pastrami is flavorful and along with the corned beef, are very tender. But the best thing is the prices. The portions they serve are at least your money's worth, if not more. For $5.60 I got a hot pastrami stacked on a sourdough roll. At my work they charge almost $6 for a processed turkey (4 slices) sandwich with sliced avacado. The dinner plate dishes are $8.50 and are fairly generous. They also have BUFFALO on the menu. It's in chili or stew. You'll have to wait in a queue at meal times, but it moves pretty good. They also have a full bar with an enormous selection of beers including Anchor Steam and Heineken on draft. Parking is on the street, but if you get tired of circling, Tommy's will validate the Cathedral Hill Garage for $3/hr up to 2 hrs.  All that makes Tommy's pretty cool. Check it out.

st2RfLr9YJIGAbc43JLVkQ.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is a San Francisco classic.  It's a must visit for anyone coming into town.    Here's the deal:  Awesome bbq(my favorite is the brisket), good portion and awesome variety.   the beers are a good deal and there's PLENTY to choose from.   There's a full bar....excellent!   They're open late!  a few knocks...parking can be tough, cash only from what i remember, squished seating in certain areas.  old people.  lol j/k old people.    You can't beat a good price, good food, and good beer.  It's definitely on the monthly rotation.

-CdioCf2vBD_agBBW3NIww.review_text: Delicious, for what it is!  Check out their daily specials.  Monday night is oxtail night!  Oh boy!!

NeXRy1C7PxS7bvIcQ3SymA.review_text: OH YUM.  Perfect for late night hunger pangs.    I am really into hand-carved meats so when I saw them chopping up some corned beef and pastrami, I couldn't resist.  For $5.60, you can get a big sandwich and that's such a good deal!  They are generous with the meat, sandwiches come with a side of light au jus, and the hot mustard sitting on the table puts the sandwich over the top.    If you get a chance, read the sign that's above the doorway.  It talks about how they get their buffalo from ranches where there are an abundance of them.  Supposedly if the ratio of buffalo to cows isn't 1:10, then the males will just starting attacking and beating each other to death.  So vegetarians, suck it.  I ended up getting the Tommy's Big Sandwich with pastrami on sourdough.  OH YUM must I say again.  I'm sure people on the East Coast will say this does not compare to Katz but I say it's the best in this area so far.  I also got Buffalo Chili which I don't think is quite worth the $5.95.  The meat is ground up and it's served on a bed of white rice which might be nice but it gets kind of boring to eat after a while.  I would pass on that next time.  So the way you do it is you walk in, stand in line, order at the counter, pay, then sit down.  If you want a drink, you can either go order it at the bar or a server will be with you really soon.  Service was good.  She got our cokes and waters out quickly and even the money transaction took place before we even noticed.  Good service definitely adds to the experience but my favorite part is still how much character this place has!

L47yNpuJtzKqkmMVHCZ8dQ.review_text: My boyfriend and I love this place. We always try to go on a Monday for their ox tail special. soooooo good and I always get sooo full!! I also love their spaghetti and meatball dish. and it's cheaper than eating sushi because I always pick sushi whenever my bf asks me where I want to eat.

ccNPeR1FsdhGeBhaH4rZgg.review_text: I use to come here quite a bit when I worked close by and the food never really disappointed me.  Well, we were coming back home from Fresno and was thinking "where can we get some food with a 1 yr old at 11pm?"  Tommy's!!!  Not really a place for kids but she loved it!  We loved it too coz we were craving spaghetti and meatballs and a cocktail!  The s'getti is different but good.  We like their oxtails, turkey dinner, and sandwiches as well.

c57xg09UReFF_oZeN8XPwQ.review_text: Good food.  This place is open late and food seems really fresh.

nsawcqioX0NDmqsDsM8L4w.review_text: This place is definitely underrated 3.5.  The decor is like a Apple Bees / TGIF, but with soul.  It's cafeteria style, so get in line and tell them what you like and they'll plop it on the tray.  We split the beef brisket with their BBQ sauce, beans, string beans and Buffalo Chili and was impressed with how moist the brisket was.  Grab your silverware, water, and pickles and sit anywhere.  Upstairs has TVs so you can watch your sports.  The portions are ample because even splitting the food we were stuffed. This place is great for groups.

Pw5GtoozGMKsDNkx8Gg0ig.review_text: Don't know anything about the place's history, but wouldn't be surprised if it was a SF cult classic. Has a laid back, been here since the beginning of time type vibe. Proteins were very good and sides were respectable. Reasonably priced. I'll be back.

PstMN4AN6OlpVp2sIfHkyQ.review_text: Food is absolutely amazing. Really small simple menu but anything is good. They have a full stocked bar that has a phenomenal craft brew selection (I'm talking 50+ beers). Bar tenders are polite and quick and the guys that prepare the food are awesome  The only downside... There is table seating with table service but only for drinks, you must get the food yourself. The waitress's are slow, spend most of their time socializing, and I am pretty sure they don't know the difference between a stout and a coors light. They also pressure you to close out tabs as soon as possible. I find my experience much more enjoyable if I just get my drinks myself from the bar....   Great food, great drinks, just don't bother with the "drinks only waitress's"....

qc3rVl8nuKqYtfGD58aHbQ.review_text: The BBQ Beef Brisket with mash potatoes is off the hook! It melts in your mouth and then heads down south!   Not much of a review, more like a craving while I sit here dying at my desk as I fiend for this mouth watering derricious brisket!!  I cannot stop shouting. I gosta have it.

iV2XaXa9VTnCkQHCpdiM2Q.review_text: my first time (after living in SF for 2 1/2 years) was such a memorable experience. i loved waiting in line.  seeing the juicy meats made my mouth water.  corn beef sammy = perfection. beef stew sammy = perfection.  AMAZING beer selection and they make a pina colda?  GOLDEN. =)

9nuv3DsQJFjApI3UgHvgxQ.review_text: It's a joint.  Lots of food for a decent price.  The food's a hit and miss, but then again, it's a lot of food.  Cafeteria style.  The folks behind the line will remember you if you come in often (I don't).  I had mashed potatoes with a steak (similar to meatloaf) sandwich.  Free all you can eat pickles.

U9yWtQO_0LPjtaU9jN0JsA.review_text: The good:      + huge portions  + cheap  + great atmosphere  The bad:   - food is hit or miss, mostly just okay  Came last Thu to find the place packed already at 6:30pm. Ordered the turkey sloppy joe ($4.75) which was a bun split into 3 with what looked like pulled turkey in bbq sauce ladled on top with a scoop of mashed potatoes and gravy on the site. Best eaten with a knife and fork. Bread was meh. Turkey was okay. Mash was okay. Great value because it was a huge plate. Next time I wouldn't bother eating the bread.  Hubby ordered the buffalo chili which was served over rice with a dinner roll on the side. Chili was pretty good but not a huge portion for $6.75. Just a normal size.  Friend ordered the dinner plate with brisket but ended up with pastrami or corned beef by accident. It was okay. He also ordered a kielbasa to try which was not that great.  Recommend you come at least once to experience the old-skoolness. Or if you're on a serious budget.

JIsACbRETTOxeuWvzpu8ig.review_text: Sf staple!  Must try the brisket :) Everything looked delicious   It's a simple down home joint !

ei7TBYg6hVy2FlQVIKS42A.review_text: Very disappointing. We saw the piece on diners drive ins and dives and expected more. We had buffalo stew, tough and bland and burgundy beef the same. Slaw was very good, the sourdough rolls were cold and hard. Will not return.

Dj77pkw_EZJvR-F4RIf_BQ.review_text: why did i give this place 4 stars?  shame on me.  tommy's highly deserves the full 5.    tommy's used to be an everyday thing for me...until i moved to the south bay.  now, everytime i head out to the city...this is by far...my san francisco treat.  haha.    order the pastrami...with rice, mixed beans salad...and grab a plate of pickles...and you're good to go.

Rr1Ruefq9XCTkI5k1hcWhw.review_text: This is a good place to get a cheap meal.  But that is it.  The meat portion of the meal is all that is edible.  The side dishes are overcooked, over sauced, and just plain inedible to anyone who actually likes the taste of vegetables.  They do have many, many choices in beer, if that is your thing.

3nRENjIkd19bMwtJQtUFdA.review_text: A very good hof brau with efficient counter service. Roast beef was tender and flavorful. Also, I like the sausage sandwiches. Reasonable prices, cash only. Tommy's Joynt really hasn't changed since I first visited in the 80's. Which is a good thing.

nxUocCceCH9sIJjN0M9jnw.review_text: Walking into Tommy's Joynt is like walking into my apartment when all my roommates are home sitting on the couch; a diverse variety of a bunch of warm meat-things all competing for my attention.   The main difference is that Tommy's Joynt gives me free pickles where my roommates give me an ulcer.

8fmwbLDKHQxm50rvlcjaUA.review_text: It is what it is, an old SF staple, with simple, classic hearty fare.  Everything is good, but dont expect anything gourmet, organic or healthy.   It's simple, wait in line, order, choose your meat and see 'em carve it in front of you. Just remember that they dont put anything on the sandwiches besides meat unless you ask, which can be mildly annoying.   It appeals to my Irish side, and I always leave satisfied.

x8yLWKxWXdXU0hOepYx4YQ.review_text: Tommys is pretty great. All the meats are awesome, but the pastrami is best. The corn beef is salty, but very good. The roast beef is cooked a little too well for my tastes, but still pretty good. The pasta salad is like crack, I love that stuff.   The best part is the price is right. They cut up some great pieces of meat for the sandwiches, and at 5.50 its a great deal. The dinner plates are filling at 8.75 (I think).     I would give tommys a try if you arent expecting good service, and wanna get a nice buzz of cheap pints while eating dinner. I hear the drinks are strong, but I have yet to try.

CmQZSnOdD6qEpci1xwJUCg.review_text: Best margarita I have ever had as long as the nerdy doode with glasses is making them.  I get the brisket dinner with mashers and white gravy and a dinner salad with blue cheese dressing. Go here. If you think it sucks, stop going here. Turkey dinner is hitting too. Pickles are excellent and free.

CAQv3QQHUasQNtN-HEldAw.review_text: Consider it old school. Cafeteria style. Meat on bread. Meat on a plate.  It's a little dry. There's no new-fangled aioli on it. The bread isn't toasted. And the only veggies you get is the salad they put on the side.  I visited Tommy's Joynt for the second time the other day. I was on the bus, the AC had shut off, and I had a terrible case of motion sickness. Maybe it was the diet soda I had earlier in the day. Or the stupid salad I ate. Whatever it was, I wanted some BBQ...  It's the same BBQ smell I inhale every morning on my way to the shuttle stop. Taunting. Teasing. Tormenting. The shop ain't even open that early in the morning.  So when I finally got the BBQ sandwich my body was literally going limp for, well, I was a little disappointed. I was expecting mine to be slathered in BBQ sauce by the way it smelled from the outside.  Would I come back? Maybe. Sheerly out of convenience since it is on my way home from work. The lack of parking may be prohibitive for some. And Tommy's Joynt is open till 2, and after a night of drinking, I could see any of these sandwiches earning another star or two.

brKdSv44CFBDGVATwQdjfg.review_text: Tommy's Joynt in SF is a must try, i love the whole bistro walk in order and pay for your food thing! They keep it real nice and simple. I ordered the corned beef with mashed potatoes. The corned beef was perfect, not too salty and it was real juicy. I hate places that make their corned beef brine too salty and cook it too dry. The mashed potato was pretty good too, and i was feeling the cauliflower and broccoli salad. It had a real nice vinaigrette in the salad. static.px.yelp.com/bphot… Tommy's does it right, i even watched the triple D episode when Guy came by and they showed him how they made it from scratch. Hard to find places like this around anymore. Especially for the prices they have, my meal was only $8.50 without tax. That was real cheap. They have all types of hofbrau food here. You can even eat at the bar when its not peak hours. I really like this sign, it has a real old timely feel to it! static.px.yelp.com/bphot… Overall Tommy's is a must try spot for some real nice hot plates. Nothing fancy nothing overdone just plain simple good food! 4 Stars for Tommy's Joynt in SF

3ZTDj5P-UQ8RUUbaWbqMQA.review_text: We first heard about this place watching Guy Fieri and put it on this list of places to go when we were back in San Fran and definitely happy we did, the food was really good and very well priced. The BBQ brisket was excellent, roast beef was good too. We will definitely be back to try out the other dishes. For four people full meals and drinks it was $50!

UVTPrOz1sVuKpon_cTgFEQ.review_text: Beer braised pork and mashed potatoes =DELICIOUSNESS!? So tasty. A bit spicy. Oh so Tasty! Enough for 2.

inC4RFU5XrSuPf3-oSMLFQ.review_text: Why am I giving this the highest rating? Because two years after visiting after I saw it on DDD I still crave to go back. I stayed across the street at the Opal Hotel so it was convenient just being across the street. It was just plain good, home made, no nonsense, straight forward goodness...oh how I want to go back!

eGemHqWyXqC6vfw06PGjtg.review_text: I love Tommy's - as in enough to marry it even though it's way older than me.  Lots of beers and the open faced sandwiches with mashed potatoes  are to die for.  I can split one with my  sexy boyfriend , who can pack away the food like a bear in that thin body of his , and we are both full. That's right- two pints of ale and a full meal under fifteen bucks.  Not a place for vegetarians but as a carnivore myself I could care less. I love the decor. It does not get genuinely cooler than this.

EM8Q9QkTEDQbq9g4bPeBlA.review_text: I can't believe I have never written about this place because I go there often that I am the mayor of it on 4square.  Yes, that's right, I am the mayor of Tommy's Joynt, one of the best meat places to go to in SF.  Victory!  Besides that, they have really great dinner plate specials that change depending on what day of week it is.  Ox tail, lamb shank, and the salmon fillet are all pretty good nights to go.  If you don't go on one of those nights, the brisket place is usually a good alternative as well.    They also have new items from time to time such as burgundy beef (which is ok), a giant turkey leg, and baked lasagna, which looks great and lasagny.  I have had the pasta there and you guessed it, there is meat in that too!  I had the salad once as a side, but that was probably the worst decision I have ever made.  Getting salad in a meat joint is just very silly.  Go here and challenge me for supremacy, you will be in a diehard battle!

te_3sFwC4hdNJN-HtqCXQQ.review_text: We say this place on Diners Drive Ins and Dives on the Food Network and figured we had to try it out while we were in town. The outside looks very "circusy" and the sign is awesome. Then, we entered and it was a really neat little place with all kinds of neat things on the walls. A deli type counter on one side and a bar on the other side of the room.  Lamb shank for the lady. Two thumbs up.  BBQ Beef Sandwich on Sourdough. Two thumbs up and I come from Kansas City, the BBQ mecca of the world. Yeah, I said it, world.  Had a great time at Tommy's and will definitely recommend to everyone we know that visits SF.

XE8Jc_84wybVBP8k1HcmPA.review_text: OK...I just wrote this review and then it got deleted...I'll try again  When I was in high school I went to a show at the Fillmore with my uncle and I remember driving past this place and him proclaiming that he had had the best sandwich of his life at Tommy's Joynt. I also have a good friend that during her entire pregnancy ate a turkey sandwich from Tommy's weekly. I finally got the chance to try it yesterday...and it was average. It tasted good, but I guess it wasn't my thing. I had a meat ball sandwich, the meat was good, the sauce tasted like home made (just not made in my home), and the bread was too chewy. The restaurant itself is awesome though...there isn't a spot on the wall or ceiling that isn't covered by some piece of kitschy goodness. You should go just to check out the decor.  I took off one star for average sandwich, and another for a bad drink waitress who just couldn't get it together.

yv0loySNdS3JuYCNWdYBrQ.review_text: Just because Guy Fieri goes there on Triple D, doesn't make the place worthy of going (I know this...). In this case, he was on the money for any carnivore.  Two things I recommend, are the pastrami and corned beef sandwiches (ASK FOR SWISS CHEESE THEY DONT ASK U IF YOU WANT IT AND WONT PUT IT ON IF YOU DONT)   these two, as well as, some of their other meats have been slow cooked with a lot of love so you know it's tasty.  I'll be honest, sometimes the meat is fattier than I like but, even on a small budget (1 $ sign) Tommy's doesn't disappoint.  Also, if you want some beer they have a beer list that will take you more than a few minutes to actually look over and will be sure to wash down any food consumed at this joynt.   As for sides- Coleslaw is OK  Mashed Potatoes and Gravy- Creamy GOODNESSSS [must have w/ any thing here] Beans - SWEET Chili - (Cup only) is tasty Cucumber Salad - Good  OH I almost forgot..the CHEESECAKE MMMMMM so cheesey and good...it's simple, plain,  did i mention cheesey, tasty, delicious NY style that is worth getting if you can fit it after your meal.

rbofc9BEvXlm7RZG0o9eHQ.review_text: The line is there for a reason - good food at a reasonable price.  Hit Tommy's Joynt last night prior to a Fillmore concert.  Glad we did. The Saturday Spare Rib special was perfect.  Others had corned beef, turkey plate, roast beef sandwich - all raved.  Spent less on two dinners and a pitcher than the cost of 4 beers at the show. Great spot.

X7NruZXmLRCXnYpa6ylwRg.review_text: Having lived in San Francisco almost my entire life, I shamefully admit I have never been to Tommy's Joynt until last night.   I had the cardboard stew and It was the most flavorful stew with chunks of dry, dry cardboard. Oh wait, that was buffalo in the stew.   Move it over and bring on that corned beef sandwich. 5 slices of equally dry corned beef neatly placed between two thick slices of, again, dry perhaps 2 day old bread. It really doesn't look that amazing, actually not at all. I am having trouble tearing a bite out of this thing. Soak it with au jus my friends said. Yeah, well, it's not helping.   Maybe the next experience will be better but I doubt there will be a next time.

343SitEpnQj0HQDg41RIYQ.review_text: Gross, greasy, and unfriendly.   The kitsch / dive bar thing attracted us but the place is filthy (looking & feeling) and generally a little alarming.  Am pretty ok with nasty looking places with good food but this place has bad food and is nasty looking. No win here.

xs4s455bWJDegXUFJY6ZwQ.review_text: One of San Francisco's original Hofbrau's drink and eat to your heart's content.  It's cafeteria style food with meats, side dishes and more old time goodness a plenty.  Come here and you'll be transformed to a land where all sorts of characters far and wide get their grub on.  Lots to see all around, the place is decorated with all sorts of stuff.   Three words BARREL OF PICKLES.  Eat all you want, but take all you eat.  I like pickles and these are nice and mild with a hint of garlic with a nice bite.  Pastrami Sandwich - awesome! Buffalo Chili - awesome! corn beef sandwich - awesome! Sides - pretty good, but that will depend on your tastes, somethings I liked others I didn't care for so much.  Your tables should have jars of mustard ranging from mild to spicy.  I would suggest even if you like hot to start with mild and work your way up.  The hot mustard will make you wanna slap your momma!  Decor: 5 Food:4 Service: 4  Would I go back? You bet your pastrami I would!

d7Pda4dWDIbaGdXMho1TIw.review_text: Good beer, great food! how can you beat it?

cPBM12o7v6BvCkU-ORbTvA.review_text: I HATE this place. I hate the line you have to wind around forever before you order, I hate the cafeteria style line of food they have in the windows, and I hate the food!! It's really dark in there and doesn't feel clean. I had the spaghetti with red sauce and was served a plate of noodles that had been siting in water all day with some BROWN sauce that tasted like beefy juice instead of red sauce. Totall gross.

JPkBg9y_J_PNprDr8E9rkw.review_text: cheap drinks, great beer selection, good location. oh yeah almost forgot, the food is the fucking best. round beef sandwich was so good. $3 for a sausage sandwich. when you need meat go here. full meat butcher station. my goal is to try everything. cash only though...

fEykdITvqKtGkwddkktIQw.review_text: Best drinks for the best prices and great services. Didn't try their food but everyone was eating that turkey leg. Try their punch!

QNRv9nSSydXfHGmGmsb_dQ.review_text: Every time I've been to San Francisco this year, this has been my first stop.  There's no other joint like it.  If you're in the mood for a drink and whether you're with friends or out to make new friends you will find quite the eclectic crowd at Tommy's.  And then there's the food. Meatball's... awesome. Brisket? Melts in your mouth. Stew? Amazing. Even the chicken wings over rice are to die for.  I have never had a bad meal here.  Most of the time I come here with the intention of a few drinks but before the night is over I've had my second dinner.

BhcdsgIPJJYPvlLP6D78Rw.review_text: There aren't that many places I know of in the west coast that offer buffalo but Tommy's Joynt is one of them. This place is not for the faint-hearted. I say that because though the menu isn't really that big, first timers may be overwhelmed with how quickly the line moves around lunchtime and for people with bad eyesight it can be frustrating as the menu is written up above the counter, line cook and cashier waiting to take your order and move on to the next person quickly. Some of the patrons can be a little pushy if they think you're holding the line up, but don't mind them. If you're lucky to grab a seat in the back area you will get to peek into the kitchen and see trays of food or clean dishes get placed on a catering windowsill for a worker to bring to the front.  One thing I didn't quite understand is how beverages work - you order one after sitting down. Oh and I heard the bathrooms are pretty grimy. Expected but keep that in mind.  Despite that the buffalo stew sandwich is mighty filling. Can't wait to go back next time I'm in town!

IEpBeWttOh2UZWslv1ZZ_A.review_text: Hit this place up because of good reviews and close to our hotel. Perfect for late night food after drinks, good food, fast service and priced right! Brisket was delicious

G6JQL79TqSiQASLUpkgq3w.review_text: Great food and won't hurt your wallet! I had the BBQ turkey sloppy joe.  Artery clogging good, and there is a bottomless jar of pickles to go with your food! Definitely NOT a date place, but a cheap place to grab a bite to eat before heading to the AMC VanNess.

3gRykLgv5-_vxngoRlAFrQ.review_text: This is the heartiest meal and beer you can get in the city for under ten bucks. The sandwiches are less than five. Meatballs and meat sauce are excellent, and the lamb shanks are even better. The bar is a great place to have a drink and watch a game, and the place is big enough to handle large crowds. The staff is very friendly as well and they're open late. The beer selection is the largest I have seen, many countries represented. The bartender Zack is a cool dood. Tasty food.

1Sxil5SdwHnJYX0dig0IPQ.review_text: Good ol' American comfort food for a great price. Better come with a hearty, hefty appetite.

v0ANF5-KxIWBtQQB0PfI4w.review_text: Houfbrau style place with plenty of great food for a reasonable price.

HnnGvz1PXm80V93fFU9lhA.review_text: A friend of mine brought me here for the first time a couple of weeks ago. I had never heard of it before but my homie's got good taste in restaurants so I was down to check it out. I did like the hot pastrami sandwich, and one of my other friends got a BBQ brisket meal which looked pretty good too. I got a side of mashed potatoes to go with my sandwich, and they weren't great, but if I was sloppy drunk, I probably would have loved them. When I ordered a Pyramid Hefeweizen with my meal, I was surprised when our waitress brought out a really tall glass of amber-colored liquid goodness instead of just bringing out a standard-sized beer bottle. They really don't water down their drinks at all over here, because everything we drank was hitting us pretty hard.   All in all, I would probably give Tommy's Joynt more of a 3.5 rating, but I usually round up on Yelp since there are no half-star ratings, hence the 4 star rating. Like Cheech and Chong, I'd hit this Joynt up again.

cCeCQxErE9ToaQQBEVFuFA.review_text: again, need cheap, but something delicious.  this is the spot. two dinner plates, one killer corned beef, the other brisket (dont get the BBQ sauce on it..) instant mashed potatoes, salad, roll and pickles, topped with awesome gravy.  $18.00 total. i heart tommy's joynt.

1vbSK5zueQ2EhJMfQZ49zA.review_text: Always a good decision for expansive comfort food and a great relaxing vibe. My dad loves this place. Every time he visits he insists on coming here and I totally oblige. I had the broiled chuck steak with onions and mash. Delicious and comforting! I love the casual atmosphere. The guys behind the counter have been there serving for years. I have not had the famed buffalo stew though. Might try that next time.   The turkey or roast is always good as well.

PlEv-bJhYFsloE4vgUV_HQ.review_text: In a nutshell: Only go here for a meal if you're drunk, a tourist, or a drunk tourist.   Cheap prices, big portions, and a bustling atmosphere but the quality of the food is sub-par. I've had better food at hospital cafeterias. Everything tastes like it came from a can.   Go here once for the experience, then turn tail and never look back.

7i2JyM5gVZnXtsgb7zCdtg.review_text: Came here on 3 occasions...  1st visit.. a Thursday Ordered the special, Lamb Shanks with potatoes. Also ordered a large pitcher of Hef. and a Tokio Iced tea from the bar. The bar tender was super nice and pour an extra glass of beer to subsitute the head in pitcher.  Friends ordered the Beef Brisket with mash potatoes w/ gravy. I thought the Lamb was good, really tender and flavorful. Didn't get to try the Beef Briskets, but it looked good. And of course the booze was good.   2nd visit. a Friday Ordered the Buffalo Stew over rice. I never had bufflo/bison meat before so this was my first experience. I thought it was really tough and flavorless. My mouth was sore from all the chewing and decided not to finish it. On the other hand, my friend got the Pastrami sandwich. I got to taste a little piece of the pastrami and it was pretty good. The bread was pretty bland and tough though. She said it was good so I don't know.   3rd visit.. A Friday Decided to change it up and order something else. This time I got the spaghetti with meatballs. The spaghetti was decent the meatballs were flavorful. Both on the salty side though ( and I have a salt tooth). My brother got the Beef Brisket. He said it was flavorless and bland.   In conclusion, I may pay another visit because it is cheap and the food is served in big portions. I don't think my body will like it very much (sodium overload).

wTR4ol0yLgepM4sPElTaTQ.review_text: Love Tommy's Joynt!  Ordering is somewhat cafeteria like, then you pay at the end of the line.  I have had both the ham and the roast beef sandwiches, and both were delicious! The dip sauces were the best part!   The decor is the best part of the place.  It is upbeat, exciting, and creative.  The men preparing the food are fun and helpful!   I could be wrong, but I believe it was cash only when I went, just a heads up!

OvNCuwc0pCG3nc0eLQjdoQ.review_text: This is where I come when I'm looking for a MANWICH!  Best pastrami in the city imo.  None of that thin cut deli style here...that's for little boys.  here you get your pastrami cut with a big fork and carving knife.  Then it's piled on a roll, and slathered with mayo and mustard to seal the deal.    How could I have not reviewed this place?  Tommy's rocks!  Everyone loves the old time bar decor of this place.  And it's surprisingly bigger than it looks as there are rooms upstairs and in the back.  BBQ Beef is not too bad here either.

S7i-y4MUhZ-_Ex1YG1g7SQ.review_text: I've been eating here since I moved to the City . It's one of the last authentic Frisco eateries in existence, owned by the same family since it was built in the 50's. The meats are great, the beer selection and bar are wonderful, salads fresh and simple, and even if the food weren't good, the pickle barrel is worth a trip! This is a must for all my out of town visitors. My brothers always insist on stopping here on the way home from the airport.  When a place is as consistently good as Tommy's, I have to wonder how anyone can rate it at one star. The problem is with you, not the restaurant.  This is a place for real comfort food eaten by real people. The corned beef is by Robert's, the best on the West Coast.  Thank you Tommy's Joynt for being there. You make me happy.

LEvBhwt9A4gSQKyVyc4PuA.review_text: Okay guys lets be honest here. Tommy's is not this magical fairyland of food and fun at which you all seem to describe.   Yes, the excessive amounts of unhealthy food can be overwhelmingly exciting but are we really talking about quality?  I used to be obsessed with Tommy's! Who wouldn't be after late nights of fun that end up at a dream world of meat? But one fine day I came across the brilliant idea to bring home Tommy take out for my roommates and myself. I got all the favorites... obviously I needed the lasagna, mac and cheese, slaw, mashed potato's, a nice cut of the lion, some corn beef, a meatball sub and a few rolls to top it off. My mouth was watering in anticipation as I anxiously awaited the divinity that was about to occur. I walked though the door and we immediately dived in... After a few bites of everything we started to get this strange feeling? What is wrong here? Why does this amazing food not taste good? Then after a few terrifying moments of shock and confusion we had the startling realization that...WE'RE NOT DRUNK! Ahhhhhhhhhh!!!!!! Woe is my sober taste buds :(  Long story short... alcohol needed to enjoy.

ygtLrCS5zAWgjVTM5VEV3w.review_text: The lines are always crazy for this place! But of course it's well worth the wait! With tons of different and yummy foods to the wall of beer and alcohol, this place is simply devine! I try to come here everytime I'm in town, and usually do! The ONLY minus is that traveling upstairs to sit can be crazy..and the restroom is seriously lacking..it borders on a little creepy.  Other than that, I LOVE this Joynt.

uZaTTVLU8fYOlVC1B9tjmA.review_text: Take anyone who says "San Francisco is too expensive", especially if they live in some destitute town like Portland, to Tommy's. Don't let them eat a delicious meal because it's usually already packed with tourists.  See you there at midnight!

VZdqA6ckDpnihWxg9_TPuQ.review_text: old school, lots of tradition, plain red and white checkered table cloths, kind of place.  full bar on one side.  carnivore heaven on the other.  tvs going in every room.  plates piled high with meat, mashed potatoes, veggies, gravy and a friendly atmosphere.  had the juicy pastrami and buffalo stew.  will go back again just for that, and willing to try the other dishes.  the chicken a la king and mac cheese were only so so.  make sure to use the hot mustard and free pickles!

kdWxHlJhA2MWnIiv9Y2Ogw.review_text: This place is now my favorite place to eat in San Francisco.  The bartender was attentive and suggested we try the BBQ Beef Sandwich, the beef was super tender and well seasoned (the sauce was great).  The mixed drinks were delicious I had "Tommy's Rum Punch" and the "Blue Hawaii" both were delicious.  When I ordered my sandwich it was assembled quickly, I asked the cashier about the pickles and was directed towards a huge barrel of pickles, I would come back for the pickles alone.  The staff was friendly and it was 1 AM, we didn't feel rushed to get out by closing.  Highly recommend this food 'Joynt'!

p3heVCnq3M0H2LMxIuuc5g.review_text: What a cool piece of SF!  I stopped in here last week when my co-worker insisted that we check it out.  This being my first trip to San Francisco, I had never heard of Tommy's Joynt before we stepped through the two-way doors.  Once inside I realized that I was going to have a great time.  Numerous beers (mainly bottle) and a slightly surly bartender made for a comfortable bar experience.  The food (you pay for this separately) was cheap, plentiful, and delicious.  I had a corned beef plate that was truly delicious.  While I stuffed my face with tender meat and shockingly delicious coleslaw, my coworker gave me a brief history lesson on Tommy's Joynt which only added to my experience.  Although I didn't spend much time here (just one Anchor Steam Porter draught), I will definitely check it out again on my next trip to SF.  Cheers!

yGapqGSj3puwrdeLK-IqJQ.review_text: I came here cuz I saw it on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives so maybe my expectations were too high. Visually and atmospherically the place is pretty cool and I was totally digging it while I waited in line. If you like crowded, noisy, cramped, old Western saloon meets old sports bar meets deli sandwich joint then you'll like TJ's. I happen to like all that so It was entertaining to check out all the old stuff everywhere and to try to figure out the various menu boards while I waited in line, which wasn't long.  Loved the price points as my family of five were all able to eat till we were stuffed (including dessert & tip) for $50. We had clam chowder, pastrami sandwich, bbq sandwich, spaghetti w/meatballs, buffalo chili, choc chip cookies, and a pitcher of soda. As much as I liked the vibe, the decor, the price point and the variety of different kinds of food....the service was even better. The girl who helped us (Japanese girl?) was probably the most genuinely friendly and helpful food server I can recall meeting in a long, long time. Very sweet and helpful, a real delight. However, with all that said...I was disappointed in the food. For a landmark place I thought it'd be better. The chowder was okay, the buffalo chili was flavorful but unremarkable, the pastrami and roast beef were tough and chewy, the cookies were too sweet, the pasta was overcooked, the marinara was bland and the meatballs were not fresh. The only thing I really did think was exceptional was the sweet, tangy BBQ sauce that I poured liberally to put the average sandwiches into 'good' territory.  So, I'm not real sure I'd come back. Because of how cool and old world it looks inside and out I'm sure it's a great place for a TV show. But it's not something I'd drive out of my way again to visit if I'm hungry and want something even remotely remarkable in terms of food. If I were in the area and hungry and low on funds and the line wasn't too long I'd give it another go for sure. But otherwise, nah. But I'm glad I tried it once so I can at least be cool cuz I can say I've been there, done that but didn't buy a t-shirt.

ZhltiCpjbVNWb3WRIGi9dg.review_text: Talk about a hole in the wall. Okay maybe not exactly a hole in the wall since it's so popular, but when you're talking about wanting late night food at 12-1AM in the morning when you're stomach says feed me something that's not McDonalds, then look no further.  The first thing you will notice when you arrive is the ambience of the place. It's got that old school feel to it that feels like a bar, until you see the bbq popup stand that slaps you silly. We even had the pleasure of meeting the owner which was unexpected. But let me just jump straight into the food and what I liked about this place.  Brisket: The brisket here is super moist and definitely not like some of the dried up raisins that I've had at other places. They even have a nice juice that goes over the top as well, so it definitely puts a cherry on top.  Meat Sauce Spaghetti: This place carries a mean spaghetti and I'm not talking about one of those that you eat and you say...meh...that was okay. This one actually taste meaty since it's so well prepped with it's meat. Not only that, but the plate comes with the brisket! Boom! Who does that?!   Side Dishes: Everyone knows that I like side dishes. Well this places gives you a huge roll, beans, and some random pickles. Seriously it's got everything and guaranteed that you will be full afterwards. It's definitely worth it.

JetW2z67dRj6VYLy4dxF-g.review_text: Decent comfort food for dirt cheap.......this is the spot  It's basically a cafeteria style restaurant.........not the cleanest or the nicest.........but the food is good!  They have daily specials that you've got to try, and the meatball sandwich is just drenched in sauce!  I've been here numerous times, and I'll still keep coming back.

0CqAmHUSWPEQdrnCbDiaVA.review_text: If you want a cheap, home-cooked style meal, check out Tommy's.  They have a good selection of meat, potatoes, etc, along with sandwiches and other things.  I made the mistake of copying my buddy's order, which was far too big (a dinner plate plus sausage sandwich.  It's a good portion and a lot of food.    Also, I did not partake, but according to my friend the "hot mustard" is not lying.

KzzsJWwTJ-8auD4MZUvWjg.review_text: Wholesome, all-American food.  Fun decor.  SF Classic.

w-UUD__OCINqlqED7iysCA.review_text: Yummy.  Parking not so good. But food totally makes up for that. Wine and beer extremely reasonable. We hit this place up before going to the Fillmore. It was extremely convenient and a short drive to the venue.

iB3wVGRwcSCATPuQ8fQeEw.review_text: The best thing I can say about this place is that it is ALL TRUE.  If you are interested in checking this place out, read all the reviews below, get super-stoked, and then go hit Van Ness and get some chow!  I went here on a Saturday afternoon and had a good meatball sandwich and a few bites of my girlfriend's delicious bbq beef sandwich. Man, this place makes some great plates.  The comment below concerning it being all about meat is on the money,  Go here with protein in mind and you will not be disappointed. The sides are tasty too: great beans and a good potato salad.  It's deli style, so you order and stand in line, pay and then sit.  A staff comes over to the table for beverages and whatnot.  If you dig beer too, then this place is even tighter. HUGE beer selection (bottles and draft).  Check out the pic on the subpage for an inkling of their selection.    Funky interior design too, makes me feel like I am at Canobie Lake Park.  Check it out.

Kem6Cf8Fch49WIXPKoT-Cw.review_text: It is a dive. Expect to eat with your neighbor but the food is orgasmic. The best meat in town. We had the Corned Beef and BBQ Beef Brisket. They were cooked to perfection and melted in your mouth. The portions are generous. You definitley get your money's worth. A must go to as a local or tourist!!

XLDHgGmbRy_X4JoKga26cw.review_text: I went to Tommys joynt with my husband and his side of the family, Sports bar down stairs and upstairs is very nice as well the waitress was great and the food was good also loved the fact that you can see all the meats and sides beeing prepared infront of you.

PkeDOqXbgEOkR-aKUHoQ_A.review_text: Tommy's feels like two mismatched businesses that happen to share a common seating area. The mashup? Its really pretty cool.   Along the left you've got a bar with cocktails and a full page beer menu, manned by smiley, long-haired beer nerds. ( The term "Beer nerd" is not only a badge of honour, but a term of endearment.) These bros know their brews and they happy to chat with you about their favourite pint.  Along the right side is a Seinfeld Soup Nazi style deli. Be ready to order when you get to the til and don't ask questions. The food looks tasty and the buffalo stew was darn good. Not fall over in ecstasy delicious, but it's some quality comfort food for a pretty decent price.   Once you've got your mismatch of geeky craft beer and angry roast beef, grab a seat in the middle at one of the red and white diner cafeteria tables and enjoy while taking in the kitschy wonderland!  They have table service, but don't count on it. We between the two of us, we ordered one of six drinks from the server. I think trying to do the service thing but not coming through with it to the extent that it should be isn't that awesome of an idea, but you don't really need servers here anyway. Don't expect service and you'll probably like it.

XmEywucVDyUP9VJ4SXGjzw.review_text: Sometimes I just want an inexpensive meal; a meal without the promise of pretensions or high price.  Enter Tommy's.  Now mind you, to state that the place is unadorned is understatement.  It is dark, foreboding, and it seemed to me grim.   If you tend towards depression medicate yourself before entry.  But the food is actually quite good given the price and surroundings.  I had a brisket sandwich served on a roll.  The meat was lean and the roll fresh.  One taste of the too sweet aus jus served beside the sandwich convinced me to simply ignore this garnishment.  A tomato\onion salad was also inexpensive and tasted of tomatoes and onions.  At Tommy's you can get in, get a fair meal, and get out with something left in your wallet.  Enough said.

VMaBiUfeCz65dkjLPLkzPQ.review_text: The only reason I'm rating this place at 4 stars is because they only accept cash (there IS an ATM inside, though). I was there on the recommendation of a few people I met in San Fran. There was about 20 minutes before my airport shuttle came to pick me up and I felt like I needed a drink because my trip was less than amazing, all in all, so I thought.. why not? The rum punch was so good and really pretty and the people were nice. I'd love to go back to San Fran and spend more time there.. it seems awesome!

B4cJvWuf59j7XlTdexnVZw.review_text: I need to upgrade these guys based on their excellent pastrami sandwich.  It's the perfect stop to go along with a matinee at the AMC across the street.  Some of the tastiest pastrami I have ever had sliced fresh and hot and the sour dough roll was great and portion excellent.  No condiments, though really didn't need any, excellent some lettuce might have been nice.  You won't need anything to go with this except maybe a rare beer, though I was not in the mood this time for one.  $6.13

WYCv0Q-QIKCSIo8IqOLOfw.review_text: We were hearing rave reviews about this place and how it made it on Food Network, etc.. So we had to try it. Walking into the place, the whiff of the BBQ makes you drool and weak in the knees. Then you look around and there's menus everywhere. It's a bit confusing, but once you locate the options you want to try, you point and order what you want. We started with the dinner plate with pastrami, mashed potatoes and a tossed green salad with ranch dressing. They didn't drench the salad with dressing, which was a good thing. Also ordered an apple cobbler.  Paid for everything before we sat down at a table and a waitress came by to take orders for drinks. She quickly drops off the bill and drinks. Any money left with the tab is for the waitress and money on the table is for the busboy. Hm, interesting.. So we proceeded to eat and it seemed as if the pastrami reminded me of honey roasted ham.. Everything else was ok. Nothing to really rave about. Wished they would have warmed up the apple cobbler.. I guess the best thing from dinner for me were the complimentary pickles.

9WzUerODzyYUkQO0u3Nyjg.review_text: A local joint, and the interior definitely looks like it's a place for locals' go to diner.    Sure, they do give a good portion of meat, along with a side salad and mashed potatoes/rice for a $10 meal. Shared a BBQ brisket dish with someone else, and I must admit, their BBQ sauce was really light and good.  I'm not usually a BBQ sauce fan, but I liked theirs.   Meat wasn't the best, atmosphere wasn't the best, and their free water was cloudy and I barely wanted to drink out of the cup.  They do have free pickles, though!  I do want to go back one day to try their corned beef.

002slNgnEtAvsNYFLw7rGA.review_text: what the hell?
