I am shocked to see this place is "whats hot" on yelp.    My friend, who is a cheap bastard, brought me here promising some "cheap grub."  I hate both of those words when they describe food, but I indulged him.  History be damned, this place is gross.  And its not even cool in an ironic way.  Like everything on Van Ness, Its just wierd and depressing.    No level of cheapness can compensate for the high-school-cafeteria-quality food.  4 stars is just a bizarre score for Tommy's Joynt - the food was worse than forgettable, it was unforgettably nauseating.  grown ass people should not be eating in a place like this.  Go here if you don't care about food quality, like tourist traps, and think being surrounded by bums and roughnecks is a great way to spend a night on the town.

1VVrwFszsFOJWEfPi5WzLA.review_text: I drove past this place hundreds of times before coming in.   Turkey dinner, extra gravy.    So delicious, so filling, so inexpensive.  Cash only though, and what's with the weird drink routine where you have to order and pay for drinks separately from the waitress?     Still, I will continue the late night visits to you, Tommy.

fhc5jBD3afBPrVR3oYzysw.review_text: Cheap food that is DELICIOUS! If you are watching your waistline, please don't bother taking a step into this place. If you are a vegetarian then look elsewhere. It is what it is, and that is a chill, somewhat hole-in-the-wall place that serves honest comfort food and lots of it.  After hearing the hype, (and some negative critiques), I had to give Tommy's a shot whilst going on a gastronomic tour of SF. Had the BBQ beef sandwich with a side of mashed potatoes and the the stuffing. Let's ust say that the the sandwich was reaaaaaally delectable with it's tender juicy cuts of meat, and the BBQ sauce that comes with it. It's simply to die for!   Now the stuffing- never have I had stuffing with bits of roasted beef in it, until coming to this place. The roasted pieces of beef just adds this uncanny, albeit insanely mouthwatering punch, to the the stuffing! Best I've ever had!  Beer selection? They have a slap-to-your-face unbelievable selection of beers from all over the world! I almost had an aneurysm trying to make a choice! Stellar!  Please stop by Tommy's Joynt if you want a delicious gut-busting meal that will send you to the moon! Health freaks and herbivores need not apply!

5GpOt6sv-fGZkNKxJFhVow.review_text: O.K....I am pretty careful about star-inflation. I try not to give everything a five star just because I like it. I try to use some objective scale. However, it should be known that I give things five stars for what the are. Five stars for Tommy's should not imply that Tommy's is as good as Woodward's Garden. Tommy's gets five stars for being great at what it is. Tommy's is an original, Tommy's is delicious, serving savory old school roasted favorites, served by guys who know what they're doing, along side amazing beers and in a cool atmosphere.   Does your girlfriend want to be taken to Tommy's at 8 on Saturday night? Probably not. Go to Tommy's on a cold, overcast Sunday afternoon for some roasted turkey or meatball sub. Go to Tommy's at 1 a.m. after boozing on Polk Street for $3.50 sausage sammiches. Take your new-food-phobic parents from out of town there when they've had enough of Michael Mina and Thai and Sushi and Himalayan.  Go there alone with a book when you just need a good, hearty meal for cheap.

779Cuiqh13DeQAxzQObKIw.review_text: It seems like Tommys Joint always calls for me on the worse days. Was the weather nice yesterday: Nope. Was work less hectic: Nope. Did I work out yesterday: Not at all. Somehow, someway Tommys Joint made my not-so-great day turn into a great night out with my wife. It was supposed to be an EAT PRAY LOVE kinda night...fellas...nah mean right? Well, my wife suggested Tommys Joint so we went. I had the Meatball "OPEN FACE" sandwich...or as I like to call it "TEARS OF A VIRGIN ANGEL" and it was to die for. The meatballs were so full of flavor that it would make Stephen Hawking jump out of his wheelchair and start doing the jerk....or the robocop...or the electric slide....you pick, I really dont care. They were huge and thats not all. The cook showers the bread with a marinara sauce...yummy. I swear he poured the sauce ever so slowly just to make my mouth water. Bastard. The sandwich does not come with a side but you can get anything from Mashers, salads, beans, cole slaw and many other side plates. They have a designated food court downstairs and upstairs. We sat upstairs since the lower lever was full. The lower level has the main bar and I am talking about a man's man bar. They have every beer known to man plus any hard alcohol your liver is trying to avoid. I am true gentleman so I order the Strawberry Daiquiri....I said gentleman so of course I asked for the little umbrella.   After my 9th drink, I either had too much to drink or someone let me use their time travel machine cause I do not remember how I got home. I do remember eating my entire plate and talking about how great the food was. I think I was screaming about higher taxes and it led to a screaming match about animal cruelty between me and a blind patron . I did not know that was his dog I swear. I hate when they smell your junk so I kicked his dog..what ever. I will never kick another Chihuahua ever again. Fucken dog flew across the restaurant. Sorry Mr. Snuggleswerth :(  If you want a great diner with an old SF atmosphere, you have found the place. The restaurant has history, its COD only, the drinks are great, the food is hearty and the people are always warm. You will not be disappointed.

1Qca4FtV1tUp-WZz9APgzA.review_text: Another for my DDD list. I happen to be one of the few native San Franciscans that still inhabits the city,  We are a dying breed.  So is Tommy's Joynt and that might not be a bad thing.  I have gone here since I was a kid.  The mural painted outside on the wall outside is as much a part of the cities history as the Golden Gate Bridge, Joe Lee Gym, Coit Tower, and Gavin Newsome Academic Intermediate School.  My mother took me here when I was a kid and a can't remember what I ordered.  I just knew that I finally got to go inside the restaurant with the funky psychedelic painting on the outside.  I also went here when I finally turned 21 years of age.  It was a place where I could go purchase cheap food and adult beverages.  Adult Beverages!  Fuck Yeah  But that was many moons ago and I am I much older gentlemen now.  I brought a friend after we watched it on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives.  Our thoughts-FILTHY.  Our table was dirty and every knick-knack around our booth was caked in dust, like it hadn't been cleaned since Moscone was shot.  (Ohh, Dan how could you?)  The food was nothing to write home about and I was driving, so could not partake in an adult beverage.  I have come to this conclusion.  And that is that I have outgrown Tommy's Joynt. It was fascinating when I was a kid, affordable and  glamorous when I was a young man,  But at my age and when in the heart of the city, I will choose a cleaner more refined establishment.

6bKLKHCZd4R8VG-WS961QQ.review_text: It's not a trip into the City without a stop at Tommy's Joynt.  This place is truly an icon.  I was introduced to this place over 20 years ago and have made it my mission to stop in here on every visit I make into S.F. I don't know what they put into the BBQ sauce (and believe me...I asked and they wouldn't share the recipe), but it is JAMMIN'!!! Tommy's is by far my favorite hofbrau and damned pretty much the top of my list for good, cheap eats.

sRg37JrnIiDxmyAZs9HjGg.review_text: I eat here once in a while and it's good every time but that will depend on what you order (stay away from the lasagna).

WDyILww9HxfTwq5zKOGymw.review_text: I can't believe I've never reviewed Tommys Joynt!!  I had my wedding rehearsal dinner here, for pete's sake!!!  I have only good things to say about this restaurant, because it's unpretentious, consistently tasty, and the people who own and work here are good people.  Not only did I have my wedding rehearsal dinner here (which is a GREAT idea if you're on a budget, need a large, private back room for a party, and want to make sure that there are lots of delicious-yet-uncomplicated culinary options for everyone to eat), but several of my birthday parties, several for my husband, my friends, etc.!!  This is a wonderful, affordable, home-y meeting place where the portions are huge, the food is simple and delicious, and the prices are ridiculously low.    If you are looking for foodie-appropriate rations, this is not your joynt.  Nor is it the right place to look for a high-brow crowd or fancy decor.  It's an old-school cafeteria-style restaurant/bar that slices your meat, piles it high on your plate with mashed potatoes, slathers it with gravy, tosses on a few veggies for a nice touch, offers you a choice of side salads, gives you a dinner roll with butter, and sends you on your merry way into a noisy, usually-packed diningroom that is full of average-joes eating, talking, watching "the game" on one of the many tv's, and tossing back a few cold ones while laughing with friends.  It's unpretentious, easy, and relaxing.  It's also a great place to hit before or after a movie at the AMC across the street.    A few things to note:  this is not a great place for WHEELCHAIRS.   While the front door IS accessible, the bathroom may not be the easiest to get to through the packed diningroom.  The back diningrooms are accessible via a side door, so that IS an option.  The owner and her family will bend over backwards trying to make it all work for you.  That's how they are.  But it still isn't the easiest.  However, if you aren't planning to use the bathroom or have a smaller chair it IS do-able and worth it.  My two favorite things on the menu?  The corned beef (*DROOL*) and the buffalo chili!  The latter is hearty, meaty (made with buffalo, so healthier than regular chili), a little spicy, and served over rice...delish!!    If you're having a special ocassion here (birthday party?), they won't charge you a cake fee.  And they'll bring you plenty of plates, forks, and a knife with which to cut your cake.  That's just how they are...super-nice, helpful, and not trying to nickel and dime you!!  I have a feeling that good attitude is a big part of why they've stayed in business for so long in a city that is increasingly inhabited by food snobs (myself included!).  Wow, just talking about Tommy's makes me hungry....!!!!

oh2J59Y1sVdmySZ_Q93ebQ.review_text: Ah, good-ole Tommy's.     This is an American Cafeteria Style restaurant.  If you really want to experience good Cafeteria/Hof-brau food then i would point you in the direction of Harry's Hof-brau.  If you want a decent meal with great atmosphere and colorful locals then you've stopped in the right place.  Decent turkey dinner with stuffing and gravy Corn-beef here is pretty good roast-beef dinner is always good All their dishes go well with a beer haha  American Cafeteria is about comfort food.  You come in you enjoy a hot hearty meal and you have good conversations with the locals. Tommy's is an SF staple, don't be surprised if there's a line by the door.  *For those truly interested in a great Hof-brau see my Harry's review, you won't regret it =)

QqJrMBOjWJeaDjUC7K2X_Q.review_text: This place u HAVE to go to. This isn't an option, its a wonderful opportunity to treat your belly to good homemade food.

L9XZe2Bx6TzqrUp2YbFOLQ.review_text: I was really excited to finally be able to stop in. I was in for a surprise when it was a hot plate counter type, I was expecting a sit down order out the menu type place.   I got their Sunday special which was the beef burgundy. The flavor was all there, BUT the meat was dry and kinda tough. I wish it would have melted in my mouth in any sort of way. It came with a bed of rice and a roll.   We also tried their buffalo chili, which was pretty darn good considering we love our chili with raw onions and cheese on top! This one didn't have any of that, but came out tasting great. Can't say there was a big flavor different with the meat. This also came with a roll.   Maybe we need to try some other things like their sandwich?   Overall, we got our food instantly and service wasn't too bad, I even asked for more pickles since they had a pickle bucket out that didn't have any left, not so bad. CASH only, they do have an ATM machine there if needed.

0ewvp9BUbNq1lqdWeTnLHw.review_text: Okay, I just ate here and I feel like I have a ton of bricks in my stomach. My walking buddy suggested this place since, it was cheap and good. I guess she hasn't eaten here in a very very long time, because I was not impress with the food. It was dry and tasteless. Had to put hot sauce to get more flavor out of the corned beef, and added more salt and pepper into the mashed potatoes and tomato salad.  The environment reminded me a dive bar slash hole in the wall restaurant with a Friday's feel to it, with all the memorabilia they placed on the wall. With the cafeteria style in getting your food and watching the servers serve your choice of slivers of meat felt like flashback to my elementary days, when the lunch lady would say, "What ya want to eat?" Just thinking about it gives me the willies. So I guess it's a fair trade. Cheap food + cheap prices= diarrhea!!!  It's like the saying, you get what you pay for.

vMPq0qluhIAWtv9p38Mouw.review_text: Wow the corned beef and cabbage meal was delicious.  Moist flavorful juicy meat with lots of trimmings. As if that weren't enough for under $10 they also include a side of sourdough bun. Service is hard working and polite, they actually greet you with a smile as they are piling on the food and even stop from their busy work for a second to thank you for tipping in the little plastic cup. It's cash only and line was out the door but it was quick.

-K2Tcgh2EKX6e6HqqIrBIQ.review_text: Tommy's Joynt delivers in spades. Specifically, a perfectly cooked turkey for our office pot-luck.  We were trying to figure out where to get a decent turkey, and I suggested Tommy's.  So glad I did!  The turkey was large and absolutely perfectly cooked. No dry turkey meat here!  And the bonus part was that they had cut the meat off the bone and chopped it up for us, which made it much easier for a horde of office dwellers to get that perfect piece of light or dark meat that they desired.  The quarts of turkey gravy that accompanied the turkey were rich and savory.  Lucky me got to take home the drumsticks, wings and a ton of meat.  Soup galore!  Love you now and always, Tommy's Joynt.

tOA_jikp_YaRZVV4RM1Kbg.review_text: Really exceptional value on the BBQ turkey. That had to be the best cost per pound meal I've had in the city. Cheap, large portions, cool atmosphere, and REALLY good food.

sCxXYROTaP3NnCcxiD-rnw.review_text: Oh my goodness I can't believe I've gone thing long without eating here. I love pastrami sandwiches and at Tommy's Joynt, they have the juiciest, freshest, tastiest pastrami!! Decently priced and SO TENDER! They won the 5 star award when I saw little containers for hot mustard on the table. I'm a mustard girl and that hot mustard melted my heart! :D  I can't wait to go back to Tommy's the next time in San Fran. The service there was great too. They even asked me to buy another one after I gobbled down my sandwich!   IN MY DEFENSE: the white bread is smaller than the other ones!! hahaha Definitely give this place a try :)

VKZLyatJIBluTouWvZghAw.review_text: After living on Geary, a few blocks away, I finally decided to go to Tommy's Joynt. The idea of a place that served mostly meat that wasn't a steakhouse kinda scared me. But I was curious about eating some buffalo meat. So my excuse was that my brother was visiting SF and that we needed to try and eat some place new.   We decided what we wanted to order and waited a while for the guy to actually ask me what I wanted. It was all about the buffalo stew sandwich for me while my brother got the turkey and a side of mashed potatoes to share. I carried the tray to a small table near the back and after ordering our drinks, dug in. I had to eat the sandwich with a fork and knife. Now that I think about it, a stew sandwhich is about the sloppiest thing you could ever eat. But it was damn good. I tasted some of the turkey which was also really good, cut straight from the bird and not some crappy cold cuts. The mashed potatoes were all right.  This place has its charm and the food is pretty good if all you wanna' eat is MEAT. It gets pretty crowded in there and I had like three people shove their rude ass ways in the door, hitting me without so much as an "excuse me". The waitress only checked on our table twice, once to get our drink orders and once to give us our drinks.   This is a place you need to eat at least once. Also... Metallica used to hang out here.

Is87yy5GzWWr3FjJvm7MTQ.review_text: If you've seen Guy Fieri's Triple D episode of this restaurant, it exceeds everything that was said. the food is amazing and the atmosphere is wonderful. This Hauf Brau style eatery and bar invites you in with the  smells of delicious pastrami, lasagna, chili, lamb stew, and more. they home cook everything on site and the service is great. there's an extensive bar on the one side that serves more beer than you can imagine (i have yet to sample the many flavours).   my favourite dish here is the Pastrami sandwich, but next time i go i plan on trying either the salmon or the lamb shank. I'm never disappointed when i go here and has become a tradition to come here after seeing a show in or near The City. it's the best pick-me-up you could ever ask for!

t1rXXdLW3Rkw2QRNWjrLnQ.review_text: Walked into Tommy's Joynt this afternoon after a visit to a shop nearby. This, being the first time after roughly nine months of cruising by the establishment on Van Ness, was ready to reap my expectations at their most fantasmic glory. Tommy's was everything I was hoping for and everything I've been told it was. A meat lovers paradise. Beef, pork, poultry, and lamb rule the focus of the down home, comfort aligned menu.   We slipped in the door and were lucky enough to be faced with an empty serving station. Nobody standing there to block our view of the totally attractive and not to mention juicy looking "rounds" of meat. We're talking meat here folks. Not some sissy serving of baby pigeon sauteed al dente in a bed of virgin rose petals, but stick to your ribs, no none sense eats.   After perusing the selections I chose the Corned Beef and Cabbage and my wife chose the BBQ'd Turkey. Both servings were very very large. The Corned Beef was awesome however the steamed cabbage was ok but I've had better. In fact, the meal would of been perfect if they could just cook the cabbage with a little southern flair.   Wash your food down with something from their well stocked bar and you will agree you made the right choice in stopping by Tommy's Joynt. While you're sitting there munching down on this most enjoyable meal look around. Take in the ambiance of Tommy's place. It is truly unique and needs some time from you so you can take in the entire collections of stuff they accumulated over the years. Hell, I'm going to bring something from home and give it to them just so I can have a piece of me in Tommy's.   Try Tommy's out folks, you will not be disappointed.   Cptsparkle

LSe5rhvilHa_1iWmeO1y_A.review_text: Price wasn't bad. Roast beef left lots to be desired. Packaging was sloppy as well. I had to shampoo salad dressing from my car since it leaked from the container into the bag and all over my carpet.

lBrID-N2JY_BWimt6e9GFw.review_text: -1 star for parking (If your driving, good luck. I would suggest to walk if possible.)  Different choices of meat to meat any persons craving. I had the pastrami sandwich, I would definitely recommend this to order (on your choice of bread of course). This place is definitely a joynt alright, good place to hang out, it reminds me of a New York style deli with a bar twist. They slice up your meat & place it directly on your plate.

4LMErvQTSEx6pXVAXAJaQw.review_text: Me and the Girlfriend showed up early to the trivia hour at nearby bar.  Not having eaten or encountering any of our friends we decided to get some food.  We saw Mel's, and was about to enter when I recalled that I wasn't terribly impressed with their downtown location. So no.  At that moment, I smelled.... barbecue sauce.... and it was good.  I followed my nose and ended up at Tommy's Joynt.  The nose never disappoints.  If you don't like meat, don't bother coming.  This place is for meat eaters.  Had both the beef burgundy and beef brisket.  The barbecue sauce looks like au jus or gravy but it is unmistakably barbecue sauce.  In both dishes the meat was tender and flavorful.  The salads and sides held up their own and you must try the hot mustard.

9bxdPvAhP6cuipD5s2UnCg.review_text: I had long wanted to come here after seeing this place on DDD and last week, after taking my daughter to an audition at what is soon to be her high school, I fished my wish.  I typically like Hofbrau type of fare and had high hopes for this place, but alas, my hopes were a little squashed as soon as I walked in to this dark and dreary and dirty looking establishment. I quickly stuffed my Jewish American Princess hat in my purse and ponied up to order food. I was glad I had brought a little cash with me as I didn't realize it was a cash only establishment that was very bar heavy and full of a different sort of mix of people doing the evening drink and cheap food thing.   I ordered the turkey leg dinner and it came with mashed potatoes, stuffing and gravy and a roll. The daughter had a brisket dinner with green beans, mashed potatoes and a roll. The mashed potatoes tasted like the boxed kind, the stuffing was meh, the turkey leg tasted like it had been made and reheated and well, I didn't like my meal much. The daughter's on the other hand was great-brisket that was moist and tender and seriously delicious. I would have this again.  All in all, this place was much more of a dive and I won't hurry to come back but glad I tried it.

zaBX3i2WgmixzgQBwA33GA.review_text: Good place to get a lot of food for next to nothing prices. They serve up decent to good American food. Everything from brisket to pastrami to turkey to buffalo. They run the gamut on their meats. If you are tired of eating at your local diner and or Mel's, give this place a try for some variety.

dqip0GkHCZPU3GvwwlbSXg.review_text: Cozy decor and a capable, friendly waitress made for a reasonably enjoyable meal, but $11 for stew? No. Sorry, it was just ok. Don't expect more that a quick, decent meal of good size and efficient service.

p6ucyVInOdbf1-jlwz1Vcg.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is one of those places you regret eating at as you walk out after lunch. The prices are good. The set up is kind of fun. All these cooking meats and sauces right there in front of you being served up fresh. Then you get your food, sit down, and realize... "What the F$#@! did I just order?" Happens to me every time I eat here.  First time was a Barbecue Turkey Sandwich - a bunch of fatty and jointy pieces of leftover reject turkey slopped on my plate in a pool of barbecue flavored gravy all atop a piece of what used to be bread. I tried to eat it, I really did. But I just gave up and chopped it up to having made the wrong choice that day.  The second time I went here I had a sliced turkey sandwich and a side of cucumber salad. Seriously, this was just a slice of turkey on a piece of dry bread and the cucumber salad was god only knows how old. The only condiment was a bunch of mustard at the table. It was so DRY!!  For my money, I would rather have a little flavor with my meal and not risk this place again. It's just not for me.

F9vGOVTz2td_SPveHxBH7A.review_text: Great spot for hand carved sandwiches - best pastrami sandwiches I've had here in the Bay.  A little different than other pastrami sandwiches I've had as they're sliced thicker by hand (I'm used to the thinly sliced pastrami at The Hat in LA.)  They have horseradish, hot mustard, and mild mustard at the table for you.  Free pickles and a full bar - what more can you ask for?  I've had the roast beef sandwich here before too as well as the buffalo chili which were both solid as well.  I'll have to try their daily specials sometime.  Cash only, order food at the front, then drinks at the bar or from wait staff.  Easy enough for me.

KFaUuuvfw-6rAbTzuYwU0g.review_text: 3.5 decently priced american food served cafeteria style  they have dinner plates  featuring  5 different kinds of meat to choose from. I would suggest the pastrami as it was quite juicy and sliced thinly as you ordered. The sides were mediocre. They also sell sandwiches and pasta.  If i was in the neighborhood i would stop by again for lunch.   they only accept cash but do have an atm machine inside the restaurant. parking can be a hassle also.

KB6gQqzPVtHBcD40wf09pg.review_text: Tommy's is one of the main reasons I go to the movie theater on Van Ness. It's simple food, you could make it at home if you're committed enough, but it is darn tootin' good stuff.   I prefer their corned beef sandwiches with a side of yellow mustard (I like to sneak them into the movie theater, don't tell anyone!), sometimes I switch it up and get the pastrami, but I think the corned beef, tried and true, is just better. The pastrami is soft and too fleshy, but still good flavor and I would absolutely eat it if you twisted my arm, I just think it's been sitting too long in it's drippings and starts to get soggy. I have gotten the dinner plate a couple times but the bread that the sandwiches are presented in is really good, soft and warm and chewy, delish! Also it's dirt cheap.  It has a divey feeling and the painted wall outside boasts "Hot Corned Beef, Cocktails", which I find funny because I have the maturity level of a 12 year old boy. I'm very endeared to the place and all the knick knacks on the walls and ceiling; reminds me of my parent's house.

IhKg06lw4AU64xojzfbQEg.review_text: This place is AMAZING. This is probably one of my favorite restaurants ever! I always get the same thing, the BBQ Beef Sandwich. What makes this sandwich so good is the BBQ sauce, it is outta this world. I've never had a better BBQ sauce. Every time I go here, I sweet talk one of the ladies into putting some into a plastic container to take home haha its soooo bomb.

vpb6VRi7FLqnJubLJDsGIQ.review_text: The first of my many San Fran trip reviews.    First of all, I want to note that I noticed a few 2-3 stars reviews based on atmosphere.  Its a dive bar!  They advertise as a dive bar.  If you go to Per Se and say they are expensive, that doesn't make sense.  You know they are going to be expensive.  It can be expensive based on quality, but don't expect to pay less.  Just like Tommy's Joynt is a dive bar.  Don't go expecting a non-dive bar experience.   They have a shitload of beers.  They DO have free pickles.  You wait in line and serve yourself food, while the waitress brings you drinks.  And its bigger than it looks at first sight.  I love this place.   For food I had the pastrami sandwich.  WAS DELICIOUS!!  I LOVED EVERY BITE!!    For beer I asked the waitress for her favorite local beer in a pitcher and it was delicious!    Total bill for 4 people was under $50 and that includes a round of jack and cokes, a pitcher of beer, and 3 full meals.  WTF else do you want!    Side note: Very cool car store located down the street...has my future Ferrari in the window.

OfRDP6VZAMaGLw93TaUYJw.review_text: Went to a spirit expedition and the tour guide suggested Tommy's.  Tommy's is a pretty cool place to eat and drink.  The food is very affordable especially for the portion they give you.  The foods not amazing, but it's pretty good.    One part of Tommy's is a bar and the other side is a cafeteria like restaurant.  They have a bunch of tables open to sit at, that's always a plus.    This place is definitely cool spot to hang out, drink, and eat late night.  The only thing that sucks about Tommy's is the parking.  Street parking blah...

i8Zuls7zrKKdi7yPhXqAbQ.review_text: Date of visit 01/17/2011   I decided to try out Tommy's Joynt after seeing it on "Triple D". I went with some friends and I was very excited to go. The place is easy to find, it is a bit small inside, but there seemed to be plenty of seating to handle the flow of the business that was in there that day.   I ordered a pastrami on rye and it was pretty good. The pastrami was moist and the rye was soft. Overall a good sandwich, I would not rate it excellent because I have had a better pastrami on rye, but it was good and I would eat one from there again. Now being with a group of people you have to sample what everyone else got, right? So I will say the bbq beef sandwich was very good and part of me wished I had got that one instead. The ham was excellent, but the turkey...are you ready? The turkey was dry, not like dry, but like dry as a desert. I was pretty disappointed with the turkey and I wasn't the one who ordered it and had to deal with it. Perhaps they were having an off day.   This place is no frills, no fuss just a casual corner restaurant in San Francisco off the path of the tourists. I enjoyed being there and checking the place out. The staff was friendly, the service was good and the place was fun. I wouldn't go out of my way to visit there again, but if I found myself in the neighborhood I would stop for the bbq beef sandwich.

cHiKdJkqz6HI0cuVxtW1dQ.review_text: This was recommended by a long-time resident of SF who was probably a teenager when this place opened in 1947.  He said it's a classic and I can see why.  Mmm..the pastrami really hit the spot after a fun night out with friends.  It's carved for you at the counter and the slices are thick and not too salty.  We had a side of potato salad that was very traditional complete with huge chunks of potato and sprinkled with dill.  It's cozy inside and everyone is there for a good warm meal and maybe a beer too.  The lady next to us had an open-faced turkey sandwich that also looked really tasty.  I'm gonna have to go back for that.

8vySzOVI4Qc5n2bCmmIeHw.review_text: Exactly what I imagined as far as the quality of the food. Stopped in after a long day. Asked for "double meat" and ended up with double everything and double charge. They even gave me two biscuits (which I didn't touch because you could probably break a window with one). The beef brisket and mash potatoes were great though. Ill be back (hold the biscuits)!

uyvMbeyEJoou8S_nzAzwrQ.review_text: This place is awesome...history galore and good eats. They have been serving buffalo before it was trendy to serve. I remember as a kid I used to think that they got it from Golden Gate Park... Anyhow brisket is good ...Turkey Leg, if you like Turkey Legs are phenominal... Great selection of beers. Pre theater stop is a must

KcEfVfc5nTPBDonYjJ3wOw.review_text: This. Place. Is. Awesome.  You get huge portions for really cheap! I went for the turkey leg (which is gargantuan). All for myself to eat!  Place is kind of "..." because I feel a bit out of place here, but like I said huge portions for cheap prices!

AgvjzJ7iNd3XysmRxe3u3Q.review_text: I admit... I have not tried a whole lot of hof-brau places before. But, I was brought up in the San Francisco Public School System, so I do know a thing or two about cafeteria food.  Tater tots, square pizza slices, and chocolate milk... that's what I'm talking about!! Okay, Tommy's Joynt might not have that on their menu. Instead they offer lamb shanks and buffalo stew among others.  This is a Manly Man spot. Just check out their website. If you want food fast, this is the place to go. If you want a fork, you better go get one yourself. If you want gourmet... go take a hike Frenchie!!   The food is no frills. I tried the buffalo stew and it was pretty good, tangy, but unfortunately, the meat was not gamey. I tried my buddy's lamb shanks. That was no frills as well with the lack of herbs on the shanks.  A major surprise was the Manhattan I ordered. This was one of the best I have ever tried. It had a great balance of bitters, alcohol, and sweetness for a delightful price of $5.50.  Yes, the prices at Tommy's Joynt is nice for the style of food that they offer. The food is not fancy, but pretty good on the hof-brau scale. So, I offer four Manly Man stars to Tommy's.

7DNCMwpfwwwim34SWV9q1g.review_text: My friends and I were starving on a Sunday and just wanted to be fed. We walked over to Brenda's Soul Food and the line was ridiculous. We ventured back toward the direction of our hotel and saw Tommy's Joynt from across the street. We decided to get in and were a little confused at the whole ordering process at first, but we got it down. You order kind of like cafeteria style, then you pay and find a table. Oh, we came on a Sunday and came a little past 12:30, and there was no wait in line and plenty of seating available. Everyone in our group ordered the BBQ Brisket sandwich on a sourdough roll with different sides. I got the side salad with thousand island dressing. The sandwich came with a little cup of sauce. SO GOOD. The meat was so tender and there was so much of it packed into the bread. I was already sold at the sandwich, but then I had to go and see a little picture of this round man with spicy white hair.   For those who know me, I'm a HUGE Triple D (Diners, Drive Ins & Dives) fan. I didn't realize Tommy's Joynt was featured on Triple D until I was about 3/4 through my sandwich. SOLD. SOLD. SOLD. Definitely coming back here again if I get the chance.

8U8Q2uF7-Pk2mWZTL1vEBg.review_text: How did I live in SF for so many years and never discover this place? Our recent visit back to the city brought us to this place two nights in a row. The food is sooooo good. The price is soooooo good. Portions are huge, atmosphere is casual and fun. The first night we had turkey enchiladas - to die for. Second night we had turkey joes - so good... and  for $4!!  We couldn't even finish it, but we tried.  If you haven't been... you must go here. They only take cash though... so make sure you hit the ATM before you go.

RSrX6J144WaXDhuasMMIRg.review_text: this place is the jam! best deli/sandwhich place i have ever been to and Ive been to quite a few. The atmosphere is not what you would think if you see the bright colored circus paintings outside; a bunch of wood tables in a dark cabin like room with a huge bar off to the side with many decorative signs with catch phrases.   I ordered the pastrami / corned beef sandwhich and it was awesome; the meat is cut right in front of you and you can request end cuts of the meat too which i particularly like; the pastrami is deli style so dont expect a big greasy slop of meat strings but rather cuts like roast. You can mix and match any of the meats to make your own sandwhich. For the price it is well worth it, everything is a la carte except for the dinner specials. For a side i ordered the baked macaroni and cheese which was super heavy but delicious. I would definitely recommend this place to all the deli lovers out there who are looking for a quick bite to eat. Be sure to grab one of the many international beers they have available or the rum punch!

-v_Y8Rnh6S1lLdfAKhZ4yQ.review_text: One of my favorite foods is pickles, so the fact that they have a huge vat of "all-you-can-eat" pickles is a HUGE plus! MMMM :)  Last night was my first time at Tommy's Joynt. I had had a very light lunch that day so I wanted something filling for dinner and therefore, a friend suggested this joynt. I ordered the corned beef and it was fairly tasty. I was bummed I didn't notice the horseradish sauce on the table until I was 95% done with my meal. For the dinner sides, I chose mashed potatoes (with gravy) and the coleslaw. I highly recommend NOT getting the mashed potatoes since they are box-made, which was a big disappointment. The coleslaw, on the other hand, was light yet flavorful and I definitely recommend it if you are a coleslaw fan.  My friend got the BBQ brisket and I tried a few bites of it and will definitely come back to order that dinner. I also tried the meatball sub from a friend and was not impressed. A mixed experience but HUGE portions for an affordable price. I'll be back!

65zrjZO0ghIIKIloGdw5WQ.review_text: I must say it's a perfect place to be when your craving some comfort food.   Needless to say the price of the food isn't going to leave you broke as you walk out the door either.   If I lived close by to Tommy's Joynt I think I'll probably be in there for both lunch and dinner.

nO89B8rJDUaHSzN4VlTRvQ.review_text: Brisket is so tender you don't even need a knife! Definitely a must whenever you go to the city. Awesome drink selection as well!!

tOniwJPtC1kmrgYfzOrojw.review_text: The PASTRAMI!    The pastrami here, ALMOST, almost is as good as Katz's in NYC.  But, it's also half the costs of Katz and about 2300 miles closer so its a darn good alternative.  At $6, you can get any of their sandwiches, I think you would not be disappointed by the pastrami!  After all, according to the word of George Costanza, it is the most sensual of all the smoked meats!  The pastrami is so juicy and has this awesome blackened crust that is just beautiful and oh so tasty!  It even comes with a little dish of jus to dip in, but you don't need it the pastrami stands on its own.  I also got the clam chowder, which considering its San Fran, better be a good clam chowder.  It didn't disappoint, it was some good chowder.  I think the funniest thing on the menu is the turkey leg.  Basically a dinner plate with a large turkey leg as the protein.  It's just a really big turkey leg, like medieval times.  Also has a full bar available for all your alcohol and non-alcohol needs.  It's a small place with an airport type line to get to the counter to order your food, but it moves fast as the guys behind the counter are good at what they do.  But if it's real crowded, seating could be tough, but you can also sit at the bar to eat.  I think there was a sign that said cash only, so plan accordingly.

dSj_Q7vt6h9V4Oc7r4SS0g.review_text: This is a pretty interesting place. I've been here twice. It's a cafeteria inside a hole in the wall bar. You stand in line for food but once you sit down there is table service for your drinks.  The prices are reasonable.  Few places have the character and history as Tommy's.  This place has been around for a long time, maybe as long as mining days. The exterior doesn't look great from the outside but the appearance can be deceiving. This place is across from  the AMC theater. Everytime I go to the AMC for a movie, I would go here to eat.  During the weekends, this place is open late. You can see people waiting in a long line even outside the store.  This place reminds of Hof Brau (the places that serve carved meats inside the food court at the local malls).

sTaqwyQFWfzWZCyZC-MO6g.review_text: Last night was my first time eating here and Im so sad I didn't know of this place sooner.This place is awesome. Great portions, cheap prices, fast service, casual atmosphere. We had 3 kids. Ages 2, 4, and 7. Kids were able to divide a huge dish of Spaghetti! I had the Brisket, super yummy. I'm definitely coming back!

YbVTtlUDLtocDB4Z-DCVhw.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is very good at what it does, which is serve big hunks of MEAT on huge plates for not a lot of money.  I had the BBQ brisket dinner; next time I'll skip the sauce, since it was way too sweet.  Also, if you're an expat longing for a taste of the shitty beer of your homeland, this is the place to go.  When you're just itching for a Mythos or Harp, their international beer selection delivers.

Oi5ITZhtmM1CeZHCNThIEQ.review_text: I thought I was being clever by going to Tommy's Joynt on Thanksgiving.  I thought - hey!  nobody will be there because it's Thanksgiving and everyone is having dinner with their families!  Boy - I was wrong!  We arrived at 7pm and there was a line going all the way through the restaurant, out the back door.  Woah!!  So we left and returned at around 9pm - much better - the wait was only 20 mins!  Thanksgiving dinner included turkey, mashed potatoes, previously-frozen peas/carrots, iceburg lettuce salad and choice of hot tea or coffee.  Blah.  Can I just get a soda?  Nope.  They don't have soda.  Can I get another type of vegetable?  Nope.  There are no options - just take it or leave it.  Sad face.  Anyway, the turkey was good - but I didn't really eat much of the other items.  They were a bit cold and tasteless.  Maybe I just got a bad meal due to the long day of service they had on Thanksgiving.  I went once before as a kid and really enjoyed it, so I'll give it another try sometime soon.

cpbvGqIRlcssC75xxdmhNw.review_text: You're sitting there reading these damn Yelp reviews and you already know what to expect. Meat. Cafeteria-style, and beer. The perfect combination in my opinion. I came here expecting that and got exactly that, at a reasonable price. For anyone who lives in the San Jose area, think Harry's Hofbrau, but cheaper.  I had the round of beef with mashed potatoes, corned beef with mashed potatoes, and the buffalo chili. I could barely finish it between me and my girlfriend.   Oh, and a large pitcher of beer.  Well worth it for $40. Well, free, if you're broke and dependent on someone else's money like me. Can't argue with that.

a297OsEyseVkSAbCgROhPw.review_text: Great quick place for lunch, the meat was very tender and tasty. Prices were very reasonable. I had the beef brisket sandwich with bbq sauce and sat close to the neverending pickle pot. My friend had beer braised pork with mashed potatoes, he really liked it. Waitress was super helpful in selecting beers. Only downsides: cash only and sketchy bathroom/bathroom hallway.

3Ggp3IS8TyFYW_IZ6VN9yg.review_text: Three stars for the beer selection... Yes, yes Metallica used to hang out at Tommy's before they were millionaire rock stars... and the autographed Metallica photo behind the bar is pretty symbolic IMO:  Both Tommy's and Metallica are S.F. icons who may be past their prime but who still have appeal to alot of folks.  Which isn't a bad thing I suppose.   I do still like the vibe of the place and it hasn't changed in the 20+ years I've been going there... but now I only go to Tommy's to kill time before seeing a movie across the street at the AMC.  The main difference nowadays is that most of the patrons are tourists, many of whom are probably expecting to see Metallica dining next to them.    On a recent visit prior to a movie, a tourist couple kept staring at my companions and I.. I don't know if it was because they'd never seen an Asian dude before or if our long hair and my friends' tattoos made them think we were a band.  No worries!  I'll sign autographs for anyone, unlike some celebrity rock stars.  Anyway, the food is digestible in that school cafeteria way; it's funny how cafeteria mashed potatoes always have *that* taste.  Do you know what I mean?  However, it's cheap and, really, the food's real purpose is so you're not drinking on an empty stomach... If you're going to Tommy's for the cuisine then, uhhh, never mind....

S2oZmy91xGsw9f_vDACM3A.review_text: I've been going to Tommy's Joynt since around late 1994 early 95. Couldn't count the number of times I've been there if I've tried(easily more than 50), and never, I repeat NEVER had a bad meal. If that doesn't deserve 5 stars, I don't know what does.  Part of that is going in knowing what to expect. This ain't new American, farm to table what not. It's large quantities of cheap, tasty, meaty food that is consistently satisfying.   Faves include - corned beef and cabbage or corned beef sandwich, turkey sloppy joe, braised lamb shank, ham sandwich, buffalo stew   Don't miss the pickles down past the end of the register by the water. And the hot mustard on the table rules!  if you need a pick me up, they'v got cheap Irish coffees, but DO NOT start drinking Tommy's rum punch unless you're looking for trouble!

82dCHyU-ANOgdhxUgZsUeg.review_text: I've passed this place many times but never really noticed it. I finally came to check it out and it was worth the visit.  The corned beef is something you should definitely try. As for anything else, I don't know. There's just lots of meat and you can see them prepare it. I tried the Buffalo Stew and I thought it was just alright. If you just want to try something and be on your way, get the corned beef sandwich.  Maybe I'll come back just to check out the bar--it looked interesting. This joint sort of is like a sports bar as well since there were some TV's and lots of people were focusing on them.  It's cash only here.

PqAscaCXRJcSSgsw1oJveQ.review_text: This place rules if only for the fact that Metallica used to eat here all the time. This place has been open forever and for good reason. Delicious meats that you can get on a sandwich or platter. Get the BBQ beef brisket dinner plate.

hrwi5d8C0CmIZegi7GfT5Q.review_text: Look this is an old school Hof Brau style establishment. If you are not into that kind of food or decor don't rate it or eat it!  Tommy's is exactly as advertised. I picture 1940's sailor's chomping down on chuck steak specials pounding boiler makers. It's inexpensive simple fare. Very much homemade. It's definitely like your grandma used to make. Lots of gravy over a scoop of mashers, extra big slices of corned beef or turkey on your roll, chicken caccutori anyone?  If you know what this place is all about it kicks ass. If you come in here evaluating it against Bread and Water you're being a douche.     Beer selection is fantastic Chimay white on tap is worth the visit alone. Nuff said, I'm off to thrash to some Austrian Blackened Death Metal.

sYjwaitubscvN70pfUlUWA.review_text: Could be a four star - based on the price and what you get.  However, there were a few items that coulda been a tad better. Otherwise, the best deal in town.  My son and husband ordered the buffalo chili.  My husband was disappointed that the chili had ground instead of chunked (he LOVES the taste of buffalo). Ground seemed to make it close to beef. My son compared to buffalo chili he had in Vail at expensive hotel, this was way better in his opinion.   My husband also got a sausage sandwich.  He said the sausage was cooked well but wished there was slaw or kraut on top. Thus the minus star.  The pastrami sandwich with swiss I had was great. Perfectly cooked, healthy portion.   Need a great filling meal that is easy on the pocketbook, this is place for you!

_4ZFOXm_AXh88ZT_8YbpmQ.review_text: A good place for someone who is strictly "meat and potatoes" (or meat and bread).  If you like a more balanced meal, this isn't the place to go.  Prices are very reasonable.  If you're looking for a tasty sandwich (meat and bread, cheese is an option) before or after a movie at the AMC Van Ness, then this would be a good place to go.  The cole slaw is ok.  The other side salads looked ok, too.  HUGE selection of beers.

CJwSYSsw36bPiN5hGyKPaA.review_text: So, I go here pretty often for lunch, and I usually get the meatball sandwich (grub!)...this place is pretty cheap (cash only of course!) and they do have several other good dishes...the buffalo chili is also delightful.    For drinking, I've been here a few times after work, also a pretty mellow spot...not exactly "happening" but still, it's the closest one to my work...but I think this place is known for all the bottled beer it has from around the world...I'm not sure how many it has there...but I'll throw a number out there, sayyyyy 100 or so, from all over the world, so I like to go there and try out different beers I've never heard of...  Update: 11/15/07- Ok, so I come here probably about once a week during my lunch break from work, and I'm not updating this review, only on the waitress who is there every week day during lunch.  YOU! Ya, you! The waitress! YOU SUCK! Fucking take an order already. I know, you might not get paid a lot, but you are horrible at your job. Quite fucking gabbing with the people who work there and get me my drink already! Also, don't automatically think the change from the drink counts as your tip, as fucking horrible as you are you don't deserve a tip.  Sorry for all the swearing, usually I refrain, but she's fucking awful. I still like the place overall though :)

Oou8sXkHO3XrIwFw2iddqg.review_text: Come here for the Beef Brisket Dinner Plate with mash potatoes and gravy.  Make sure to ask for the free barbecue sauce for the Beef Brisket.

baD0m5hJdUYEqmJaV3uMdQ.review_text: Basically, the food while eating it was delicious  However, unfortunately, my g/f and I got food poisoning. I had boughts of diarrhea the next day. My g/f a day later was throwing up all day, and had to call in sick that workday  I called and notified the staff. They mentioned the owner was not available but would be back in a few days. I simply told the staff associate to relay the message to the owner. It was months ago since I went there but I think my g/f had the brisket of some sort  Not sure i'll go back there b/c of this scare. Maybe it was a rare occurance but it did happen.

E0Rl0CjwVILqfWl2s6Q-GQ.review_text: It's cash only cafeteria style comfort food for non vegetarians. The decor is random stuff and graffiti on the wall, and I think if you were a tiny person and could see the inside of a glockenspiel, that this is what it might look like. There is a barrel of pickles?!  This is not a wheelchair friendly place, the only bathrooms are up a whole bunch of stairs. There is a decent beer selection. The patrons are very diverse. Families with kids asleep at the table, couples, groups of men, groups of women, huge age range.   It's good and inexpensive, big portions, and not at all pretentious. The staff are all nice and friendly people. I looked into having my wedding rehearsal dinner here, but they said no groups larger than 30. They have a big upstairs area, but I appreciate that they didn't take on more than they thought was reasonable to handle.   It's a San Francisco landmark establishment for a reason. If you aren't vegetarian or vegan, and don't have a physical disability (or at least know you won't need to use a restroom), then it's probably worth checking out.

hl96MJJgF8ng1wGF5CLNZg.review_text: I went today with some of my family after my aunty had mentioned that this place was featured on Guy Fieri's "Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives" on Food Network. My mom used to come here for pastrami sandwiches and beer back in the day.  We went in and stood in line to place our order. Cash only.  It was really neat to watch the men behind the counter create your meal in mere seconds! I ordered the turkey enchilada... IT WAS FLIPPIN' DELISH!  It was also quite big and I couldn't finish it. My boy cousins helped me finish it off and they said that it was really good, too.   We also had ordered the turkey sloppy joe, buffalo chili, beef brisket dinner, and a sausage sandwich. According to my cousin, the sausage sandwich could have been better considering it was a small sausage hidden between two huge pieces of bread. Other than that, everyone else agreed that it was a good meal.   I really enjoyed that enchilada and will be back to try the rest of the menu!

e58WqXc-MbCHGCC_XfVKkg.review_text: Great place to grab drinks and food! The cafeteria-style ordering is an interesting change of pace. Really unique bar.

SQOp4Uf5LONyaKMvNVAjiA.review_text: I've been here on multiple occasions and it is always just as good as the last time.  I usually get sandwiches to go, and I've tried most of them.  They're $6 each.  I don't get the platter with mashed potatoes and vegetables because it's too much food.  The sandwich is super filling since they put so much meat on it.  GET the BBQ Brisket Beef sandwich on a sourdough roll.  It is juicy and tender.  The flavor is amazing.  The pastrami and corned beef are also amazing.  The round of beef (i.e. roast beef) is not good.  Do not get it.  It is too tough and flavorless to eat.  Now I understand why roast beef in deli shops are cut super thin - because it's tough.  And Tommy's cuts its meat thick and gives you a ton of it, which is A+.  They show you what true roast beef is.  But it just not a good meat in this situation (no fault of their own).  Cash only, super quick line. $6 + tax for sandwich.  Get the beef brisket sandwich and you will have a hearty meal.    Pro tip: If getting to go, aks for some bbq sauce on the side.

KZx47cED_UezMaZX1dO87w.review_text: as close to a home cooked meal as you can get from a restaurant! not vegan or vegetarian friendly... but for the rest of us its awesome! huge portions and pretty cheap. my favorite is the corned beef with mashed potatoes. sooo good! great place to go watch a game too!  oh and i cant forget about the giant jar of sliced pickles!

M5juPA27-uSQj5H2AsPjhA.review_text: You wanna party like a rockstar??  Well you need to EAT like a rockstar!!  Tommy's is pretty much a SF classic.  I mean, this used to be one of Metallica's favorite eats.  When you stroll into Tommy's, you're greeted by the display of food and an interior decor that's just as loud as the exterior.  It's a completely  relaxed & casual atmosphere, with a great bar and always something sports on the tele.    Theres a huge selection of food and they've usually got everything from buffalo stew to turkey legs to pasta.  The baked beans are pretty good but some sides like the green/garbanzo beans have an out the can taste, and the mashed spuds taste ilike nstant.     Theres better places to grab the hot meats (roast beef, brisket, pastrami), but I like to come here for the pasta, salmon, & lasagna.  For a hof brau setup it's as good as it'll get in SF.

HsItDau8N5Ssreb8zfc2qQ.review_text: Been coming to this place for 10 years and still love it!  The buffalo stew and the BBQ turkey sloppy Joe are my favorites.

o4W-L__qOkbvo9rAO2cqkA.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is a mecca of carving board sandwiches (most prominently the hand carved pastrami, and corned beef), and roast turkey and roast beef dinners with all the fixings. Originating in a time when home cooking was the only option for restaurants which operated under much stricter standards, Tommy's Joynt is part Jewish delicatessen, part old world diner, and part saloon. You can't ask for a more historic restaurant in San Francisco.   The pastrami and corned beef are from scratch and kept warm, and the roast beef and smoked turkey are slow roasted on premise, and all are carved from the brisket, bird, or roast to order. Also let's not forget the home made buffalo chili, available daily, or the fourteen different home made daily specials, a different selection each day, from lasagna to oxtails to braised lamb shank. Finally if you're in the mood for a drink, there is a twenty foot oak bar original to the space (meaning really, really old), with all the fixins for classic cocktails, a better than average liquor set, and a very, very impressive craft beer selection for such an old-school traditional place. Add in the classic early 1900's interior and vintage advertising all around, and you have one of the finest joints in all these United States.  Back in the earlier part of the last century there were lunch counters and full service delis all across America serving home cooked traditional standards like roast turkey and gravy, corned beef dinner, and hand carved roast beef. Sadly that old school traditional restaurant culture has been replaced with fast food drive-thrus and mass marketed corporate chain restaurants serving re-heated frozen foods. Troubling though that may be, we have places like Tommy's Joynt to remind us what we are missing out on, and hopefully they will lead us back to the old traditions once again.

kh1tUMr-Yy1U9Fit7wHZsQ.review_text: Lamb shanks, pastrami, and roast beef had me going 3x in one week. This place got meat for days and I'm not talking bout Castro district.

ECcXvW4cLQF9zYH8KoynJA.review_text: Been awhile since I've yelped but here is a good place to pick it up again! ... Tommy's is classic and looks like it as been here since the gold rush! We went in at about 3pm and there was still a line almost out the door so be prepared to wait a bit but not too long cuz it moves pretty quick. It is cafeteria style and they have roast turkey, beef and others with all the classic thanksgiving style sides. They also have a lasagna that looked amazing (even though I didnt try it)! The service is so so and they charge you $1.25 for refills on soda which always makes me a little sour cuz I go through soda pretty quick. Overall its worth checking out and is walking distance from Union square!

lSFVlEDd8g8z8W-STbLy1w.review_text: Tommys is definitely one of my favorite places to eat in SF. Just make sure you show up with an appetite

OxNw3_hlEv33pLqqADVsTA.review_text: I was brought here by an old timer / sugar daddy who was raving about the amazing food & beer. Um, not so much, grandpa! Welcome to the meat fest, kids! Cost of admission? 1 clogged artery.  The food looks like something out of a 60's cookbook & that ain't pretty! The chocolate cake tasted like Safeway cake that's been sitting out for a week, maybe more. No bueno!  1 star for the amazing plaid carpet.

XCW5pJCDhvlW76XTSUEkIg.review_text: This is "As Seen On T.V." review #2. Another Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives treasure we found.   If Dive had a picture next to it, this would be the place. The lead based paint on the walls gives it even more qualifications as a Dive.   We sat at the bar for about an hour and a half before we ate. The specialty cocktail menu has the basics listed. We tried this Toms Rum Punch thing. To sweet for me, I only had one, my husband had about 4.   I then moved over to beer from there. They had Boddingtons on tap. It was served in a cool Bodingtons glass that I really wanted. My husband told me not to steal it.   Second beer I had was recommended from the bar tender. It was a beer from Kenya called Tusker. I liked it. It was light like a Red Stripe but had that full flavor of a New Castle. I really enjoyed it and would probably try and go find it at Bev Mo.   When we finally decided to eat food we gave up our well established seats at the bar and got into the line. Like cattle going to slaughter, we were just walking in zig zag form until we got to the front of the line to order.   We had a while to read the menu and I went with Corned Beef Dinner Plate with Veggies and a side of Tomato Salad. The Veggies were grayish green colored Green Beans. Obviously canned.   The meat was very good. I saw them bring over a big piece of Corned Beef right before it was our turn so I knew it was fresh. There was no cabbage it was straight Corned Beef.   The Tomato Salad was very, very good. I was worried about the large tomato slices being to hard like some large tomatoes can get. They were crisp and good and had full tomato flavor. The only part I could have done with out was the Green Bell Pepper. This was something I could see my Grandma make for a family get together.   My husband got the Kielbasa Sausage Sandwich with a side of Clam Chowder. His Clam Chowder was way to fishy smelling for me, like low tide. He said the Kielbasa was good. I should have taken a bite but I was to consumed with my own food.   This place is definitely not worth 4 or 5 stars. Its unique and pretty cool but the food was mediocre and the drinks were average.   If you haven't been go so that you can say you did. Other than that I would probably go to a nice sit down place for a lovelier meal.

7QgJHvGSCndSf-zOsAHf3A.review_text: I heard about this place a year or so ago and I finally went. I was tempted to get just about everything on the menu but I know about the portion sizes so I decided to go with the turkey sloppy joe. The plate alone could've lasted me 3 meals. Huge slabs of bread and giant scoops of the turkey sloppy joe, sided with a generous portion of mashed potatoes and gravy. Amazing! Especially for the price at $4.50. We also had the roast beef which was perfectly cooked and seasoned.   Great classic American food. I am definitely coming back.

n2lKPfuoSoUl3lRY9RPZ5A.review_text: Good ol' American food at its finest. No, you won't get the pampered treatment of a 5-star restaurant...you WILL get chunks of potato salad and coleslaw dumped onto your plate and you will have to find your when seat.  Think mid 20th-century American dining...plaid striped table cloths...wooden tables and seats...guys with aprons behind the counter serving you...and then the bar.   Finding this place is not that hard...you will not miss it by its exterior...think of a building all "tattoo'd" up and you will get Tommy's. And once you get inside, there will most likely be a bit of a wait as your order and pay on the spot (all one line). Once you order, you can find a table/seat either on the first or second floor.  Based on yelp reviews, I decided to try the Buffalo Stew Sandwich ($6.95). You basically choose your own bread (Whole wheat, Sourdough, Rye) and they dump a whole lot of stew + meat onto it. Just how I like it. It was surprisingly filling. I came with a group of 5 and everyone ordered something different, I especially enjoyed the BBQ Brisket.   If you are ever in the area whether it be on a Friday/Saturday night before going out, I'd highly suggest you hit Tommy's Joynt up...it's definitely one of the better restaurants around in that area.

IuMwynBkQt9RXhbSFUsKIw.review_text: Popped in the other night. Had a couple of Fat Tires, the bartenders were very friendly and fun.  Then I sampled the Turkey hand carved sandwich on a sourdough roll. Might tasty if I say so myself.  I think I got out of there for under a $20.  Don't forget to get your parking validated.

e77JyltArqckcdBl13bVbA.review_text: Tommy's is one of those places that you could go to, eat or drink nothing, and still have a good time.  The walls and ceilings are plastered with stuff they've collected since they opened in 1947.  Right out of a noir movie, you'd expect to hear the sound of a mournful rooftop saxophone when you walk in and have a seat between a down-on-his-luck private detective and a hooker with a heart of gold.  The food is the typical hofbrau fare ... giant slabs of something with parents, drenched in gravy.  The beer list seems like it has shortened over the years, but they still have a dozen or so brews from all over the world that you can't get at the local grocery store.  When you're sick of chain restaurants, get in here.  It's a San Francisco classic.

5517Yj-6hxE2IZl0xbRYYA.review_text: I honestly don't know why this place is so popular and has so many reviews maybe because the population density of the area that it's in... the food is just glorified cafeteria food that stays under heating lamps I am not a picky eater but I had to force myself to eat it with me being hungry and all... I got the roast beef by the way

dhsmYyhk_9vMoH2y4uThhw.review_text: Our go to spot before Giants games! So yummy and AFFORDABLE. It's old school and I think that's why we love it so much. Turkey sandwiches with spicy ass mustard ! My favorite ! We always tell everyone about this place.

7C6Y8Cm4rLmlPl2yNEBD3A.review_text: Epic late night grindz. Love the selection of meat, always so delightful and hearty. Wish I were closer to eat there more. Cool

7cO_2Ymssx6_7DACvCjoWQ.review_text: The food here kinda sucks, but it doesn't matter! Tommy's Joynt is truly an institution not to be missed, if only for the pure novelty of the place. The mediocre food (including canned green beans) is served cafeteria style and a la carte. There's a lot to choose from, so luckily the line is long enough to give you time to ponder. The bulk of the menu is comfort food staples. Simple and hearty.  The reasons I'd return again and again would be the picnic table cloths, cheap margaritas, kitschy decor, dark wood paneled walls, and the great tourist watching.   Perfect place to go for a pre-movie dinner if you're seeing a flick at the AMC across the street.

VHdY6oG2JPVNjihWhOooAQ.review_text: Late night eating FTW.  I am all about late night eateries in this city and I wish there was more of them. Tommy's Joynt not only represents when it comes to serving up big portions of filling fare till about 2 in the morning, but they do so with true local charm.  Tommy's has been around forever and when you walk inside you can feel the historical energy move around the place. Their food is also quality. Unlike many late night spots that will just serve you up lack-luster fried food - Tommy's is all about filling your plate with hearty slabs of meat, fresh mashed potatoes, greens and more.   I'm not a meat girl - so I stuck to the salad section - which suited me just fine. Cucumbers, fresh tomatoes, dressed up in a light sweet vinaigrette along with your standard salad.  Seated at the beautiful wood bar - while absorbing all of the undeniable ambiance of Tommy's on a mellow Sunday is the way to do it.  Trust.

NCg53EdDxLZrVAF2PQppTw.review_text: Over rated, but great!!  They really are known for their beef dips.  So no matter how tempted with the smorgasborg of other gluttonous and delicious smelling\looking foods, be steedfast and headstrong and get what all the old timers who knows wassup  and orders - the Beef Dip Sanwich.  Otherwise your just like all the other toursist Dips out there.  The unlimited pickles is a great thing too...  Street parking, lines go out the door but run quick during lunch.  About 7 bux a sandwich.

s5XJsJNNI944pvNKsb_OeA.review_text: This is a San Francisco tradition. I'm a native San Franciscan and grew up eating at Tommy's Joint. I have continued to eat there from time to time all my life. I love the sandwich bar. I usually get a corned beef sandwich with Mac and Cheese. The roast beef sandwich or the pastrami is terrific too. The dinner plates are awesome, I'm a sandwich guy. They have horseradish sauce (it will open your nasal passages) as well as hot and mild mustard at the tables. There are plenty of free pickles too. Don't forget the full bar service with a gadzillion beers. Try a few....over time. This is San Francisco tradition. Stop in and spend time in the old place. More locals here than tourists. One warning,.... Bring cash, they do not accept credit cards. Great food, good service. It's a classic.  Trust me on this one. It's worthy. If you miss it, you'll be sorry.

mpm9olv35gqQePUdQvK62g.review_text: I found this place 2 weeks ago, and I've been there three times since. Not bad for my wallet, not good for my stomach. The meats here get all the recognition, and I agree - the pastrami, beef brisket, and buffalo chili deserve all the hype they get it. But the sides keep me coming back. The mashed potatos, baked beans, potato salad, tomato/cucumber salad, and the ROLLS! They should have a meal just composed of sides for weirdos like me. Waitresses and busboys are super friendly and helpful. Will continue to frequent this place for its proximity, inexpensiveness, deliciousness.

2r6IotEf_aLEWYMqQiu7fw.review_text: My wife and family are from Orange County Californian are die hard 49er fans. We take a trip every year to see a NINER game. We always open and close our trip with Tommy's Joint. It is one of the only establishments left that holds the real heartbeat of San Francisco. All types of great food and generations of staff. If you want the real San Francisco experience. I suggest you come here. The new stadium is in Santa Clara so we went during the offseason to visit the new stadium and drove 40 mins out of our way to visit Tommy's. We will visit whenever we are in the area!! We love Tommy's!!!

GfxgiSFlh-pNFR1A1Mc9Tw.review_text: This was one awesome find.  Best brisket!!!  Quick, Cheap, full bar and good and fun  Next time I am in the city I will totally be back!

EbbOIQ5oAamS9D_B_7cC7w.review_text: This place is a San Francisco institution.  Here's the deal: you walk in, get in line, choose your meal and sides in a cafeteria style manner, then pay (cash only.)  Then you sit down at a table and a sever takes your drink order and you pay and tip your server as well. It's a strange deal but it must work for them because this place is packed.  This place has all the comfort food you want at a cheap price.  The food is ok. It's not bad, but it's not great. This place is a bit of a dive, but that's half the fun, I guess.   I don't think I'd ever crave this place, but I wouldn't argue too much if a friend wanted to some here.

fIfKT5J7OWnr_sNP7VKkAw.review_text: Have I tried your food Tommy? No... Have I really got a chance to sit and experience the ambiance your joynt has to offer? Noooo..... Did I at least talk to some staff long enough to get a vibe on your team's service?? Nope.  But guess what good sir, your bartender had me at "Jameson is $4 a shot." It wasn't a 'special drink offer', I didn't know the guy, that's just your price.   I love you.  My friends party in the Mission so I find myself situated at the 49 bus stop right by Tommy's often. At night I may have to wait a solid 30 minutes for one of those bastards so I head into Tommy's for a shot. Well, maybe two shots at such a nice price. Who says you have to spend the entire time standing on the curb awaiting the damn bus? I say that's time for shots!  Or you could always go to the Korean bars down the road and let them rape your wallet for $7 or $8 a shot *cough* Hanaro & Outsider *cough cough*. Me? I'll take my treat for $4 at Tommy's.

jK1WLzDdwLP5k7V75tjV7Q.review_text: Love the pastrami.  If you are going to SF, you must visit this place.

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: How can you not like a place that spells joint, Joynt? I can't vouch for the food here, as some of what I saw looked good and some not so good. However, the beer and tequila selection is quite impressive. They have three of my favorite english ales which is reason enough for me to stop in. As for the sports satellite tv claim, that might have been the case years ago, but the two small tv's really don't allow for an abundance of sports watching these days...

1aIeLV989fcYInK6tPA8_A.review_text: We went on a Sunday and the place was packed. They are know to have Buffalo stew  and sandwich,never tried it but they have it. Our group had turkey dinner  plate(very good), Pastrami sandwich(very good) and BBQ Brisket(very good) drinks are kinda of expensive and no refill on the soda. overall a must for tourist and locals....now  GO!

4uUspdcp3TZhIGcD5xHQgg.review_text: What an interesting experience!  Getting your food, piping hot, IMMEDIATELY!  I like it!  The menu choices are simple, and ALL look delicious, AND AND AND the staff is really friendly.   I had the polish sausage with sauerkraut and boiled potato, and I got to try my friend's meatball sandwich.  OH THEY WERE BOTH SO GOOD!  I can't wait to try more =)    This place also has lots of character, I enjoyed the pinatas hanging from the high ceiling, and old-time photographs on the wall.  So many things to look at, and so much goodness for the eating!

mn2dBGX5-brzrPr8gx8XoQ.review_text: If you like meat and you like cheap eats that you can get almost anytime then you are going to love Tommy's! You have to know what your going to get when you go there however if you are ready for a not flashy, meat and potatoes meal with a beer and minimal service then you will be a happy, full camper.   This is a great place to go watch sports, hang out with friends or eat alone if you are in the mood for some hearty meat and potatoes!

xBWegfKda5n8tyFjSIIPig.review_text: After seeing Tommy's on TV ( Guy Fiere, DDD) I really expected to love this place. I knew about the dated decor and even the cash only thing (even though I think that's rediculous in this day and age). I didn't. I ordered the Sunday Special, Beef Burgandy with rice. Can't go wrong with the special, right? WRONG! Firstly, it looked like slop thrown on the plate, sauce dripping off the plate (ick!) and there was A LOT of it, big portion of inedible food. It was so not even similiar to any beef burgandy I have ever tasted anywhere in the world. For some people that is welcome, a quirky take on a classic. Just plain not good. At all. Period. My daughter got the brisket plate with mashed potatoes. Again, a large portion. The meat itself was very tender & tasty. Unfortunately the BBQ sauce that was (again) slopped all over the plate, inncluding the potatoes, was syrupy sweet. The potatoes were not too good with the sauce on them. Gravy would have been better. My husband had the turkey plate with mashed potatoes and dressing with gravy and really liked it. His turkey was really good and again, nice size. My mother-in-law had a corned beef sandwich and enjoyed it very much as well. It was a Suday around 1:00 PM, only 3 people in line ahead of us and the restaurant was quiet. Good timing because as we were driving away we saw at least 20 people waiting, many of them outside. I understand this is a neighborhood stand by, but I was less than impressed and will not go back. My companions might. I guess you'd have to try it yourself, just don't expect much. i see many reviews talking about how cheap it is; I'd rather pay more, get less food that is GOOD food.

iq_BGBm21kj2hiNGBjOOlA.review_text: Fast, Extensive menu which includes buffulo meat, bbq, turkey, mexican. Vintage feel and THey give out free pickles which is awsome!  I eat here at least twice a week. So far my favorite is the bbq beef brisket sandwich, THey have been around for decades.

NzoaXoBZnnkwo5Yg88nL4A.review_text: Classic place. If you like meat, eat here. If you stay out late, and are hungry afterwards... eat here.   Their pork ribs are friggin incredible. As is there turkey. As is their brisket. Basically, if you are a fan of any kind of large-serving meats, then this is the place to be. Slightly seedy (but in a good way,) full bar that's open until 2, and very reasonable prices. You can get a down-home-cookin' plate for about 7 or 8 bucks, and it will fill you up.   They're cash only, but there's an ATM there. Service isn't wonderful, but it's what you'd expect. This is one of those places where once you bite into the food, everything else about the place just starts making sense. Like it doesn't matter that they don't take Visa, you get your own silverware, or there's no discernible reason for half of the crap on the walls. It just doesn't matter, their meat is that good.  That being said, their green beans taste like they came right from the can, IE, like garbage. Avoid.

Uke3Ob09vZgndCZ1ulHsdw.review_text: First it should be noted that while the hours say 10am, that is for the bar, not the food which isn't served until 11am.  We were looking forward to eating at this old school dive and it smelled good when we walked in an hour early.  I got the turkey dinner with stuffing and potatoes and it came with salad which I got ranch dressing.  The hubby got the roast beef sandwich that also came with salad and he got Italian.  When I was getting my dinner the asked  "you like gravy?"  "yeah"  *dumps over a cup of gravy over everything on my plate*  Did the same thing with the salad dressings.  More of "would you like some lettuce with your dressing?"  So if you don't want your food swimming in liquid tell them to put it on the side.  The gravy drowned out all flavor on my food and I didn't eat it all because after awhile it just tasted like salt and nothing else.  The hubby who loves italian dressing was wincing by the end of his salad because he said vinegar was the prevalent taste.  He said his food was average at best.  We both felt like we waited an hour for nothing but the Oreo milkshake we got across the street at Mel's while waiting was good!

vv1UqWpCyTxA-6H-cWh-Dg.review_text: I like a good pickle.  I really really do.  The giant tub of free pickles at the counter alone gives Tommy's Joynt 5 stars in my book.    The fact that they serve delicious, freshly carved meat dishes for under $10 a pop doesn't hurt either.  I have tried their corned beef, turkey, ham, and, last but sure as hell not least, pastrami. The pastrami is phenomenal, whether it be on a sandwich or just on the plate.  I'm pretty sure my boyfriend dreams about it every night.  Everything else has been consistently top notch, with the exception of the turkey.  I tried the turkey dinner plate once when I wasn't really in a red meat mood & I probably will never try it again.  It was pretty dry & I ended up washing it down with a lot of whatever random wordly beer I was drinking.  As for sides, I would recommend the potato salad & the clam chowder... om nom nom.  Though the line may be long &, yes, they only accept cash, you can never go wrong with a giant, juicy pastrami sandwich. With a side of pickles of course.

iIaSoCvT7lOwYMELWTu0Vw.review_text: This place is truly a fantastic restaurant. The entire experience of going here is something you shouldn't miss out on. I will always crave that cornbeef. I would go on and on about how much I like this place but it has all been said. Go in. Wait in line (it goes fast) and get excited. I can't imagine coming back to (or even through) SF and not going here.

gZmEv9IiDFU_Ie0SOYyiPQ.review_text: I just came into the city with my friend after driving up from San Luis Obispo and the first place we went to was this.   The outside was pretty cool looking. "The Original Tommy's Joynt" put a bit of old fashioned flavor into the restaurant. There were also memorabilia in there too. Pictures, posters, cut outs, frames of certain crafts, everything. It put a feeling of being in a European restaurant since it had dark lighting and everything around me was made of wood. The meat carver was a nice guy. I asked him which sandwich to get; the corned beef or the round of beef, and he said the corned beef.   We received our order right away and they cut the meat right in front of you. I dipped a corner of the sandwich into the gravy and took a bite. It was soft and the meat required no excessive chewing at all. The meat was full of flavor and tender. We also ordered an Irish coffee. It was a bit expensive and for me, it was a bit too strong. Maybe that's because I haven't really had too much experience with alcohol.   The food was great. The service was friendly and quick. I'm gonna come back again and try their round of beef sandwich. Tommy's gives you a homely feeling. I really like the decors and seating. Glad I came back home to try it.

tLHOUMtntejdMzZowQN97g.review_text: I LOVE TOMMY'S JOYNT! I'm sure everyone does! If you don't you're lying to yourself.  Since I'm sure most people know about this place I'll just tell you what I usually get when I'm there. BAR-B-Q beef sandwich - $6!!!! You cannot beat that. So freaking good. Add horseradish and spicy mustard, yum! The pickles are the BEST!   This review is really about thanksgiving. My love and I were here to grab an actual thanksgiving dinner since we had a non traditional meal before hand. It was like $14 for an entire thanksgiving dinner. Which fed the both of us and we took some home. The turkey was good!!!!!!!!!! Let me tell you, I am not a big fan of turkey but it was so good and not dry. So the actual dinner came with turkey, stuffing, mashed potatoes and gravy. Also a side or salad, bread roll, cranberries and a pumpkin pie with tea or coffee. It was worth it.
