The sour bread was a little hard to bite into, but I guess it's really meant for picking little chunks apart and dipping it into the homemade barbecue sauce they serve the briskets with.  I'll have to agree with my fellow yelpers in that the portions here are very generous and the prices here are beyond reasonable; my entire lunch cost me only 8.99 plus tax. Although I didn't get anything from the bar, they do have very reasonable happy hour prices for beer from the tap (I think it was something like 2.75) and if the posters can be held as a credible source, they apparently have Carlsberg on draught here.  for all you tl;dr's: Tommy's Joynt gets 3-stars for the actual food itself plus one star for portions and price.

8cgQECj_cdwYa1n--vXL6A.review_text: I spent the last rainy night of an otherwise sunny visit to SF eating here with Spencer and Andrea.  We drank a couple of pints, saw a movie, and then, "starving", came back for dinner.  Its comfort food all the way, served  to you on a tray by a chef in a paper hat.  We all had the full dinner plate, which includes your choice of meat, mashed potatoes/veggie, salad, and a dinner roll.  I had corned beef that was succulent and certainly not lean, and one of the best cole slaws that I've ever had.    When I mentioned Tommy's Joynt to my aunt and uncle in SF, they, of course, knew what I was talking about; Tommy's Joynt is a staple, right up there with all of the other famous and notorious landmarks of the city, but part of what makes TJ's so appealing is that it doesn't feel as though it is aware of its reputation.  At the old sticky wood tables there are men eating alone, couples, big groups, and never once do you feel like they are there for the novelty of it all.  If anything Tommy's Joynt feels like a place where everyone else is carrying on with  business as usual, like, "we go here to eat, and drink.  Obviously we do that, because this place has good food."  Meanwhile my reaction was like, "Holy shit, what a discovery! How can a place like this (still) exist?"

5ECpPlyJaZsopL4GIHdMTQ.review_text: Tommy's Joynt on Geary and Van Ness has been welcoming strangers since the mid-1940s, with a sign hanging over the front door to prove it. Located on a busy thoroughfare, Tommy's Joynt has long beckoned tourists, but unlike most tourist traps it's a local institution as well. You're as likely to engage in conversation with a solitary spry septuagenarian regular as you are to meet a young couple visiting from Spokane trying to decipher the extensive beer list.  Viewed from the outside, with a line snaking out the door, Tommy's Joynt can seem a bit daunting at first glance and a little chaotic. It's neither. People line up for the hofbrau carving station where veteran carvers serve up fresh turkey, barbecued brisket, lamb shanks, ham and buffalo stew, to mention a few. If the line seems a little onerous, simply veer left, walk past it and belly up to the bar, where you can order a beer while the rush subsides, as it invariably will. Once you're able to order your food, you can bring it to the bar until around 6 p.m. By no means is the food "gourmet" and some of the sides are more than a little sad, but it's affordable, fresh, tasty and hearty. Hofbrau food like brisket and roast turkey matches perfectly with beer, and Tommy's Joynt has the usual suspects on its dozen taps - Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, Anchor Steam, Sam Adams Lager and Guinness - along with a few pleasant surprises, such as Trumer Pils from Berkeley, Speakeasy Big Daddy IPA and Chimay. You can find some winners among the numerous bottles, too, like Maredsous (Brouwerij Duvel Moortgat NV) and Leffe from Belgium; Old Peculier (Theakston) and Old Speckled Hen (Greene King / Morland Brewery) from England; and Franziskaner Hefeweisse and Hacker-Pschorr Munich Gold, Gold Weisse and Dark Weisse from Germany. Very little, if anything, about Tommy's Joynt has changed over the years, and that's by design. Its Web site declares: "While the City has been changing year after year, we remain steadfast in our opposition to change. We want things to remain the same because our founders established a reputation in San Francisco; a reputation that promises hot food and cold drink at a price that parries our atmosphere." As long as Tommy's Joynt continues to deliver on that promise, it will remain a valued destination for hungry tourists and locals alike.

KTFoVUc-uk0cD-PhEqc6AQ.review_text: The woman taking my order by phone was the most pleasant thing about this place. I was there within ten minutes( the time they said it would take to be ready). I was super excited bc I've always wanted to go. I went inside, being ignored and having eyes rolled at me as I asked if I could pay for my order, amongst other hurtful gestures. I still tipped then Took the same cab I arrived in 5 blocks away toy dads where I uncovered bloody, soggy white bread with room temp roast beef inside. No mayo, no condiments or anything at all! I called them to ask why. Like A broken record, the man kept repeating that the workers Ask what's on it. Since that's not what happened, I told him that but he wouldn't believe me, just kept repeating that line I mentioned earlier. I said: so that's it?? That's whT I get for $30? He said yup and hung up on me ;(

Q0kOoAjPmFbIn8gq1RGYRw.review_text: I like the food but wtf. They took my dam plate when I was gone for a refill. I still had food left.

__tr37QhFc-nKxpKUzP63w.review_text: We needed a quick snack, but not a heavy meal, before heading into the AMC movie theater for a 5:05 pm showing.  My bf pointed out Tommy's Joynt across street.  I couldn't help but ask for the Sloppy Joe because somehow once I saw it on the menu, I HAD to have it.  Memories of messy, oozing sandwiches from grade school....Sigh!  Strangely, one of the few things in the cafeteria line-up that I actually looked forward to back in the day!   This sandwich was nowhere similar in many ways.  It was made of turkey strips and chunks in a juicy sauce spooned up over a large sourdough roll.  It came with a scoop of mashed potatoes and a healthy serving of gravy.    My bf ordered the huge turkey leg.  This thing was GARGANTUAN! He  grasped it in his hand and began to gnaw away at the tender meat.  It looked so primeval!  It came with stuffing and a side salad of his choice.     What an amazing value....our bill came out to just over $10!  We'll definitely be hitting this place again.   And you can see in the pictures that it's a joynt with a lot of character with red checkered tablecloths, a random assortment of signs and who-knows-whats hanging from the ceiling, and an extensive beer menu.  So, we ended up getting our quick snack, but in reality, it was so filling that we didn't have dinner...

kJEigkuolJfUn-aotHtI6A.review_text: Pretty sweet. We happened upon this place by accident. We cunningly maneuvered around the panhandling Vietnam vet into a bbq paradise. We ordered the brisket sandwich with a side of baked beans. You can really taste the meat...they don't drown it out with an overbearing sauce. Its a great tasting sauce, don't get me wrong, but you can tell they want you to taste yo meat! I mean can one ever really go wrong with bbq? Its like different types of women...they're all great as far as I'm concerned...just as long as they're not fat and hit the gym a few times a week.

_fFpucW8mSKvFJ46zSJCrg.review_text: AUTHENTIC, UNIQUE, AND GREAT FOOD AT A BARGAIN We were heading from the Golden Gate area back to the airport and we needed to stop for lunch before our flight. We saw the front of Tommy's Joynt with it's large, busy mural and thought it would be a good sandwich place to go to. Boy were we right!  There is a lot to choose from and the pricing was very reasonable. The big downer was there are no selections for vegetarians. My girlfriend primarily eats vegetarian but in a pinch (one or twice a month) she'll eat meat if she's having trouble finding vegetarian selections. I'm really glad she did this time because she ordered the CORNED BEEF SANDWICH and POTATO SALAD. Both were awesome! The Corned Beef was very lean and very tasty. The bread it was on was really good, too. We shared an order of the potato salad and it had lots of flavor.  I ordered the KIELBASA SANDWICH which was decent. The bread it was on was really  good and so was the mustard. For $3.25 it was a deal. I'd DEFINITELY recommend the Corned Beef over the Kielbasa, but if you're jonsin' for a sausage sandwich, this wasn't bad.  They had a full bar and a huge selection of beer. ALL PINTS ARE $4.50, and I LOVE it when a restaurant prices things that way.  You could tell it was a very popular place but they were able to churn through the customers pretty quickly. This is a place where "Bang for your Buck," "Lively and Unique Atmosphere," and "Good Deli Food" all come together.  If you're in San Francisco looking for good deli food and Tommy's Joynt is one of your considerations, I'd strongly encourage you to give it a shot.  Cheap. Great corned beef & potato salad. Kielbasa was decent. Bread was very good. All pints $4.50.

N_-rbw8pxE_-OiHbkVm2Lw.review_text: You find yourself on Van Ness? Either you're staying at the Holiday Inn, going to the movies at 1000 Van Ness, OR hey after your appointment of perusing some Bentleys or Lamborghinis and you want to have some good eatin', Tommy's Joynt is HIGHLY recommended. Why?! Check out this menu tommysjoynt.com/menu2.htm I had the Roast Beef Dinner Platter. AWESOMELY generous, juiciest cuts of roast beef that will leave holding a damn cup to catch the drool running down your mouth. Yes, I was hungry. The mashed potatoes were great, along with some juices and gravy dumped on the platter... Just amazingly magical. Line is usually long as hell and sometimes extends out the door, but the lunch line style serving makes it move along quite quickly. Besides the line hooks right besides the bar, so you can easily grab a cocktail while you wait. Honestly, I'm going to keep coming here until I have everything on the menu, because, well look at the menu when you're there! Everything is so mouthwatering. The prices are great too considering the portions! This is just a over all great place to eat! You can also get it to go! So if you love MEAT! Tommy's Joynt is a place you can't BEAT!

Wez_YoTdzSxsBWPvx-leaA.review_text: Do you want heaping amounts of MEAT?  Or are you drunk and need something open late and delicious to fill your stomach? Tommy's will definitely hit the spot.  How it works: walk in and get in line. It might look intimidating but the line moves pretty quickly. Get a drink at the bar while in line and get some cash at the ATM, also in the line, since it's CASH ONLY. When you get to the front, order something from the piles of meat that they have.  I highly recommend the brisket dinner plate. Almost everything I've had here is delicious, but nothing compared to the succulent brisket here. Put some hot mustard on that and it is GOLD. Out of the meat dishes I tried, I would put brisket first, round of beef, pastrami, then corned beef. I usually love corned beef but sadly, their corned beef does not hold a candle to the brisket. Put any of these on a sandwich and it's delicious too. People tell me the turkey is good, and I have tried the Turkey dinner plate and the Turkey ala King (Gravy turkey stew over rice) but honestly, I don't know why I would get anything other than brisket here. They are good, but nothing compared to the Beef dishes.   Now that I'm done gushing about all the BEEF, let me get to the not so good part - I don't think any of their sides are amazing, with the exception of mashed potatoes. Tomato salad tasted like armpits and their macaroni salad was a bit too sour. Green beans are just regular soft green beans and their slaw isn't anything to write home about either. I guess the delicious free pickles make the sides forgivable.   TLDR; get the Brisket Dinner Plate with mashed potatoes. You can thank me later.

1PdVyrWPU3Dxhho-X3dsdA.review_text: i couldn't love this place anymore, its perfect..   delicious meat and crazy selection of beers from around the world. go there.  cafeteria style, dont be intimidated by the line, you need that time to figure out which of their awesome menu items you want.  i'd go sandwich over dinner plate personally.

abyU-JVd2sot6XQkaeVyVA.review_text: I decided to give this place another shot after seeing it on 'diners, drive ins and dives' w/ Guy raving about the roast beef.  So I got the roast beef sandwich on sourdough and potato salad.  Roast beef sandwich - great!  Roast beef was super moist and tender.  Could have had more flavor aka some salt.  Sourdough roll was super soft and tasted like it was baked within a couple of hours of me eating it.  Overall, a great sandwich at a very affordable price.  Now if they had made a delicious au jus sauce to dip this thing in, it would be the perfect roast beef sandwich!  Since it would add more flavor.  The flavor was good, it was just a bit bland thats all.  Potato salad - lots of potatoes (good thing for me) but way too bland and not good flavor.  I went to this place years ago when Borat was sold out across the street at the movie theatre and my friends and i needed to kill some time before the next showing started.  We came here, and I remember ordering the brisket plate with beans and a roll.  It was super dissapointing - the meat was dry? not good, the beans sucked, and the roll was not very good.  So, in conclusion, if you live or work nearby, I definitely think this place is worth going to for a quick lunch if you want a simple and satisfying carved sandwich.  Skip the sides.

C5VdqjjQ7cXKCG1x0UJ19g.review_text: This Joint has been in SF since before I was born as well before the Diners and Drives-in and Dives... This place is a SF original..if you want to try what the locals eat. Try the Buffalo stew is so great! as well they have a nice selection of beers from around the world..this joint is a guy joint but hey I do see some dames that also like to eat meat and have fun.The portions are fit for a king as well the best thing you can do is share and is cheap!

KQxqFHzmFIHuRh5v4dbjGw.review_text: Roast beef was really dry and chewy. I guess I better learn how to order their specials to have a decent meal here. Pretty decent place here to get a quick bit to eat.

fiGqQ7pIGKyZ9G0RqWLMpg.review_text: I saw this on DDD with Guy Fieri (talk about a great job). Ok, it's funny I remember seeing this place in the past, but sometimes when you're younger, you're not paying attention, especially when you're not the one driving. The full scale mural outside is a clear indicator of what sets it aside from the rest. On the show, we learned that the meats are cooked for a long time, which gives a good flavor (yum for us).   We arranged to come here with friends on a sunday night for dinner (parking was a block away, on a side street- pretty easy). From the show, the line can get out the door, very easily. We were lucky, it wasn't as long as I'm sure it would be, during the week. Sunday was a good night to be there.  You choose your selections while you're standing in line (oh, the possibilities- daily specials, side orders, desserts @ $2.75, dinner platters @ $8.50). A regular in line was giving us recommendations on the food. All sandwiches are $5.50- your choice of bread- sourdough, wheat, white, or rye- roast beef/bbq brisket/corned beef/turkey/ham/pastrami. Excellent price for such good size sandwiches. You pay for the food after making your selections. Then you find seats. Kind of cafeteria style. A server then takes your drink order. The setting is like a pub with dark rich woods (plus it's dark inside too) and it's kinda like a teepee (with more seats upstairs). No booths upstairs, just tables and chairs, and you might have to politely say "Excuse us" to your neighbors because it's somewhat of a tight squeeze at some seats (depends). But for the most part, they understand.   We had the turkey and the corned beef- we both split it. Both were really good but the beef had more flavor. We sampled some of our friend's chili which was pretty hearty. Our other friend had a lamb chop or leg or something. We really liked the place and would definitely come back again for more cheap eats.

9YXx_m-WYuUltfOJc6kmBQ.review_text: Do you know what happens... when you taste some of the most hearty, delicious, probably not all that good for you food... and offer it up at... prices I could've afforded on my age 11 allowance? Oh goodness. Ohhhhh goodness gravyyyy (which, by the way, they have a lot of.) You have one of the greatest holes in the walls EVER.  Again, the first stand out is just how affordable the food is. Hearty portions of good eats for about $4-$9. If you are a straight up carnivore, this place is heaven. All the meats, sausages, and sandwiches are beyond top notch. They will fill you up and you'll be mighty satisfied. The food here is just full of flavor. It's like cafeteria food to the next next NEXT level. Speaking of which, food is served up cafeteria style. No fuss, they just take your order, you pay, and you're good to go. Don't forget to see what daily specials they have. Awesome stuff ranging from ground chuck steak smothered in mushrooms, onions, & gravy to braised oxtail pasta. Oh, also turkey legs. Turkey legs folks. Not sure that much else needs to be said about that.  The place is kinda sorta small, but it's not hard at all to find a seat in here. You're likely to find a seat right after your order. I believe the water is self-serve (that's what I did) and drink orders are taken by the waitress, so keep that in mind if you're getting confused at the food counter. Oh, and don't forget to order some brewage or one of their custom drinks over at the bar. Goes perfectly with the food. Aw yeah.  This place is a MUST if you want to get some serious chow on a low low budget. You will not be disappointed, trust. If you're going to complain at THESE PRICES.... mannn, take your complaining self over the Ruth's Chris or something. I need to free up a seat for my friend.  Man... I wish I was/I had been an 11 year old in the city.  Turkey leg.

uqC3ll6vCfqFalbWnPi-Qg.review_text: Good meat- cafeteria style but authentic and charming - unbeaten beer selection ~ 132 beers. Id take an international traveler here to show them true American food. Juan loves his job on the meat line and is awesome and always smiling- cash only!

xTbwHdSgPgCCI_Ok5Q-4TQ.review_text: I like their pastrami sandwiches.  Good beer selection, and they make a tasty rum punch.  If you like pickles (which I do) they have this big vat of tasty, zesty, spicy pickles which, essentially, are all you can eat.  Yes!!!  Also, really good mild or spicy mustard, and horseradish to adorn your freshly carved sandwich.

74DBh_FKOC-NPsKiT0cTYA.review_text: Meat is freshly cut as your sandwich is made.  Great Food!

wjcOzqMzVtVMN8I4hxLgmQ.review_text: Saw Tommy's on a episode of Triple D. Had to give it a shot!  ATMOSPHERE: Fun, casual atmosphere where all the decor seemed to fit. Parking was easy to find on a Thursday afternoon, can't speak to busier times. It's a little disorientating when you first walk in, but be patient and pick something off the menu that sounds good and you'll be just fine. Fun place for sure! 4 stars for atmosphere   FOOD: I had the Thursday Special Lamb Shank with Veg. Lamb was fall off the bone good, and you can choose between 1 or 2 shanks, I should have gotten 2 because it was that good. It was served with potatoes and carrots veg with a gravy poured over the top. Veg was cooked perfectly and gravy was about average. My buddy had the Pastrami sandy and said it was the best he ever had. Portions are bountiful and the price is such a value at $6.00 a sandwich.  SERVICE: It's self order deli style and the deli guys were cordial, there was a very picky lady in front of us requesting a few obscure items and they were very patient with her. Weird thing is you need to pay at the counter but order your drinks though the waitress? We didn't order beverages but it seemed a bit confusing?  Our waitress nonetheless was accommodating and friendly. 4 stars for service  OVERALL: Great place for some good grub. I could smell the meat once we got out of our car and I knew this was going to be a experience. Highly recommend to friends and will definitely be back!

4niAobfn_1haRE4EHYt4zQ.review_text: It's nostalgic - when my dad visits he loves Tommy's - and yes the lamb shank is savory... a delicious treat that leaves some dough in your pocket for other things...

4RUXeyp_Af2C5t9JFyJlBQ.review_text: 1400+ reviews. But I do have to add my two cents. It's packed. Pretty easy to find seats though actually. I ordered pastrami plate. Delicious. Felt so fat afterwards though. It's alright. nothing a little exercise can't fix.   Great place to get some cheap food, beer and hang out.   mashed potatoes were delicious!

38M__vAGqk9uJLK1dBr3QA.review_text: Loved Loved loved this place, there is something magical about this place, its open nice an late and the food is very good post drinking food. I can thank my girlfriend and Yelp for this discovery...

NyB7kpDW6bmKjy-vUr2AMQ.review_text: No bells and whistles at this place (thats what I like about it).  Great food and open late night.  I always get the brisket or pastrami dinner.  Hearty, stick to your bones kind of food.  Dig it...

qSdYgBZy_je29J3lFLdNkw.review_text: Based on food 5 stars.   The decor in this place is awesome! So many knick knacks. Me and my bf played I spy while we were eating. Lol.  They have really nice baristas but horrible...plate takers? We were so hungry and left our food on the trays. One cleaner upper asked for our trays (while we were eating) and we told him were eating. He left and another guy came out a minute later and asked again. My bf asked why they want our trays and they said it was policy to take trays...I thought it was rude. They had MANY trays and I saw a couple that was seated and had their food set by the same guy that told us it was policy to take trays!!! Really annoying. Minus one star.  I originally wanted the BBQ beef but saw the brisket and took that instead. After they set my plate I saw the BBQ beef and regret my order. So my bf took it.   The brisket was good. But the BBQ was flavorful. Both were tender but of course the BBQ was more tender.   The mash was good the gravy could be worked on.   I took the potato salad and my bf got beans. So fresh! The beans had a pickle taste to it so I didn't like it much.   The only thing I didn't like was the clam chowder. Way too thick and way too salty.  For all that food it was 23$ I believe. Can't wait to return.

zzw6StqjEhV03Kvr1hIX3g.review_text: This is the second place we have visited from Diners drive-ins and dives. And they both have been disappointing. The ambiance here was amazing and the location was easy to find but we ordered the Turkey dinner which the Turkey and mashed taters were good. But the gravy killed the meal. It was spiced with cloves of some kind and had a very nasty taste. Also being as it was Saturday the parking meters only stayed active for 30 mins. kinda bad when you have to leave your dinner to go refill the meter  1/2 through.

TsMbWyBjglirYu2cDD4c4A.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is a SF institution on Geary and Van Ness.  You can miss it for the colorful murals.  It's  heavy, hearty, inexpensive, and utterly unpretentious food.  Meat features prominently as do potatoes, rice, macaroni salad, cole slaw and the like--not for the health conscious or vegetarians.   Has a definite old fashioned Hoffbrau menu.   After giving up red meat for more than 20 years, I've take it up again and decided it was time for a roast beef sandwich.  For $6 you get a french roll with thickly sliced rare roast beef.  It kind of feels like Fred Flintstone food, very primal and filling.  I can't say that it was particularly good.  I think it may be another 20 years before I eat here again.

Fuo3Zlw9a2AIBTLru7RunQ.review_text: This was my first place I ate in San Francisco 20 years ago.  And not the last! Still going there once in a while.  Food is great and homie. Slices of ham, beef, turkey, chicken, etc.  Nice mash potato with a gravy.  Salads.  Everything yummy.  Drinks are great too and cheap!  $2.50 for a beer!  You can find any kind of beer in this joint.  I mean ANY from around the world.   Priced are excellent.  They accept only cash but the ATM is right by the door. Bravo!

oFsE7RwRdl_GPqI_fFDuEQ.review_text: Came here 130 pm on a Friday, no line! Awesome!   I'm from the Midwest, so been looking for a great BBQ place for a long time in California to no avail!  BBQ brisket was amazing! So tender, falls apart. Mashed potatoes weren't flavorful, simple run of the mill mashed potatoes (nothing I'd call home about), still pleasant to eat. Salad was normal, ranch was watery (average). Potato salad was also average. Holy crap the roll was so hard, my muscles were quivering trying to tear it apart!  Still great beef brisket! Yum!!!

QATTnxw4kmvjocvh-1mrOg.review_text: This is a place I would truly look forward to coming to again.  At lunch we passed by because it looked sort of like a bar (which it is not) and we are traveling with three kids.  However, it is kids friendly and we actually ordered family style.  The portions were impressive.  We got the Saturday rib special, the brisket, and the pastrami.  It was too much food.  My favorite was the Pastrami and cucumber salad which cut the richness of the meal.  It is cash only.  The hot mustard and horseradish were awesome at the table.  Best meal of the trip hands down.

wPpTh_Bbg8NAaUXtRG-xsg.review_text: Came here for a drink. Not getting dinner here will be a decision that will haunt me for the rest of my life.

XtxWzVmn9CbFnWQO5p3X8g.review_text: you know a place is good when each bite comes with a mmm..   The BBQ is amazing, the ribs melt in your mouth.. service is not too friendly, not unfriendly, it's just right. I've been here at 2am when it's packed..   but it was on this lovely laid back sunny San Francisco afternoon I felt compelled to give this place a 5 star shout out.   treat yourself

wb_N5rbsl-wXQHd0thlvJw.review_text: I'd give 5 but the wait staff takes their time too often for my taste. I couldve walked to the bar myself, ya know. The food is bitchin! Get a turkey sloppey Joe for 5 bucks and you're done! I've never ordered seafood but why would I when there's a giant leg of cow goodness staring at me?! mmmmm... cow goodness....

0oFwsICNyFoQFwGTpe19Vw.review_text: Oh Tommy, how i love you.. Let me count the ways. Came to this hole of goodness with my son on mother-son day as we saw it on DDD and yelp. Found street parking however they allow you to park at the movies for like $6. They are so quick so make sure you have your order ready. I got the turkey, mashed potatoes, salad and a roll and my son had the brisket sammy with chips. $16 and i had to unbutton my pants when i was done but no tums was needed for my old a$$. The wait staff was awesome... Plenty of seating and the food was the bomb! Prices were on hit.. I'm in love! See ya soon Tommy!

PJtohAOs_a6_ixjtTKe2ZQ.review_text: Tommy's is always great spot for late night dining, especially if you want to avoid Hell's (Mel's) Diner across the street.  I ordered the beef lasagne this past weekend, quantity for what you pay for is great. Quality is good, but not great. (I've had better). In the past, I've also ordered their sandwiches and dinner plates. I'm always a sucker for their pastrami and beef brisket. Their mac and cheese is pretty good too, but having too much is an overload for me. Then again, I've always had the problem where my eyes are bigger than my stomach, lol.  +1 San Francisco needs more hofbraus, Tommy's is the only place closest to my house that offers late-night hofbrau dining. +1 for their menu selections - I can never decide what I want since everything looks juicy.  -1 not the greatest hofbrau, I actually prefer Harry's Hofbrau over Tommy's. -1 parking around the area SUX BALLS.

ls9Z1mRQ9m4sYG4f-WzoUA.review_text: I was watching a movie at AMC Van Ness and afterwards my friend and I decided to try this place out. I always drive passed this place so we decided to give it a try. We got in line for the food counter and browsed the menu with a variety of sandwiches, dinner plates and grilled items. I ordered a pastrami sandwich and a couple side salads (potato salad & cole slaw). They also have a different daily special on each day of the way.  The pastrami sandwich was pretty good with a healthy portion of meat. They have a variety of sauces and I topped some spicy mustard and horseradish on it.  They have a full bar and at the time people were watching the Preakness Stakes. I ordered their irish coffee, which was $5, and it was on point. While we have to line up for food and carry our trays to the food there were staff who took our drink orders. We didn't need to bus our trays or anything.  Pretty solid time, I would go again. It would've been nice if they weren't CASH ONLY!

884jblxG71321Z6-pCTwsw.review_text: This place is awesome.   Did a search on DDD places one day in the city, and this turned up as being close by.  I had the pastrami, which I still have dreams about.  It was so awesome I don't even remember what the husband had, but I know he enjoyed his too.    Tommy's is so good I'm going to drag the husband to the city again just so we can have lunch here.

LdWIjNvjdaAoAfpQhT6F9w.review_text: Comfort food that I can inhale as emotions are exhaled. I eat here when I want to sit down and pour my heart out.   It's a late night spot with way too many options for the indecisive diner in me. Line up, stare at wall, check out the food in front of you, peruse the specials. It's a tough choice. Meatball sandwich and roast beef are tasty. Side of pasta - not very fulfilling. The chili looked good though.  Drinks sold separately. A waitress will swing by to take your order once you find yourself a seat.

CdElEjvPKd3Qy-W7iE0b7w.review_text: Another great greasy spoon. Cafeteria style, home cooked goodness of meats an sides galore. Our party had the Saturday special (ribs), brisket dinner, and a corned beef on sourdough. The sourdough and the corned beef took the award--Bf said "best corned beef I've had in my life"-- and his momma really does make a mean corned beef. It was so good, I didn't even add the mustard that is on the tables (though I tasted)--and it was good mustard! In little jars! The hot mustard was especially yummy. The ribs did indeed fall off the bone. The brisket was good, but nothing spectacular.   We ended up here because bf wanted mashed potatoes. I am happy his hankering led us here!   Also--CASH ONLY! Bring $$ or be sad.

zpLyM0YD2mK7rf4JGhz-3Q.review_text: Great quality and price a long time favorite however service has been compromised in recent years and the favor of the "American" cuisine is a bit bland. But all in all definitely a worthwhile experience.  I wouldn't go there everyday nor would I detour one's SF tour to visit this spot but nonetheless, it is fairly priced and the ambiance is nice.   Keep in mind it is one of the few cash only establishments that have yet to be audited by the IRS.

OQImub6evGiBTwpQmoVUjA.review_text: Great cafeteria spot for die-hard carnivores.  Order by sight if you can't make sense of the 50+ menus scattered around the walls and hanging above your head. One bonus point for lights bright enough to read by and a chilled out vibe that says you'd be welcome here with a big book to go with your plate of meat and your big can of Strongbow.  That's right, Strongbow.  Thank you Tommy's.

sPCr1IwzvPDL6Qu5nkrDig.review_text: Great food (BBQ) and beer selection at very reasonable prices - just gets a bit crowded during meal rush times.

WGXK155z8-QnqJ6iDeWNtQ.review_text: Another fun place to get a great sandwich, I grabbed a roast beef on sourdough for the plane ride home.  Very good

e1ypByHp7-KvZwPBfXNoxg.review_text: I've been in and around SF for the past 30 years and have always wanted to eat at Tommy's Joynt but have somehow never gotten around to it until today. Since I'm moving to Tennessee next month, I seized the opportunity to eat lunch there at 2:15 pm.  The outside is happily decorated with festive art work depicting food and patrons and is inviting enough. After my 30 minute visit, I can agree that a classy place it's not --- it truly is a Joynt, and a tired, rundown Joynt at that.  Upon entering this dimly lit establishment, I saw a long bar on the left with an impressive list of foreign and domestic brews. To the right, a Hof Brau style serving station. It wasn't very busy; only six folks sat at the bar and another ten were in the front dining room.  I ordered a pastrami sandwich and the meat looked terrific. The server cut several generous sized slices and then put them directly onto a plain French roll. No mayo, mustard, sauerkraut or anything -- just a plain roll with meat.   Now it's been said that man cannot live by bread alone, there must also be condiments. I got him to put some Swiss cheese on top, but that was it.   I moved to the next station and ordered a bowl of fruit and a diet pepsi.   To my dismay, the man who served up my fruit was also my cashier and didn't even stop to wash his hands. If that wasn't bad enough, I sat in full view of the serving line and for the 30 minutes I sat there eating my lunch, never once did this man wash his hands even though he was very much involved with the serving and plating of the food.  When I ordered my "sandwich" I was told that the "waitress" would bring my drink. Never once did she acknowledge my presence. I guess that's why she is called a wait-ress.  After eating, I went to the restroom to wash my hands and face and as I walked up the stairs, I was disgusted by the filthy carpet that very well could be the original carpet from 1947 when this place opened. They were dirty and had enough grease on them to lube a rental fleet at an airport.  The men's restroom was equally dirty. I don't think anyone has cleaned the corners of the floor in years. I guess no one here has heard of good old soap, water and elbow grease.  The pastrami was terrific, but everything else was a resounding thumbs down. At least I'll not be missing this place when I move eastward.

oBdOvorTDDky6zGINg3SOA.review_text: Very disappointing. Nothing special at all. I asked the gentleman what is the different between the smoked meet and the pastrami, he replied "the seasoning". Sorry sir, your meet has no seasoning at all. Serving plate was not clean, as was the silverware.

fx3_UtZdwGy3p8Gn3fmMyQ.review_text: some of the grossest food i've ever had the misfortune of tasting!  i've given this spot a few tries- since some of my friends are really into it. it is never my idea to go to Tommy's. this city has so many damn good places for good inexpensive chow and Tommy's is def not one of them.  i've eaten good hof brau over the years but Tommy's is something else. the meat is always over cooked mush....the salad is a poor excuse for veggies.  they do give really big portions though but who wants a really big portion of shit?

memc4lvcz5bshtBnY0wZnQ.review_text: The Rolls Royce of dive bars! Good beer, friendly staff and amazing sandwich. Nothing but my best recombinations!

slJlxDoPjUc5VPKjD2O3oA.review_text: Decent sandwiches, I had the prime rib and it was delicious. It's CASH ONLY and if you know me with my fraud background you know I hate CASH ONLY places.  Other than that, if you want a divy joint with good food this is the place.

yZxRl6Wp2ZSLv0Eeu9favA.review_text: Great meats of many kinds. The sides, however, are nothing special.

sIr9BQJ8eNaJNe1svVrI3g.review_text: Tommys Joynt is for a certain type of person, a hungry-ass person who is not worried about their diet today.  With their wide variety of beers on tap and Thanksgiving-dinner menu of carved meats, mashed potatoes and delicious gravy, you'll regret that you didn't wear your viking helmet today.  I stopped in for lunch a few weeks ago and first off, the atmosphere has a sweet antiquity like McSorley's in NY.  It's been around since 1947 so the walls and high ceiling (there's a 2nd floor in the back) are collaged with relics from Americana.  I got a Pastrami sandwich with chips and an Anchor Steam beer.  The sandwich comes with a little container of thin gravy which is amaaaaazing.  I kept pouring it in the sandwich with every bite, not to mention adding the zesty hot mustard available on the table.  The pastrami was good, pretty dry by itself thus the gravy, but plentiful and in a considerably thick roll which soaked up the gravy beautifully.  I came in another time w/ another friend pretty close to 2am and we had the drunk munchies.  Of course this is the PERFECT place for that.  This time we shared a sandwich w/ stuffing in a pool of gravy, and it was ridiculously satisfying, so much so that we got another order of the stuffing.  My friend was like "uh oh, now that I know about this place I'm going to keep coming back on nights like this"  Don't apologize for what you eat here, back it up with a fresh beer and kiss your biceps.

-vo7sXoJqX_SfebpYw0geA.review_text: Came here the other night for dinner and tried the pastrami sandwich with a side of cucumber salad.  The pastrami was the best pastrami i've ever had and all for under $5.  The only thing is I ordered it on wheat and its just plain slices of wheat bread with the thick slices of pastrami in between with a side of au jus.  No veggies or anything else so thats why I give it only 4 stars.  I like my pastrami sandwich with veggies.  There is mustard bottles you can use to dress it up and pickles.  The cucumber salad was just okay.  It didnt leave me feeling full but satisfied.  I tried a bit of their whole turkey leg and that was pretty good.  I also had a bite of the lasagna of the day and it wasn't bad either.  I'd come back just for the pastrami!  Yum!

5zkoQoTRT1ciHXlilgDcvQ.review_text: Yes.  The food was awesome and the atmosphere was relaxed.  I had the BBQ turkey sloppy Joe with mashed potatoes.  It was crazy bigger than I expected but it was also crazy delicious.  The food was hot and fresh.  Not only that it's also a bar and alcohol is always delicious.

3xsmXxDysn5yqflq3AzWKQ.review_text: I just made friends with a BBQ Turkey Sloppy Joe Sandwich.  I'd never even heard of such a thing.  Man, it wish it didn't take me 29 years to find this.  The entire time I was eating it, my friend kept telling me he didn't believe there was turkey in there.  It was just that unbelievable.  The other observation I had here this time around:  I am completely entertained by just waiting in line at this place.  To tell you the truth, I don't think I've even been so entertained by waiting in line.  Their posted menu consists of about 30 different signs that each have like 3 different menu items.  The signs are haphazardly strewn about the entire wall behind the serving line, and every sign looks different.  It fills me with a glee to just stand in line and read each sign, and somehow conquer the task of figuring out what to eat.  It's just so fun!

7nse8pveJImlw85AmSg0pg.review_text: order your food and step to the left. this place always gives me the soup nazi feel but what can you say their sandwiches are awesome.  always go for the pastrami on the roll... add swiss please, with a side of potato salad or stuffing  large pitchers and lots of beer choices.  OPEN TILL 2AM  CASH ONLY!!

8JtTm7QOUbQkEa7M0scOjw.review_text: This deli has the charm of a native restaruant without any forced sophistiction about it. The joynt has the charm reminiscent of an east coast deli, complete with declisiouly signature sides. Taste is not compromised, full flavor will prove to satisfy the most sophisticated palate searching for the perfect immigrant inspired american classic. The Pastrami sandwich was beautifully authentic.

_bF7I69OrJtLQPTsWZMNqQ.review_text: After hearing so much about this place, I came on Saturday evening to check it out. Walking in, I was like, "Am I still in SF"?, the decor here is off the wall, making me feel as if I'm in the back roads of some small town.   The food: Ordered the dinner plate with Beef Brisket. Let me tell you, I'm a big beef eater. I wasn't a fan of the sauce they put on the brisket so I was glad when I told them "only a little" since I've never tried it before.   I like the low key feel of the place. But I also feel like it's just any other Hof Brau style eats. No complaints here. But I wasn't a huge fan as I thought I would be.

scMje76n_lfrhEf5ZzLefQ.review_text: What a great atmosphere! I went with a large group of people to try this place out for the first time, and I was definitely satisfied when I left.  I had the chefs suggestion and went with the BBQ beef brisket.... Mmmm Mmmm Mmmm.  Along with the meal I had the stout on tap... *Devils something*, another great choice.  If you're in the area and have a hankering for the taste of a home cooked meal, this is the place to go.

RugiruRsLxooWa5aE5Z5lg.review_text: Open late with lots of cuts of different meats = Good late night find. CASH ONLY.

av7_yhfvfZVLEKmIomEZsA.review_text: You feel you are sitting in the middle of SF history at Tommy's Joynt. We really like the dinner choices here. I love the roast beef...hubby loves the turkey. There's something for everyone here.  The side "salads" could be a little more flavorful. Also, the waitstaff could be better at bringing you initial drinks and refills  - I find myself with a dry glass everytime I go there.   But for the price $21 bucks - this place is a place we find ourselves at least once a month. Be sure to bring cash. Vagrants outside are super annoying. Not what I would consider family friendly.

Pnws4Zz4Xw_tpfjE7c3BOQ.review_text: If I could, I would write a book on this place so I'll keep is short and sweet. This is my definition of 1 a.m. comfort food. Get the pastrami, put hot mustard on it, enjoy. Enough said.

dH1YHuBdJZaUkZcTiNDZYQ.review_text: I have been meaning to try this place since I walked by and smelled the amazingness that is Tommy's. I almost want to give them five stars for the smell which is FANTASTIC. Who needs appetizers when it smells that good?  I came here after work with a friend from college and I had a great time. There was no line at 7 which surprised me because I know it is pretty popular. I really wanted to try the buffalo sandwich but I tried the corned beef plate because it is so popular and I could also get mashed potatoes and baked beans. It was $10.04 after tax and that is pretty damn good for such generous portions of high quality food. The style here is order, pay, sit, and relax which I really enjoyed. I got to talk with my friend for a few hours and no one was trying to kick us out or bother us.  The baked beans were a little under cooked and the bread was a little hard but they both tasted good and rounded out the deliciously salty corned beef and nicely mashed potatoes with gravy.  I will hopefully come back and try the buffalo sandwich and upgrade them to five stars.

wKq30kYS60VvsCFxNH46Cw.review_text: Man oh Man oh Man!!! The food here was incredible to say the very least and rather cheap compared to all the other places I had gone. I loved the atmosphere they had going on and even though the line was a bit long it moved extremely fast!

JPjiiUSyHL8Mhtap-chOQw.review_text: This place is bomb, cheap, huge portions of sexy meat n sides.

qI1VGXdutR1S5cnf9Ev0oA.review_text: This place is the anti-yuppie place of SF.  Feels old school, smells old school, food is old school. That's all good. Too bad the place sucks.  Seriously, this is like school cafeteria food in a bad dive bar.

emF8KqAfI2VL6Sfaek9gFg.review_text: If you're a local to the city and make the mistake of writing this place off as a gawdy, mediocre tourist attraction, you will miss out on some of the juiciest, most tender corned beef around--not to mention the cheapest!  Given the choice, if I had to pick a post-party, afterhours spot for some grub in the area, I'd go with Tommy's. Mel's Diner is directly across the street (and somehow even MORE flashy than Tommy's) but I hate Mel's and only ever go there if forced. While Tommy's certainly has its own degree of kitsch to it (the interior is a mix between a quirky neighborhood dive and a cafeteria), I'll take cheap meat and 100 imported beer options over bright flourescent lights and angry servers dressed as 50's sock-bop diner employees (see, you'd be mad too) any day.  The mistake I usually make when coming here is to order near the thrifty end of the menu--forgetting that the most expensive dinner item is only like 12 bucks! I end up only picking at my buffalo chili and rice, while I covet, and eventually borrow, bits of my friend's corned beef, mash potatoes and gravy. Be spendy here! You'll still walk out with a heavy wallet (plus a higher knowledge of Greek beer).

vhDsTttoL-KVPb6ODvFGXA.review_text: Just go, the review is irrelevant. Stop reading, and just GO. RIGHT NOW.  ...You're still here. I see you're going to need some more convincing. Good, good, I would want to hear more information as well. You're in for it then, because I got plenty to say about this Joynt.  Let me start off by saying that there is truly little I love more than good food, good beer, and good company. You'll have to supply your own company (or talk to yourself or whatever), but Tommy's Joynt has the good food and good beer covered.  I wrote in another recent review of mine that the Spanish 'meal' known as tapas are supposed to be small, cheap dishes so that one never drinks on an empty stomach. Tommy's Joynt genuinely is the closest thing I have found to an American tapas bar.  The way it works is you order and pay for your food at the counter, then take a seat and a server takes your drink order. Trust me, it's going to take you a good few minutes to decide what you want to eat, especially if it's your first time there. It's all laid out and prepared right in front of you, very much in the style of an old-world type deli. The prices are low and the proportions are large.   I've been to Tommy's Joynt a few times, and again just yesterday. In the past, my eyes have been bigger than my stomach and I ordered much more food than I could actually handle. I go by a general 1-item rule now. Yesterday, I had the kielbasa sausage sandwich and my girlfriend got the Monday special, which was braised ox tail with buttered noodles. The sausage sandwiches are a great idea: surprisingly simple, surprisingly cheap, surprisingly tasty, and surprisingly filling. The sauce that comes with the sandwich is what MAKES it. I'm no foodie, so my abstract description of it is syrup meets gravy meets a little gelatin? I probably made it sound weird, but believe me, it's fuckin' BOMB.  When we took our seats, we had a very charismatic server named Isabella who actually taught me how to eat the sandwich. I'm not the type to say, "piss off, I eat how I eat," I will gladly take a reccomendation from someone of expertise on how to eat something, especially the way she went about it. Acting almost like she was my mother, she brought me a plate of pickle slices and a bowl which she poured the sauce in. She told me to pile pickles on top of the sandwich and dip it into the sweet and savory sauce. God DAMN was she right! I have seen the light now. I couldn't even eat the whole thing and it was like $3.25. Totally awesome, right? And that ox tail my girlfriend had was seriously unreal, I've never tried ox tail before and it was something you need to try to believe.  They have mac and cheese too. I LOVE mac and cheese.  I haven't even gotten to the beer! Their bottle selection is very extensive, and their draft selection is a respectable dozen. My girlfriend and I ordered a small pitcher of Trumer Pils this time because it's delicious and less filling. Pint prices are $4.50, which is ehhhh. Not bad, not great. The small pitcher was $13, and I think it was a good value. Not Zeitgeist cheap, but still a good deal.  I highly recommend checking this place out. Cash only, and they have an ATM .

x-i8n-WW7YHrhRrPHos75A.review_text: Tommy's Joynt... ohhh Tommy's Joynt. As a kid I was all about the open face rare roast beef sandwich with mashed potatoes and lots of gravy. As an adult im all about... the open face rare roast beef sandwich with mashed potatoes and lots of gravy. Seriously, though, Ive branched out a bit and everything is so good. This is a San Francisco culinary landmark. Good for lunch, dinner, late night drunken engorgement... Lots of choices, food and beer, and everything for a good price. As a neighborhood spot the clientele is what you would expect: cops, pimps, clubbers, old men, sports fans, and people like me trekking across the bay for a taste of something special.

gDnCUfo0IT_hDl85Vr-h5Q.review_text: If you want a lot of good, family style food for a reasonable price with an amazing dose of history, Tommy's Joynt is the place to go!  The restaurant is "cafeteria style" with hand carved meats like turkey, roast beef, beef brisket, ribs and corned beef; all of which is very good with generous portions. You are not likely to leave hungry!  This place has some beer and other signs in it that have not seen light of day for many, many years--and in some cases, the beer brewery doesn't even exist any more. Very neat place, my family and I love it.  It is very easy to imagine that you are being transported back fifty years in time when you are in Tommy's.  Tip:  Bring cash, no credit or ATM cards accepted!

AeA9A189v8D9evGXhqtyFg.review_text: Came here on  a monday night and this place was packed. there is always a long line out the door. i had the BBQ beef brisket with the steamed peas and mash and a side of mushroom salad. everything tasted great except that steamed peas... it was over cooked, maybe because it just sits in that hot boiler tray .. anyways a cool place on thing i would like to mention is that they are quite messy with their meets.. theres really no containers for ham or the beef.. it all just kinda served on a big boiler thingy with the juice kinda spilling over the other BUT FOOD TASTS GREATTTT

kWMqvz7DFnFd4z28Y9TGfg.review_text: I went to Tommy's Joynt with a bunch of friends after a rather disappointing Christmas street light fair. Although the day sucked, I ended the night happy because of this place. I ordered the round of beef sandwich and for a brief moment I felt like I was in a college dining common....I ordered my sandwich and received it on a tray. The only difference was that I had to pay for this one.  The sandwich was SO good. Tender, juciy meat on a nice roll....what more could I ask for? It was so juicy I felt like a lion eating a zebra. Thats if lions ate zebras between 2 pieces of bread. It could have also been for the fact that I accident soaked my entire sandwich in sauce but I'm pretty sure it would've been great just plain.  If you want to feel like a true secondary consumer feasting on lower primary consumers then Tommy's Joynt is the place to go. It's the perfect date spot too if your a guy because you can show the girl your manly carnivore side.

c6tDecYh9dRp1jfC9-bSyQ.review_text: Got a bbq brisket sandwich and I almost died and went to heaven. It was so good that I went back for a second one. Bad decision. Second sandwich was a lot drier and tougher. I guess it all depends on which cut you get. Three stars for inconsistency.

zPEQAF0SlMC6dSG-y7J34Q.review_text: It was around 9pm on Sunday night, but still many people were enjoying their dinner at Tommy's Joynt. We ordered a Turkey Sloppy Joe from the "Today's Special" menu. The Turkey Sloppy Joe was excellent. It had a lot of chuck of Turkey meat with a mild sweet sauce and mashed potato also came with it. It was a rather light dish( was perfect for a late dinner). In addition, not only the taste was very good but also it was only $4.95!  Can't beat that.  We also ordered buffalo stew. That was also delicious!  This restaurant was founded in 1947, I believe. It has quite interesting interior. I saw a poster of Asahi beer from maybe in 1970s,

-02_VompCxhW4vLmeCtccw.review_text: Amazing!! Pretty much hands down best place to eat at in the city!! Great quick service and food taste amazing! Full bar so what's there to complain!!! Love it!!!

WPJhoQF8O2pFoiJXbMdYLw.review_text: BBQ Turkey Sloppy Joes...nuff said.  Seriously though, for like $4.25, you get a fat open-faced turkey sandwich and a sizeable portion of mashed potatoes on the side.  I've been there at least 3 times and have yet to try anything else, but if the sloppy joes are any indication then I'm sure the rest of the food is just as good.  Just make sure you have cash, because they don't accept cards and you'll get stuck with a $3 ATM fee if you have to use the one there.

FG70BeGJuwMm7vWVJUkGwA.review_text: Solid place for meats and even more importantly, a good stiff drink. A massive selection of imported and domestic beers, plus all the cocktails you want.  Mixed crowd, lot's of older dudes, hipsters, TL denizens, the occasional yuppie and civilians stopping in before they go see a movie at the AMC. in short, a diverse crowd.  Metallica has  a deep and legendary connection to the spot as well. So get the low down on that from the bartender if possible.  Two TV's in the front, plus there's a back room with some more space and tables.  not a spot for people who like veggies

XmsYOTZIpq-ZLyNnGtgjgw.review_text: Great establishment with a long history.  This is one of SF's landmark eateries which was featured on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives!!

hCwRpP6nTS0HM6r8Tya9Nw.review_text: I passed out drunk in here the other night.  I was woken up by a sore infested pile of crap who said it was time for a smoke break.  Who are you?  I asked this feces smelling man/woman.  "Name's o' Harris."  I took out a baseball bat and struck him.  His blood hit my hand and it melted off.  I'm a cripple now and probably have the A.  The madman is still out there.  If you ever go into the Yellow Teeth and see a 34 pound A infested pile of sh_t.  Turn and run.  I beg you.  Turn and run.  Oh yeah, Tommy's has awesome food.

KdDLBUJul0e8Hqw0_ztXLQ.review_text: This place is a Triple D fav and proved to be an awesome find. Food is caferteria style and the place is full of eclectic items. We ordered the corned beef and pastrami sandwiches with a side of buffalo chili to go. The corned beef was home made tasting, cut thick and flaky. The pastrami was cured to perfection, thick, juicy and so delicious. Both the sandwiches were prepared on some delicious freshly baked San Francisco sour dough bread. So great. The chili was similar to beef chili but the buffalo has a more beefy taste and it was rich. This is one of the best sandwich places and is a real San Francisco gem.

RMS-_Z0JWmYw0u5JtEI8MA.review_text: Any meat you want, and it is sliced to perfection for you.  Every meat there is incredible, juicy and flavorful.    Cash Only.    Everyone goes there and it is always crowded, but the food makes up for the cramped environment.

J0ochILMvbWzg-T3K5knGA.review_text: Interesting set up. Food so-so, drinks good, service decent, decor eclectic, atmosphere family style. Overall, it's not worth the hype. But wasn't horrible either. They feature BBQ which really isn't that good, maybe in SF but not for this Midwestern girl!

xupIYrEgJHC7hkEx8KDQCw.review_text: 350 reviews for Tommy's Joynt, what can I possibly add? I think if you skim down the page, you'll see that this is a no-nonsense Hof Brau, serving big meat and steam table sides. Perfectly. The food seems unchanged since 1950. Which means if you were expecting Gary Danko, you will not like it. If you know what a Hof Brau is, you will love it.   I mean, the food here is so bad I have never seen it without a line. There is a constant flow of happy customers who obviously don't know they're getting terrible food.   Besides being a great Hof Brau, I think it'd be a great place to take a date you weren't sure about yet. If they turn up their nose at Tommy's, cut your losses.

zGnetV2r8BoQvSBcXwakJA.review_text: Can this Place actually get better and better every time I come in. YES!

z0HiuDcai8S-2oPV9J9sIA.review_text: Heaven at a cheap price. I fucking love tommys joynt....but I am in love with their corned beef. Always been a meat lover since i was young and man this place blows my mind. The turkey leg or wing (whatever its called) is so good too. I usually get corned beef with rice and cabbage and a side veggie salad (tomato, cucumber, onion). I'm FULL after and I didn't pay a shit load for my meal. My tummy is happy and Im happy. A WIN-WIN situation. Only problem I had was finding parking , which can get quite annoying....but other than that this place is great. GOOD PORTIONS, and staff is always happy and friendly!

ngDArMA5Xw-RG1obpp_ccQ.review_text: Good food in not the most convenient location.

3aTVeGFq_s3KuGcVXCNquA.review_text: TIP #1: The line is long, but it moves quickly.  TIP #2: There's a small fee for take-out orders, probably to offset the cost of to-go containers.   I have long been intrigued by Tommy's Joynt. First, it was the loud, colorful mural on the outside of the restaurant, a welcome splash of unabashed color amid boarded up buildings in the Tenderloin. Second, it was the scent--that sweet, sweet scent of BBQ meat wafting through the air as I walk down Van Ness after work. When the air is right, it smells like there's a cookout going on.   That scent caused a craving that could only be satisfied by actually stepping inside. Upon entering, I was transported into an old-timey cabin-tavern of sorts, complete with a jumble of framed photos and art on the wall. There's a bar and large, picnic-style tables right in the front, and booths for parties of 3 or more in the back. The menu is prominently displayed behind the counter where you order your food.   I knew from the scent that the food would be good--it was just a matter of narrowing down my choices! All options sounded hearty and, judging by the size of the meat-carving station, worth the money. I passed up the plates in favor of the beef sandwich. What a big, no-nonsense sandwich: the six or seven thick-cut slices of juicy, tender beef made me question my choice of flimsy whole wheat bread. Good thing my sandwich was cut in half for me--just the sheer weight of the meat probably would have made the whole thing fall apart! The BBQ sauce was thin but flavorful; it came on the side so I could control how saucy each bite was. From start to finish, it was a great sandwich.   My boyfriend ordered the beef plate, which came with a little more beef than was in my sandwich, a hard dinner roll, and a couple of sides. Stick to the sandwich--it's quick, easy to eat, and highly satisfying!

ch3SPVL4vUPdrCB2FW09YQ.review_text: Elevated cafeteria food.  I like the knick knack, bric a brac decor, but I can't find much to eat here. However, I've noticed that anyone with a set of testes seems to really enjoy the place.

RhB-Ts8LaP-NYIHTV5gbUA.review_text: yummy corned beef and pastrami.  Impecable international bottle selection.  Ok draft selection.  The place itself is cool with old beer signs, low lighting odd deli/bar bar.  I dig it.  I will go back.  It is neat.

8lN2U-Rfk11FOZ-u-vxntA.review_text: Nice place to go after the movie. Something simple but good.

NFngndOE7qtG9h9FgSIyJA.review_text: Had to give this 5 stars just for the character itself.  Love the interior... everything's old and interesting.  This place has so much history.  .....and the food!  good size servings at a very affordable price.  I will definitely be going back next time I visit.

_cB_0BNWc5_VMI1JjgP-OA.review_text: This is the place! When you are in the mood for delicious meats go to Tommy's. End of story. open late, cash only, simple and good.  My mom came here when she was a kid, and my grandfather came here when he was a teenager. Bottom line, quality last a lifetime!  $10 will have you leaving with leftovers :)

4R1kC0H_O2obG4reluJ8yg.review_text: I can see this spot becoming a regular place I go to. The portions are generous, the pricing is good, parking kind of sucks. I loved the Brisket, it was just soo lick your fingers delicious. The mashed potatoes were creamy yet not too salty. I ended up going back the next day and tried the roast beef, I was not as impressed, it was still good though.    Beer selection was plentiful, a collection of international favs.  Lastly, the horseradish was the best I've ever had.

lzBBxfeZnvgFm5xjVqWQ6A.review_text: A San Francisco institution and my ALL time favorite restaurant, tommy's joynt never fails to deliver. I once ate here twice in one day on thanksgiving.  It's like Picadilly having a three way with a deli and a dive bar. endless list of beers, AWESOME soups,salads meats, etc.  You've got to see it to believe it. If/When i ever go back to San Francisco, this will be my first stop.

ccDcDMSywHuy8UXuhOqzuA.review_text: GREAT AT WHAT IT IS  The place: noisy if not boisterous, but in a friendly way--your basic cafeteria with a good bar and beer selection, an SF tradition, literally unchanged since I first ate here in 1973.  The food: very good BBQ beef brisket dinner, turkey dinner, and inexpensive   The service: polite and efficient---in a cafeteria it's all about throughput

BG4sJSZcc2Z_vqXQ1kBK6w.review_text: This place is a staple in S.F. The braised lamb shank and the buffalo stew are out of this world! If you haven't gone there yet, you're really missing out.

L1tiYnSgH85hUTVbGd4auw.review_text: Eh - I must have been there on a bad day.  The ambiance is fun, the food is very mediocre.  I had the BBQ brisquit with a side of slaw and green beans.  The BBQ was "ok" - but nothing to get excited about.  Similar for the slaw.  The green beans tasted like they came out of a can... about a month ago.  The rolls were rock hard and were not tasty.  Looks like it might be a fun place to have a beer and watch a ball game, but I wouldn't go there for the food.  Also - no brownie points for "cash only".

rCuwJGuD21T3CG3cU8ps_A.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is the O.G. of all SF hole in the walls (LOL)! Its the SHIT. They will definately have something that will fill your tummy and wont hurt your pockets.

eoiKkHye1DOp-TDEClLe4A.review_text: I've only ate here once. It was around Thanksgiving and if I recall correctly, they were having some kind of Thanksgiving Dinner special. Well, I strolled in one day since it was so close to Zappos and got hooked up with a Turkey Dinner.   While it wasn't the most impressive Thanksgiving Dinner, I thought it was good. The mashed potatoes definitely needed some work. They tasted like they were out of the box. The gravy tasted the same. The turkey however, was utterly delicious, very juicy and cooked perfectly.  I'd go for another round if I'm in the area around Thanksgiving. Hopefully the potatoes are better now! I should mention the last time I ate here was probably in 2003, so things might have improved.

VD8Ox-akHloK3-QV3FxY-g.review_text: I'm trying to write this before the meat/carb coma kicks in.  Among some people, this is known as the "itis".  If you're not sure what I'm talking about, watch the boondocks.  anyway.......I love a good hof brau.  This meets the bill.  The mashed potatoes were yummy, the pastrami was good, but he did include some burnt bits.   This is not a fancy pants sandwich.  Mine came with..........pastrami and bread.  If you want salad, they have a green salad, and slaw.  This is not a good place for a vegetarian, or a vegan, because it seems like there's meat in the air.  You order drinks either at the bar or from a waitress.

MDsO-PrVw7GqB6cN9ye4zQ.review_text: First of all, Tommy's Joynt is the kind of place that doesn't give a fuck if you don't like it and/or the food. To me that's part of the appeal. They have been doing the same thing for almost 100 years and it's been working out pretty well for them I'd say. Second, don't be an idiot. Order the BBQ brisket plate with beans and a draft beer and you will go home happy and full, guaranteed.

7pLAHP6GqM3tUBCc5ME8EQ.review_text: Finally made it in here. Stood in line at the counter, ordered a turkey sloppy joe which came with mashed potatoes, paid at the register, picked up some pickles and found a seat. A waitress came by to take drink orders- Mmm ginger ale. My sandwich was ok. I like the beef brisket more so. I definitely have to try other menu items that everyone raves about. So until then, happy yelping!

EmizCaxieR0gMw0a2hBn6g.review_text: The dude pulled out a fresh batch of BBQ Brisket! Awesome! Thank you!  I had: - BBQ Brisket Dinner platter - Mashed Taters - Tossed greens - cheese cake  BBQ sauce and gravy was sweet but brisket was juicy, tender, hands down food comma starter.  two huge dinner platter and only $23. Not mad at that!

iVDnD7KNbKzOI6zS-x7ayg.review_text: So ya kinda low on the dough. And you kinda looking for cheap eats past 12 am. Well then Tommy's s the place. Dude... there Brisket is cut to order ...a whole Turkey is roasted every night. There Burgundy beef is not authentic but it is their version which is excellent.  And there house pickles are excellent.  There is no waiter...just get in line order..get a table and enjoy a meal that is under 10 bucks.

2B8pBuPK-nD7gVGJTaWOjw.review_text: They have a bucket of "serve-yourself-pickles". 'nuff said

81dnAuKMBHESd63ynEBVjw.review_text: Tried this place because it was featured on the Food Network. Disappointed by the food quality and cleanliness. Had the corned beef and cabbage, too salty. My son had the roast beef sandwich, tough as leather. Ordered the roast turkey plate for my daughter, turkey was delicious.   This is the type of place you go to if you like straight up meat and potatoes and large portions on the cheap.  Just expected so much more after watching Guy Fiere raving about the food.  BTW......this place is cash ONLY!!!!

I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg.review_text: A classic dive bar in San Francisco!  They serve up the most delectable and competitive prices for grub food in the center of San Francisco!    They offer mustard on the side and it goes well with the entrees that they offer!  The hot mustard does open your palate up because it has that wasabi taste to it! Corned Beef and their Turkey Leg plate, is what I would order!  I like their Vinegarette Salad - it went well with the provided meat!  It is a historical place - tourists, locals and day to day workers would go here to check this spot out and dine here!    The ambiance is very full of bar decor and metal plates imprinted all around.  Homely and historic, endearingly!

y-xnIeYdLh0HlPws6_wYgg.review_text: Why is the bread so hard?  We were not impressed the first time we went here. After watching Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-ins and Dive show, we wanted to give it another try, hoping that we might just fall in love with the place.  First Time (To Go): -Meatballs & Spaghetti ($6.75): meh...bleh...the spaghetti was overcooked and sitting in a heated container. The sauce was like from a jar and the meatballs were just meatballs. Bold statement but I think I make better meatballs!!!  -Meatball Sandwich ($4.25): meh...bleh...the bf was not a fan. Same opinion as mine, he didn't like the sauce. He also didn't like the bread--he is big on bread!   If I remember correctly, both of us didn't finish our food...  Second Time (Eat-in): -BBQ Brisket of Beef Meal ($8.99): We both had the same thing. It came with a small salad, a side of mashed potatoes, and a dinner roll. 1) The Brisket of Beef-it was full of fat, especially the plate my bf got. For the parts we could eat, it was tender and tasty with the BBQ sauce. 2) Side Salad: Probably the best part of the whole meal because nothing was done to it! 3) Mashed Potatoes: Wow...not impressed. It tasted like something out of those ready-to-eat mashed potatoes mix you get from supermarket. The bf can make it better! 4) Dinner Roll: Please see my first sentence.  To be honest, I'm kind of intimated to order food here. The menu is one of those posted on the wall (not a fan) so you will have to order while standing in line . They were also scattered around on the wall and I felt pressure to order quickly.  Over all, I'm just not impressed. I would give the place 2 Stars if weren't for the booth table and the tasty meat smell I can sniff from outside.  Will i go back...that is a good question. Maybe third time's the charm?!

2MPTbMgbVCwUClgCKP75MA.review_text: Been here plenty of times and am always leaving satisfied. Usually get the plates but decided to get the big sandwich bbq beef which was great. Bread is somewhat dry but the meat is always great and fresh. Another great thing about tommys is their drink selection, over 100 beer options as well as full bar. Always have a great time here.

1GYWtrgcniwM6LOubrp4Sw.review_text: Absolutely phenomenal.   This is a great restaurant for a late night bite (I think that place stays open until about 3am). Its always busy, which, if anything, adds to the thriving vibe of the restaurant. The decor is campy and tacky but in the best possible way. Strong A for ambiance, but the FOOD is what really makes the place. A+.   I really love the brisket, but everything else I've tried - ham, salmon, sausage sandwich - are phenomenal as well. Make sure to try the baked beans and potato salad! These are among my favorites, but it seems that you really can't go wrong at this place whatever you order.   If you're interested in the bar scene, this place is pretty solid as well. Not, most likely, somewhere I'd go just for drinks, but they've got a decent beer selection to accompany your heavenly meal.   Great place for a second date;) its a fun place, messy meal, and delicious food.   Highly recommended.

nW4POvJR2MqjU90mnNPqvA.review_text: Oh Tommy.... how you get me.  You know how i like my ribs and you know i like my turkey leg too.  Oh boy.. oh boy.  I can still taste it.  I have been passing by Tommy's for years and every time i have passed it.... i never thought it could be a restaurant.  but after watching an episode of Diners, Drive In and Dives... i had to try this place.  And then I looked up the reviews on yelp and saw the photo of the outside of the place.  The light bulb went off and i knew exactly where this place was.    I had the spareribs (the special for the night) and they were perfect.  Not to tangy and fall off the bone.  Soooo yummy.  Also has the potato salad and coleslaw... not exactly what i'm used to.  I hate to admit it but i do love Kfc's super sugary cole slaw...  So i guess i can say i'm a little indifferent about those.   The next time I went there i decided against the special and to get the turkey leg... since the last time i went they were all sold out.  I must say... it was quite yummy.  With the gravy and stuffing... makes my mouth water a little just thinking about it.    You really do have to love cafeteria style food... i like when watching people cut and scoop up my food.  I'm the kind of person that likes to see what shes going to get before she orders it.  Oh and don't forget your free pickles!

9huVwvm0Qii-cw7sbrH07Q.review_text: yuuuuuuuuuuuum when i first came here with my boyfriend and some friends, I was a little intimidated on how to order, so i just got a turkey sandwich, which was the best turkey sandwich ever! The bread is sooooo fresh and the turkey was moist.  I tried everyones sides and I am usually not a fan of coleslaw, but tommy's coleslaw was the best i have ever had!!!!

MGK7RSZhjk0_F8xbi5S-7g.review_text: I'm ticked that I've been living in the SF bay area for 2 years and I just found out about this place! Today I had a corned beef sandwich on sour dough, green beans, and stuffing. The meat is sliced fresh off the bone in front of you. Other sides include baked beans, coleslaw, mashed potatoes, and macaroni salad. Full bar, low key picnic table cloths. Order your food at the counter, then take your tray to a table and eat,Not pretentious or expensive. Great place to have a filling, relaxing meal.

qlJVwqTNPKDv91NOfi0k9A.review_text: i'm a bit bummed that i never knew there was a full bar here. i've watched loads of movies across the road, and we always ended up at random dives in the tender loin. i never thought of going in here because it seemed like it was a big meat carvery, and for so long i was a vegetarian.   we ended up here after a night at the opera. i enjoyed my normal jameson on the rocks, the mister had murphy's. what we loved even more was the bbq turkey sloppy joe. shreds of turkey with mushrooms and peppers smothered in sloppy joe sauce, with mash and gravy all atop an open faced roll. it was enough to share and bring the two of us to satiety. he really wanted the buffalo stew, but i'm still working my way up to being courageous with different meats -- maybe next time.

o2qn6hMTUJfTI-W2GazX0w.review_text: I first stumbled upon this place when I had first moved to the city and a friend visiting me recommended we check it out.   A few years later it remains as good as it gets - Dinner platter with a choice of various meats, mashed potatoes or rice, and a choice of one of their salads - potato salad, lettuce, beans, all for under $10.   I usually just do take out, however from what I have seen it looks like a good spot to eat-in as well. Lots of folks from out of town, a pretty decent bar, and of course the food which you order buffet style.   For what it is I say 5/5 - Highly Recommended!

bGMsv9nbakAn5g9smPgSaA.review_text: Don't be turned off by the crazy Tommy's Joint murals on the exterior of the building. There's some good hofbrau food inside.  The buffalo chili is the standard there. Good lean buffalo meat. There is the turkey leg, too. MMmmm.   Besides they are open late (around 2a). They have just the right stuff to hit the spot for a late night snack.

K5qQ09PsbW2Pscaf1fkmfA.review_text: This place is awesome. I had been meaning to check it out as I always drive by and see the brightly painted exterior of the place. I was driving around the city with my GF looking for late night drinks and food when we passed by Tommy's Joynt. I said "F it, let's check it out"...  The inside of this place reminds me of a bar you would see on Burbon St in New Orleans. Super old style bar with old style adds all over the place "Hard boiled eggs- $0.25!" which I love. Super nostalgic.   Now, don't expect culinary excellence when going to a place like this. You're going to get large portions of 'pretty good' tasting food for cheap, with the option of a full cocktail bar with a myriad beers from all over the world. I was starving and ordered the Corned Beef and Cabbage plate with a Racer 5 IPA while my girl sipped a Strawberry Daiquiri. The food was great (admittedly I am easy to please, none the less)- Hauf Brau style, on a large plate with a roll. Delicious.  There were so many options, I didn't even know if I had chosen the right one. They had spaghetti and meatballs which looked great, mashed potatos, beans, soup, sandwiches, ribs.. the list is endless. I was however happy with my decision, knowing that I would be back to try more.  Best part: Full bar with food available until 1:40am every day.  Worst part: Cash only! However they did have an ATM  I highly recommend Tommy's Joynt.

O6hPAFzQtAyn-zGPjNuTKg.review_text: Hey what's that place downtown with all the crazy shit on the walls? oh you mean shenanigans? (collective) ohhhhhhh!  stuff on the walls that are less obnoxious than bucca di beppo but imho better food (meat + meat) and potatoes. The meat is tasty, the service is good and there is a full bar.  its cheap and good, and sometimes you might catch a local theatre troupe's reading

ctr_BlCf3Ogny-vLs8E9tQ.review_text: Service was fast and friendly, and seating was casual and comfortable.  I'm not really into hof brau style food, but Tommy's Joynt did a good job with my pastrami sandwich.  They also have a great selection of beers, and once in a while you can catch a football (soccer) match on their screens:

2acfq0fHzCH5SeSwhMGOYw.review_text: Every visitor to SF should come here to get a meal. I'll warn you though, the staff is not particularly good, except for the usually sweet wait staff. The people behind the counter are usually awful at making the experience enjoyable for the customer. They all seem sick of their jobs, and I couldn't find a smile on any one of their faces. Now if you can get past that, you will probably love the food, depending on what your order. It is usually a terrific bargain and the taste is usually great, but I have been disappointed with the portion size on rare occasion. With that said, it is a great place to get a good meal for a good price. The place is mostly no frills. There is a full bar for getting drinks, but I wonder why anyone would go there just for the bar.

ggl6fl-PM5O1WrdReL0l4A.review_text: I thought Tommy's was just ok, their cafeteria style food set up is just ok. I thought my corned beef sanwich was alright. I didn''t think the bread they used was all that good. And as any good foodie knows, good bread is the secret to any sandwhich.   Five stars though for their beer selection!

f14WqzSOoZKLEN1iDceq2w.review_text: Filling. Somewhat trashy. Exciting. A San Francisco treat. Hmmm what else... Delicious? One of my favorite sfc spots. Parking is hideous though

99NcsApGTVHpDClWSW8_iQ.review_text: You're standing on the corner of Van Ness and Geary. It's only 9:30 p.m. but your friends are wasted and there's a Mel's Diner on one corner or Tommy's on the other. What do you do?  Know your element and know your friends. Head to the cafeteria style SF staple among the hoards of Emerald Bowl drunks and keep your head down!  Ordered two meatball sandwiches, two orders of spaghetti and meatballs and two sides of mashed potatoes. Two Anchor Steams, one Stella and one Hefe. Drink total: About $17. Food total: Less than $5 a plate.  I had this memory in my head of Tommy's - I was about 7 years old, my grandma and an Irish family friend with an accent thicker than Tommy's marinara sauce. In my head the cafeteria style line went on FOREVER! In actuality it's got carving stations and a handful of other items - Sandwiches seem to be their deal. I remember seeing corned beef the other night and asking if they had sauerkraut - a Reuben sandwich stuck in my head. The cafeteria man said no and I opted for the meatball sandwich. Sauce is thick and creamy. Meatballs have either nutmeg or some sort of ingredient that throws you off a bit. But when you're faced with Mel's or Tommy's, you can get Mel's just about anywhere - Tommy's is worth the wait, longer than the cafeteria line!

RTopumkGa_cu3edxEf9U2g.review_text: I had heard of this place from watching Diner's, Drives, and Dives on Food Network.  I ordered the turkey leg, lasagna and a bowl clam chowder while a friend ordered the pastrami sandwich.  The turkey leg was very good... juicy down to the last bite and it melted off the turkey leg like butter when you cut into it.  I tried a bit of pastrami and it was equally good too.  The lasagna was okay and the clam chowder was interesting... however I'd prefer a bit more creamy clam chowder.  The clam chowder was a bit spicy.  Overall, I recommend just sticking to their meats -- especially their turkey.
