_kENUv9ZoaomCD3nWkIUDg.review_text: I really can't complain about the quality.  It's super cheap.  The portions are huge as well.  I had the lamb, which was pretty good.  I had the Turkey Sloppy Joe and didn't really like it.  It was pretty watery; however, I'm not a big fan of turkey.  I really do not expect so much from the place except that I really like the atmosphere.  This place has been around forever, so that must say something about their credibility.  I also like that they are open late (until 2AM).  So it's a good place to eat if you're hungry after a concert in the city.    The staff is pretty friendly too.  I like the cashier's hat.  Reminds me of Super Mario Bros.

0Hh4UaPslHviVRZqUxJ2EQ.review_text: Holy crud, this place is great. Rustic, raw, affordable, and--most importantly--delicious. Fresh, amazingly tasty cuts, variety of sides, great beer selection from tap and bottle. Only drawback is that the place can be crowded and overwhelming for first-timers figuring out the menu, logistics, service, etc.  I've finally found great, and affordable pastrami in SF. The sandwiches here are the only ones that can tempt me away from certain $5 footlongs (great, now I've lost all my cred)

GBZt2aD-0tpD7l-pb9WLqQ.review_text: Their pasta is REALLY over cooked and not good. BUT, their meat/sausage sandwiches are really good. I dont know what's in the sauce they serve but it's really good.

I2htluZX8zFT28zyZxUBcw.review_text: I was expecting more out of tommy's given what I've heard about it. I must say the sauce (BBQ) is wonderful. The beef is also moist. Very reliable, simple sandwich. I have definitely had a better knackwurst, but like I said before, go for the beef sandwich!

npLz7-1BH_ban9xfqV9usw.review_text: Only if you know what's good, you will go to Tommy's Joynt!

WF1o6AyXm6-NovD5dFnMOg.review_text: The pilgrimage around SF eateries has been long and tasteful since my arrival into the city by the bay, but last weekend I stopped into a local gem on Van Ness that is a no nonsense attack on your heart and gut.  I've passed by Tommy's for a year, to and from work, to and from the gym, and finally after a reprieve from R Bar, my good buddy Ben H directed us into this lair of history and flavor.  The moment you step in, you realize you're stepping into a true neighborhood joint, so you better figure out what's going on. Fast.  Get in line, and start analyzing the walls and signs that adorn this great big mess hall. Your eyes and nose will direct you to the big daddy brisket, the steaming hot sides, and the assorted meats like their pastrami.  I went with the pastrami dinner plate with a whopping side of mashed potatoes and gravy, with a cup of slaw. It was late in the evening, and my stomach was screaming for some good home rib sticking food.  The pastrami was soaked in flavor, and put you in a trance to do only one thing. Fork to mouth. Fork to mouth.  The mash was creamy, the gravy was heaven and the slaw gave you a good reminder that you'd be back.  Tommy's is a must visit. The vibe is non stop, the service is straight up, and the meal... well, you better get in line asap.

y6hcwGUjhOuEo-y6eY0lbg.review_text: i love this place my dear old grandpa used to live up the street from this place.   one of the best places to get a beer. and grab some great food.   buffalo stew is the greatest. and they have the best hofbrau around. and its a great price

FeHJoodcF00pYALcL2kyXg.review_text: I liked this place a lot.  The attitude of the workers and in general was very laid back.  I kind of felt like I was at a high school cafeteria in alaska.  They had an abundance of meats to choose from.  Very traditional, American cuisine.  Meatloaf and rib dips are staples.  We ordered a roast beef sandwich and the turkey leg.  Although both were a little too dry for my taste, the flavor was definitely there.  Just being able to eat a big ol turkey leg brought me back to Disneyland where I can probably eat two at a time.    The decor is definitely unique, and the bench tables give the place its own personality.  At every table there's a honeyjar looking thing that holds the mustard.  I thought it contained blueberries.  *nom nom*

tt_WDRqcoYt7niE9YbxJBQ.review_text: Good casual spot for lunch or dinner. Enjoyed the brisket a lot - perfectly tender and seasoned. Wasn't the biggest fan of the roast beef, not sure if it was just a one-off thing, but it was very chewy. It's very reasonably priced, probably around $10 for a dinner plate which includes a generous portion of meat plus potatoes and a side (I'd recommend the baked beans). We were able to find seats immediately at one of the booths in the back. The server came by as soon as we were seated to take our drink orders. Remember, it's cash only. And they validate for the AMC parking lot, but there's usually street parking if you circle the area a few times.

hiLDnJAUR6o9vAEH_8BmVQ.review_text: MEAT, MEAT, MEAT! AWESOME!  The sides aren't bad either. It's a little weird paying separately for food and then drink, but all in all it's pretty bitchin.  Note to waitress: Carry more change. Some folks might give up rather than ask you to break a larger bill to just tip you.

zvAZsfg7Id2c9X5Vx8uMvQ.review_text: This place is great! I am a meat eater and I DO love my meat. This place is super cheap and has a great laid-back atmosphere. What's even better is that it's across the street from the movie theater. So after stuffing myself with delicious meat I can venture over to the theater to catch a flick. I believe I had a steak sandwich and it was pretty damn delicious. However, next time I go there I am definitely getting some meatloaf. That looked delicious!!

ZnoRV0CJYbKqHlWWm_6MIA.review_text: Ahhh classic Hof Brau food. A hearty meal with reasonable prices & all must be washed down with an alcoholic beverage!   Tommy's always has some excellent Hof Brau food. Crawl into this dimly lit joint, hop in line, & order hand carved roast beef or turkey...or maybe even some Buffalo for those that are daring! Slap on a side of beet or potato salad, slide your tray down & pay for your meal at the register. They have plenty of other selections, along with a selection of drinks (alcoholic and non). Eat your heart out, and fall into a food coma. For $8 I had a good turkey sandwich & a side of potato salad. Slapped on some spicy mustard to which I sat alone gorging down my sandwich while my nose flared & teared because I didn't realize how spicy it was!   The service is welcoming, and a waitress usually comes around to your table to take any drink orders. I enjoyed the last couple visits, and won't mind returning.  Looks like Tommy's IS the joint!

2m1YJYxDnTprBWxTEzPKfg.review_text: Good lord, this place is good. The only way I can really describe Tommy's Joynt is "a man's dinner". It's hearty, filling, and utterly delicious. I always say I'll try something different the next time I come back, but it never happens. I'm IN LOVE with the brisket dinner plate. It melts in your mouth, and the gravy they serve it with is smoky and smooth and has just enough spice. It's spectacular.  Tommy's = Brisket. That's all you'll ever need to know.

SWIBbHr_P7lL4LgMRJOP6A.review_text: Meats in a vat and beer.  There's nothing less exotic or more thoroughly American than this place.  Tommy's is on Van Ness -- which literally means that it's on Highway 101.   This makes Tommy's one of the few truck stops accessible by foot.                  * * *  Here's what happens:  You're trapped in that barren stretch of urban decay and Mercedes dealerships, between the Tenderloin and Western Addition.  Your gout prevents you from walking to the Polk St. bars, and your cash flow prevents you from taking a cab.   You sack up, analyze the situation with a clear, sober head.    Next to the movie theater, but before the heroin junkie, you see the billboard for Bar 101.  You stop in, get a beer, play a round of pool with your friend, a drug-addicted anesthesiologist.  It's 4:30 PM on a Tuesday, and you skipped breakfast.  Tommy's Joynt is open.    What's on the menu?  Meats in a vat and beer.  Done.

WWP06D5BncW30kSOkOC6WA.review_text: Van Ness area is pretty dead on a Sunday night. One of the only bright spots is Tommy's Joynt, literally I mean with the flamboyant and colorful paintings all over the building (like one of the big breasted lady in Victorian attire who's about to eat a sandwich).. I'd have to say that I passed Tommy's hundreds of times without ever really thinking, "hey what the heck is in there?" I didn't even know it was a restaurant until last week.  So what brought me here during such a random time? I'm shamefully going to say that I had seen this place on the Food Network's "Diners, Drive-In's, and Dives." That show is ALWAYS on and after a few featured places they all start sounding the same. Guy keeps talking about how the meat dish is as big as his head or arm blah blah whatever. I wanted to see for myself.  We tried:  BBQ Sloppy Joe Turkey Sandwich with mash potatoes - I knew this was cafeteria style dining but I didn't expect the cafeteria tasting food. I seriously felt like I was back in elementary school. The taste was just so familiar; the meat tasted off... like it was sitting there too long and the only flavor came from the BBQ sauce. At first glance, it looks like you get a whole lotta meat between the two thick pieces of bread but then you dig down and see that they gave you an extra big piece of bread. What kinda sandwich has THREE pieces of bread?! And no, the big mac is a burger. I guess they just have to do that since they only charge $4.25 for the thing. Braised Lamb Shanks with vegetables (potatos and overcooked carrots)- I liked that it didn't have too much of the "gamey" taste lamb usually has but I felt like it also lacked flavor. The meat was also inconsistent with some parts being really dry.   I know this place is hella cheap so I wanted to like it. We only spent like $14? But just because it's cheap, doesn't mean it's going to be good. Food Network, you failed me!

DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw.review_text: Good ole' Tommy's. With the exception of letting Guy Fieri into your kitchen, you do little wrong.  A dive of a deli but an institution on the corner of Geary and Van Ness, The Original Tommy's Joynt dishes up heaps of homey comfort food, and a whole ton of meat, to the many diners who patronize it daily. If you're a fan of fresh carved deli meats, you're in luck. Come on over and get in line. I recommend the daily dinner platter versus the sandwich as the bread is really tough. Love the pastrami, BBQ brisket, and roast beef as my meat choices. They are all well-seasoned and delightfully moist. Pair them with simple but satisfying sides like mashed potatoes, macaroni salad, or mixed vegetables, you have a pretty substantial meal. Also, don't forget to check out the daily specials. I'm totally in if it's the fall-off-the-bone braised lamb shanks.   To top it off, there's a bar in Tommy's with a decent selection of brewskis to go with all that delicious meat. Been here pre and post drinking, and have equally enjoyed my food. It's an SF institution for a reason and I hope it goes nowhere as the neighborhood around it changes.

JhRRBFvqpEmWUXrjHjRuUA.review_text: Best Haufbrau in the city.  Most truly authentic San Francisco venue I frequent.    The Seats a little packed.  There are a ton on beer ads, hockey sticks, and other chatskies hanging from the ceiling and walls and the service can be lacking.  However, Fresh carved, incredibly salty pastrami, corned beef and bar-b-q beef brisket sandwiches for under $6.  Priceless.  Not really, but cheap.  Better quality food and venue than Lefty O'Doul's.

WCoCQQKN5jfu731pfOt1oQ.review_text: i excpected a lot more from the reviews and the hype about this place , than again it 's san francisco where everything is just overrated , but i have to say the prices are amazing for the amount of food you get , turkey was super dry , turkey leg had more flavor . good place to hang out with friends and grab a beer ...

Lzkp8TNrCDk7hBwAjBNvQA.review_text: Ummm. If pricing is driving you then yes.  It's ok.  If hunger is a motivation fine then. If satisfaction is what you want I don't recommend.    3D you disappointed me.

SitYDdmJtpyi8V7vNJcBCg.review_text: I feel a little silly giving Tommy's 2 stars but I am writing this review after my third visit there last night, so I did give it a chance.    I totally understand why this place is prob the favorite place of alot of people...kinda that food that grandma and grandpa might have made back in the day and the spot has alot of culture to it...as someone else said the stuff on the walls looks like it has been there since the 50s.  They always have somewhat of a line..there is a little Disneyland style que set up to wait in. The menu and the way it is set up is really confusing for someone who has not been there before.  There is no real set menu that I could find (maybe I wasnt looking in the right place) and there are random signs all around with different dishes.  The guys serving the customers (its kinda like a cafeteria) are really good at what they do so they get people moving really fast through that line.  But that sucks when you have no idea what the dishes actually are and what they come with.  They seem annoyed with you if you dont instantly know what you want and seem even more annoyed if you cant understand what they are saying. (last night one of them had a think accent)  I am a simple person...if I dont know the food I am best with just regular stuff...maybe a good hamburger, fries, steak, ect...none of that here. Its all braised something or brisket of something thats all sitting out and looks like they marinated it overnight.  (Not in a bad way)  Now as I said this may be the bees knees for some people but not me...I think I ordered the BBQ Beef something thinking that it might be something like the BBQ I had in the past but the guy quickly sliced me up a bunch of pieces of meat and potatoes and slathered the whole plate with a gravy that tasted like regular BBQ sauce in like .2 seconds.   The meat was between 25 and 50 percent fat...I am a meat eater but I dont eat straight fat.  I really had to pick apart the meat to get some regular non fatty stuff out of it.  I left a good portion of it on my plate.  The roll was yummy...it and the mashed potatoes saved my being hungry later.  Its a nicely cheap, fast dinner but there are two things that bugged me...and knowing me I am the ONLY person these two things bug.  Its small so you have to sit in long tables with other people...now I am a TOTALLY social person but when it comes to meeting total strangers over dinner I dont really go for that...  and  No free refills on soda.    WHAT?!  Man what a bummer.  I understand a place has to make money but we all know how cheap soda is and practically every other restaurant nowadays has free refills.    I know, I know I am going to get a bunch of people telling me I don't know how to eat or I don't appreciate Tommy's but I am just being honest, its not really for me.   That being said if a friend wants to go there for dinner, I have no problem going.   :0)

WtLEbEE3P7Vcony-wlLX3g.review_text: They literally go H.A.M. with their meats! Displayed in a quick cafeteria order as you go (CASH ONLY!) and sit anywhere in the two floor homey joynt. I like it because their fast, the beer selection is pretty huge, they are open late, and they attracts meat lovers from all walks of life.   Heres the daily specials: -MON: braised oxtail w pasta -TUES: breaded veal w/ mash potatoes -WED: steak sammies -THURS: braised lamb shanks w veg -FRI: Salmon filet w rice -SAT: sweet & sour spareribsw rice -SUN: roast chicken w rice  My go to food there is hands down the BBQ BEEF BRISKET, such tender moist juicy meat (never been a big fan of their super hard bread) with a side of mash potato. ahhh every time i walk in there its automatic salivation for the briskets! my carnivorous heart belongs to you

Qq7j8H3-VuaBzF8qxBZysQ.review_text: I had the oxtail and beef brisket. The meat is tender and soooo moist. They definitely know their meat, too bad thats all they know. The noodles in my oxtail was overcooked. The sides were not worth it unless you're getting mash potatoes, or a salad which you should really get since most entrees are just meat and carbs. Pass on the cole slaw.

inUNR2uTfqpYLjT81zsYLQ.review_text: NOW THIS IS THE FOOD I HAVE BEEN NEEDING.  We hit this place up after the auto show for lunch. Can you get your food any quicker... no! The drinks took longer than our ordering.  Real meats cut right in front of you. My mom, me and my son had the brisket w/rice and beans. Almost as good as mine from the smoker. We also split an order of the buffalo chili...yum.  Also, the family had awesome roast beef dip sandwiches. Done just right, medium rare for the wife and medium for my daughter.  Food was under $50 and drinks were $10 only because we basically had dinner plates. It would have been even cheaper if we all just had sandwiches. We need more places like this.  Thank You Tommys Joynt.

zyLIp7DRFqeIE1Grrh3Zng.review_text: Hangover prevention.   Straight up meat, lots of it, and potatoes. I got the brisket with jus and mashed potatoes.   Lots of comfort food selection here.  Closes at 1:45am, so leave the bar early and save yourself the headache in the morning.

j0QzHCYxlOp_8KqSqopyHg.review_text: Definitely one of my all-time favorite restaurants. This place is amazing. The staff is great and the food is awesome. Do yourself a favor, make a trip to Tommy's. You won't regret it.

ba-WbH2sxdAZqjt64gHirw.review_text: Ok so first things first this place is def very casual. Was meeting up with some friends here after woork so I was straight suited up in heels and when I walked in to wait for them I felt verrrry overdressed lol. That being said the Bartender was an absolute doll. I have a new fetish for whipped cream vodka so any place with a full bar it happens to be the first thing I ask for. they were def more geared towards beers and dark liqours so the kind man put up with my 30 questions about types of vodka. Luckily they had rasberry grey goose so I was a happy camper. Friends still hadn't made it so I think the bartender felt bad for me cause my drink came out vodka with a splash of mixer. :) Now I was a very happy camper.    Looking around the place reminds me of a cozy mountain bar like up in Trukee. Tons of stuff to look at. They have food there but I did not get a chance to try it, this might be a fun return opportunity.   Tv's everywehre but kind of tight spaces between the seating areas. BAthrooms are upstairs, which I may add the stairs are trecherous in heels! Overall based on drinks alone I liked this place :)

Ve0LUwcrzxL7w0RYgY4Aaw.review_text: This place can flip flop between stars depending on when you come. Tommy's AKA "All You Can Meat" is a great spot when you're starving. I've been a few times and have found that the most fun here is to be had around 1am. The food is somehow BETTER, the portions are large enough to sop up the booze you've been consuming all night, and the atmosphere is fun. Everyone else is in your boat. Just trying to eat some food before they stumble home. The last time I was in town I made sure to stop in and get a corned beef sandwich - it was awesome! I also chowed down on a friends turkey and gravy plate. Equally yum.  Be sure to check out the bathrooms upstairs though! They have funny little vending machines. I'll leave it at that. ;)

gjh6da4yHahEpQ73O6DX_Q.review_text: It's big, it's colorful, and it's old.  No wonder our hero saw some tourists taking a photo of themselves next to the wall of Tommy's Joynt when he walked by.  He made a mental note to return later that night.  Upon his return, he decided to try their Saturday sweet and sour spareribs special.  It's was very saucy, somewhat chewy, and generously portioned.  Although it wasn't the best ribs, it was still edible and filling.  The best part about Tommy's was probably the beer selection.  Now, it's not craft beers like Toronado, but it's quite impressive how many countries are represented on their bottled beer list.  Tommy's has it covered from Amstel Light to Zywiec Pilsner.  The prices for "tall" well drinks are pretty cheap too!  PROS: - Really cheap sandwiches. - Good selection of beers from around the world. - Cheap drinks with table service too.  CONS: - The meat quality isn't all that great. - It's better as a bar than it is as a restaurant.

QcH6sIducEcg2TUOv8qsBw.review_text: Tommy's Joynt- I'm putting you on notice.  I have not patronized your fine establishment in over 20 years since I transferred to San Diego with the Navy.  During my 4 years stationed at Treasure Island I was a regular customer.  I will be stopping by with my first-timer daughter on Sunday, September 2nd sometime in the afternoon.  I have fond memories of generous portions, tasty food, an interesting atmosphere, and decent service, all at a great price. My daughter is expecting great things- please do not disappoint us....    Thanks.  We are looking forward to our visit.

a2wL432MCURrkqWbgoDVrg.review_text: Dear Tommy, I felt like mighty Beowulf about to take on Grendel as I chomped on my giant turkey leg. Almost slammed my water cup on the table a couple of times when I ran out of water... kept having to remind myself it was self-service. Tried my best to sit with my right foot off the booth and to chew with my mouth closed.... hard to do when I had gravy dripping down my forearm the whole time. It was a lovely experience.

5DgqFoGeikJYuvbKDh3tMg.review_text: Solid food, great atmosphere, fast-moving lines.   I wanted to order ALL of the beef plates and the lamb shank, but ended up getting the double lamb shank. I might have to fly back to SF just to try the other dishes...

YNSh9bFYRdnkU0mckaSDsQ.review_text: I don't live in San Francisco.  Other than Paris, it is my favorite city ..  I am a Northern California girl, but I  live in Nevada now... I have been coming to Tommy'sJoynt since I was a teenager in college, doing the math that works out to be 40 yrs...  You can spend a lot of money real quick on a weekend trip to San Francisco, and most times for us  it is  a Birthday destination, for Entertainment; Concerts,  Theatre, Shopping, Photo ops...  We try to pack in as much fun as time will allow, and before we go home we are usually starving and cold...  We  typically fall into Tommy's on our way out of town and have never really had a problem  finding parking on the street.  If you've read my other reviews you know I  have a signature go- to item on a menu, here it is always  the Big Sandwich - Corned Beef  (well back in the 70's it was Turkey)   From the moment  I hit The City, I anticipate Tommy's ...The price is right,  the  food is delicious and filling,  the decor is just so perfectly old San Francisco... It rounds out our trip and sends me back to Nevada with a bittersweet smile..For me it 's really true,  I do leave my heart in San Francisco...

zaXK04RqnjTEiNQh26DECg.review_text: Hello 1979, with your wood paneling and out dated beer signs..I truly enjoy coming here.. This place reminds me of  the dive eatery's located on the Mississippi River..  I always end up only getting the Brisket drenched in bbq sauce.. The brisket has always been a tender tasty treat.. This place is good and has a good atmosphere... American style that I miss from the Midwest..

5izbs0G2wOwnMfRiAcG_1g.review_text: I'll be honest, I only went here because some friends were from out of town and they wanted to go... but it was actually a decent place.  Don't go here if you're a vegetarian though.  It's meat, meat and more meat...  Good irish coffee too.

XHuNSjrPA3Vyi7n4iVhZaQ.review_text: This is the kind of restaurant you go to when your relationship is already established & you are therefore free to eat as much crappy food as you want. Turkey sloppy joes are the best deal as they come with a spoonful of mashed potatoes! Salad is a joke, although if you're ordering salad here and expect it to be anything but iceberg lettuce & french dressing, you should totally move along. Many of the neighborhood's working/underground economy folks eat here due to it's close proximity to the Loin & all it has to offer. Stiff, cheapo drinks, many of the fruity/strange old school variety made by old school bartenders who may or may not charge you according to how pretty they think you are. Luckily, they think I'm hot.

UG4EKu13JRwzRix6ESINdg.review_text: Well,  This was a so called legend? Over hyped once again by the Nor Cals!! Yes I did enjoyed the buffalo stew. And yes, I tried my daughters spaghetti, and wife's lasagna. Both were different, but I did liked them a lot. But the sandwiches weren't that great, It's just a cafeteria style food. I am not trying to make it sound like this is the worst thing around. It's OK! Just over hyped, once again I read and hear about a place to go eat and I just expected to much.

TS2j_gt5qugbmQ1R_fq6TA.review_text: Love the Joynt, be it for lunch or dinner or at 1AM. Also, they have  a lot of great beer. I love the corned beef sandwiches and a side of mash. My dad used to come here in the 70's. The last time I was there, I noticed that they had a stancion (sp.?) and rope which was filled with tourists. After coming here years and years, I don't know how this whole tourist infusion thing has started. Perhaps it was profiled on the travel channel or something? Bummer..

46R-O6u5ao0k0Uae1R830g.review_text: Corned Beef Sandwich with a side of Potato Salad is the best. I used to not like Potato Salad before I came here and ate theirs and I am obsessed with it now. Everything here is amazing but I love the Corned Beef Sandwich too much, it's hard for me to ever get anything else. The prices are very reasonable, but it is cash only!

fwdKpYLmjyRsM2DMal_XPw.review_text: Turkey with all the fixing and a giant glass of vino for $15 in the city, call me crazy!

vZQ8Ks_5vR3A4aCAoYEkbw.review_text: I stumbled in here after trying buzzball for the first time. BEST SPAGHETTI AND MEATBALLS EVER. Seriously, it was a party in my mouth. A really economically priced party in my mouth! Great place for families, friends, or even enemies I guess. There's good food, you're bound to be happy no matter what.

WFkiP-yqdmvFraFbbg38IQ.review_text: After noticing this restaurant on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives on the Food Network, my friends and I decided to go.  It's funny how we drove by this spot so many times in the past not knowing what was inside.  The street corner restaurant's outdoor walls are covered with colorful art appearing to look like a record store, paint, or tattoo shop.   The diner serves a variety of American food in an American setting.  So howlie!!  You don't retrieve your food seated--it's more like getting your food at a cafeteria where you make your order and the netted cafeteria men place your food on a tray.  Really howlie! You then look for a seat and once doing so a waitress will take order for drinks.  Yes, you pay again - argh.  Our waitress was peculiar =P.    This diner can get really busy, but people are coming in and out, so it's not too difficult finding a seat.  I see why Guy commends this diner--the howlie food is yummy!  I had their cornbeef with beans and potatoes on the side.  Their menu consists of large variety of howlie food.  My friends and family have had the following:  turkey leg, pastrami, spaghetti, clam chowder, maccarroni, and a turkey sloppy joe sandwich.  Their portions are large, affordable, and definitely yummy.  Other pluses:  free pickles ( I like pickles), the howlie setting, and the huge variety of beers.  Howlie-licious!

LskqMak3AY64cRaEi8Q7Vw.review_text: Came to Tommy's Joynt because my family's a huge fan of DDD. I was worried about the parking situation, but it worked out great because we just parked in the AMC theater parking because we were going to see a movie afterwards anyway. Even so, there seemed to be open spots on the street as well.   I love the set up: get in line, order, pay, find a seat. It's that easy. I had the BBQ beef and it was good, but what put it over the top was the au jus/gravy it came with. It had a hint of that great BBQ flavor. My sister had the Turkey and it looked good too (they gave white as well as dark meat). The sourdough roll was great too.   The price isn't bad at all ($6.00 for a good sized sandwhich). Not a lot of menu items.  It was pretty cool to see them carve your meal right in front of you. The place wasn't too loud and they had televisions set up everywhere.

mAqj8WY-uHncPpCn3ahCiA.review_text: Stopped in here for lunch while in San Fransisco and I'm glad that I did.  Reminded me of the Blarney Stone's of NYC back in the day.   Pint of Guinness was $4.00. Perfect pour.  Had a bowl of clam chowder and the turkey dinner plate (Heaps of freshly sliced turkey with mash potatoes, stuffing, gravy, cole slaw and a roll with butter.) Aces.  Also had a Hennessy and coke. Strong pour.  Bottom line: Strong drinks that are cheap and cheap food that is good.

fHnAHkd0rNscAXlWpy7M9Q.review_text: HA! This place is so divey, but so cheap and plentiful.  You can't miss it. It has a giant mural of crazy shit on the side of its facade. The kitchen doesn't stay open late though, so I think come in before 1am? CASH ONLY.  Don't mind sitting in between the loud drunk group that just rolled in from Polk Street and the transient drug lord smelling of his own feces. This place attracts all types of people and welcomes them in without discrimination.

MATQEGmQcVVT2ASAYTfWfg.review_text: This place rocks. Everytime we come to San Francisco we get ready to crank this Joynt. If you live or visit in San Francisco this is a must!  My favorite place to eat and relax

YAG90mceVFQLdvl4wndvQg.review_text: Cheap, but unimpressed. I'm willing to come here again and try something else.  I got the turkey sloppy joe...let's just say it's not a sloppy joe. Sloppy joes are made of beef with ketchup sauce. lol. This was basically some pieces of turkey and gravy put over bread. It was very filling and the bf enjoyed it. However, I think the name sloppy joe is very misleading.

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: I've been to Tommy's several times now, meatball sammy, yum! Corn beef and Cabbage, good. BBQ Beef, the meat was good but the sauce is a bit too sweet for me and I like sweet bbq sauce. Only one thing I would like to see better about Tommy's is their vegetables. Can I please have some FRESH green beans, maybe a green bean caserole dish or even just some steamed broccolli would be a nice addition, the canned beans don't do it for me and but it did bring me back to school lunch days, ha.

L0Ce93GwnRbviIxZibBztA.review_text: a low brow hofbrau  they have pretty much all the usual menu items, and then quite a few more. The sandwiches are good, but not great.....and the sides are less than that.  All in all, definitely worth stopping by, but not worth going too far out of your way for.  unless of course you're trying to get drunk with that food.......in that case, come from afar; eat, drink, and be merry!

hzPJg-U-hxKFCSW5tzLtMQ.review_text: I went here for the first time this past sunday and i have to say it was pretty good. I had the beef brisket. Very tender and tasted super yummy! My boyfriend had burgundy beef and that was also super good. Very friendly wait staff. I liked the old school atmosphere as well. They have daily specials as well  Its a must try if your ever in the city

kZzwW0hGHZo00PS2gWFmYA.review_text: Love their beef brisket! Must also try their open face meatball sandwich...drenched with sauce!!  It is a cafeteria style restaurant but really tasty!  Parking can be a hassle at times but well worth it.    They also have a lot of differ types of beer here but I ain't much of a beer drinker...I just come for the food.

b_KKFVVndLzr87CRmE2_vw.review_text: Went while in SF for my birthday. Super cheap and amazingly yummy!!! I cannot wait to go back!!! Loved the pastrami on rye. My mouth is water just thinking about it!  Cheesecake was awesome too!! My whole crew left stuffed and smiling :)

8rGwxyBKdrB7GJ26T7Dozw.review_text: MEAT=TOMMYS  Tammy love Tommy=Tammy love MEAT  so many types of meat, my carnivorous little heart went buckwild.  The mashys are so good, no super crazy about any of the other sides but just about all of the meat is way fab.  plus they have a million types of beer, don't go here on your first date, take her here after she's been in the saddle for a while, she'll like it

H0meAoUk_FtReRVG9W-S6A.review_text: I went to Tommy's Joynt for the first time last night and got the corned beef plate.  The price was right ($10.13 including tax for a generous plate of corned beef, a side of potato or veg, a side salad, and a dinner roll), but the food was only average.  The corned beef had good taste, but was a bit on the dry side, even with jus.  I opted for green beans instead of mashed potatoes, and the green beans tasted canned (mostly flavorless and mushy).  The side salad was fine (iceberg lettuce, mainly), but the "Italian dressing" was -- to be direct -- a bit weird.  I don't know what dry spices (oregano?) they put in the dressing, but it was heavy-handed and off-putting.  My friend ordered the turkey dinner plate and had similar feelings.  The meat was good, but not spectacular, and everything else was just OK.  That said, it was a lot of food or a little money.  Tommy's Joynt wouldn't be on the top of my list for a repeat visit, but if I had to go out to dinner with a group of hungry (carnivorous) friends who were tight on cash, Tommy's would be a fine option.

QuGUsAYQ0osMalSuMLKnJg.review_text: Came in  hoping to try an old tradition in the city with the Mrs. The line was long to get to the counter and when we got there they told us they had no turkey. The Mrs. isn't a cannibal and that's all she wanted. They told us to wait 5 minutes as it would be out soon. We waited at the counter for 15 minutes. Nothing came out. No sorry. No nothing.   This is NOT a place to take a date. The place is full of hungry cheap guys looking for an inexpensive slophouse meal. I don't think I even saw one woman in the whole place. We walked out.

tXVZPRu4GacqM3E_YadlMA.review_text: Came here for a late meal around 10pm.  The potatoes and gravy were delicious and the meatballs were delicious too!  The brisket was alright. I would give it a 3/5. My cut had a tad too much fat.  Regardless, if you're looking for a meal later in the night or comfort food, this is a great place to go. Keep in mind, it is cash only.

km85xKVg_nEx0CJT0uSMRw.review_text: This place is so good for sandwiches! It's a cafeteria style place that is kind of a dump but it's really good. The pastrami here is amazing and it tastes really good with the cheese. It's really cheap too! Only $6 for a full sandwich.

Hs24zBW8S1usufMOvvR0Ww.review_text: Came here late after making a trip out from a Warriors game and was hankering for some food.Needed to get off at Van Ness and asked the taxi driver if I should hit up Mel's or Tommy's. With out hesitating he said that I needed Tommy's and boy was he right.  The turkey leg was pretty spot on and really helped me get that late night grub on, and the mac n cheese was also pretty great. This is for sure the place to come after a long night of drinking or the perfect place to start.  Biggest tip is the place is cash only so make sure you bring plenty of money.

6_DOmNyngi2b3ZuV4MvuEQ.review_text: In for breakfast. What??? Handcarved pastrami for breakfast or burgundy beef...? hmmmmm Well, I doubled up on the pastrami meat on a roll and went back or dinner for the bugundy beef! hahaha Wha can I say except, yum.  Been having the joynt for 11years now and it never fails. The house made pickles are frickin' great man. Just the right amount of sweet & sour to them. The Tommy's horseradish is off the chain with like ANY piece of protein too!   Best time to come, weekday mornings to beat the tourist lines.  P.S. my lack of the 5th star is for the portions ratio to the prices. Notice I  double up on the meat. I don't expect Katz Deli style amounts but c'mon now...just a bit more wouldn't kill their bottom line.

Un8Qs57suMRiEF3ubPWt4w.review_text: I went back and tried the LAMB SHANK DINNER PLATE and I thought the meat was too SALTY!  the meat was kinda chewy too,  it came with potatoes, carrots , gravy and  another one of those chewy bread rolls.  they do skimp a little on the portions, and the bread only comes with one small piece of butter [cheap]  also they dont have ice for your drinking water! the water dispenser has no ice! just semi cool water, thats being Cheap! I guess they want you to order a drink to get ice?  the Lamb Shanks were way too salty! maybe I should have complained?

UJV92-v6CXyKx4h6ny1I2w.review_text: Cheap wholesome food.    If you don't go to the bar, you'll need to find a water station because the waitress will never find you.    The special Veal parmigiana was overcooked and the sauce and noodles were non traditional, slightly funky.  Surprisingly, no burgers.

2H6gAvXrIwMTsXhixfKMrw.review_text: You might lose on a few years of living by eating here, who cares?  It's that damn good.  Something that used to be on four legs is now on a plate slathered in sauce.  To quote Dave Chappelle, "Mmmm...mmmm, bitch!"

VOYvD-kerR204k0WrR0J3A.review_text: Don't expect the greatest food or service... Don't think that the meal will be spectacular.   However, your experience should be solid.   The food is cheap... hot.. and tasty.   We went here the other day before checking out a movie at the AMC. We saw No country for old men which had a crappy ending.  Tommy's has everything from pasta to fresh hot sandwiches to salads..   They have a full bar with some good beers on tap.  Of course, i will be back again.

bF5-57qAJKIZJgWNoVspUg.review_text: I like meat, if you like meat go here!  Went here while on holidays in San Francisco. It was recommended to us by the conductor on the cable car. It was a short walk from the cable car terminus at the top of California street. Turn left on Van Ness Avenue and walk 5 blocks. Tommys Joynt is on the corner on the right hand side, on Van Ness and Geary boulevard.  The food is savage! They have a huge selection to choose from. We were the only tourists here. It was full of locals and fans on the way to the game on Sunday.  I had the beef brisket and it was great, the gravy had honey or something sweet in it. Very unusual and tasted great!  The place reminded me of the pubs back home, a little dark, loads of timber and nothing pretentious, the food speaks for itself. The place was packed and has a constant flow of people coming and going.   I would definitely go back here!

DhFlekUsVEMv8aQHO7nsNw.review_text: I drove by Tommy's Joynt in 1963 and the sign proclaimed that it was the best damned place in town. So I bit and stopped in. In the city of San Francisco the claim best damned place in town is hard to live up to and and maybe the sign should read One of the Best Damned Places in Town. But that would not be near as much fun and Tommy's Joynt is all about fun. Anyway if I don't make it to Tommy's Joynt when I go to San Fran I feel like I've cheated myself.  So when you're in the City by thr Bay, don't cheat yourself. Try it.

ZNdJDKHjxq75J3b4_Kw_fg.review_text: Amazing turkey sandwhich for 6 bucks! It has a really cool vibe when you walk in and the place has been there forever!!! I heard about this place thru diners,driveins, and dives... Def worth the 6$ to have a wonderful hot turkey sandwhich

ZbHkj6HH4udAwi6MMx2SjA.review_text: Haiku for review Tommy's Joynt review number 589:    Really hungry now? Get in line for some cheap meat Meat glorious meat

OAToG3n1bubhEhBdDnfYPw.review_text: Friday night line twisted and turned but moved fast. I got the 1/2 Brisket 1/2 turkey... family style seating.  This is a tough spot if you wanna avoid meat, my buddy said "live a little" and we got the 1/2 and 1/2 deal. turkey and beef Brisket. Its picnic bench style seating, which is great if you wanna socialize and make new friends.   if you think the layout of the get your beer, get your food in different spot was weird, try using the restroom, go up some rickety stairs to a low ceiling... fire martial nightmare. I remember this spot was I was a kid... way back in 1975. Some things never change!

l0I8QAnHJoLhEozrFilONg.review_text: In a word: hofbrau. To add a few more, it wouldn't surprise me to learn that the skanky cucumber salad here had meat in it. Vegetarians, beware.  Turkey sloppy joe. Sandwich roll, loose turkey and mashed potatoes. All covered in gravy and open-faced. I'll try anything here in theory (I love hofbrau food), but can never get past this damn sandwich. It's fun and cheap and I'm a complete mark for it. Sometimes I will get a side of green beans, which are always disappointing and comforting both at once.  If you're in a metal band and are replacing your bassist for any reason, this is the place to tell the new guy he's got the job.  I should also mention that Tommy's has a full bar. I rarely combine this feature with their menu, and hell, neither do they (you order your food cafeteria-style, then either a waitress takes your drink order when you're seated or you belly up to the bar), but if you're in the neighborhood and want to have a couple of drinks, this is a legit choice.

3JD9hLQpRO13KZw9wOlHdA.review_text: I went in to try their roast beef sandwiches.  Nope.  The meat was dry and the au jus was flavorless.

GiwQssbHoctdHyp4Qt-NKA.review_text: So once again I saw a great unique place to eat close by on Triple D so I had to check it out. Me n the gf came here after the Bruno Mars concert on a Wednesday night around 11:00pm. When we got there we didn't have to wait long at all in line thank goodness cuz after we got our food a ton of people came in, the line was hecka long for a while. The selection of food was great, so are the prices. You get a lotta bang for your buck. The atmosphere is cool, I love all the crazy decorations everywhere there very rustic and eclectic... So I had the roast beef with mashed potatoes and a salad and the gf had the turkey with mashed potatoes and gravy. I loved my dish it was sooo good! The horseradish they have on the table for you is divine! (super kick to it so use sparingly) My gf was lovin her plate too and she's super picky about her food. Very cool place to eat I'm really happy we went. Can't wait to go back! Only bad side here is you kinda feel rushed to spit your order out so have what you want in mind other than that its great.

e1FuiYSV1v29q2OTR9ojBA.review_text: I went last night at 1am with my friend after a movie at the AMC Van Ness...we shared a round of beef dinner plate and were LOVING it.  I am a big fan of horseradish and beef so I was in heaven.  Plus, we were slightly drunk so it was just the type of food to sober you up before heading home.  Our large portion of beef came with a green salad, mashed potatoes, and bread, and was enough for both of us.    Tommy's has an extensive beer selection (Brazilian and Israeli beer!) which is really cool....

DqvPZh-crUdz4vN4tuVw-Q.review_text: Roast turkey is awesome & they hook it up. Be sure to get the pickled beet salad too. But the cash only thing has got to go.

ZTvK1kNqd3-zoL7ig6JxHQ.review_text: I love the atmosphere. Been with the family back in the 1960s and I love all the clutter and color. Great place to have a drink.  And the guys cutting the meat in front of you -- the meat looks so good. And I love how you can get buffalo there.   On the other hand -- Diarrhea EVERY TIME. One time it came on so quickly that I couldn't even finish dinner without a trip to the bathroom. It feels strange to return to the table and look at the plate with food still on it after a bathroom trip. Still hungry but didn't want to eat another bite.   I told my dad and he laughed, saying, "It's always been like that! I've always gotten the runs after eating there."  I've worked in REAL clean kitchens. Hospital clean. I know where stuff can build up if you let it. I have an image of the back of Tommy's being real grimy and grungy, and even if the food is perfectly good, there's still something on the plates, and/or people don't wash their hands enough.   Every time I read about SF restaurant owners resisting a cleanliness grading system, like they have in LA, I think of Tommy's Joynt. Sorry!   Note:  my last visit was about 5 years ago. If they have improved their sanitation, I'd like to know.

hHMXRHPQO_7bAX2bNwbR9A.review_text: i used to visit Tommys Joynt years ago when i lived in San Francisco. I was always afraid to enter the City's Tenderloin district...but I would always see a huge line wrapping around inside this old school looking buffet styled establishment..so i had to check it out.   After my first Tommys experience, and I was hooked...what amazing displays of meat, and American homecooking. All their cooked meat is good, but my dish is the corned beef and cabbage.  Be ready to put on some weight and go to Tommys Joynt for good and hearty American cooking

8ilYdOcteBu4Hoa0veVNpA.review_text: BBQ Brisket plate. DONE :) Pastrami is good too.  Everything else is eh, good but not amazing.  Some of the waitresses there are very unfriendly. My brother said "excuse me" so many times and she didnt hear him. he wasn't facing me and i heard him clearly. Shouldn't have left tip on the table.   I really think they need a remodel. Place is grimy. I avoid going to their restroom.

o2c659-Zkjfl2UG24a3FMg.review_text: I've been to Tommy's Joynt several times over the past year; it serves up comfort food for an affordable price, and it is a cash only place.  The BBQ brisket is tender and tasty, although the BBQ is a bit too sweet for my liking. The roast beef is rather tasty too, although it is less tender than the BBQ brisket and not as flavorful.  The baked beans as a side dish is pretty good, and I like the bread they serve with the meals.   Don't get the mac & cheese here though; my friend and I both agreed that it tastes strangely sweet. which is not how mac & cheese should taste like.  If you have a hankering of buffalo, the buffalo stew is scrumptious; skip the buffalo stew because you are unlikely to get a taste of the buffalo since the chili and beans will overwhelm whatever flavor of buffalo there is.  A great place to stop by for a bite to eat whenever you are in town and hankering for some simple comfort food to brighten your day.

Ocz_Adp2JGTakaUq2m04fg.review_text: My friend and my boyfriend are going to kick my bum for writing this one because they love this place. My boyfriend and I went to visit our awesome mutual friend in California where she lives now and we checked out a whole lot of places to eat and explore in California. The one that they both wanted to go back to was Tommy's Joynt. I wasn't that super impressed.  Maybe I just have a crappy food selection but I'd love it if EVERYTHING that this place had was good. When we first went I was kind of sick so I thought maybe my taste buds were off, I got a meatball sandwich. So the bread was great.  ::crickets::  However the meatballs sucked....meatballs.  Even my friend on our second visit there had meatballs with her spaghetti and she wasn't thrilled with them. However they have a huge  bar, everything on the menu and otherwise is cheap. They have daily specials but not always is there something too spectacular on the menu.  My friend and boyfriend loved the lasagna and my boyfriend the second time we went got this meatloaf thingy on a sandwich which was then like drowned with two kinds of sauces and mushrooms. I tried that and it was REALLY good. That was one of the specials, so was the lasagna. I had a German Sausage the second time we went and ....  Again with the crickets, it was just whatever. It was pretty tiny and the sauce they gave me with it was not the tastiest. I wouldn't personally go back unless I was thundering around the city and wanted a quick bite for cheap.   That's the other thing, its like cafeteria style aside from the bar, and then you seat yourself wherever. The vintagey stuff on the walls is pretty cool, its bar-ish. Pretty dim inside, a few booths, mostly tables and an upstairs. It's super cool though that you don't order drinks while you're getting your food. When you sit down a server takes your drink order, OR you can straight up go down to the bar.  Lines are long as hell though past dinner time for food and drinks.

4Gv94E0y7Fs-UZ_cP9LXpg.review_text: Fabulous food, seems to change everyday.  Meat tastes like it's been cooking low and slow.  Eclectic decorations inside that look like they've been posted to the wall for years.  There is parking at the hotel next door, and they will validate you for $2.50.

F0ZYoC3hm3XspMEb0NeiUA.review_text: I love when I find a great place like this completely by accident!  We got in to San Francisco late and just wanted somewhere quick to grab dinner.  Tommy's was right across the street from the hotel and the front desk manager pointed out it had a full bar.  So we figured, why not?  Everything looked so great I could barely decide what to get.  I finally decided on the BBQ turkey sloppy joe and shared some mac and cheese.  All the food was great and really reasonably priced.  We decided to have a seat at the bar for drinks afterward and I was amazed by the beer selection.  I would never expect a place like this to have beer from all over the world.    I will definitely have to make it back to try some of the specials.

fTWtXca0hmdjLQFvkrNDPw.review_text: One of San Francisco's original soul food joints. This place has been around for years. Cash only.  Some choices of proteins arrange from turkey, roast beef, brisket, barbecue, and chicken. Some choices of sides arrange from beans, Mac n Cheese, and salad.  Over the years, there has been quite a cult following. Some famous bands have stopped in as exhibited by the various pictures on the walls. The restaurant has been featured on shows like Diners Dives and Drives.   Concept is simple enough cafeteria style ordering for food. A bar area and waitress help with various requests.  Food is warmly served or cold (if it's potato salad or likes) and properly seasoned. Staff is helpful and efficient.   Good: fast friendly, vibe, flavorful.  Bad: cash only (ATM on site). I don't usually carry cash but plan before I eat here.   I am return customer.

PTQvqqK80jstGM71e0Zudg.review_text: I know this place is old-school, has been here forever and people love the huge portions, but I wasn't super impressed. I came with my dad for lunch and we quickly realized it was cash only, which was annoying but luckily I had cash and we stayed in line.  I wasn't really in the mood for anything heavy, so clearly I was at the wrong place, but my dad hadn't been in a long time and wanted me to try the food. I finally decided on a pastrami sandwich and I believe my dad got the corned beef. My dad seemed to enjoy his, but mine was nothing special. The meat was a bit dry and I could barley finish half.  There was a lady taking drink orders and she seemed annoyed that we only wanted water. Sorry that neither of us wanted a cocktail when we both had to go back to work!   The place looks cool and everything, but I just wasn't blown away by the food and am not in a rush to go back.

ek-DTKEOtfWewahooEiMfw.review_text: I had a pastrami sandwich with coleslaw on the side. Best $9.33 I spent all weekend! The meat was delicious and loved how they served the au jus on the side! Yum!

Oxi_QEu2jREcp6-RfSPH6A.review_text: One of my favorite places in The City.. Everything is everything at Tommy's Joint.  Old school flair with Awesome food!!     We tried a bit of it all and only became disappointed when we walked out the door to leave.. Food was that GOOD! Brisket and Pastrami with spicy mustard was on FIRE! I'd give it SixStars if I could.. Anchor Steam on Tap was a BONUS!

NPeCK0A7R6SndkgEth4pMw.review_text: Bbq brisket was excellent. Overall an excellent alternative to San Francisco's seafood and ethnic restaraunts.

8eexFIJNOCbVv8JK3gVXqw.review_text: I don't understand the high 4 star review average for this establishment. The food our party experienced here was sub-par across the board. The worst part was that nothing seemed fresh, nearly my entire meal tasted like it was composed of stale ingredients that were nearing the expiration date - - not even close to the peak of freshness and taste as I expect when I choose to pay the extra money to dine out. The decor has some unique aspects, but the sum total of the elements result in a touristy ambiance.

zfd_wDiXLGKVvcH0Mi8yUA.review_text: The best around. I've been going to this place since I was a baby and it never disappoints. Classic hofbrau that never changes and doesn't need to. I'm a sucker for both the pastrami and brisket sandwiches.

iSLQTD8uBxYK_OSWVn-kcA.review_text: I LOVE this place. Whenever I am at a fault of where to go for food in SF I come here. Everything is reasonably priced and is served and tastes like a homemade meal. There are daily specials that never fail to taste great, and I have yet to eat something there that I didn't like.   My only complaint is that it is almost always crowded. But that is a good thing, right? There is ample seating; it doesn't quite look like that immediately, but when you walk to the back you find upstairs seating.  S f you are looking for an affordable and delicious meal, search no more. You have found it.

1h-Qx_oP_XyfB6nlfokL_Q.review_text: I was excited to try this place after reading the reviews, but was shocked by the lack of quality in the food. The buffalo stew tasted like beef stew out of a can. Same for the green beans. I haven't had mash potatoes made out of flakes like this since college. At least I can check that restaurant off my list.  Done.

4VhXAtphxUiV79GYt7FX5g.review_text: Can't say enough good things about Tommy's Joynt. Great food, awesome service, cheap drinks. Never disappointed; a must for locals and visitors.

BfwkErYYxxI0WM2ZISl_Qg.review_text: Great late night spot for some hot food and cold beer. It's cafeteria side (which is cool sometime, especially late at night, cuz you get to see the food before picking what to order). All kinds of savory meats/turkey to choose from (and they carve right in front of you) to make hearty satisfying sandwiches. The BBQ beef is my fav

EFRmhMAxy2uyo2xUTej7aw.review_text: Huge portions and cheap. The BBQ brisket of beef was melt in your mouth. Yum!

BL7RvOOq6Mczln9d4kT70A.review_text: A friend told me about this place!  Great Bar-B-Q sandwich and lasagna.  Very affordable (inexpensive)!  I will visit again when I return!

B2jNEZXPcieDWgWhYtg0kA.review_text: ANOTHER YELP DISCOVERY FAVORITE!  I attended Sacred Heart Cathedral Prep. off of Franklin and Ellis... For years I drove by Tommy's Joynt adoring their mural always wondering what kind of food they served here... but then again I was only in high school and my friends and I were too into the local teenage hangout spots...  Flash-forward from the late 90's to 2006... Sitting on my computer yelping away trying to figure out what fine establishment I would be eating at that night... For some reason I was craving Cornbeef and cabbage and voila! The link for Tommy's Joynt caught my eye.  Dinner was awesome. I thought I was only going to order the corn beef and cabbage but as soon as I saw the foodgasmic array of meats, it was OOOOVER!!!! I ended up ordering the Brisket with a side of mashed potatoes with gravy and the Roast beef ... with a nice cold tall glass of Heff!!! MMmmmMmmm! (eyes closed day dreaming of Heffeweizen)  The food here is great, but in addition to enjoying a wonderful meal here, Tommy's offers a whole package with an energetic environment of people from all over SF, a homey feeling with the mess-hall style arrangement of tables where you can sit by a complete stranger and ooogle at every bit he takes of his food while you wait to eat yours... lol... The decor is interesting and they have totally paid attention to detail - The buffalo piece is awesome make sure you read it if you happen to pay them a visit!

WDsr8RnPqbceR3s2yZYr3Q.review_text: I've driven by their neontastic storefront for years, and somehow the gaudy old school exterior convinced me that this place must be a tourist trap.  Actually, it's pretty great!  You walk in and notice it's got a kind of retro kitsch interior with super high ceilings, and those old school red and white patterned tablecloths (see any number of photos) that used to be ubiquitous in cheap Italian restaurants.  It tuns out they also have some delicious corned beef (as fatty as you like it!) and others meats that you can order at their counter, cafeteria style.  Once you get your food, a server will take your drink orders.    You should use this opportunity to order the "XPA" or experimental pale ale, which comes from a nitro tap that produces magical creamy head.  You're welcome.  Cash only.

hFvLaKDNHMxHze13Hd-FZQ.review_text: Seriously. This place isn't that good.   Is it cheap? YES.  Are there tons of international beers on tap? YES.  Is the cucumber salad, which looks Greek-ish, totally gross? YES.  Do they give you just 3 little meatballs on your sandwich? YES.   Are the baked beans only 1/2 baked and not cooked through? YES.   YES. YES. YES.

j7whUEP6ynT6vUglXWiS4g.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is LEGIT!!! Located in the heart of SF, it's close enough to most clubbing venues to be a de facto grubbery-of-interest. Like my friend put it, this place doesn't try too hard to be "hip" or "cool", it just is simply by having its own character and personality.  The same cashier and waitress have been there for years (according to a friend who went to UC Hastings), and the service and charm is all there. I am a gigantic pickle fan (not enough to suck down pickle juice.. I know you guys are out there), so I love that they have a huge barrell full of them that you can just grab yourself.  Onto the food... you order from a deli-style counter. I heard the breads they use in their sandwiches are too tough, so I opted for a dinner plate on the recommendation by a friend. They slice it right off of the slab of meat (I got the roast beef and also tried some of the bbq brisket), and pile it high next to a generous scoop of mashed potatoes, a dinner roll, and a choice of cucumber, potato, house salad or coleslaw. For 8 bucks! You also don't have to tip because you pay at the register and sit down with it.  They also have 3 dollar pints and $2 halfpints, so good deals all around. After I ate, I saw a guy walk away from the deli counter with a gargantuan steaming turkey leg with cascading cream of mushroom sauce and mashed potatoes which caused my stomach to grumble despite the generously portioned food I just consumed. I found out it costs 5.45, and that made me want to come back and try that even more!  A healthy late-night alternative to something like Carls Jr. I approve wholeheartedly. 5 stars!

ZRPLaDjJJ3ebJFQL5MIO_g.review_text: Love this place. The food is served cafeteria style where the line is often out the door during peak dinner hours. Their sandwiches are humungous and come with au jus to dip. After you order and pay for your food, don't forget to swing by the pickle barrel!

_2CNWXnIFKZ1QkCUhvwqqg.review_text: One of my favorite places to eat in the city! The decor is funky and fun (all kinds of random stuff ebery where). Every thing I've ordered has been really delicous and my favorite is the ox tail, yummmmm.. oh and the all you can eat pickles is a big plus in my book considering I think pickles go good with everything lol

gELwQeYees4tVxCOQyRclQ.review_text: Ordered the roast beef dinner. Meat was bland, mashed potatoes weren't that great. Highlight of the meal was the potato salad and sourdough roll. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing but I won't be back.

OatWyH-NVOOTGynlb5rXLQ.review_text: I don't even remember if I reviewed this or not but I came here months ago while in SF running some errands. I stumbled across this restaurant with the help of fellow Yelpers who've been here and gave this place a thumbs up for their excellent food and laid back atmosphere. Alas, when I arrived, this place was PACKED. You stand in line - high school cafeteria style - to get your choice of meats, breads and drinks. I got the spaghetti and meatball while my friend got the roast beef dinner.   Damn it, it was so good.  Even though spaghetti and meatballs are probably the most lamest thing to order at a diner famous for their roast meats and potatoes, they did a damn good job with the spaghetti. The sauce was made from beef, and the meatballs were generously seasoned with herbs like garlic, paprika, oregano and Parmesan cheese. I also tasted the roast beef with the gravy and the signature potatoes and instantly fell into an oblivion of my younger years as a child eating deliriously happy at a local diner. Those were the days. And if any food can bring back such pleasant memories, I am so there.   The restaurant is much like a bar, seating is very limited and they offer a little service if you want drinks and such. It's a very roudy place so I don't recommend young children. The food is spectacular, but not over the top. Prices are at a fixed rate and if I remember correctly, under $10 for each dish. I hear people love the buffalo chili but I did  not try it however, I am regretting it at the moment because I am an avid chili love that would go to great lengths to eat good ones.   Definite cheap eats, cheap thrills and the later it is, the tastier the food.

vatGxID8GQeM1v6224EhOw.review_text: I lived in S.F. for many years and frequented this place! Really tastes and 'feels' like home cooked food.. The turkey dinner is awesome. The roast beef here should be the benchmark for all others! I guess if it was good enough for Mettalica back in the days, its good enough for all of us :-)

Ldq_o2IgBcU3ykv7sPYf4Q.review_text: Went here on my latest trip to SF, and I must say this is the place to get some good eats! I ordered the BBQ Beef Brisket, and my girlfriend ordered the Turkey dinner. Both were amazing! The brisket was melt in your mouth, and the turkey was super juicy. Nothing short of awesome. Will for sure go again soon.

lfxlD12Ps_EAgZPyqC5K5Q.review_text: We visit San Francisco once a year for a week, and in that week we try to explore the City for new eats.  We discovered Tommy's Joynt thanks to Yelp, and I have to admit it reviews well for a reason.  The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because the guy behind the counter got snarky with me when I got momentarily confused pointing out the pastrami when I wanted corned beef so customer service got a bump down for lack of patience with a newbie.  But the food was amazing.  There was not a thing wrong with my corned beef, and my husband dug the tri-trip. Ended up going there twice in two days.  Definitely look forward to going back next year!

00xij_Pk8lDzaMubY7AxSQ.review_text: Get drunk and go eat around midnight, BEST PASTRAMI EVER!!!

QRD3mCAz2Ro6O4d_rLX_GQ.review_text: I totally miss living a block away from this place... it was my comfort food haven.  I love mashed potatoes and I love Tommy's in particular.  Everything is great there, yes, EVERYTHING... It's a casual, dim and extremely gaudy establishment where if you go there a few times the staff greets you with a wink and lets you know they recognize you.  One of the best things about the place, in my opinion, is the huge barrel of pickles... garlic sliced pickles... there for all the pickle lovers.  It really is a BIG barrel.  So many locals go there as well as a big spot for the tourists.  Who could turn away from the building that sports a painted woman with huge breasts on the side... kind of circus carnival style?  It's kind of a magnet. LOL

wo38nW_JbXC4m_zlaN86wQ.review_text: OH MY GOD!!!  I LOVE this place!!  Tommy's Joynt is a total treasure in SF! I have always wanted to check this place out because I would always see it while on the 38 bus and I finally got to tonight.  Tommy's Joynt grabs your attention at first glance because they have this fabulous mural on the outside walls of their restaurat.  When you walk in, you see al these crazy and cool decorations on the walls and ceiling. They have all different kinds of sandwiches, salads, desserts, chilli, beans, potatoes, green beans.  I ended up getting the pastrami sandwich and my boy friend got the roast beef sandwich and also some cole slaw.  The prices here are super reasonable as my sandwich was 6 bucks and i  only ate half and am saving the other half for breakfast tomorrow morning.  The pastrami sandwich was absolutely delicious.  The meat was warm and juicy and seasoned just right and the bread was thich and soft and chewy.  The cole slaw was really yummy.  The service here is also excellent.  The guy carving the meat was really nice and when we sat down, the lady working here asked how i was doing.  I thought that was really great.  I can't believe I waited so long to try this place out!  Now that I've been here, I know for sure I will definatley be coming back!  Tommy's Joynt is absoultely sublime and it doesn't hurt that they stay open late!!

HRUwQNMcYV2TDsI1sSYqug.review_text: I've been meaning to try this place out since I got to SF.  I mean if Guy liked it, I'm sure I would too.  I got through a 5-10 minute wait line and ordered the BBQ Brisket of Beef Dinner Plate with mashed potatoes, baked beans, and a dinner roll.  I didn't particularly like the gravy on the potatoes nor the beans (the smokiness levels were off the charts, my friend tasted it too and said it was like eating a "campfire").  The meat was pretty good; I thoroughly enjoyed the sauce.  Overall, solid quantity but mediocre quality.  Also, cash only...beware.

OnagJ2dnPjfRRT4a_CgKCw.review_text: I am a sucker for Triple D! So when Tommy's was featured both my bf and I had a hankering for the delicious sandwiches.  We paid our visit and I realized why I hadn't been back to Tommy's for such a long time.  There is no doubt the value is great! You can get a heaping plate of food for under $10. However, the quality of the food and service leaves much to be desired.  My turkey leg was dry but ironically greasy....the cole slaw tasted weird...The men at the counter weren't the friendliest...  I suppose you get what you pay for...

I61A0DjJJtsqgxFOr1szrw.review_text: I've always driven past this place and wondered how the food it. The sign and art on the side of the building is huge and hard to miss. When I came in, it had the feel of a hofbrau and an old fashioned dive bar meshed into one. Personally, I really liked the energy and atmosphere of this place. A lot of smiles, good vibes and hipsters. The huge bar doesn't hurt either  Let me get on with the food. I got a BBQ beef sandwich with cole slaw on the side. The sandwich was juicy and tender. Their sourdough bread was perfect too. The cole slaw was great too. Not too saucy which is important to me. You order and soon as you walk in and watch them put your food together as you pay with the cashier. All the workers were friendly and helpful.   I ordered a Hefe to drink but it tasted a little strange. Some weird after-taste that just wasn't right. That was the only thing that kept this from being a five star review. But I'd say Tommy's Joynt is definitely worth the try. I enjoyed the experience.

LiWm3gaXfDtGVaknNjk-cA.review_text: Their web site states that this place was established in 1947. I would have thought earlier; it just seems to me the place has been there forever. It is a bit of a San Francisco Landmark.  With some notable exceptions, the food is good, but not great. The corned beef is hard to beat, but then, it is pretty hard to screw-up corned beef.  But I am going to give the place TWO STARS (2 1/2, really), because it is so damned dirty in there. I was in there last night, for the first time in quite a while. The carpets are filthy!!  That simply is not right. Geez!  UPDATE No. 1:  Sam K. of Tommy's has explained that the floors were just re-done in wood, and asked that I come back for a look. I certainly will, and will post my "re-thunk" review here.  UPDATE No. 2 (12/30/09):  Wow! I am impressed. Sam K., the owner, has been very persistent and responsive to this review of mine. That says a lot; at least he cares, and is watching. So, okay, that gets 'em up to three and 1/2 stars.   Sam K. explained that there are new hardwood floors on the main level (and I went back to take a look - yup), and that they are about to re-do the mezzanine level too.   I did have a back-to-the-basics, no-frills corned beef sandwich in there the other night (on french roll) for $5.60. That is a deal!!!  I think Sam K. has a predicament. In a Landmark place like this, how the Heck do you maintain the "old landmark ambiance," and at the same time keep it from going downhill? This is why I am NOT in the restaurant business. Too much work!

XHvfw3UU2YtvvKMLV_oWSg.review_text: Come here hungry and hung-over if possible. My husband LOVES this place huge slabs of meat to choose from. Kind of a little grungy though so dont expect a high class joint. The food is tasty- if you are a MEAT fan. The three bean salad is also one of the faves of hubster. Tough to find one as good anywhere else.

AxqpR1dFg4lbKYNF_qR4JQ.review_text: An eclectic and locally interesting place that spans a long history of San Francisco. You don't come here for the food. That just okay. You come here for the people and the culture, really just the experience. This is not a place with a family atmosphere especially after the sun sets. You can venture inside for the cheap food and the interesting people watching but prepare yourself for the pretentiously bad taste in both decor and demeanor. While the staff is friendly enough you won't be rewarded with a scrumptious meal and you will have the honor of visiting an icon of San Francisco that is if anything the quintessential kitschy dive you saw on TV.

azivU1jkJhPSKS6ASMegQQ.review_text: Great place. I recommend the Roast Beef dip Sandwich, the BBQ beef sandwich, the open face turkey dinner or sandwich - all are killer   Great comfort food  And a stiff cocktail as well! Great deal in SF!

Y3JSs_5yjCjRceGApqaksg.review_text: this place is always crackin.  every time i come here, i order something different and it's always good. the service here is always fast and you can sit anywhere you want.  good selection on beer. yummm...

KIBrs2JxmNElFRtHmBVj9w.review_text: So to start off, I rate on vegetarian restaurants and this is not very vegetarian friendly in terms of having lots of entree options, but there is enough to eat. I hate a baked potato which was well cooked. I had a shirley temple, which was also good. My friends all had corn beef and other items. You could potentially share a plate if you get the sides. I got my baked potato with sour cream, butter, and a bread roll, so it was a cheap meal. You really don't wait long since you stand in line and get your food at the counter. The waitress was nice and helped us move from a small booth to a larger table in the back, there is plenty of space. Everyone was pretty nice here. I don't think I'd come back unless I have to, but for the average joe, I think it's a fine establishment.

0H7dqqtPyWs4bGBdQluYKw.review_text: I've been living in the the Bay Area my entire life and have just recently taken the time to go visit Tommy's Joynt. Let's just say I probably could have waited a little longer. I just wasn't impressed with that they were offering, although I can definitely see why the food would appeal to some.   To me, the food was good but was somewhat bland and lacking. I got the beef brisket and mashed potatoes, with a side salad ($10). The portions are HUGE, more than enough to fill a grown man, but didn't strike me as anything more than ordinary meat doused in sauce.   I'd give it another chance but I just wasn't impressed enough to go for round 2. My girlfriend got the BBQ beef sandwich and it was delicious so mayhaps coming back during lunch would be better.  All-in-all, I might need to come back for seconds but wasn't impressed with my first visit.

3kkRNOa8n8eLdtuLIYRMDg.review_text: Delicious home style cooking on the cheap! I got the lasagna. A massive piece drowned in a sweet delicious meat sauce.  Really enjoyed the meal - def recommended this place!  oh ps. this place is super reasonable (read: cheap) with prices!

1nWwwKZ3dBKdyH0V2weWOw.review_text: I have high expectations for BBQ visiting from Texas, but I loved that (1) it was open really late and (2) had simple yet delicious comfort food.  I got the brisket which was delicious and the green beans (for some reason brought back childhood memories of cafeteria ones which for some reason I absolutely loved then and these were like a better version of that!)\  I like the casual atmosphere with interesting-to-look-at decor. Helps that you can walk by all the foods to quickly pick, pay and sit down to eat.   Want some good grub? You should really check this place out!

7cL0wq8QwMGlUQnG2ruLSA.review_text: There are some places in the city where time seems to rewind, where a much earlier incarnation of San Francisco seems to co-exist with the modern. This holdout from the 1940's, poorly lit and covered by posters and paraphanillia from every era of city life happens to be one of those places where ethereal past collides with a tenuous present, allowing for a rarefied coexistence which leaves one with a peculiar sense of what The City may have been like before gentrification and Hipster domination.   While my roast beef sandwich was certainly not of the highest quality, and exceptionally basic (bread and meat), seeing the meat for my sandwich expertly sliced from a giant slab of beef gave me a primordial thrill that I simply cannot find in restaurants with...you know...kitchens.  Booze is CHEAP! 8 ounces of wine for under 4$? I'm cool with that. A wide selection of beers? Yep. Overpoured shots? Definitely. Will they judge you for getting faded at lunchtime? Hell no!   All in all, having a sandwich, a bowl of buffalo chili and a pint of Anchor Steam at Tommy's is a classically San Francisco experience that should be shared by every resident of our city (vegans included!).

6s-g2vFu12OemhiK3FJuOQ.review_text: Can't decide between brisket or pastrami or kielbasa? This local landmark does it all, and quite well.  Tommy's Joynt has been at the corner of Geary and Van Ness for years - their sign's unmissable. It's a relaxing spot to enjoy a drink and sandwich, day or night. Line up, peruse their extensive meat selection (they've salads, too), place an order, then find a seat. Need help? Service won't bite.  Last I was here, we shared a few sandwiches (inexpensive; cash only). The accompanying dipping sauce was delicious, and the horseradish on the table had a hell of a kick. The kielbasa was tender and tasty, the pastrami divine.  For drinks, their selection of beer is as hefty as their meats. There's domestic and worldwide brews (English, German, Belgian, etc.) on draft, plus bottles. My friend had a Chimay, while I had a Guinness.  My only regret? Not indulging in their barrel of free pickles.  Assuming you're not here after a night of marathon drinking, visit during off-peak hours to avoid a crowd.

AL0_BZxfrdNlJht2mz3PGA.review_text: This place tries very hard to compare to east coast staples like Kats and it does a good job when it comes to the atmospheric.  But when it comes to the staple of a good Irish place, the corn beef and pastrami, this place is clearly not as good.  The food is just missing that something special so I'd rather just make my own corned beef at home.  But I still give it three stars because there is no denying it can be fun to head over there for a few beers and some adequate food. Just don't go if your craving authenticity and for the love of God don't order the salmon here.

7jiVn2-rZ1DsFdWSMYwRbw.review_text: There's a big difference between a downhome gem bursting with memorabilia and a cheap, grungy buffet tricked out with junk.  Tommy's Joynt is the latter.  It's got some cool photos from 1906 and definitely brims with, um, age.  That doesn't make it charming.  The food?  Way mediocre.  It made me think of those scenes in movies where you can see what a prisoner has on his plate.  Their BBQ brisket is fatty and tender, as you'd want it to be, but the sauce they slather over it is 2 parts water, 1 part Heinz in a bottle.  Way to kill your own star piece of meat, guys.  The mashed potatoes would be quite good if they were hot.  And my grandmother would never approve of how chintzy they were with the wimpy ladleful of gravy.  All I can say about the cole slaw is that it was crunchy, but I poured a lot of salt on it.  The dinner roll was like the half-invisible lonely girl who stood in the corner during high school dances -- she may as well not have been there.  The only reason I don't give this place just one star is that it has a cool wide bar with an extensive selection of everything.  Can't believe someone would actually take a person here on a date.  Yuk.

sHVdX4V9Rg0L1HKR4HQKDw.review_text: My friend ordered a meat ball sandwich that looked delicious for about 5 bucks. The rest of my friends and I had a pitcher of beer for a decent price. I would have given this place 4 stars but I minus one because the bartender did not know how to make a Black Velvet which was poor half a glass of guiness and the rest with champagne. After asking me how to make it, he poured the champagne first (WRONG!) and the drink was mixed when it was supposed to be separate. Oh well, the drink was cheap like 7 bucks when I think it usually runs about 10 bucks. Great place to come before watching Sherlock Holmes drunk and then 3D AVATAR!

JSRh7PxwhOe-bgzZV_oxgA.review_text: We found this little gem 6-1/2 years ago on our first trip to SF while looking for a bite to eat our last night in town.  We have since made it an annual tradition...we MUST have our last meal of vacation at Tommy's.  We know everyone raves about the stew and corned beef, but we always stick to our usual...the Meatball Sandwich!!  It's absolutely delicious and you'll have to roll yourself out of the Joynt after your done because your tummy will be full, but happy!!  We also highly recommend the mashed potatoes, baked beans and cole slaw...can't pick better side dishes.  Oh, yeah and don't forget the pickles!!!  Definitely try to go before 3:30 or you'll be waiting in line (it's quick though).

f1-Ds0X2Gb-acICN_oXVgw.review_text: I've been coming to Tommy's, before I could grab an Anchor Steam. I dig the environment, steam tables and loads of food and at a admirable price. And yes, they're open late.    I enjoy their:  BBQ Sloppy Joe w./ mash potatoes  $4.25  Salad $2.25 (With hella ranch)  Brisket roll dinner $8.50  Chuck steak dinner $6.75

eVLBGAgrTxc3tUfb5J0-Gg.review_text: Let's paint the scene - midnight on a Tuesday, karaoke finishing up at El Rio, you've blessed the rains down in Africa already and now it's time to decide.  The big decision.  What will it be?    Do you head home and get some sleep?  Tomorrow you'll wake up feeling tired and a little hung over and you'll be thinking you should have gotten home by 11PM while you stumble to work.
