eeI4DVW43NLBlo6nFkcANw.review_text: Good food, Good Location.  Went here once after Oktoberfest when my taste buds were numbed by Bratwurst, Saurkraut, and Spaten.  Don't remember tasting a thing though.  Came here a couple more times and had the beef bruscuit.. OMG so good.  Reasonable prices and a good atmosphere.  I get happy just looking at the different kinds of meat while in line, I guess I'm an easy guy to please :)

quzdKkB0f-cz0r9Qw8hhJQ.review_text: Excellent corned beef sandwich, as well as their pastrami.  We went on a Sunday afternoon and the line wasn't too bad, the service we got was quick.  However, I didn't care for the mashed potatoes. Mostly because I'm pretty sure they weren't real potatoes- they were instant.  So I would go with a different side, unless of course you don't mind instant mashed potatoes.

2M8syOlOiqegqD7Mf_Zx7A.review_text: HECK NO!!! The food is bland as hell. The sides are cold and tasteless. Who in there right mind want to eat here at a late nite. I was expecting the best out of the best because of the yelp reviews. I had to put a whole bunch of salt and pepper on the  rotisserie chicken that I ordered. I mean you get what you pay for. My poor friend had the roast and he was disappointed also, for there was no flavor neither.

tVv6B0pQhggJTABmS_f7UA.review_text: I was jonesing for the lamb shank, but since we were there on a Monday, it was not to be.  Got there at the open to avoid crowds.  I had the buffalo stew, which had a lot of flavor.  My wife got the Corned Beef sandwich.  She was not a fan of the au jus.  The sweet aspect was a little odd.  I sort of wish also I had gone with the oxtails, but I'll save that for next time.  The place oozes eclectic charm.

Mjk-jauyb5w_yzIEGOoOQQ.review_text: I went here on Saturday night with my husband and friend; she wanted to take us here since we'd taken her to a couple places that came out on the Food Network and Travel channel.  I came to find out this place was on the corner of Van Ness and Geary, and I'd NEVER seen it in the 20 years I lived in the bay.    Anyways, we walked in and there were maybe 4 people in front of us so not bad at all, especially since it was 10 pm on Saturday night.  I ordered the turkey dinner, which they cut right in front of you.. awesome!  Mine came with stuffing (which I didn't realize till I was at my table), mashed potato and cole slaw and bread.  Hubby got spaghetti and meatballs and my friend got the sweet and sour ribs.  Everything was AMAZING and we couldn't even finish all of our food.    Definitely gonna start coming here when I go to SF now.  My food coma only cost me about 14 for me and my husband combined.  Highly recommend this place.  PS- we left around 11pm and the line was about 15 people deep.,

13nGs99vJJyJiIiP1-hCNA.review_text: This place is a true dive in the Cathedral Hill neighborhood.  It is in probably one of the first buildings built after the 1906 earthquake and it seems like nobody has cleaned it or redecorated since then either.  That said you get the ambiance of being in a slum dive bar but the food is pretty kick ass.  The bison stew is a must and is difficult to finish just because of all the meat in it.  That is saying alot because I am a big eater.

R5Tps94zfW_Bu55DkkVTjA.review_text: Magical.  For less than $10 you can stuff yourself with food so delicious it'll make you want to ditch your utensils/manners and eat like a happy cave dwelling manimal.

OqYkUBD3sGVGjTgka_rGEQ.review_text: I love a place that has a full bar. I love a place that has red and white checkered plastic table coverings. I love a place that has gravy. I love a place where for $11.95 I can eat an entire side of beef and 20 minutes later belch up a hoof. Minus one star for their Punkin Pie. Don't try to compete with my Gramma's. DON'T.

qK_E5Hn5ADq66SoJ23D96Q.review_text: Huge disappointed ,, don't know how it got that many good reviews ,, tasteless food and bad service

77bvFx8QNxR-P4OZjwmh5w.review_text: God put this place on Earth just for me!  It is everything I could ever want!  You get tons of food (fresh-carved meats, potatoes, veggies, a roll, and more) for under $10 and get to sit in a great atmosphere with people from every walk of life.  There is also a bar with a stellar beer selection, a helpful staff of bartenders (one has been there 30+ years), and it is just perfect.  This is a place made for people who like great food at a great price and good drinks.  There are no frills.  You get a tray of amazingly delicious food served almost cafeteria style, and you're guaranteed to love it!

TmAd0zvOqTd7lRCclz_ouQ.review_text: Holy crap giant food. Had a massive sammy and a beer to wash it down. Stuffed a side of beans in there too.   Kinda cramped, hokey seating that works for the tourists maybe more than comfort. But, overall, this is a solid comfort food joint.

LEho8AFSA-H6M9SekKxb_A.review_text: Awesome place for locals who wants to eat a hearty meals with lots of meat!   They serve their food cafeteria style. Get in line, order, pay and find your seat.   Their menu range from buffalo stew, to spaghetti and meatballs, to corn beef sandwiches. The meat is always nice and tender.   If you're a vegetarian, this place is not for you. I think the only day they serve something non-meat is Friday, where they're serving a salmon dish instead.   They also have a wide selection of beer here... great place to hang out during a game.

rFoKcDytlUEpE0VS_VUPoA.review_text: We've been to Tommy's many times before and we are always satisfied. I always get a pastrami sandwich and this time we also got the lamb shank. It was soooo good. Good meat, good gravy, good bread. They also have an awesome selection of beer. I had a big daddy ipa and jason got a boddingtons. If i could eat at tommy's joynt every day, i think i would!

aXCV6Be-ihsfM2c91ZWgZg.review_text: food= for the most part very good.  my fav. there are the mashed potatoes, veal, roast beef, baked beans, coleslaw, all the sides, all the sausage sandwhiches are bomb, basically everything except the turkey leg..somewhat dry. fresh food nice workers great bar...even though my wine was super warm..i forgive...just because their shirley temples make up for it. the pickles always complete the meal. it is open late so that is very convenient.

GT_qlbmdBZ1KWvS3jh9T4g.review_text: I am giving this place 4 stars becuase it's a cool place to hang out, a variety of beers to select from and it closes very late!   If we were just talking about the food here, it's a ok place to eat. I would give them 3 stars. The prices are definatly good and pretty good portions. Another good thing to know is this place is cafeteria style but pretty good for what it is. My Favorite is the turkey sloppy joe. It comes with mashed potatoes, gravy, and a dinner roll for like 5 bucks!! If you like pickles, there are pickles up the yazoo for you in a barrel and you help yourself to them.

PcNWAfNVlWB1-CI4fwGQ6g.review_text: I loved Tommy's Joynt...!! We ate here twice within our short stay in San Francisco. Food was good and plenty of it on our plates!! My favorite... the Baked Beans... I am still craving them...!!! Good Service =]

qWjSy1RdKJtKXbPjIrJnZg.review_text: If you define "A Regular", as keeping a weekly schedule of appearances at an establishment for over a year, with the staff already knowing your order and expect to see you on a certain day every week, then I guess I'm "A Regular" at Tommy's Joynt. I'm there every Friday for the Chicken Lasagna and Mac N Cheese and since Friday is the only day that those two items are served, I just can't miss it. This place has Home Cooking down and might even out do some of you Home Style Chefs out there.  I totally recommend that everyone should try Tommy's Joynt and find your special to become "A Regular".  BTW,  I gave 4 Stars, only cause they don't serve the two items I love and crave the most on other days other than Friday.

xts1GJq4PQ2Dj_-CrsvHWw.review_text: Really great pastrami sandwich. Pastrami, mustard, horseradish and bread. Really simple really delicious.   This place isn't your typical deli, they have a ton of different foods and some really delicious looking items.

y7gL4Pz2UXOXcxwfnvNpdg.review_text: I love this place! Cool, and mellow atmosphere. Food is great, and cheap too. The bar is pretty nice, and the bartenders are nice, and laid back.

Ha4mOL_9JtmYgn7NvrAu6A.review_text: I went here with my friend Ben on his recommendation.  I guess I thought his good taste in music might transfer over to his other senses.    First of all, when he started to describe it to me - cheap... cafeteria style... huge servings - I knew it would be iffy.  I'm a fancy pants dinner kinda girl.  If it is inexpensive to moderate all the better but I like to eat food that I KNOW I couldn't have cooked at home, or if I could it would take HOURS to do.  But I won't poo poo something until I've tried it.   POO POO  I'm not a vegetarian by any stretch of the imagination but anything visibly fatty often makes me want to throw up a little in my mouth.  And it can safely be said that the choices here are clearly for people who don't have that problem.  I briefly thought about getting the salmon but then my fear of food poisoning kicked in (nothing to do with Tommy's in particular, I just have a thing about cooking my own salmon and knowing where it came from.  Not with meat or chicken.  Go fig).  I thought I'd probably have better luck with OxTail stew and overcooked egg noodles, mostly because I always saw oxtail soup in Tesco's and thought "hmmm that could be good but I'm super broke.  Let's go with safe chicken noodle"  I only ate half of it because the other half was bone and fat.  Ew.  I imagine I would appreciate this place alot more if I was drunk.  But if I was drunk and in that area of town, I do believe Mel's is just a few blocks away.  And I love Elvis when I'm drunk!

OAJoabfTubJL_11ho5TQeQ.review_text: Any place with a barrel of pickles is going to get at least 4 stars from me... just sayin.  This place is a fantastic meat buffet of deliciousness. The portions are hearty, the food is tasty, the ambiance is San Francisco-y. Parking isn't the easiest, so I would definitely recommend hoping on that 38L or whatever will get you here fastest.   Food is served cafeteria style, and the line is no different that pizza day in elementary school. And like the elementary school line, Tommy's is worth the wait.   My favorite is always the brisket. Brisket sandwich or by itself is delicious. With your own personal ladel of juice drippings on the side, you just can't go wrong.   ... did i mention the pickles?! gotta get the pickles.   Only downfall is that it's cash only!

A10pWUU0LqdOgzWjrhHHIQ.review_text: Meat = Yum  This is an old school place that has a real neighborhood feel, even though I wouldn't consider the Van Ness corridor a "neighborhood".  They've got a good bar selection, super reasonable prices, and meat... lots & lots of meat.  The sides & deserts belong in a cafeteria, with mushy stuffing at the bottom of the scale, but I always look forward to tucking into the proteins. Fan favs are the lamb shanks, chopped steak w mushrooms, and veal parm.  If you want to interact with the sometimes sketchy but always interesting locals, eat at the bar.    Many a time I've stopped in for a quick drink with friends and ended up staying for hours.

MQbaGVfwGnddzrcABnS-Fw.review_text: Really, why would anyone give this place a high rating, I've eaten here many times, and it has sucked every time.  Roast Beef, cold and tough. Meatballs, flavorless and cold as well. Okay they do have an amazing array of beers, but the food while cheap is crap!

5WSABtyg5mAZJmpsMh8HIg.review_text: Turkey sloppy joe or BBQ beef sando. Can't go wrong. Order an extra side of the BBQ sauce and wash it down w/ a Jameson and soda. I could die happy after eating a meal here. The guys behind the counter are meat magicians and the bar tenders are bad asses that remind me of a time when the world sucked less. If anything ever happens to put Tommy's in jeopardy I'll chain myself to the door and defend it 'till the bitter end.   LONG LIVE MEAT!!!!

QVAmRIrCxhYLqh7wl4Vlog.review_text: I saw this featured on the food network show with that guy that looks like Joey Fatone and it looked especially delicious. I tried it today and was relieved to discover that it was as good as it looked on TV.   Tommy's Joynt is a Van Ness/San Francisco landmark that you don't want to miss. As soon as you walk in, you're greeted by the sights and smells of meat and alcohol characteristic of a dive eatery/hofbrau. The cafeteria style line you stand in moves by extremely quickly, and the menu is huge. They've got lamb shank, pastas, salads, sandwiches, corned beef, ox-tail, fruits, vegetables... i couldn't name everything if I tried.   I ordered a meatball sandwich which was definitely a knife-and-forker. Their meat sauce was really well cooked: not too salty or sweet. I also tried a bite of their corned beef and lamb shank which were also really good. The only thing that was iffy was their au-jus that comes with other meat sandwiches. I tried some and it tasted a little like cinnamon or molasses. Not sure what that was about.  ***REMEMBER!*** This place only takes cash. Just a heads up for if you ever stroll in with an empty stomach and empty wallet.  All in all, the cool local vibe, reasonable prices, large variety, and quality meats make this place a must visit when you're in the area.

kqetYGI-E90Ll8iy6PFLaw.review_text: The first time I arrived on the Tommy's scene, I was apprehensive and hesitant - filled with that fear of ruining a significant occasion or embarassing oneself. I was on a date with a lovely california bred Irish boy, and it might as well have been HIS joint, that's how much he ate there and talked about it.  This was a TEST!  Was I cool enough to like Tommy's?  If not, surely the night would end in disaster!  Drama aside, as soon as I stepped inside and got over the panic of "ok now what the hell do i order!" I had an awesome time.  The setting is laid back with that slightly seedy atmosphere that invites in amusing characters of all sorts and kinds.  The various paraphernalia on the walls always makes for conversation in those dull moments between subjects.  The beer selection is  vast and wonderous (Chimay on tap!!) and the food reminded me of home, especially the roast beef and mashed potatoes dinner.  (Divine!)  Since that first date, the boy has brought me back a few times and I have yet to be disappointed.  The setup is a little confusing, the drink service sometimes slow, and the bathrooms are yucky - but this still doesn't dent my five star affirmation.  Great place, great times.

DRuGrTidzVEVZpiJlfCxvA.review_text: Cool place! didn't even think about going in when I saw the place from outside. It's so loud with its exterior design. My gf suggested me to try. She said "it's all American food... meat and potatoes... " I thought, hubby would love that!  Anyway, the food pretty much looks like homemade and the kind that mama used to make at home. The place looks like a fast food restaurant with homemade food. Pretty cool!. We went on Thursday, so the special was Braised Lamb Shank for $8.95 and we got two lamb shanks with slices of carrot and potatoes, also bread and butter comes with it. It was a lot of food for us, so we shared and ordered side dishes- rice and potato salad (each $2.25). We left the place feeling full and happy. Everyday, they have different special menu. All looks good and of course, with meat!.   So, the place has good food, and they are cheap food, the place  opens late at night, and it's in the city!!. REALLY, what is not to like?!

vRjVhl3ONG2GfWY4NXJZbQ.review_text: Food: good. Prices: even better. Add a beer: you're set.  What you really have to appreciate is the place itself.  It's on the corner of two of the busiest streets in SF.  The parking (well street parking anyway) is next to impossible.  And it is in competition with a place serving almost the same food across the ways.  Yet it's still there and doing well.  This place draws all sorts of people: a testament to the kind of familiar and hearty food Tommy's serves.  I almost dare say this place is the epitome of comfort food.  keep on yelping

2-EvmyN8yZ5MYlc_G5CrGQ.review_text: What can you say....fancy cafeteria food. The chocolate cake was from Ralph's I think and so were the cookies. This time we had Beef Ribs, Roast Beef, Turkey, Buffalo Stew...it's all about the experience. The food is okay. I've found better food places in the city now so I'm not sure this will be a place I'd go to every trip to the bay. Check it out...it's an interesting ambiance :)

ME-5Vwn6VAhMx2yYl4utSA.review_text: This place has style and is extremely charming! I took my girl there and we had their prime ribs. It was good quality with acceptable prices. We also took advantage of the full bar and we ordered some craft beers on tap. We really had a great time there!  For those of you who have never been to TJ, they are self seating. So just pay for your food and sit anywhere you'd like.

mROok9JZx19AwvOJlI8FHQ.review_text: Can't vouch for the food but I can say the bartender during mid-day was very cool and it was fun to finally cruise in here in a  state that I can actually remember things. That previous time was two decades ago or so when I first moved Bay Area. That type of silliness isn't totally gone but incredibly rare these days.   The layout was strange in the way only SF can set up a building. Bathroom was upstairs in a mezzanine area but of course that just added to the charm.  I'd love to come back at night just to see the crowd but I liked my day time venture here.

WCqRZxHbIcLXpZJxb9YBMQ.review_text: The place is kind of fun and they do have a wide beer selection. But the pastrami was very salty, and I recognized those green beans from a can I opened in 1966. The green salad was fine after I rescued it from its vinegar bath, and the Agave Colada, although peach colored, had a good dose of booze in it.

DVY9R4TQOALCZMJ2SSnw_Q.review_text: This is for the Ribs...  This really wasn't what I was expecting...  Sauce all over the ribs and rice, not even BBQ.  I was really looking forward to this, but was just eh.  No char on the ribs and not even that tender.  My cousins said it was pretty good when he had it...  Doesn't seem to be the same style as when I got it.  He said it was just ribs when he got it.  Mine was ribs over rice with sauce drenching over the ribs and rice.  =/

9-SktWI3Xq5sXKIik-BxNA.review_text: very good food and generous portions

Mv43AWxRTm8O9aR-e4vICA.review_text: I love Tommy's, first time I actually ate their food is when I had a family emergency over Thanksgiving and used them to Cater my family dinner.  Everyone loved the dinner and went home with plenty of leftover's. I have since eaten at Tommy's and it is such a great vibe and a great price with so many beer options.  I will make it a regular place to go for good food and plenty of choices for drinks.  Way to go Tommy's!!!

ozXoLPVB0wtkZQvrHZIj9g.review_text: Fantastic pastrami and corned beef... and especially on fresh sourdough! Cheap and quick. I would love to try their braised oxtail one day.   Cash only, but they have an ATM. Also an excellent beer list, though I didn't have any.

Nc8kVGwETsaWhYn1lgMbKw.review_text: This place is a MUST if you are new to the area or just visiting. I always bring my brother here when he is in town from London.. If you are a fan of meat, bread, and gravy, this place is your heaven. They have an incredible buffalo stew (always on the menu) as well as a darn good lamb shank on Thursdays. Don't expect a lot when you come in though, its not the cleanest place in the world, but its got that dingy "been here for years" kind of feel to it. These days those places are few and far between, so just appreciate it for what it is. The food quality really depends on what you order. Example: I would never order coleslaw that's been sitting there for hours...But I would definitely get my hands on some buffalo stew considering it's the most popular item on the menu (and it's less likely that parts have gone bad).   They've got a full bar and plenty of seating, totally fine for kids, and feel free to dress casual. Tommy really doesn't mind ;)

qiA5QI85-A2WB5lKRlyCIQ.review_text: Birthday vacay in San Francisco! We passed this yelp favorite a couple times, so we stopped in on our last day for lunch. Stood in a short line (that got much longer after us). We ordered 2 brisket plates with beans, coleslaw, potato salad, & stuffing. The food is dished out cafeteria style. Some people might call it prison style, but whatever. You pay & then choose from limited tables or booths. Keep walking though, there's a short staircase that leads to more tables. Then, at some point, most likely when your at least 1/2 way through your meal, a waitress comes over for your drink order. Then you have to pay for your drinks. I'm not a big fan of the "2 pay process" but I'm easy-breezy, I can deal. The food is like a good homemade meal my Midwestern grandparents would have cooked up. It was meaty, starchy and very hearty. The beef was good. The beans could have been cooked longer, they were hard but had a good flavor. The stuffing was too soft & mushy, not the right texture. The bottom was burnt. The coleslaw was good but the star of the meal was the potato salad, it was awesome. All in all, it was good. Nothing wowed me. I couldn't tell if the decor was meant to look old & really dirty or if it actually was old & really dirty. It's an interesting place to say the least.  Someone tried to break into our rental car parked across the street while we were eating. The windows had some damage. Good thing we got the extra insurance! When we return to SF, we'll probably skip this place. But I am glad we tried it.

L3mmNtzxkBBBvB5yAbqL2w.review_text: I dislike anyone who doesn't like beer and I dislike anyone who doesn't love this place.  End of story.  Corned Beef take me away!!!

ajiBmXVNJ9FFUKMIJRSh7g.review_text: So most of my eating adventures usually start with yelp, and then figuring out from there where is closest/most convenient and what kind of food I want, but this time my choice was made by 2 people driving down the street and pointing at a place and saying "let's go eat there later". I blindly followed, and against all odds, the place we went to was AMAZING. We walked in and the first thing we see is a giant cafeteria-style counter with tons and tons of MEAT behind it. Then the prices are right behind that - and they were so... reasonable. The bar was on the other side of the restaurant. It's a very fun and casual atmosphere - tons of delicious food, and seemingly fun people.  We had the corned beef dinner plate, with mashed potatoes and beans.  The beans! OMG amazing.  Loved everything I got.  I was super impressed with this place - turns out it's highly rated on yelp after all. Awesome. Open late too, and busy at night as well, even at 10:30pm on a weeknight. Since then, we've been back multiple times, and everything that we've tried has been great.  Always get the beans though, they are amazing.

sLNHFRk3Bssc8VuMvehIBg.review_text: Been coming here for YEARS.  In the beginning partially because of the thrill of thinking someone from Metallica would be lurking around in the shadows...but ANYWAYS...  You have to show up hungry as balls for one thing, because the servings are quite huge.  It is like an awesome cafeteria that serves HELLA MEAT.  I don't even like meat all that much but the brisket is pretty good.  My personal fave is the oxtail on Mondays and the salmon on Fridays.  Kinda sad tonight because I worked my ass off and I really wanted the salmon but the didn't have any left.  The guys that serve you are super sweet.  My only other complaint is that they only take cash.  It's one of those places you need to take an out-of-towner to so they can really experience SF.

Q_3-COiRiBvR_v-NFXvkPw.review_text: I was really disappointed with my food here - the turkey leg was super dry and my bf wasn't impressed with his lamb shank either :-/ Don't know if it was an off night but we walked away feeling jipped....

Xd-_yPe-2FnNxF1yh7PTmg.review_text: Love Tommys Joynt. another place I frequented when living in San Francisco. Been though I am now in New York, I still visit when I travel to SFO. I love the buffalo stew, spaghetti, chili, brisket with horseradish. They have great sides. Nothing better then the selection of great beers from all over the world! Believe me, Tommys Joynt has it going strong! It also happens to be Metallica's favorite spot to dine in San Francisco

jhao9DuSPnVxcEf9L5t6DA.review_text: Came here about 2 years ago on the suggestion of my friend.  Had the roast beef sandwich with mashed potatoes and I remember liking it.  Fast forward 2 years later to today...  I felt the urge to have mashed potatoes and gravy.  And at looking at the places nearby, I stopped and looked at what Tommy's Joynt has to offer.  After reading a few reviews on here, I decided on the BBQ sloppy Joe turkey sandwich.  I will say, I definitely got my money's worth.  A huge slab of turkey on a roll with a hefty portion of mashed potatoes and gravy.  Good luck trying to eat this as a sandwich (you won't be able to).  Your best bet is to eat it with a fork and knife, open face style.    I definitely got my fix, thanks to this place.  The only downside, they're a cash only spot but considering the prices it's well worth it.  Whenever I'm feeling American, this will be my go-to.

G2FVUXuLEGc2fDTWFaQplw.review_text: It's no wonder that Guy Fieri from Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives visited the Northern California mecca of restaurants, San Francisco to check out Tommy's Joint on Van Ness Ave. Tommy's Joint is just the shizzznit per word on the streets of America. With a great selection of pork, beef, chicken, lamb, roast beef, ham, turkey, ox tails, salmon, pork spare ribs, etc. Down a couple beers from the bar. They have a famous selection of beers from all over the world!  I tried their roasted chicken and sampled my brother's beef steak. Both were so good that one might actually lick the plate right after. Save your gorilla appetite because Tommy's  serves in big portions and the servers always ask if you want the juices or soup base to drown the meat on. They also promote the daily specials that includes lamb shanks on Thursdays which I heard from a coworker of mine, were heaven.

CiJat5Up2jAO3B0qTbiN5Q.review_text: If you like meat, then this is the place for you.  A little confusing to me at first, but I just followed my husbands lead and soon found myself ordering corned beef with cabbage.     The place is loud and crowded, but it all lends to the fun atmosphere inside.  We managed to find a small table for two and dug into our tasty pickings of the night.  I love my selection of corned beef and was very pleased to find that what I had was not too salty (which is the usual risk with corned beef).  It went perfect with the cabbage.  Hubby had a pork sandwich which was pretty tasty too.   No hesitation of going back.  Kind of hard to find parking in the neighborhood, but the hunt for a spot is worth it.

LKcFo8BfF0EyrhP6wb5Uow.review_text: Great food. Lame ass bar rule... Forcing u to drink at the bar??!!?!! I was there 1:30am getting grub.. Decided to sit at the bar.. Douchbag told me I have t drink in order t sit at bar..  Maybe 10 other in entire place... LAME!!!!!!!!!! Stupid!!!!!!!  Go to hell! don't come here!

_V1yQayLSaaXdKM76kVqnw.review_text: The pastrami sandwiches are the best. The staff are friendly and a few are rather entertaining. The cafeteria / bar feel works well here. You can have a really filling meal and a beer for a decent price. San Fransisco is very expensive and it is nice to find a real value after being fleeced by the parking lots and meters.

i7qESjVCm1EfzeV26l4okQ.review_text: Good food, good beer, great atmosphere. Yum.

CaF1DkQbHn4sWhx3qJd5bQ.review_text: This place is awesome . I've been eating here for twenty years or so  and every time Tommy's hits the spot . Stopped bye and had the BBQ Brisket just now ! Good food good price , would go 5 stars but no wait staff so 4 stars.

_1RFsuZq2VkGmMhuKXIGWA.review_text: This review is not for the food quality.  It was for the horrible DISCRIMINATION my friend received.  I had eaten here before so expected better service.  I'd give you a zero if I could.  We had a huge group of about 10 people coming from a leukemia charity event hoping to end the night in a good way at your restaurant.  My friend purchased a vegetarian meal from Mel's Diner across the street and joined us for the late night dinner in your restaurant.  After the rest of our party (9 people out of 10) had ordered our food from your restaurant, your waitress came up the stairs to tell my friend that he couldn't bring in outside food. Wtf?! She even stayed around to make sure he put his veggie burger & fries away.  Wtf?! Your discrimination against my vegetarian friend was uncalled for.  We tried to explain to her that he was  vegetarian and that Tommy's didn't really have any vegetarian meal options on their menu for him.  Side salad, coleslaw, or beans?! OoooOoo... What a variety of choices for a filling meal. Not!  I told her this was discriminating.  She replied saying bringing in outside food would cause other restaurant goers to be curious of what food my vegetarian friend was eating.  Yea... your specialized meat restaurant was surely threatened by his veggie burger.  I think everyone there that night decided to become a vegetarian b/c his burger looked oh so much more delicious than your food.  Give me a break.  So my friend had to put his food away and told us to eat our food because he didn't want us to mind him.  I felt so terrible!  There we all were with our food and ALL of us lost our appetite.  Who would want to eat after that, esp when he had to watch us eat?  Total downer for the night!  Btw, she came back up after 15 minutes and changed her mind saying she didn't want to get in trouble and told my friend he could eat his food.  (Duuur,  you knew it was not the right thing to do).  The mood and our appetite were already lost.  I wouldn't blame him for not wanting to eat anymore either after being pointed out in front of everyone (not just my friends, but everyone on the 2nd floor) to put his food away.  What we really should've done was give the food back and ask for a refund so we could spend it elsewhere.  I'd rather choose a vegetarian friendly restaurant to spend my money at than yours!

7W-K0_0hLnkYx-2gUbKdig.review_text: 3.5 stars actually, but i don't think i can do that. I went here once this weekend while dining out with the family. Apparently this place is world famous (how come I've never heard of it?) and even the SF police come here sometimes, it seems. The food is actually pretty decent for the price, they give you a VERY reasonable amount for what you pay for!  Plus, you get this ball of bread and a bowl of salad (that is just so-so).  I ordered a lasagna, and I felt so fat by the end of the night.  That was horrid..haha.  I can't say the food was entirely delicious or anything, but it was exceptional.  I hear their fish is really good (my dad ordered it). When I came, the joint was kinda crowded, but mostly older folks. I did see a few younger people and some kids too. It's really dim inside too, but you get waiter service and all that.  I would suggest trying this place at least once, but don't expect anything GREAT.

jzV56K7A_mx3y3Eh7YG26g.review_text: I can't believe that I have not yet written a review of Tommy's.   Imagine the fanciest sandwich place you can think of. And then imagine the complete opposite.  You walk in. Move to the right, where the counter-of-sandwich-deliciousness is. They want to know your meat. Your bread. Whether you want cheese. This is not Subway. This is not Port-of-Subs (for you Reno folks). This is three ingredients. Their veggies are not sliced fresh because veggies are not an option. Meat. That's what you're here for. Get the ham, it's my favorite.  Move your tray to a crowded table and then send one of your party up to the bar for beers. They're reasonably priced (shockingly).   Pour some of that amazing horseradish all of over your sammy, but be careful. Every other bite seems to be ridiculously hot.   I've heard it can get crazy here, but that doesn't change where I end up at midnight every time I'm in town.

GQwiY_PvTUtdtnt8cCjmfQ.review_text: After a few drinks at the club, I think of Tommy.  He fills me up with his hearty meat and leaves me wanting more and it barely costs me anything either.  He's OG and been around for quite a while.  He keeps it real.  Thats what I like!   My besties is a born and bred San Franciscan and been wanting to drag me here to eat.  I had the brisket sandwich and man oh man, deefreakinglishush! It was on a firm roll with thick freshly carved slices of brisket.  It only cost me $5!  I split with my friend (so the pic I uploaded is actually half the sandwich).  I wanted to try the braised lamb shank since it looked so good, but I drank a bit too much to eat so much.  The dipping sauce for the sandwich wasn't too sweet and didn't over  power the meat. Perfect accompanyment. And the all you can eat pickle chips - crisp and soooo good. =)  I love the Deli/Cafeteria style setting.  Totally up my alley. Lots of old decor that keeps this place so cute!  They don't mess around with the portions here.  Can we have a joint like this in LA pweeeeeease?

c8RF5DgEzea1l-6rZHFaxg.review_text: I liked the vibes I got from this place. Great fresh turkey sandwich and open faced meatball sub. Super cheap. Huge beer selection, many I've never hear of. Convenient location across from the Van Ness movie theater.

a05KZzJk5gQ25yVvn46I9Q.review_text: Man...as a native San Franciscan with a penchant for San Franciscana, I love institutions that give that authentic San Francisco feel. Not that pretentious, up-its-own-@$$ feel that everyone seems to think San Francisco is about, no. No South Park parody vibe, here. This is the real, authentic, Barbary Coast, Gold Rush, Emperor Norton, San Francisco. The decor can only be described as dank, ancient chaos. And that's just what I love about it. It's like stepping through the door into an old saloon out of a Poe novel, with a splash of camp thrown in to lighten the mood.  But enough about how much of a dive this place is. The food is awesome. Not *all* the food, mind you. It's a hofbrau, some of the food is going to be downright mediocre, some of it is going to be greasy, some of it is going to be disappointing. But you can *see* what you're ordering before you order it. I rarely look at the menu, I'm usually too busy looking at the food. I've experimented some, and been disappointed plenty of times, sure. But that just makes me come back again to find something else! The one thing that I get every time, without fail? Buffalo chili. Oh god, I'm craving it just thinking about it. Can't recommend it highly enough. The portions have shrunk in the past ten years, but it's still damn tasty, and makes up for any other poor choices I've made at the same time.  You want to know what the *real* San Francisco is about? Go to Tommy's Joynt. Dark, completely schizophrenic, and never boring.

E_9WOCYIGHtT2nbcY4_t4w.review_text: Surprisingly crowded on a Friday night. Maybe everyone was thre to see Borat (all evening shows sold out at the theater across the street on opening night)  It's a pleasure to point at food and be immediately served.  Go for the roasted meats and potatoes...and don't let your eyes get too big and over order the sides -- the helpings are huge.

clN0KNa2UYfv-rbhXwfZnQ.review_text: This place is great! I was pleasantly surprised. I went to Tommy's on a Sunday afternoon. It was great. Fun atmosphere, quick line for food. Football games playing. Great beers on tap.  The decor reminds me of a hole-in-the-wall pub in Boston or New York. Paraphernalia everywhere.   And the price is right.   $5 for a Turkey sloppy joe with mashed potatoes.

wO1BEwXH0tIOT5KtsAWa4w.review_text: I can still taste the brisket.   And the pastrami. And the bristket. And the mashed potatoes. And the brisket. And the wonderful bbq sauce. Hell, I can even still taste the damned roll, THAT'S how good this place is.   I will return, without a doubt. I can't believe I've lived in the Bay practically my whole life and had never been here.   Yum!

809LOzj0WgywrJetEpH-lw.review_text: Great place,  came here cause it was close to my class registration office.  It's out in the open at the corner of the street, and inexpensive.  Had the BBQ beef brisket,  and the Lamb shank. Both were excellent wish i had more when i finished, but I think next time I'll try the brisket in a sandwich. I'm not a SF person but I would definitely come back again.

fv8CRwwfTEuMNqTF02rf9Q.review_text: I'm surprised this place received 88 out of 100 for their health score to begin with. I'm a college student and not picky by no means but holy fuck, man.. the two times I went here with some super drunk friends my food was cold. I had some turkey and part of it was still RAW AND FROZEN! Wtf?   Cheap. In every sense of the word. Take it for how you like it.

hEjhuWxQwDvP_B8yeCjDYg.review_text: Well having been taken to this Joynt as a kid *(had a hippy brother in law & since then I have been a fan). Went back to this joint ( oops Joynt ) a few times. This joynt has been around longer than Willie Brown (disclosure have not confirmed the dates of birth, but now that I think about it Willie may be older than this joynt). Anyhooooo,  it is a joynt that for me is an icon of SF.  Ok, the food is basic, but sometimes great (as comfort food, or if you wanna get stuffed) if you are not counting the calories. Over the years, the buffalo / beeffalo (sp?) choices (in my youth) were exotic.   Not a fancy place (* and no fancy prices ) so if you are lookin for the bqq turkey sammie w/ low cal dressing w/ the side of heirloom tomatoes and organic basil.... dis not be your joynt.  If you want to try out an SF institution, with hearty *(read generous proportions), no attitude except "make up your mind". Then go for it. Go for Tommy's Joint. Food/  Meat quality is commensurate with the price (otherwise drift up to Ruth's Chris steakhouse). You get what you pay for, at Tommy's Joynt there are no apologies, no "kiss your ring", no do you want Perrier or ....  Sometimes you get what you expect, and sometimes you get a bit more. This Joynt delivers a bit more.

CO82sC1pmHrRs_JXW96FAg.review_text: I love this place like I love smoky old black and white movies from the 40's. The men smoked, the women smoked, the men hung out in dark booths with bookies, the women didn't ask questions. They drank things like  Manhattans, and Whiskey Sours. Well, unfortunately for you smokers out there clinging hard to your dirty habit, the only thing smoking at Tommy's is the food.The food was straightforward, no frou-frou here. Heat lamps and cafeteria style service. And you can never go wrong with the daily special.

sOQcAssKn_OpYVfCUffY1g.review_text: COMFORT FOOD COMFORT FOOD COMFORT FOOD, OMG!  Tommy Joynt is a classic staple in San Francisco, most San Franciscian's know of this gem. It's open late night which for a club goer is a SCORE! I usually pick up a dinner plate, with either roast beef or turkey, or sometimes brisket, I always scope out the meat first before I order, everything I've had though is good. Their drinks are super cheap also and they have a WIDE variety of brews. LOVE this place!

ehdrFZwh1XRxzqR-6Kbg9A.review_text: This review is long overdue.  Yum.  This is a true landmark, and it is always busy.  Freshly carved meats, and lots of entrees and big portions to choose from if you have an appetite.  I always want way more than I can eat.  They have very reasonable prices.  Everyone is nice and it is just a cool place to go.  mmmmmmm!  Cash only!

0lrwmKifNNf-WbAJtsIjhg.review_text: Beef ribs were delicious. No bone, mostly meat that was super tender. And the mashed potato and gravy were so flavorful. Beet salad was ok.

GBkSuO6Z9ccXol95Y1_2LQ.review_text: This place on van ness has been around for ages and truly lives up to its reputation, gives out hardy portions of meat for a very affordable price. The bar serves strong drinks again for very decent prices. My usual go to is the pastrami dinner place with mashed potatoes and a salad for just 10 dollars. a very good deal in my mind. There is no set menu, you just order from a scattered wall of different options, but once you do it for the first time you see how it works and it becomes easy to read and a unique experience. I'd recommend it to those who are hungry on a budget!

zyqCGucCDipDQybwcU0XLQ.review_text: Where else can you get an around the world (beer style)?  Before the microbrew revolution, Tommy's used to be THE PLACE to sample off brands from overseas, first and third world.    Tommy's is the Gold Standard by which all other Hof Braus are to be judged.

djxnI8Ux8ZYQJhiOQkrRhA.review_text: My belly aches just thinking about Tommy's, both good and bad.   For $10 you get hella food... Yes, I said hella. Roast beef, pork ribs, ham with a scoop of mashed potatoes. Vegetarians beware! It seems like a no-brainer bang for your buck. Wait in line, a la cafeteria style, and tell the guys behind the counter exactly what you want. Cash only, folks.  Upon closer inspection, the meat isn't that good. Shocker. About an hour after our meal ended, my stomach started to lurch. Add a jostling BART ride into the equation and you've got a nauseous customer.   Come here and get a Reuben sandwich and a beer, that seems like a much safer choice than the dinner plate. If you want a lot of decent-quality meat, go to House of Prime Rib just down the way.

3eTizQ3IU-PihPGJpx6BuA.review_text: At last I get to try this place. I am a SF native and I have passed by here a million times and I have never went in. I have heard mix reviews on this place so I was a little hesitant since I already have a hot baruf place I love. Anyhow, I gave it a shot.  We ordered a corned beef sandwich, a pastrami sandwich, and a side of stuffing.  The ambiance was cool. The people were nice and my overall experience was good. The reason I am giving it a 3 stars is because the corned beef had some dry areas on the side so I didn't devour it in 60 seconds like I usually do with corned beef sandos. We saw someone order a pastrami and that looked really juicy so we also ordered that. It was actually better than the corned beef. My only problem with this was there was a chewy fat area and they didn't cut it off. It was annoying picking that out of my sandwich. The stuffing was soggy and mushy. I like it when there are some dry pieces of bread and you can see some vegis in it. This was just mush. The gravy poured on top was a bit clumpy too.  I am a huge sandwich whore. Don't think dirty please..... I love my sandwiches. The best corned beef in SF is Lefty O'douls (french roll and have them dip both sides of the bread in the au jus), best pastrami is Miller's East coast deli. I also like Lee's deli in the financial district too if I want a quick good sandwich fix.  I am happy I tried Tommy's but I need to be loyal to my sandwiches and deal with the crappy parking and sometimes paying for the union square parking lot and have my corned beef sandos at Lefty O'douls.

yz3AsDd82T2G6erzb9TSEA.review_text: I love the dive bar feel mixed in with the delicious food. Definitely a hearty meal and really good prices.   They are pretty simple, it feels like a cafeteria lunch line with amazingly better food. People who complain about not knowing they don't take credit cards should really look up because they have several signs that say THEY DONT TAKE CREDIT CARDS.   I love their bbq sandwiches and definitely plan on visiting them again soon.

CM1SVXJ1kiH5uztj_Vg7XA.review_text: I'm a little surprised that this place has so many 5 star reviews. Were you all drunk when you ate here? Had you been on a really strict diet? Starved and shackled in someone's basement and forced to eat nothing but bread and water?   Tommy's Joynt isn't bad per say. They have been open forever and apparently my dad had his first job here has a bus boy. You can still get a reasonably priced meal here and a drink until 2 AM.   Tommy's really caters to everybody (except vegetarians or snobby foodies). They offer cafeteria style comfort food in hearty portions and offer a full bar.   My meals here have always been just so-so. The last time I was here my turkey was pretty bland and cold. The potatoes were meh and the gravy was gross. I wouldn't touch the stuffing.  I would stick to sandwiches here. They offer a pretty decent selection of sides/salads. The coffee was good, but they only offer one free refill. They want to nickel and dime you here, so stick to ordering the basics as another poster suggested--the pickle barrel and serve it yourself water might just suffice.   I wasn't wowed by the food, but I like the atmosphere. It seemed a little raucous and busy for a weekday night. I had a lot of fun listening to this old man who looked exactly like Vincent Price tell me tall tales.   All the tables are family style here, so pull up a chair and make a new friend. It's more fun than you think. Maybe being the only woman here helped.   It's cash only for food and the bar.

E9m9adcWg9h8mRX9idm9Qw.review_text: Ah, Tommy's Joynt... if only they had a sister restaurant in London. And, if only people in England actually ate turkey...  During one of our last late night adventures in SF, we actually called Tommy's to make sure we had enough time to leave the bar, take a cab over here and enjoy a turkey dinner plater. That's right - we actually made plans for our late night meal and arrived safely before close at 1am (they had told us over the phone they were closing at 1:20am that night, ha!)  Insanely awesome portions of warm, delicious, neutral-colored food. I recommend the coleslaw as (at least one) of your sides. Good beer selection too and a nice place to meet real SFers, undoubtedly hanging at the bar drinking beer and eating solo. Fantastic, eclectic  decor. Skip the salmon (Page) and go straight for the turkey or other hot meat based on the daily special.

vYcCnLqIE6P5KkVv0H5cnw.review_text: Looking to satisfy a little meat craving and want to do it for cheap? Then this is the place to be. Located in the busy area of van ness, it attracts a lot of business. Went in and there was a line looping out the door. I ordered the round of beef with mash potatoes and a side of beans. For 11 bucks I definitely got my money's worth. Seats are wherever is available. Cheap selections of beers and a lot of varieties. Overall it was decent. Food was good, atmosphere good, overall a decent place. Would recommend giving this place a try if you're n the neighborhood.......

4xX5eXMgXScGBG02djxxFg.review_text: I've been living in the bay area for nearly 10 years and my first experience with Tommy's was just last week. It's now on my Must-Go list for when folks come to visit me!  I had no idea what I was doing when I got to the counter to order. The guy was helpful, courteous and made suggestions. They're a simple establishment of mostly meat. yum. I ordered the Roast Beef and ended up splitting with a friend who ordered the Pastrami. Plenty of meat, soft french roll - simple food and really good! I also ordered the Buffalo Chili, which wasn't special, but still yummie. Really friendly staff taking drinks, too.   Things to be desired: larger water glasses and french fries on the menu.  YUM

KW38OXpDlH3Xd1LutwjaQA.review_text: My wife an I have been here twice. Once for a B-Day party then just the two of us for dinner and to watch the Giant's game. We came back mostly because we can easily share and fill up on their 9 dollar hearty dinner plate.   First time we got the brisket it's good but a little fatty. Second time we got the beef round and its lean but a little dry. They also serve baked beans and mashed potatoes!!  We like this place because it radiates an old San Francisco vibe. A must see for tourists and residents.

clQ5_3BFDqnJaebdp6LcHA.review_text: Bland. Bland. Bland.   Everything in this place tastes like it's been boiled for two weeks before it got to the table. It's the only place I'd ever been where the sausage dripped water onto my plate. I never went back.    My boss got their catering for a Friday lunch. Most everyone agreed it was terribly bland / boring / not very good. My boss was disappointed and embarrassed for picking the place.

-XF9C3V1cCxn19j-Rlbglw.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is the kind of cafeteria chophouse-style restaurant that you would see all over the place in the South. This place is popular, with a line out the door during dinnertime that snakes back and forth in the restaurant before you make it to the front of the counter to order. After choosing your entrees and sides, they throw your meal together, and then you pay at the end of the counter. Help yourself to water and pickles out of a barrel, and then carry your tray to the table, where a waitress will take your drink order.  Tommy's Joynt differs from the establishments you would see in the South in being more expensive, having smaller portions, and being frankly a little less tasty. A meal here comes out to 10 or 11 dollars, which I suppose is cheap by SF standards for a restaurant meal. The portion size was satisfying for this reviewer, but not gigantic, like you would see in the South. And while the dishes I sampled were decent, there are better BBQ restaurants even in SF, albeit much more expensive. I wish they had more varieties of pickles in the pickle barrel (the pickles weren't anything special), and I wish they had more kinds of barbecue sauce available to sample and mix.

2ld0za9AIZT5B1qzxFOVGw.review_text: Stepped into this bar on a rainy night and the atmosphere was so inviting. Thankfully it was raining because the first thing you see is the long line for food and if it wasn't so ugly outside I may have opted for something quicker.   After reading reviews, I wanted to try everything on the menu. I ended up going with a bbq beef sandwich and baked lasagna. Both were so good!! I like my meat drenched in sauce so for all those who like it the same way, ask for extra. The lasagna is far from dry. It's extra creamy and perfect to dip my sandwich in.   The atmosphere is warm with rustic decorations and stained glass trimming. I didn't get a chance to check out the upstairs, but the place was pretty roomy on a weeknight.   The staff is all-around nice and efficient. The line went by faster than expected. It's also a nice touch that they have someone to help people move along in line, but I guess you have to have some kind of doorman when you have so many customers.   I parked at St. Mary's Cathedral so that I wouldn't have to fight for street parking on Van Ness.

AAWRUJmIpmGc0_rd6TBbfQ.review_text: Delicious BBQ here...we ordered the BBQ beef brisket dinner plate with beans and green beans, the pickled beets and the buffalo stew sandwich. The beef brisket was DELICIOUS! The beef was just the right amount of fat to lean ratio to make it juicy and flavorful. The bbq sauce was super yummy and the bbq baked beans were just right. The green beans tasted like they were out of a can but the pickled beets were refreshing. The buffalo stew was a little heavy in sandwich form but the buffalo was less stringy than I expected. A little bit of a line but acceptable for a Saturday night.

UjAHXZHm9dJzbzK-h870Hg.review_text: We usually come here on a Sunday night to pickup dinner to go.  Our usual fare is the lamb shank.  You get two shanks with carrots, potatoes, and a roll.  They have recently raised the price but this item is still a steal to walk away with.  Kudos for the server who always recognize us as regulars.  He usually toss in more veggies and gravy.  Establishment accepts cash only!

6p_b23-lIwJORpceR1bS_Q.review_text: The inside of this place kind of reminds me of Disneyland's Frontier Land (except with lots of alcohol).  Every inch of wall space is covered with random kitschy memorabilia, and in an odd way, the nonsensical chaos of it all manages to work.     On one side of Tommy's is a cafeteria line with the large selection of meats and various sides on display. There's a makeshift menu on the wall, but we found out from one of the regulars that you can basically just point and tell them what you want.  He recommended the pastrami dinner, and it was spot on!  The sandwiches looked really good too--reasonably priced between $5-7--a steal in downtown SF!  On the opposite side of the cafeteria line is a full blown bar.  There's a wide selection of beers on tap and mixed drinks.  Tommy's is the place to come for a satisfying and hearty meal + booze--and it's a great alternative to the traditional standby of late-night diners since they serve up their home-style goodness until 2 am.  (Bring CASH--they don't accept plastic, although they do have one of those rip-off ATM machines conveniently located inside the restaurant).

MkpyVZj-S52eq7w0jSZmoA.review_text: CASH ONLY!!!! Great place, great food, great environment, brings me back in time. I highly suggest this San Francisco landmark. The process is a little weird. So you get your food, pay with CASH, and then sit down and get your drink order from the waitress and pay CASH again. Other than that it is awsome. Check it out for yourself.

KwLVZxdse7so57gQSkY6JA.review_text: Maybe we caught them on a bad day, but the food was horrible and the service non-existant.  We did not attend this for the frills, but we watched Guy F's show on TJ and he raved about it. We arrived from San Diego and this was #1 on our list to try.  We took the Larkspur Ferry to downtown SF and caught the bus to Van Ness and Geary.  When we got there it was a full house so we were excited and hungry.  What a huge disapppointment...Our food was cold/warm at best, the roast beef was bland and the mash pototoes were instant.  I also ordered a side of pork sausage and it was still frozen in middle..."yuck".  The waitress/waiter NEVER showedat our table for our drinks until they cleared our plates, huh?  Rough day at the office TJ's...best you lift your game.  We will NOT be back.  Too many other SF city joints to explore...next!

wxOdKssmCr1HKHSL3hLR-Q.review_text: I've always wanted to go to this place, my curiosity based specifically on the exterior aesthetics.  Finally, I went here with in a group of four after catching a movie at the Van Ness theater.  I was ill prepared for a hofbrau, but liked it.  I felt a little like I was back in Munich, only the local sports teams jackets really fucked that one up for me and really, the entire interior, but whatever - I had it going on at one point in time.  I didn't like what I got, but I did like other stuff that my friends got.  I tried the BBQ Turkey Sloppy Joe, sloppy was accurate.  Sloppy is fine once in a while, especially at a hofbrau, that's not what I didn't like.  I didn't care for the overall taste.  The mashed potatoes and gravy were good as was the turkey and the Sweet and Sour Spareribs.  I'd be happy to go back and get another beer and try to put on some winter weight.  I think I'll try the sandwich that involves meatballs next time.

ozeIAbijpNxSMQTnWoAFWQ.review_text: Had lunch here this afternoon, fantastic!   Why did I wait so long to try it?  Comfort food to the max, indeed, loved the mashed potatoes!  Prepped my tummy for shopping on Fillmore.  :-)

uEBYjEEGORtagp9bafj9mg.review_text: This is a great meat and potatoes place.  It's pretty cheap, the portions are big, and they have a ton of beer from all over the world.  I had the pastrami and my brother had the corned beef, both were juicy and delicious.

jadRdG9lUmMJUau50ra20g.review_text: We went in having high expectations from watching the Food Network and all the other Yelp reviews.  The food looks amazing; however, tastes mediocre.  The line was long and it seemed over hyped and you are pretty much there for the "experience."  The service is friendly and the food is really cheap (in this case you get what you pay for).

ICM-ZogVtiDt2vKS2NyyaQ.review_text: Welcome to a local water hole with a fantastic hof brau that offers a variety of meat that satisfies like M n M's. (it melts in your mouths not in your hand. The brisket, roast beef, corned beef is right on point. If u were on a budget there's always a sandwich turkey leg and sloppy Joe's. I just love this place and it always satisfies your hunger and afterwords you can get hammered from there full bar. Haters of this place can just leave and go  home

4307tGlvII4NKFwy0OSeLg.review_text: Today was a sad day, I have been failed by my fellow Yelpers.  I'm sorry but Tommy's Joynt does not deserve 4 stars.  I think I would give it 0 stars if possible.    My friend and I were looking for a quick bite to eat for lunch and decided to try Tommy's Joynt.  My friend has been there before and said he was not impressed, but decided to give it a second try and since I never been there before I wanted to see how it was for myself.    Upon walking in, the decor was kind of what I expected.  Nothing to fancy, more dive bar feel.  With the atmosphere, I expected some decent comfort food.  I wasn't to hungry so I decided to just have the bratwurst sandwich (my friend had some meat sandwich with its own au jus sauce).  When, first, looking at them take out my bratwurst, I was not impressed, it looked like it was sitting in hot water for like a year.  After receiving our food we sat ready to eat.  I added a little bit of hot mustard to my sandwich and decided to try it out, before I add the gravy that they gave me.  After my first bite, there was no flavor at all.  I could not taste the bratwurst at all.  I could tell I had some of the bratwurst, b/c I could feel the different texture in my mouth, but the only thing that had taste to it was the hot mustard.  I tried to then add the gravy to see if there would be any help and nothing.  The gravy was too sweet and that's about it.  The bread was not even worth mentioning either.    As we were forcing this meal down, my friend was complaining on how his meat was super bland.  The au jus sauce could barely help.  My friend was temped to just drink the au jus sauce straight up to get some flavor.    For my meal I have paid $3.56 and I honestly think I got ripped off for $3.60.  I could honestly say this meal almost ruined my day, it was that bad.  I would have been more satisfied with going to Burger King (and I don't even eat fast food).  I'm sorry fellow Yelpers but I don't see how you can say a meal with no taste can receive this many stars, if any.

thnNVCYcH7sIzsyZO0aAGw.review_text: I love their beef brisket with that sweet sauce..although i always forget what it is that i ordered but its always super yummy! The dinner plate is about $9 but its worth it and very filling. I tried the roast beef...its ok not my thing but i would say the beef bisket is the best thing that i've tried there...its soo yummy!

c8FOqDRhtL7q_YsQio6bog.review_text: If you're a vegetarian, you might as well just skip this review, because this is a carnivore's cafeteria.  I've been coming to Tommy's Joynt for years. My dad and I would always come here when I was a kid before or after seeing a movie. The set-up is pretty simple. You wait in line and tell the guys behind the counter which meat you'd like carved on your plate. Choose from corned beef, roast beef, turkey, or any meat that your heart (and cholesterol level) desires. You can then select a side dish to pair with it (mashed potatoes with gravy, mac & cheese, and other sides that your cardiologist would probably not recommend. They then ring your tray up at the old-school register (Cash Only, btw), hand you a roll and some butter, and then you're off to find a table.  Most everything here is priced under $10. Even the drinks (including premium spirits) at the bar are like $4 (all day long). It's easy to understand why Tommy's Joynt continues to be a success with old and young generations.

kI55n0ZBPp-DpzNVYimWrg.review_text: We came here late at night after watching a show. This place was great! The buffalo stew was delicious! The sweet and sour spareribs, although super saucy, were super tough and chewy. If I'm back in SF... I will definitely go back again for the stew!

tyPjUfyNPblczts7KszjLw.review_text: Buffalo chili? Corned beef? Polish sausage sandwiches? A Vegetarians worst nightmare! Good thing I'm only a part-time veggie.. ;). Walking in, the place smells amazing, and the decor is very cool and has an old saloon feel. Food is served cafeteria style - you order, they pile it on your plate. I got the Sloppyjoe BBQ Turkey sandwich (not much of a beef or dark meat eater, although the options looked yummy). First they lay a decent size sourdough roll on the plate and then comes the turkey meat (already in gravy), then another layer of a different gravy.  The flavors were all good, it just felt like a lot of bread and gravy without much meat (which was a little tough :/ ). The mashed potatoes were awesome, as were the baked beans I sampled on my friends plate! I wanted to see man-n-cheese on the menu!   Hell I won't complain though. For $5 I couldn't even finish the food on my plate!

-p-bowcfBW0I5qeMS3Umxg.review_text: I feel really sad writing this review after coming here for over 20 plus years and finally recently found at that they are racist here from the server to the cashier. Now let me start from what happen that night. I was meeting two of my homies here for some late night dinner after the gym my two homies were already standing in line in front and ready to order and here I come walking in and I ask hey guys what are you getting for dinner tonight? Then two white guys standing behind my homies thought I was trying to cut in line so I said  sorry I was only  asking them what they were getting for dinner then I walk to the back if the line. While I was standing in line I see that the two white guys was standing in front of the cashier to pay for there food and whisper something to the cashier and then he look over at me with a weird look then he whisper something over to the server then he give me a weird look and finally when I reach the front of the line to order my food the server totally ignore me for exactly two minutes and I said can I please get the brisket dinner with double mash five times before he decided to serve me and when he bought my plate up to place in my tray I can see his fingers all over my mash and brisket. I kept my cool and walk over to pay for my dinner then the cashier did the same thing to mean and ignore for exactly 4 minute until someone else behind me said something then he decided to finally talk to me and rude and loudly said 9.50 so I handed over my 20 dollar bill and when I reach over to get my change he just drop it on my tray close to my food. I couldn't believe that really happen to me after again coming here for over 20 plus years just cuz some white guys said something to them and they could treat me like that is just fuck up!!! I am asian and I realize today that we are still living in an environment that the race cards comes in to play is ridiculous and I am outrage and I will never come eat here ever again!!!!!

pEnPxArLOZlKC94iVkVFxQ.review_text: Now this is the best neighbor I could have ever asked for!!! I come at least once or twice a week. It was the only thing on my mind on new years and I left the party just in time to make it to the best meal ever. It's so cheap and you get so much food!!!! The BBQ briscuit beef and corned beef ha e to be my favorite, accompanied by mashed potatoes and baked beans... Ummm it's making me hungry right now. All of the people that work there are so nice and I think they are often suprised at the amount I consume n such a short period of time. They also have a full bar which I usually try to stay awayfrom cuz I coMe in after enjoying my neighborhood night life.  It is honestly my favorite place in the city, better than any bar and an yvenue I just seriously love it. Just watch out for the food black out/coma after affect it's so good you will forget everything after you eat :) enjoy!!!

3OYsB_oNKTz7Uil6XREjgA.review_text: Every time I visit San Fran I MUST stop here. Thanksgiving food every time! Damn...so good! Ambiance is great too.

O7hVHYuHj3pqk79UYlJEGw.review_text: I've only had the corned beef and brisket sandwiches here and both were scrumptious.  They put the perfect amount of meat in between the slices of bread.  Add a little mustard (and maybe some mayo) and it will melt in your mouth~

dUtQekrUY3dt0B_AsC69jw.review_text: This place is a classic.  It seems as if most people who live in SF or visited it a few times would have made it in there by now, so I don't think a detailed description is in order.  Nice and dark, good bar, cafeteria food and seating -- just superb.  Go for the food, stay for the dank.  boobies

8pC0ZsCRO65Tp0Sdz9iV_A.review_text: Great food and drinks. You probably saw this on Diners, Drive-in's and Dives and it fits the bill perfectly. I started drinking with friends and a huge line started to form by the door at like 11 pm...What the....Amazing food starting flowing out of this place like magic. Huge portions of artery clogging amazingness was everywhere!! I got a couple different meat items to share and they were sold by the pound which I thought to be hilarious. The food is high quality and there were tons of locals sneaking in for carry out late in the evening which is a great sign of course.   It's in a great location with lots of cool bars all around it like Vertigo, etc. The Opal across the street is a great place to stay for the night for like $50 if you book ahead.   This is a really cool place to go with friends and have some food and drinks late in the evening and definitely worthy of 5 stars.

QGsDg7N8sw350BpObaawoQ.review_text: Tommy's Joynt I've been coming here since I was a kid,about 45 years ago and on any trip never miss a chance to get into Tommy's Joynt . My dad took me there as a child as a native San Franciscan I just want to say , if you haven't been here you're missing out on LIFE! Hot Pastrami on sourdough roll, potato salad, hot mustard and au jus . Don't forget the pickles!! I now live in  Hawaii and have sent hundreds of friends, family and tourists there always with great reviews. I still wonder how many times that buffalo head got stolen, I remember 2.  Live-on Tommy's Joynt! Go Eat There!!

KZ41Gn5DAkF9drz45WmZfg.review_text: the food is so clutch their gravy and beef brisket n buffalo stew is better than anything I ever had from a powdered bag or like hometown buffet and its helal cheap too pretty yummy

Pe4Ygg8ELD7Ao-AnlasszA.review_text: Decided to check this place based on its good reviews on yelp and I'm glad I did! One of the best brisket sandwiches I have ever had. Awesome atmosphere with good sized portions. I will definitely be back next trip to San Fran!

iUClhGZaYne0RxmdWLOuSg.review_text: I guess this is a place where man serve man. It is meat and a side splashed on your plate in front of you, the waitress will come to you once you sit down for the drinks. They have a wide selection of beer and the food is decent. I guess it is not exactly my cup of tea but we were on the way to a concert near by, late and hungry so we just tried it. If you like big portions and you are a true meat lover give it a chance, it is not a bad place, the servers are nice, the food selection varied, i guess the ambiance was what threw me off.

_I-jEFK9dWfE3u_gZz_BfQ.review_text: Tommy's is a staple of SF college life. I am assuming its also a staple of SF alcholism, and its so cool.  Good hearty food that really hits the spot after a night of drinking or a night of greenness.  Stiff strong drinks that really f you up.  Great staff that all have strong opinions about which foods are the yummiest  Recomend the Stew or the stuffing! Great Corn Beef.   The perfect night: 1. smoke 2. flick at van ness with some popcorn 3. smoke 4. huge dinner aith a couple of strong drinks at Tommy's 5. smoke 6. hot lovin' 7. sleeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeep  i love tommy's

H5tU70rJCqCES1FBCz8-NA.review_text: A San Francisco landmark.  If you come to San Francisco for three days or longer, you should eat at least one meal here.

aXlKEbjLvffoFf20KTiQRw.review_text: This place was ON POINT! A 130 or 2 am accidental discovery after getting lost... searching for a vacant hotel room for an out-of-town visitor... we decided to give up temporarily on the hunt for an affordable hotel and go get milkshakes at Mel's Diner. Their loss, they were closed and wouldn't let us in even to order to-go.   The homeless man out front suggested we try out Tommy's. I should have gone back and given him some change and a high five for the suggestion.   Tommy's is the most awesome dive spot full of character, gross yet lovely charm, and HOT FOOD AT 2AM. What more do you want? Their selection of drinks is absurd. The decor is hilariously entertaining. There is even a signed "Diners, Drive-ins and Dives" poster. WINNING.   It's a gem. I'd go back. The food seriously surprised me. Would love to get tipsy here and make friends with some old fishermen-esque dive bar trolls. :)

rjvqsyvfcX18nncaAq_VEA.review_text: The business info on Yelp is wrong. This place DOES take reservations.  Anyways, they did a fantastic job hosting our 50 person Thanksgiving Eve party!

l7dL6hcK2F0G4Qxbu68P-Q.review_text: One of my favorite places of all time in SF!!!!  If you're looking for fancy and chic, get the F out and don't hate!  You don't belong here!  This is an awesome place if you're looking to chat with friends over a nice tall glass of adult beverage or craving some late night meal (and you don't need a wad of cash for them).  The bartenders are old school that knows their drinks and easy to BS with.  I haven't really gone there often for the bar, I've been there more for the food.  They have such a wide array of anti-vegan meals, I'm surprised that those animals are not yet endangered.  I don't know how else to describe Tommy's, but Annie P. and Jeaninne S. pretty much summ'd it for me.

oiZNrO8Z4q0h-Qg41_odhQ.review_text: When I get a hankering for a traditional American-style dinner, Tommy's Joynt is the only thing that fits the bill. They offer dinner plate combos of meat, sides, and a dinner roll. The side choices are all great: macaroni, potato, carrot, and cucumber salads, beans, veggies, or mashed potatoes. I always go for the mashed potatoes, they are so creamy and buttery. I honestly don't know where else to go for quality, homestyle mashed potatoes in this city. The buffalo chili is really good too, and even the white rice was buttery and delicious.  I have been to Tommy's for dinner a number of times now, and each time I left feeling happy and full! Recently, I stopped in for takeout and was even more pleased to learn how easy it is to get the food to go. It held up so well, still piping hot when we sat down to eat it!

Abw-iHeU2-Ldcwq0KQhInA.review_text: What a place. I was in town for work and it was late and decide to drive by Tony's. As usual bustling Line to the door that moves quickly. Gives you plenty of time to decide your order before  get to the couner. Fresh and fast. This place has great crusty ambiance and one of the things I love about this place. Hearty comfort food dishes. No nonsense waitresses to take your drink orders. What is there not to like about this place. Great prices. It's a keeper

2IyAfWgJhU7N0Q-9gyDm2g.review_text: My group of 4 all had sandwiches... Fresh turkey, moist round, and best brisket this side of Texas. Best part was it a $10 spot for this amazing cut of meat, fresh bread and a premium beer. If only I could rate this a 6 or even a 7.

7Na1pUcEv3oF_QTRwZ-2iw.review_text: Delicious and open late. What more could you want? Considering it is across the street from Mel's, you totally have to give it a try because all the Mel's are the same, for the most part.  This place is open super late and is cash only. Set up like a BBQ buffet, the meat here was hearty and filling. I loved their mashed potatoes and brisket. Their prices were very low, and the dining style was fun and great for large groups. YUM!!!

75Er1Yc1pcrcFhJF6HYVPA.review_text: Love this place for some good, cheap eats.

9Vmqj86WQ6WTU8SdSkfBCA.review_text: I hate the slicers at Tommy's Joynt since they always give my friend Robert the tender juicy slices Pastrami and then give me the crappiest cut.  It is very obvious when they do it and they don't give a shit.  I am the tipper too.  After they did it to me last time I stopped tipping them and stopped going there too.  They suck...

KqIZAhAjlPq6D62FvJcJDA.review_text: Holy cow, almost 1000 reviews!  I guess I'm late to the party and my review will most likely be superfluous but what the hell.  This place is great!    They serve old fashioned, cafeteria style foods.  You will find delicious classics like corned beef and cabbage, sausages, steak, and spaghetti.  They also serve buffalo the last time I was there and it was great.  There is no waiter service - you pretty much pick up the food from the counter.  However, there are cocktail waitresses who come by and take your order for booze.  Oh, and they serve Opptimator, which is rare.  The interior is old and kinda grungy, but it has a real charm to it.  Hard to explain.  During the day, it's pretty normal, but I've been here at night and it does get seedy.  You get some hardcore alcoholics and some deranged looking people; it reminds me of San Francisco before the gentrification.

JtN2VvC26anadoeAKanLWg.review_text: As simple as it gets.  Meat.  Tender meat.  Seasoned and cooked with no flair or outstanding quality, just cooked and placed on your plate in slab form.  If you order a sandwich, expect meat on bread.  No fancy garnishes or sauces.  I often get sandwiches to go, bring them home on my lunch break and put on my own mustard, etc.. The side dishes exist.  They're nothing special either.  This place is cheap and filling, but for all the hype it's not even the best hoffenbrau in SF.   Also beware--sometimes the tourists just appear in swarms and the line goes out the door, but still moves reasonably fast.

mnRN7f34nVNyE60ey_5upA.review_text: It's bland and pretty meh. I don't regret going but I'm not going back

vKbWuE-8NFWdXs7iQs3t5Q.review_text: I'm not a big eater, although I can appreciate food in any form.  This place gets three stars for the price and quantity of food they offer.  If you want something hot and affordable, and don't mind the lack of thought behind seasoning (heavy), presentation, or preparation, you'll be okay.  My husband loves the corned beef , and it's a go-to item for him every time we come.  I have had the brisket (good), salmon (okay), and oxtail dishes.  They are full of flavor, though not what you would expect.  For instance, the oxtail was cooked to perfect tenderness, however, it was way too sweet for my taste.  I expected a savory stew but got more of a braised oxtail with sweet, sweet, barbecue sauce.  IMHO, it was a waste of a fairly expensive cut of meat.  Whatever happened to honoring the animal that gave it's life for this meal?  Anyway, that's another conversation altogether.    The folks here are nice enough, the prices are right, portions are generous, and the atmosphere is casual.  It's a good place to take in a filling meal without emptying your bank account.  They only take cash, so bring some; or you can use their ATM and pay the fee.

54CUJlhYcCpYTJgBioaPIg.review_text: Great late night eats! Went on a late Thursday night and it was excellent.   I had the lamb shank w mashed potatoes and gravy and was exquisitely satisfied. Boyfriend had the buffalo stew sandwich with baked beans and was not as pleased with the buffalo stew, still really good though!  Definitely look forward to coming back and exploring the rest of the menu!

Fcig8YnnowLD3ktJpN1mGQ.review_text: Meat, meat and more meat.  This is kinda like thanksgiving all year round, but there is so much more than just turkey and stuffing and mashed potatoes.  Of course, they have turkey and stuffing and mashed potatoes, but they also have corned beef, roast beef, chicken, buffalo, etc.  Probably a few other species.  They also have cole slaw, beans and such.  Look for the specials.  A full bar with a number of great beers on tap round out the selection.  Of course the old, funky decor just lends to the experience.  On a diet or a practicing vegetarian?  You might want to look elsewhere.  But otherwise, it's hard to go very wrong here...

7Ek4da_Btvznc4Q4S0_Bag.review_text: Let's face it - this place is all about scene.   But really, their brisket does rock the planet. The meat is totally melt in your mouth tender and the fat blobs are the perfect consistency. I only wish their "barbecue" sauce wasn't essentially horrible. I mean, just don't plan on judging it on the bbq sauce. Get it dry and put A1 on it or bring your own sauce. Oh, Dave S is right; this place is purgatory or worse for vegetarians.  Tonight I met some old friends there to break some bad news to them. It was the perfect place to do it. Our seasonal crab feed has been cancelled. Pretty devastating but Tommy's made up for it by coincidentally having a raffle drawing - all you needed to do to get a ticket was buy a drink. The red checked tablecloths and the raffle drawing were exactly like the annual crab feed, and we all felt a little bit better for some old San Francisco institutions still being around.  People should understand that Tommy's is a cafeteria style place and also that it is funky with lots of nooks and crannies and old stuff. The service is very nice, but you're not going to get pampered and the food is what it is. The meat is generally good quality, the soups and chilis are loved by all, but gourmet it ain't. If you haven't been to Tommy's and you like places like Lefty's and/or a cheap meal among people who feel like friends, you'll feel warm and cozy at Tommy's. The other thing I can vouch for is the turkey leg with stuffing. Can't go wrong.

kqRcwT46Jc522q7Bc1r24g.review_text: Really disappointed with this place after seeing and reading all the hype for this place. I see plenty people on Yelp like it and it was even featured on one of my favorite food network shows "triple d". Plus I love beef brisket so how can this place go wrong?  Well today I made my first and probably last visit to this place. So I get there and look at the menu and notice this place is cash only? I mean come on now, if you been in business this many damn years then why not step into the year 2009 and get a damn debit card machine, hell I've seen vendors at street fairs and flea markets with debit card machines so what's Tommy's excuse?  So after we dig in our wallets to come up with some cash I ordered the bbq brisket sandwich on sourdough. So I see them cut up the brisket and give me a few slices and I'm thinking "thats all?" I know its $5.50 and all but damn I guess times must be tough. I mean the bread made up the majority of the sandwich, isn't it suppose to be the other way around? And to top it off I have to bust out my wallet again to buy my drink since you can't buy it when you pay for your food.
