All around not what I expected, but the brisket itself was tender and had lots of potential but I won't be back for a while, a long while at that.

f2_ORdto2MUlxp6-LlmKgg.review_text: Coming to Tommy's tonight reminded me of being in a school cafeteria line, except there was booze lining one wall and the whole venue was full of adults. I came here with a friend to have a meal before a movie at his recommendation and I was really excited to check the place out, as I know it's a San Francisco staple and it was featured on Guy Fieri's "Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives".  We get in and I'm instantly overwhelmed with the decor and the venue, but in a good way. It has a rustic homely feel to it, but there are little quirks around every corner. Cash only, so make sure you hit up your bank's ATM prior.  I ordered the beef brisket special which came with mashed potatoes (my choice as opposed vegetables) and beans (as opposed to a salad). The beef brisket was probably some of the best brisket I have ever had in my life. Slathered in their homemade BBQ sauce, I seriously did not want this meal to end! Every slice of my brisket was juicy, plentiful and tasty. There was no bad part to meal, and I was honestly looking for something to be a stickler about, The portions were adamant for the price and everything was just amazing.  I can't wait to come back here and trying the giant turkey leg!

v_tz6D4BLW5I7rueVtJNPA.review_text: This place is a San Francisco institution!! Growing up anytime we came to SF with any member of my family lunch at Tommy's Joynt is automatic. My great grandfather started coming here when it opened and it has been passed on through our family for 5 generations and many more to come.  All their food is classic and delicious!  My personal favorite is their corned beef, pastrami, and turkey. It is a real dilemma having to decide between them as they are all great!

mvqvnprmVixglO8-R1dc4A.review_text: Not sure what the buzz is about this place. We went here since it was the only thing open on Wednesday night at 11m and it was pretty convenient. I had the turkey and salmon. Thought the turkey was dry and wasn't one bit impressed.

pDECV7hUB1UyYLw_rZfkgA.review_text: I was 15 when my step mom took me to Tommy's Joint for the first time and I never lost my love for this place. It is way close to my heart. At 17, I was going to punk shows in the early eighties and Tommy's was one of the only places that would take my fake ID (I'm 43 now, so don't judge me or Tommys). The food is good, cheap and the atmosphere is what I like - real and old. Pitcher of beer, a few friends and a BBQ beef sandwich - makes me feel like it's 1984 again! Love this place!

WjvIGdLc7ZZpiux3P6xSEg.review_text: A friend of mine really likes this place so we stopped here for a quick dinner before seeing a movie across the street.  I had the pasta special and it tasted like it came out of a can. But hey, it's cheap so you really can't complain....  This is a very simple place to stop at for a cheap and quick meal. Don't come in expecting too much. They have a bar and the prices listed on the wall for booze were really cheap, too. I didn't get a drink but I noticed they had some decent beers on tap. I am giving them an extra star solely for the bar section even though I did not drink there. If I ever come back, it will be to get a cheap drink at the bar, not to eat.

f-N8vG4zZglejT7X5iCGZg.review_text: lets just say i felt like a totally fat ass once i left here lol everything was really good... !

xiBGreimmO1XYqznZIwv1w.review_text: Even well into the night, this place was poppin and quite crowded. And after getting one of their signature sandwiches, I can tell why...  BBQ Beef sandwich is where it's at. At first, I was a bit skeptical about getting sandwiches for dinner, but I really liked the BBQ Beef. Even though it only had mustard, mayo, (and cheese I think?), it still had a great smoky taste, and was pretty tender as well - it just tasted...real (if that makes sense). The only thing that kept it from being the perfect BBQ beef sandwich is that the bread was a bit tough to my liking.  Love the backyard BBQ atmosphere of the place, and it remained crowded throughout the night.

8009a15Ow6ryqfJQueNYPA.review_text: I love me some Tommy's but took away one star because it still annoys me that they only take cash!!

IU-7eZMf_qc6T3ILdsylMQ.review_text: Four Stars? There are so many people on Tommy's jock they should change the name to Ron Jeremy.  I blame alcohol. Tommy's is a classic place to grab "drunk food" so that *has* to be the reason it's so well reviewed.   I live nearby and have eaten here many times sober:  1) the meat is OK. The cuts are usually pretty fatty but that's how they're priced. 2) Stay away from the pasta.  I love pasta but had a stomach ache twice after eating the pasta meat sauce.   3) My favorite thing is the turkey leg and rice.  This place is relatively cheap - expect a cut of meat with side and salad to go for 8-9 bucks, but you get what you pay for (I can get $4 sushi at Safeway too.. doesn't mean I should).  Good for quick romp in the hay when you're drunk, but when you sober up, you'll realize you can do better.

8fpQdFUsRnV3xmcH5VPMcw.review_text: best Lamb shanks and spare ribs in town!

lLvNgtTSDah6XTdziRey6Q.review_text: Imagine being able to enjoy Thanksgiving any day of the week! Walk in and there it is, people ready to cut you slabs off meat fresh off the corpse. While the group I was with all chose a version of Thanksgiving, I opted for the Meatball sandwich. When it arrived I was pleasantly surprised. Two long cuts of bread, and plenty of large meatballs smothered in an amazing sauce. Once seated you can order your beers from the bar nearby. This place reminds me of a restaurant I went to in Berlin. The walls were plastered in old  metal beer signs, most of them in German. Gives you the feeling this place has been around for a long time. Definitely worth the visit, you wont run into to many places like this.

x6MLG-i7ybWNkZdE545u-w.review_text: I decided to try Tommy's Joynt while I was staying across the street at a hotel. I wandered over, bored and wanting for something to do while waiting for my friend to get off work. I was immediately shocked at the line drifting out of the doorway. Luckily enough, it moves very quickly.  I'm a beef lover, so my eyes immediately drifted to the BBQ brisket and corned beef. Indecisive, I asked for half and half and they were happy to oblige. I got mashed potatoes and salad for my sides. Everything was so yummy, but the meat was divine. It was really juicy, succulent and oh-so-melt-in-your-mouth good. I loved it so much, I went back the next night.  The beer selection is enormous... It's mostly bottled but they have a great selection of imports, Belgians, and many other beers.  The setting is very quaint, with communal tables and a wonderful bar that patrons can opt to dine at. That's where I had my dinner and the bartender was happy to provide me with not only drinks, but also silverware and anything else that I needed.  But what puts Tommy's over the top is the prices. Uncharacteristically low for San Fran, Tommy's keeps tried and true to low prices and hefty, yet quality-induced portions. Looking forward to my next visit to Tommy's!

b_d1QFNWBi3vlTt9y0cwsw.review_text: Dipped corned beef sandwich! The best.

2OzT8NIKcP4bUgolp6MI6Q.review_text: The place had got character, I'll give it that.    And the prices--less than $20 for two, including sides--can't beat it.  But the food itself is just not so good.  It's kind of comfort food but its just bland and.... blah.  I don't think I'll be back.

FkiDKAYGGNIPQVdMe4JEXQ.review_text: My friend (who has been watching me type all evening) is glaring at me from across the room because he truly believes Tommy's deserves a five star but as I type I try to explain I've had dry brisket here and let's face it there are few things worse than dry brisket!  Having said that yes, this place is an institution in SF and the buffalo stew and turkey sandwiches are good grubbin. The beer selection is quite nice (or maybe it just caters to people like me) and their bloody mary is more than passable. The decor kind of reminds me of a college boys dorm if his dad and grandpa had the same taste as him and he's just added to the collection. Still not too shabby and easy on the wallet (which is always a plus-hence why this place got a 4 instead of a 3).

pO6mu_37HMNGZlyzWBwZ7g.review_text: What a gem.  Great beers (although there is high likelihood they'll be outta the one you want.)  A big ol' buffet of slow roasted meats.  And a fantastic barrel of pickles that we hit about 4x.  The atmosphere is bustling, loud, and full of kitsch.    Don't let the line for the buffet deter you as you enter Tommy's.  Bust through it, grab a table, order beers and plan your meat attack.  Bring cash (although you don't need alot of it.)

EGePDHaEoeV0xvB5X0vNRQ.review_text: Went to Tommy's Joynt after work with a group of my co workers awhile back. Ordered the Beef Brisket dinner plate and felt like licking the plate when I finished. The place is like a school order your food and find a seat to eat in which doesn't bother me at all. All the staffs were nice and very friendly. I still haven't gotten the chance to try everything yet but when I do I know I will always leave the place satisfied, because Tommy's Joynt won't disappoint you. Prices of the food are affordable that's all I can say and its "CASH ONLY" but there is an ATM inside. I do recommend this place if your hungry late at night with a group of friends why not stop at Tommy's Joynt instead of a Denny's or an Ihop! Fricken love this place could go on but I should stop!

lD3YhWTQkiXKQgKfiBXPPA.review_text: In the continued perusal of my 'tea for 20' policy on Sundays, the wife and I tried Tommy's tonight. This place rocks!  The wife had a BBQ brisket plate (with mash, coleslaw and a bread roll) and I had sloopy joe with a side of beans. Washed down with a coffee and tea the total came to $18.99 which fitted nicely into our 20 buck limit for sunday dinner.  The food was great - we'd not had home style before and we will be back ASAP to fill up again. The seating is in long tables and makes dinner a more social experience .  Parking at the hotel next to Tommy's was easy - take the ticket to the cashier when you leave after your chow and pay then and there. $1.50 for an hour was pretty reasonable given the hassle it is parking in this area.  The only reason this place dropped a star was because it was so darn busy. The line inside was all the way down the side of the bar and into the back when we left which made it a little unconformable with a load of hungry punters standing over you while you eat.

UMUZqm2KGm9evsgtMxjEyQ.review_text: I got it to go...we were across the street at the movie theater waiting for the cattle to be herded inward.  Then it happened...the infamous tingling feeling.  No NOT the happy ending kine...the kine that happens right before you pass out.  I was hungry - yet again.  So I hurdled a few cars and dodged a couple busses across Geary.  TWICE!  Once the dust settled, I was in line with a to-go box full of ox tails and a whole lotta napkins!    Thank god I had someone there to hold their hands out for use as a portable table!  I'm sure by the looks of all the sauce on my hands and face - the surrounding crowd was disgusted and unimpressed.    Fug-em.  Food First.  All else the latter...3 Stars!

0vlH5wMTG60abGTuiiy7hw.review_text: Wowzers. I'm a pretty enthusiastic yelper by nature but Tommy's Joynt definitely earned all five stars!  Came here with the bf last night after catching a Giants game... we were starving but refused to pay big bucks for a dinky ballpark frank and beer. We decided to hoof it down to the TL and met up with one of our pals for some meat sammies instead.  Here are some things to love about Tommy's Joynt, in no particular order:  - DELICIOUS SANDWICHES, FULL OF MEAT! - jar of sliced pickles, yours for the taking - the old timey-dive bar-irish pub-truck stop-new york deli-bbq pit vibe - various gravys (gravies? dipping sauces.) - will not break the bank; big portions for small bucks - extra extra hot horseradish - the hilarious spelling of Joynt  I had the pastrami and bf had the corned beef. WOOOOW you guys. I'm from New York: I know what good deli meat tastes like... and I was blown away. SO DANG GOOD! Both were truly remarkable, although I have to say, the gravy that came with the corned beef was a little better, kind of sweet and very complimentary to the meat. Well played, Tommy's Joynt. Well played.  After we settled into a booth, our very friendly and patient waitress came over to get our drinks. I asked her what was on draught and had to stop her after 30 seconds... the list is pretty much endless! Our other friend was too poor to order anything (times is tough, y'all!) but she brought him a half pint "sympathy beer" anyway. So sweet!  Seems like they do cater to a pretty late crowd, which was nice- we didn't feel like we were being hurried at any point. The place was still pretty packed when we left, around midnight.  So. If you ever find yourself in the TL with an empty tummy, the wind is howling and the air is damp, do yourself a favor and grab a seat at Tommy's Joynt... you can thank me later with a pastrami on sourdough. Pickles on the side.

hBQ38MnA6j5W_mh62y-fEg.review_text: I love food that sticks to your bones!  Tommy's Joynt definitely delivers on warm, hearty home food.  I love the atmosphere of the place and the prices are decent too!  Me, being the pig I am and also the ever-indecisive Gemini, well, I decided that I couldn't just have a dinner.  How about some extras?  I ended up with the pastrami dinner with mashed potatoes and gravy, pork and beans and a sourdough roll with butter.  And some spaghetti.  I couldn't resist!  Their food is friggin awesome!  The pastrami was a little on the salty side, but it's pastrami and that's to be expected.  I'm also a salt whore, so that was not a bad thing to me.  I only wished they gave me an extra scoop of mashed potatoes and gravy!  I'm not always a mashed potatoes girl, but damn if they don't have good ones there!  And who can resist gravy?!?!    The pork and beans were the best I've had in I can't remember how long.  They were sweet and salty and tasty!  I also had their spaghetti which was covered with a meat sauce.  That was also really friggin good!  I also tried some of the brisket (tasty and tender), as well as their corned beef and cabbage.  Yay!  I'm Irish on my dad's side, so I'm a big fan of corned beef and cabbage.  I'm just used to only having it for St. Patty's Day.  It was defintely a nice treat to have corned beef and cabbage in January!  I ended up loving everything so much that I ate it all except for maybe two slices of pastrami so I could have my co-workers taste how good it was.  I was like the energizer bunny...I kept going and going and going and going...until it was all gone!  I dig this place for not only their food, but also their atmosphere.  I would actually go here if I wasn't working, it's that good!  At any rate...if you haven't been to Tommy's Joynt, you have to mosey on over.  It's worth your time.  A last piece of advice: it's cash only, so make sure you get some before you go in!

XQMaAvF3YUslCD-0tZY1xg.review_text: Old School at it's finest - meat on a plate; with a roll and various sides.  Came in on a Thursday Night at 7; ordered the corned beef plate with baked beans and mashed potatoes and gravy- which ran $10.13 with tax; then proceeded to sit at the bar and order a Guinness.  Meat was tad dry; mashed potatoes were ok - however the beans were amazing.  Service was on point - with a waitress working the dining room; and the waitress paying the bar cash for all drinks each time they came up which seemed a tad inefficent yet it appears they do not have Micros or Aloha here.  CASH ONLY.

8Lc3-TTHjExd79GSQIHnAw.review_text: Been here twice now - both times were memorable.  It's semi-cheap and the meat is amazing.  The bread is eh and the salads are pretty good.  The roast beef was so good.  The ambiance is not for dates.  It's for fun friends who play with naughty toys from the bathroom.  Cash only!  There's fun toys in the bathrooms.  Bring 3 quarters!

Cf87Z3NPUaQhpFrQVmAwjg.review_text: Their turkey sandwich was pretty good. The turkey was freshly carved and nice and moist. It wasn't anything special, but it was filling.

mtR36A8cqppab6472_b6Og.review_text: Yes it's the best place for delicious brisket portions are big and everything is super fresh. They got condiment selection that includes horseradish and other things I didn't dare to try. Big beer selection and mixed drinks. I don't think I can ask for more. And if this wasn't enough they are open late and hahaha joint.

w1tI3Oh7GB-fUYzECYrnlQ.review_text: Just when I thought that Tommy's couldn't get better... IT DID.   I brought a few out-of-town friends here for a post-drinking meal and one of them ordered the Buffalo Stew, which I had never tried before.  WOOOOW, schooled by a tourist... and one from the OC, at that.  The Buffalo Stew was absolutely freakin' delicious. Not gamey at all. Tasted like the most tender, savory, hearty, homey, delicious beef stew I have ever had. Served over a hot bowl of white rice, GAME OVER!   Looks like I'll be adding a new side dish to my usual corned beef sandwich....

dDEj8C8dm7CY36AQaJ-FPg.review_text: The meat here is amazingly juicy. You wait in a crazy long line full of foodies and bar hoppers trying to sink their teeth into one of their sandwiches. It looks fairly dive bar-ish. The bartenders are not pushy and invited us to take our time on deciding from the beer menu. The waitress Sandra was super sweet and suggested food items to try. I ended up with the pastrami sandwich and used the spicy mustard from the table. Amazing-town! You will not leave hungry.

IOhVIAjtdGo3NZ75_fF4Qw.review_text: After seeing this place featured as a popular restaurant on Yelp, I came here with a few friends.  There's a decent amount of metered parking along Geary or Van Ness Street.  As soon as you enter the restaurant, you're already lining up to order from the cafeteria.  The food simply tasted as if it was straight from a cafeteria.  I ordered a simple pastrami sandwich - what I got was 2 pieces of hard sourdough bread and several thick slices of pastrami (not exactly the deli cut I was hoping for).  It also came with a dipping sauce, but it did not mask the bland flavor of the pastrami.  It was almost unbearable to eat.  I was also able to try the mashed potatoes and it was really, nothing special.  I dont even remember the cafeteria food tasting this bad. I dont think I'll ever be returning UNLESS one day my tastebuds are totally flipped 180 degrees and I suddenly crave cafeteria (let's just hope that day never comes)!

tIn5b-2UzF2LMB9RCqczyQ.review_text: Hot Mustard that's hot; Turkey legs, Corned Beef, Pastrami, Ah-mazin.

52oH4DrRvzzl8wh5UXyU0A.review_text: This place is rich in character. The owner is usually there to chit chat with the customers. I love all the antiques and pictures they have on the walls! The food is so plentiful. Try anything on the menu, you wont be disappointed!

Fv-0TzwmzV3JwZfEatTo0Q.review_text: Walking into the place made me slightly skeptical. The line was backed up to the door, and I anticipated a long wait, but the smell of home cooked food was glorious! The line ended up moving pretty quickly which was great.  The food was pretty simple, but quite delicious. My boyfriend ordered the BBQ steak sandwich and I ordered the pastrami. Both of the meats were cooked to perfection and came with a side of sauce.  We also ordered a side of mac and cheese, but were not overly thrilled with a seasoning that was in it.   The place was great, feel good food. Real simple, real quick. We did not order anything to drink. The place is cafeteria style, nothing fancy, and it was cash only, but while you wait in line there is an atm right on the way through the line (conveniently I might add.)  With some daily specials, cheap beer, and late hours, we will definitely be back!

ZF6pafgFFywXpHz3bSfqAA.review_text: Very good food at very good prices!  It definitely has regulars, and at lunch expect a bit of a line.  The place moves very fast I've been in-and-out in about 10mins w/ takeout back to the office.

4QIyUE6oV5yBoIAm73ehug.review_text: This place is always alluring when I walk by. They've got huge juicy pieces of meat right next to the door and the smell wafts into the sidewalk. They've got an impressive selection of bottled beer from around the world. Overall a great place to bring people from out of town. On with the food!  Round of Beef Sandwich - surprisingly tasty although the bread is only so-so. Comes with au jus and the table has hot/mild mustard and horseradish. Although a little dry, it was still very good and only ~$6.    Chili over Rice - This is ~$7 which is expensive for the amount of chili you get (not that much). But it was definitely memorable with big pieces of meat and beans. Delicious (albeit expensive) side order.  Pastrami Sandwich - This I thought was excellent. Probably some of the best pastrami I've ever tasted.   Some girls next to us got the Saturday special (short ribs over rice). It looked and smelled so good. Definitely coming back.   Other notes: It's an official landmark and really sticks out of the neighborhood. Great food and quite cheap.

TSdV_lsddT4F3TJvmdmXag.review_text: Try nothing but the meat.  The delicious, perfectly cooked, flavorful meat with whichever sauce or jus you receive.  Sandwiches were our drug of choice yesterday: $5.75 for meat and a bun (the sourdough was delicious) plus jus.  All-you-can-eat pickles (tart and refreshing).  I had the turkey, which was juicy and full of flavor.  Turkey can so often go wrong, but Tommy and his Joynt managed to serve up a hunk of white meat that was utterly satisfying, especially for the price.   However, my +1 had the BBQ beef on sourdough, which made me instantly sorry I ever cheated on cows with a mere bird.  The sauce, served on the side in a little metal pitcher, elevated some pretty damn good beef to orgasmic levels.  I wouldn't bother with any sides - the sandwich was filling enough, and I don't come to a meat joint to eat coleslaw.  It's not a fancy place, but boy, was it tasty.  Save a seat and a hunk of hot cow flesh for me, Tommy.

dVX6h7tyhX95mFj7NCpHbQ.review_text: Been coming here since '98 when I was only about 10 or so and the place is still the same, which is a good thing.   BBQ Turkey Sloppy Joe IS ALWAYS ON POINT! Meat is always piled high on your plate.  This place is prefect if you're on a budget but want awesome food.  I got a parking ticket for over-staying my meeter from this place one time. Make sure you put sufficient funds in your meeter if you want to enjoy yourself with your crew having dinner or something.  I love the vintage memorabilia and history behind this place as well, especially the "Hello My Name Is" stickers on the ceiling of the upper half of the "joynt".  (I added photos of them in the Tommy's Joynt photo album here on their Yelp page)  I hope this establishment stays here for years to come.

XKnEGiPjvI69SVHIdUpS9Q.review_text: Comfort food with a pinch of nostalgia...  Somehow this place make me feel like I'm in a 21st century Tavern... It's truly a MEAT LOVER'S HEAVEN! Just as you enter, the  display of ROASTED, BRAISED AND STEWED BEEF AND LAMB shank with their wonderful aromas make you want to order everything on the menu.  I used to stop by after work or school for a diner plate or a good sandwich when I didn't feel like cooking. It's cheap and the portions are huge! If you want a yummy, hearty  homemade style dish, give Tommy's Joynt a try.  PS: I wouldn't recommend their desserts....

6spgB0rFS8wpjhtnyt3KEA.review_text: Buffalo stew anyone?  This is better than the most famous New York Deli's AND they have a bar too!!!!!  You can get a beer and a hot pastrami sandwich at 1:30am.  Put that in your pipe and smoke it, NY.

dVqxThmOXIF3Qb6wBkpbsA.review_text: For home cooking, hofbrau status, this place is a gem. I'm one of the lucky ones who lives right up the street, which is probably the best thing considering I need the exercise after devouring their ridiculously cheap and sizable portions. There's a reason why Guy Fieri filmed there, it's legit. The lamb shanks are fabulous!

QpjRc-dOVkJcGZFKcsbe0A.review_text: There's no place any place quite like this place so this must be the place.  Their tagline, which I suppose is true - it is unique in a way. It certainly wasn't what I expected. You walk in and are immediately at the end of the line to order and say what else you want of the food that is displayed in a cafeteria-like manner (thus, you don't wait at all for your food) and then sit at long tables with other groups of people. The is a staff that takes bar orders, but they are super slooooow. I was almost done with my food before my beer showed up. It was a fun/interesting environment though and it was listed in our guidebooks as a "local favorite" which by the number of ppl there on a Monday night, I'd say is true. It was a pretty good mix of families/tourists and people who had clearly stopped in on their way home from work.   The food on the other hand is far from unique. That isn't to say the food is bad, it just doesn't stand out at all. I got the turkey platter with mash potatoes, a salad and a roll. My friends all got basically the same thing, and we all laughed that it reminded us of a (bland) Thanksgiving dinner. They did give us a very generous portion of turkey though.

aVaa64zb_-d6VTY3XcXyIQ.review_text: BAR + DINER + MESS-HALL SMASHED TOGETHER (4 stars)  Who doesn't wonder what kind of food is servered in that loud building on the corner of VanNess?   - FOOD, good - PRICES, affordable - SERVICE, good and quick - AMBIANCE, dim bar/dinner smashed together  The line somewhat reminded me of a school cafeteria, you get in line, you order what you want, and you pay at the end. Serving some classical and traditional meals. While in line, the menus are overwhelming, YOU JUST DONT KNOW WHERE TO START. Do you get the dinner meals or do you settle for a sandwich? We settled on some sandwiches. After you pay there is a BARREL of pickles. Help yourself!  HEFER STATUS.  CORNBEEF SANDWICHES ($6 each) - fresh carved cornbeef. They aren't stingy on the poritions. Didn't get sides because the sandwiches were plenty enough. However, did help ourselves to the barrell of pickles. The cornbeef itself was kind of too salty when eaten by itself but when eating it sandwich style - tasty, the bread helped. It came with a side of Au Jus which makes the sandwich even better and moist. The bread (sandwich roll) was really good!!! Something about the yeast in that bread was just.... satisfying.   Will I be back? Yes!! Perhaps we will get different things to share. I want to try the Pastrami Sandwich and a dinner meal.  Until the next review...

D96pOQ39yzgoJWObBZ9Wzg.review_text: Hofbrau, hofbrau, how I adore thee hofbrau. This hofbrau like bar makes it hip to eat at a hobrau, and is not at all geriatric in the usual sense (if you go to Harry's Hofbrau, that's a whole other environment there). Here there's a very dimly lit bar to the left, a packed dining restaurant in the middle and upstairs, and the cafeteria bar of glistening hot food on the right. As soon as you step inside you're greeted with the menu. I love seeing giant slabs of meat, giant buckets of sides, and lots and lots of gravy. Mmm.  I ordered a giant turkey leg, which came with a salad and bread. It also came with a side of stuffing, but I was pretty meh on the stuffing. The turkey was very juicy on the outside near the skin, but rather dry on the inside. No matter, I ended up not eating the inside and just gobbling down part of my boyfriend's giant open faced ground chuck steak sandwich that came covered in thick gravy and sliced mushrooms. That was so good - savory and gooey. Yum!  I love the giant barrel of pickles too. It says take all you want but only what you can eat. I took probably a bowl full, and ate it all. Yes!

v4C8VqqXhwvP0KuhWkCL6Q.review_text: Ok so a lot of people seem to dislike this place. After reading all the reviews it seems that some people have had horrible experiences. My visit to Tommy's was made prior to reading all the Yelp reviews. It was suggested by local SF Yelpers but warned about it being a tourist trap. Then I saw it on being featured on Triple D on the Food Network and what can I say, I was sold.  And the fact that I went was so random. It was in my list of places to go to but it wasn't a for sure spot to visit. We were on the bus and one of my friends saw it and point it out to me. Since we were right there..we just got off the bus and decided to order a sandwich to go.  I'm so glad we stopped! I had a pastrami sandwich on a french roll....and hmm I loved it. It was one of the best pastrami sandwiches ever!! The meat was juicy and tender and literally melted in my mouth! And the sandwich was pretty affordable, had plenty of meat...I was a satisfied customer. I shall see you soon Tommy's...you will definitely be a stop next time I'm up in SF.

kaqlSjOjI8YW7PcLdanK-w.review_text: This place is amazing.  I loved the lamb that I ordered.  It was so good.  My husband got the tri-tip and loved it too.  I wish they had places like this in Orange County.  Only thing is that they're cash only, so that's really inconvenient.

D08BNrV6hK8TuwaYvS44Lg.review_text: Stopped in for first time about midnight....huge hunks of every meat imaginable.  Boyfriend thrilled. Me- vegetarian.  They were so helpful pointing out the veggie options!  Food really good and really reasonable! Great late night find!

CGlzws9RhhUSrgNEGgdPbg.review_text: very interesting place. The food tasted more like food your grandmother would make rather than restaurant food. The beer selection is waaaaaay better than your grandmother's house. Not sure I liked the setup of the place (waiting on line and then waitress brings drinks) but the food is pretty good. Worth checking out

oD8PrAO_GUtlFNFv4ZUY9g.review_text: Wow, looking at the pictures before I started writing this review made me think, "Damn, I want some corned beef."  Well St. Patrick's isn't too far off so I'll have to wait I guess.    I digress, back to Tommy's... I saw tons of Yelp reviews and DDD references to this place and the fact that it was cheap, made this a must visit.  Unfortunately the Special Lady Friend and I were pretty worn out rolling into Tommy's so I wasn't able to be as attentive as I'd like to be, and I must confess, I had been to a couple bars prior to Tommy's.  That being said, I ordered the Buffalo Stew (over rice) as recommended by Yelpers, and I also had a Kielbasa.  Both were quite tastey, but nothing to write home about (ironic that I am writing about them in my review).  The SLF had some lamb shank that I had a taste of and it was good, but again nothing that I would be anxious to try again. The line was long, but moved quite rapidly.  Big beer selection, from all over, I would have liked to try a couple but again I was in need of a nap.  Good spot, great place to fill up and save a few bucks.  I'll have another go at this place for sure.

IbWSdnPb8UXbOS_J-sjrSQ.review_text: Hofbrau is the game. Tommy's is the name. died.  went to heaven.

j08OyHBkWEWHSdx4KySXow.review_text: Tommy's is an original.  Tommy's is a classic.  Tommy's is dirty, not the bad dirty, but the kind of dirty that's like your foreman grill, where it hasn't been cleaned for days because you want the flavor to build up over time.  Give it that solid tongue blasting sensation.  Actually, I've lived less than a block from this joynt for several years now and have never ventured here until recently, when I ran out of eat-out locations.  I was sick of thai food, mexican, mel's, more thai, and cereal.  I finally decided, oh what the heck, let's see what dimension these doors take me.  For the longest time, I was wary of Tommy's.  I was confused, and I don't know why.  maybe all the graffitti, maybe by the eery red light from the lunch counter.  Have you ever watched Harry Potter, and on a couple occasions, Harry ventures to these old twisted pubs in the ghetto magic alleys, where old twisted snarling hags and wrinkly gramps that resemble trees occupies the space?  Yeah, that was my image of Tommy's for some strange reason.  Don't ask, no idea.  Anyways, I peeked in.  No signs of danger yet.  I push open the door, to my right, the lunch counter.  In the middle, tables and chairs ready to swallow me.  To my left, a bar.  Hmmmm, not too bad.  There are several menus all over that you have to adjust to.  One right above you, and a couple behind the kitchen counter.  BBQ beef sammich, turkey sammich, meatball sammich, turkey dinner plate with mashed potatoes and beans, turkey leg dinner, mmmmm, I let go of my inhibitions, and stepped forward, ordered...DONE!  Everything is so cheap too.  $5 sandwhichs, $7 specials, $8 dinner plates....YES!  Found my new kitchen.  So take that plunge people, I did it.  Also, random factoid.  It was at Tommy's Joynt where the original members of Metallica minus Cliff Burton (RIP) told Jason Newsted that he is their new bassist.  There ya go, now go try the place out.

gUOevFTr0qeVSEWOac6Rqw.review_text: man ive been coming here ever since....man i dont know, a long time ago... nothing fancy about this place, but when u walk in, itll give u that old, woody yet cozy, homey feeling their beer selection is pretty good, last time i was here they were selling lungenitas IPA (spell check pls) for like 3,4 bucks i think and they have a lot of specialty beers and cocktails, spirits, etc  if youre craving meat, this is the place to go, i like all of the different types of meat they got here but their bbq brisket....DAAAMN...and their lamb shanks are off the hook, too  and PLEASE do come here on MONDAYS for their OX TAIL SOUP.....ITS DA BOMB, its a must try if u live in SF...  i do have one bad experience here....some no good punktard keyed my car on the street....sry, very irrelevant   4.5 stars

pI15RINDqpXIk5492xx7PA.review_text: Tommy's is a cool little Joynt   Food is served cafeteria style and is reasonably priced with large home-cooking portions. BRING CASH!  Drinks are also a good price here, I can definitely see someone getting drunk here pretty easily. I think they take cards for the bar....

cCsSUhyHaTuC1QoxuigVyw.review_text: Before going to Van Ness Theatre I always try to stop by Tommy's Joynt to grab a bite to eat. They have a great choice of foods on their menu but I LOVE their pastrami on a sourdough roll. I've also had their salmon served with jasmine rice, which was also really good. The prices on their menu are very reasonable. It's a great place to grab some food and watch the game over by the bar.

rdcUSlj3IAS8gLWZC462VQ.review_text: Best American/traditional food I've had in a while. Eating here is like thanksgiving every day ! Only concern was that they didn't have many alternative selections for example their beans and sauces were cooked with pork, so that doesn't give much flexibility to order for vegetarians out there.. Also, cash only? Really? Ruined it for me cuz I almost never have cash on me.

wW_qpveJyFmG2KUuoIi3jg.review_text: Ribs are sooo good Debbie the waitress best ever so friendly  the whole staff so cool. Tommy's Joynt is the place to go and get a lot for your money.

PABIXXEx_6ykhF7I6_Fu-A.review_text: Came here for a roast beef sandwich, mashed potatoes, and a cuke salad for all under $12 bucks. Mel's across the street can kiss my frugal food lovin behind.  The roasted hunk of meat was freshly carved and mounded on my sourdough roll with a side of jus that was heavenly! All that is needed to gussie this up is a dab of their mustard...i go for the mild cuz i am a weenie, but the homeslice took to the horseradish AND hot mustard. He's such a manly man!  Mashed was average and so was the salad, but if you concentrate and order meat and beer here you can't go wrong.

R8CpXWAkh7czlxvT91eDng.review_text: I absolutely love this place! It's a hofbrau in a dive bar, love the surroundings. I always  get the Buffalo Stew, it is to DIE FOR, I have had the brisket also which is tasty but the Buffalo Stew is so tender & you rarely find it anywhere else, so I always wind up ordering that for a treat. The people watching in the bar is always fun too!

SUD8M_CO-bR7iID6IKUQaQ.review_text: Phenomenal.   Great food, great drink, great value.  Cannot say when I enjoyed anyplace more!

y44i4LnqgLCk7iJtcM_uoQ.review_text: Jan and I saw this place featured on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives on Food Network so we thought this place would be good to check out. Parking here sucks like it always does in the city, but fortunately we found parking near the restaurant. We go inside and see that there's a bit of a line which wasn't so bad since it went by quick. I order the barbeque beef sandwich while Jan orders the corned beef plate since he LOVES corned beef. We grab a table and wait for the waitress to get our drinks and we dig into our food. I thought my sandwich was juicy and tasty, but I didn't like that there was a bit more fat than I would like. Jan enjoyed his corned beef w/no complaints. Pricing and amount of food you get is reasonable here and the atmosphere is cool, has that "old school feel" but it's not a place that we would wanna come back to anytime soon.

qGLkFXVmnovZB_tMIi_ICQ.review_text: I found a dirty spoon when I was grabbing my silverware.   I felt like I was at a cafeteria. Mac & Cheese was good. Pastrami sandwich was good, but too much bread.  The place is ok, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat there.

txWFXIMtDUaheiePKnAQyg.review_text: Yeah, the menu looks like some madman tacked a bunch of signs at random on the wall.  And the service is focused more on efficiency than friendliness.  My brother was asked what kind of salad he wanted, and the guy behind the counter stared at him like he was a complete moron and said "Just look."  But it all sort of adds to the trash charm that is Tommy's Joynt.  And tender BBQ beef brisket with mashed potatoes or vegetables, salad AND a roll with butter for only $8.50?  Done.  Don't forget your cash.

8n2atRJI-ZCQ96HROXYFDw.review_text: Delicious! I went last week and had the bbq beef brisket plate. This came with a side of mash potatos and gravy, a bread roll and baked beans. ALL FOR UNDER $10!!! That in itself is amazing. The meat was tender- very tasty, and the sauce was tangy and exactly what i want in a bbq sauce. the mashed potatos?? omgosh, i think they are drenched in butter (i'm a fan!).. so i could literally eat this without the sauce. but why would you if it comes with it? not crazy about the roll, but thats neither here or there. The beans were delicious as well. Minus one star for the set up of the place. its definitely a hole in the wall place, but i had t o carry my tray up stairs just to find a seat. definitely worth it though!!!

xObzTAC6gsFH6XKhc9yRYQ.review_text: I left my heart in San francisco...and it's okay, because I might of had a heart attack.  Drenched with delicious gravy and more inviting than most soup kitchens.  San Francisco host Tommy's joint a wonderful affordable place with hearty portions that even a homeless person can afford.   This recession friendly place has been a staple for the blue collar worker and looks as if it was a tavern or den that host Vikings or warriors, yet one of the best affordable sand-which places and good eats.  I've been here several times, It Is my go-to place in San Francisco since the hours it seems as if its open for late night (until 1pm) with it's wooden old-school cafeteria style atmosphere.   The portions are American style stewed meaty dishes.  The Buffalo stew is awesome, but I almost always take the Turkey leg, Yesterday when I went I has the Turkey Sloppy Joe.  Everyday there are different special featured.  It was delicious, My heart still pumps the taste of the richness in my veins. It's a very manly place, I know I enjoy it because I am a manly man,  not saying women won't enjoy this place, but she has to be a cool girl, this is not really a "date" place to my standards,  unless you date doesn't mind being seen in public without makeout.  This place has a awesome bar and TVs  playing the game as if it was the world contact to the real world outside... Truly, this place is a world of it's own.  The downside It's also not a place with a selection of veggies,  for my herbivore friends.  but I dare you to try EVEN as a plant licker a piece of meat and you would be converted into a meat-eater so quick, "Peta" will slap you in the face.  Pro-tip - Cash-only

4jVd9n4DQiNi5F9Y509JtA.review_text: plan to come here every time i go to SF! nommmmm!!

QonWYgHUHI2fisIcANB7Zg.review_text: Love a good hofbrau! This place serves up big portions at fair prices, and is open late. It's great for a post-show nosh with friends. Been going there for years!

Ef-NDzuYpy9Y_ntbk6GUfQ.review_text: I actually saw this place showcased on Diner's, Drive-in's and Dives, and how they showcased this placed I decided that when I was going to San Francisco that I definitely wanted to check this place out. Your first sense that is overloaded is sight. Just the outside of the building is a spectacle of itself. Really rad artwork and a huge ass sign. You can go by this place without noticing it. Which is I think is intriguing. You see all these bright colors, and ginormous and you want to know what exactly is going on inside.  Upon entering there was a line about 15 people deep and the whole place was packed! It was nice to see people chatting and enjoying the food, always a pleas er. Observing this I knew I found a gem. Reviewing the menu they had the standard deli menu. Corned beef, pastrami, tongue, turkey, etc. And every day they have a daily dinner plate special, which is nice. I walked up to the counter, ordered the corned beef, and watched them slice it right in front of me with a knife, and not a meat slicer which is always appealing. I paid, got my soda and they offer unlimited pickles at the end of the bar, awesome!  I finally took my first bite. Juicy, tender, perfectly cooked corned beef on a very nice soft and chewy roll that soaked up all the delicious juice of the beef. I was fully satisfied after one bite! Enjoying my sandwich I was looking around the restaurant. Really cool decor, a cool crowd and a full bar, which is always a plus. I was very pleased with my meal, my surrounding and was almost ready to order another sandwich although I was full, it was just that good!!  My meal was over and so it's time to go, aw man!! I had such a blast at this Joynt! Definitely check this place out if you're ever in San Fran. Just a quick heads up it's cash only.

BL8iAXR7eLhOFAZe7bksmQ.review_text: Usually get the turkey sandwich and it's always fresh and delicious. You can tell they make it daily.  Last time there I got the sandwich open faced with the same gravy as the beef sandwich and it was delicious as well.  Clam chowder is good and the coleslaw and potato salad are also very fresh. The food here is always delicious!  Make sure you bring cash.

uurK51y7d78eZz0DkwnCCQ.review_text: Walked in here on a Thursday afternoon at around 11:30 to slightly avoid the lunch crowd, but of course there was still a line.  The indecisive me thanked the lord for the line because the choices at Tommy's Joynt would make anyone with a frontal lobe crazy.  The delicious meat is just laying out, taunting you to try them all.  But...but...I know I can't eat lamb shanks, buffalo stew, AND a sandwich.  So I ended up going for the top round beef on sourdough and corned beef on rye (half for me, half for my Matt N.)...knowing that I would soon need to come back to just quell my curiosity.  After taking my seat upstairs with my meal in hand, I sat next to a very diverse crowd of businessmen in suits, mechanics in jumpers, and constructions workers with hard hats in tow, all having in common one thing: hunger.  Hunger for a freaking hearty meal of meat.  The corned beef was really fantastic, definitely a step above most delis in LA.  I mean, they obviously must make it in-house and take time in preparations.  You can taste a difference.  However, one bite into the top round sandwich instantly ablated my indecisiveness.  Holy god this was good.  The chewiness of the sourdough alongside the tender meat with droppings of fat dotting its edges hit the spot.  But the Jus is where I almost lost it.  I couldn't pour enough of it on the sandwich.  It was the first time I've ever tested the absorbency of bread on a sandwich.  Sure it got soggy.  Who cares?  It was so delicious that I almost ordered another sandwich just to use the rest of the beefy, brown concoction.  So I will definitely be back for another try, especially for them lamb shanks.  Cause my curiosity of missed food can only be shut up for so long.

iMMePWzFMopTJbIol_ecxw.review_text: Tommy, gimme an order of bbq turkey and pulled pork right meow! Local joint, great place to watch the olympics with seedy dudes that look entirely too excited when watching the USA sand volleyball match. Meat, beer, mashed taters - rinse and repeat.

dvwSZ6azy8q2afSLLk64ww.review_text: The brisket was so tender, the sourdough bread was amazing and their sauce was good too. Portions are very large.  Only complaint is the lack of attention with my salad. It was definately a compressed bag of lettuce (which Im not pickey...butttttt ----) a lot of it was brown.   Heads up its CASH ONLY and there is an ATM available inside.

Z9gS1aYbpW-ENmAcAC3w-w.review_text: This is the go to place for hearty meats and sandwiches. I recommend the turkey leg or pastrami. The buffalo chili isn't worth it.  Tommy's has a great selection of beers on tap to go with your meal.   Tommy's is a San Francisco must-do!

eRAiAu1ZmvagwfE565ckOw.review_text: Always a solid spot. You better be prepared to forget about that diet you were on though.

rZVOJkhy8shhqfpHkHMR3g.review_text: Hey Tommy, where the hell have you been in my life? Especially so close to school and they show UEFA champions league on Tues/Wed. Perfect for when I have a bunch of time in between classes so I can grab a hearty plate of brisket, a beer and enjoy the midday games!

Qvl5LuaBWgEpYqvqhICn4g.review_text: This right here is what America is all about.   Great food and drinks at extremely affordable rates. Tommys takes pride in their customer satisfaction which is why I come here so frequently. The food is all American Baby! and served cafeteria style but soooooo good. This place is unique because of all the crap clustered on the walls and ceilings, some posters are even upside down and the bartenders are hilarious!.   I love coming here before hitting the movie theatre right across the street for dinner and of course their $4 jack n cokes which I end up spending about $50 on - Ya you do the math!   awesome place!

0GHsxjCk-Ynzx4Ihj8tjPQ.review_text: Great place if you are in the mood for some greasy good MEAT.  Lots of options and prices are cheap. The BBQ brisket is definitely the best.

TAEkXstpbxmCH-N89cqvZQ.review_text: love to hit places on Diners Drive-ins and Dives. Love the Food Network app I have yet to find a bad place to eat. this place was great. Food came out fast great place to sit and talk. Drinks never ran out. so all and alll I say it was great.

GVYg18F-Rkuk63hvtHoG5Q.review_text: Cash only, almost always a wait, tables that are small and cramped - you have to eat here!!  =)  To be completely honest, I'm sure it probably would "scare" first timers or tourists but the food will make you change your mind.  It is mainly meat - brisket, turkey, ham, beef of round, buffalo stew...but they do have pasta and salads.  I've been here a couple times...on my recent visit, I had the bbq brisket with mashed potatoes and carrot raisin salad.  Everything I ate was delicious - the brisket was super tender and flavorful.  I loved the carrot raisin salad too...it's like a coleslaw but with carrots, raisins and pears (?).  My other friends ordered the beef of round and the lasagna with coleslaw and potato salad.  There wasn't a bad item...everything was super yummy!!  =)  Great price, great tasting food and large quantities...it's a mandatory destination on any SF trip.

VNX4sQ54ur8DJhjBEOP8oQ.review_text: BBQ beef dinner plate. Savory, decently priced, easy. Don't take a date here unless you're pretty comfy with each other, but most any other occasion this place hits the spot. It's been around for ages and has a lot of character, not to mention a decent selection of beers.

wkklbFK50TTkd1GJXXAntA.review_text: We like this place because it's good ol' American food--corned beef, turkey, etc.  It's kind of divey, but locals can't be wrong!

VgNKhxp4ZH4_J_JqlqUJWQ.review_text: every time i passes by this business, my stomach smiles. its like a schoolboy being tickled. shredded meats are succulent and the soda is fresh. i like to imagine i worked a hard labor day down at the wharf and have to come here for a mighty meal to satisfy my inner hunger. i don't know you personally, but thank you tommy.

MbHuIP6GaiYdLc6ZURc9bg.review_text: Had to try this place after I saw Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives, and I wasn't disappointed. I got the turkey leg special for lunch that came with a massive turkey leg, stuffing, gravy and a dinner roll for just over $6. The lunchline style pick-up is really fast. The place definitely is a dive, and the dining room is small and rundown, but you can't beat that price in SF. I would definitely go back. It's cheaper than everything in the area. I'm pretty sure it's packed at all times, but we got a table right away on Saturday at 3:00. Probably better to eat at strange times if you're gonna eat here.

eu19K9KfnvvubzWuv4l6Wg.review_text: If you are ever looking for a meat on meat sandwich wrapped in meat with a meat spread and a side of meat....you can get it here.  mmm....meat.

fLX5aINqWHMDxM4D2Q5XVw.review_text: Wanted seafood since it was San Fran and didn't want the usual touristy Wharf fare .    Googled  a place downtown  that was definitely white linen, fine dining pricey. Not what we were searching for since it was lunchtime. Guy at Starbucks  recommended Tommy's since I wanted a place where "locals" go to.   Just what I love! From the old bar/deli atmosphere to the awesome food that is well worth the price. Go for the food, not service or looks... Reminds me of New York in a great way.  Just wish I could stay to try each of the daily specials.  This is what a local joint is all about. They know what they're good at and they don't deviate from it.

X5ES6ySaJX2HQOuU3My91w.review_text: Me and my husband end up trying this place co'z they where featured in Diners Drives-in and Dives. Unfortunately it's not worth of a trip going back, we had a pastrami sandwich and a Spaghetti - meatballs. Sandwich is good I'll give it a 2 1/2 stars spaghetti/meatballs 1 1/2 stars co'z it is so bland I add lots of parmesan cheese, ground pepper, tabasco sauce and salt just to have a little taste to it but still didn't impress me, on top of that sitting near this guys that seems like they didn't take a bath for a month it's either their carpet that smells or the guys near us. Probably their sandwiches are much better.

OwiSGXIxML8lURzZKFZJVA.review_text: This place def offers MAN FOOD... big hearty meat meals. They give large portions and from what I remember was pretty inexpensive. My roast beef was a little too bloody for me... but I have been there during other times and didn't have a problem with my meal.   The atmosphere is casual and fun... it's a man's place.

ltbUXodBTHEwiHESNsMZ6Q.review_text: Dirty, divey, loud, too many food and drink options, inexpensive and cluttered. All the ingredients necessary for a post hike lunch. We stopped here after finding quite a few places closed on a Sunday afternoon. My first impression was this would be a good spot for Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives and then I saw the little placard announcing they had already been on there.  With all the different choices, I took a good 10 minutes to decide. Everyone's plates around me were full of bread, mashed potatoes, huge stacks of meat and bowls of beans. I ended up getting a corned beef sandwich with swiss cheese. Actually, 3 of the 4 of us got the same exact thing. The 4th person got a meatball sandwich.  While ordering it was kind of hard for them to hear us over the football game on the television. Not a big deal but I didn't appreciate the cashier interrupting me a couple of times while still communicating my order to the meat carver. The only glitch in our short visit. Again, not a big deal. The waitress at our booth was very sweet and attentive. The meat was carved perfectly with only a few specks of fat. It was moist, flavorful and stacked just high enough that you could wrap your mouth around the meat and the perfect sourdough roll. The au jus on the side was VERY tasty. I usually just like a little mustard on my corned beef but I found myself dipping into that quite a bit.  I managed to steal a bite of the meatball sandwich and it was really good. The marinara and meat were seasoned just right and melted in my mouth. The servings are all huge. There is no way you can leave this place hungry!  It's obviously a little tourist trap but not one I wouldn't mind visiting again when in the mood for a beer and a hunk of meat.

pOsSRzm0ZOXE9FcJ5pWxYg.review_text: How to Score Good Girlfriend Points:  1)  Take your BF to Tommy's Joynt.  2)  Get the Turkey Plate.  It's like Thanksgiving in May!  (sans family dysfunction and travel hassles).  A scoop of creamy mashed potatoes, a scoop of ok but salty stuffing, several slices of roasted turkey (white or dark meat), and loads of gravy.  You also get a sourdough roll and a bevy of side salads to choose from.  J got a basic mixed greens and I got one with tomato wedges.  You also get access to the awesome pickle barrel.  Portions are hefty, the price is right (only $20 for us both), and as it is a cafeteria style hofbrau, gratification is nearly instant.    3)  Go across the street to the AMC Van Ness Movie Theater and get two tickets to Thor 3D.    4)  Buy him some Red Vines.

smiSHqn6Ua5IMmYH7mWbLQ.review_text: This place is indeed as good as it gets.  4.25 for a turkey sloppy joe with a huge roll and mashed potatoes!  2.75 for any deaft beer except Chimay at the bar!  Cute ambiance!  Pies for dessert!  Friendly staff and bartenders!  Extremely fast!  The only downside is the poor location that's really only convenient to the neighborhood.  Planning on going out of my way to be a regular, though.  Just had the food last night and already craving it again:)

lFLVZOb_m8OrFL1MEG6nGA.review_text: This is a San Francisco classic. Love the turkey and ham sandwiches. Baked beans are amazing. Stuffing leaves a little to be desired but overall good. Huge sandwiches.  Only downsides are that it is cash only and that you have to order your drinks from the bar (even if you are having non-alcoholic beverages).

M6_Wn2LhImUKtJDRtUDoRQ.review_text: I came here after a show at the Fillmore -- ravenous and looking for some quality late-night eats.  I then consumed an entire Thanksgiving dinner.  As I recall, I pretty much licked about 5 plates of food clean.  I left feeling fat and happy.  I went home to my bed, and laid awake for a good two hours.  Yes, I was so full that I was UNABLE TO SLEEP due to the discomfort caused by my gluttonous meal.  I lay there whimpering a little bit in the dark, wondering why I had done this to myself.  Tommy's, I love you, but the aftermath was downright painful.

-tv0HwOyhdsrg6Gm53M20Q.review_text: The corn beef, turkey, and the brisket were all tasty!!!!! We had them as sandwiches  and got a side of the brussels sprouts and the salad. I also loved the dinner plates too. The bar is super sweet too!! I love this place so much!

YCoPYtXOfJvV5_Tb43oP4Q.review_text: can't beat it for the price. oxtail stew is flavorful and not too fatty. The baked beans were sweet, with lots of sugar, but nothing unpalatable. And to my surprise the cucumber/tomato salad was delicious, with fresh ingredients. For the price, it's outrageously good. I just wish they took plastic.

5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ.review_text: This is FEASTIN' ON PENNIES! My previous review hardly served Tommy's any justice so here's to second helpings! Tommy's Joynt, located in the heart of San Francisco, is simply one-of-a-kind. Cafeteria style eats serving huge slabs of slow, savory, and beautiful cooked meats ready to be craved before your very eyes. The only problem I always have.. is unsure of what succulent meats to gorge on! Hot Pastrami Dinner Plate - yelp.com/user_local_phot… What's for dinner? PASTRAMI. I EFFIN' LOVE PASTRAMI and Tommy's knows wsup. Hot, tender, heavenly slices of flawless meat-to-fat pastrami, seasoned to perfection, and smoked in all it's own natural juices. Don't you dare add sauce on this meat, or I will find you! Best of all, they pound the meat on your platter! One can't have too much pastrami. Beef Brisket Dinner Plate - yelp.com/user_local_phot… Meat that melts in your mouth; it can rival House of Prime Rib in all its glory, and with only a fraction of the price! All dinner plates come with a dinner roll and your choice of mashed potatoes, baked beans, or a side salad. (wait, EFF salad, MORE BEEEF!) Just don't forget to apply some of their table-side Spicy Mustard for that intense horseradish flavor! Pastrami Sandwich - My favorite "On-the-Go" option at Tommy's. The same great pastrami, piled high, on your choice of sourdough, white, rye, or wheat. (Go for the sourdough!) Don't forget to ask for a cup to grab some of their homemade pickles! (It's in the barrel next to the fountain!) Buffalo Chili - Made in-house but WTF are you getting chili for? The chili is slightly pricey ($6+) and really, ain't that great. A lot of beans, minimum buffalo meat, and didn't have any spicy kick. You should slap yourself for ordering this (because I sure did..). Clam Chowder - Who doesn't visit San Francisco without grabbing a cup of Clam Chowder, amiright? Sure, it's quite the story to say you ate it out of a bread bowl, but forget that tourist trap, and get it at Tommy's! The chowder doesn't have much clams but is creamy redefined, and paired with a house dinner roll, it's the same exact thing! Grubbing at Tommy's Joynt, which is family owned and badass since 1947, will not disappoint. The meals ranging from only $5 to no more than $10 is too unbelievable. A meal cheaper than 2 gallons of gasoline, WTF! Daily specials also available or opt to try something new and hey, as long as your plate is succumbed with meat, you can't go wrong!

F3m5hN8ph9Yti9kU_YCc5A.review_text: I'd say it was closer to a 3 or 3.5, but (for now) rounded up for the atmosphere.  Really, the service staff and huge beer list made up for the over-hyped food.  Maybe I just came on a bad day, because Tommy's seems like one of "the" places to go in SF.  Ambience/decor/people-watching are all top notch - even the busboy was funny!  The dog and multiple beggars were friendly as well.  But the food... the lamb shanks and brisket had great flavor, but both were way overcooked (possibly sitting under lamps too long?).  Coincidentally, the turkey sandwich was dry, too.  The jus for dipping was very salty and lukewarm; it did little to help the turkey go down.  Sides were good, but I'd like to see lower prices for slaw and some sides (all are $2.50).  Free rolls with meals are average quality.  Mustard on table was too scary looking to try (definitely had been in that jar for a while).  I liked the cafeteria style service and free pickles yet will need to revisit Tommy's to reevaluate my rounding conundrum.

QMWlVYtOA6BVADnQu1niBw.review_text: Fantastic prices, smoky, kinda divey, and that's exactly why I like it.   It's dark and worn-in, and nearly always busy. The food is delicious. Prepare for comfort food.

FDU1EnQQctw5E0-PPrHo2A.review_text: Had been told by a coworker that this was a spot I definitely had to visit when I came up, so I found myself here on a Monday night around midnight. Even at this time there were still a good amount of people.  The atmosphere was very laid back and old school,  which is a nice change. Got a beef brisket dinner plate and my buddy got corned beef,  both were quite good. You get a lot of food for ~$10, the plate includes a couple generous slices of meat, mashed potatoes,  a vegetable,  and a large roll. Would definitely come back next time I'm in the area

eEhWNBT0lZH-WOojdnkfjQ.review_text: I'm terrible at writing reviews on time, so here's to another late one  Came here to grab a quick dinner with babe before our movie started. I thought it was kind of interesting how we got our food, it was like waiting in line at a high school cafeteria again. Everything is freshly cooked and displayed behind the glass and you tell them what you want! Well, this place serves it fresh, I don't know about school food.....  And then you pick an available table to sit.   Babe and I each got a Roast Beef Dinner Plate which also comes with a choice of mashed potatoes or veggies, beans or salad, and bread&butter. I grabbed the mashed potatoes, and salad along with the bread and butter.   I must admit that I wasn't expecting too much from the place judging by how they served food, but I was pretty surprised. Food was delicious and pretty darn good for the price.  Roast beef was extremely juicy, and the mashed potatoes were pretty good too, but I doubt that anyone could mess up on that. The salad, and bread with butter was okay though.  Overall, not a bad place, definitely a good place to go to grab a quick bite if you're near the area.

dXhOCYxobqN7E56c4LM1Aw.review_text: If you don't like historic haunts, juicy and tender meat, lovingly crafted ox-tail stew, crisp pints of Anchor, and sports on the TV...well you're probably hopeless anyway.  But!  If any or all of those appeals to you, then add Tommy's Joynt to your list of places to visit and visit again.  Classic San Francisco.

KGXWpnGr-KS9HAfV0YUDgg.review_text: Great food. Great restaurant. But you have to go here at the right time if you hope to get a table because it can get very crowded.  The meat and the mash potatoes here are great. I recommend getting the brisk with a side of mash potatoes. Do the dinner special and then you get a side of salad and a roll all for under ten bucks.  As mentioned this place can get really crowded. The best time to go here is for a late lunch or an early dinner. During these hours you can always find an empty table upstairs.   For the first timers upstairs is the best place to eat. There is a lot more room up there and you can enjoy your food over a nice conversation.  Highly Recommended. This is one of the Must Eat At Restaurants in San Francisco.

4v9NX1EzLUH7inkmgHwUxA.review_text: What the hell, I'll give this place, i mean "joynt," 5 stars.  Jessi and I didn't stumble in with a hankering for turkey sandwiches or brisket, but instead felt obliged to check out the general scene from the bar. A fully loaded bar, might I add, stocked with a diverse assortment of beers, wines, and liquors. Although Jessi and I merely ordered Budweisers, it was impossible to ignore the selection of drinking options at hand.   The inside of this "sandwich and cocktail stop" is remarkable, very San Francisco in both a tourist and tenderloin sense. The bar sits across the room from the meat counter, where you order your meal, receive it on a plastic tray, and then sit at one of the long tables in between. A server either takes your drink order or you can mosey up to the bar and order for yourself. Our bartender was an older gentleman dressed in a white shirt and black vest, looking quite dapper, I might add; however, a bit later into the evening another bartender arrived wearing a polo shirt and jeans, causing me infer that the first bartender just chose to wear his fancy clothes for the hell of it. And I find that incredibly charming.  What else? The walls are plastered with signs, posters, and everything under the sun; even the ceiling houses some select paintings and decorations. The bathrooms are upstairs, off of a small balcony that overlooks the utter beauty that is Tommy's Joynt. They have those novelty sex toy machines (at least in the ladies room), and for a mere 75 cents I purchased a "blow job enhancer." Which I have to say was pretty sweet, since I've been in the market.  I'm totally going back.

UuxiH2oLycDhMv7TKQ5EVw.review_text: As a friend of mine said, "They do some fine work in roast beef in there".   Indeed they do.   Tommy's Joynt is a super awesome classic sandwich shop. You go in, get a tray tell the guy at the counter what you want and watch as he cuts a nice thick slab of beef onto a roll for ya. Mashed potatoes, gravy, all that good stuff.   Sit down at the red and white checkered table cloths and dig into some mean pastrami. Hell, I'm getting hungry writing this.  The bar in there is also a great place to hang out. They have a large selection of beers in this place and the bar guys know how to make a fine martini at good prices.   It's kinda got that old timey, beer garden, hof brau house kinda vibe going for it. Just walk by and smell the place, you'll have no choice but to enter.

KkF3AIc8J9Fna3fP-44ODQ.review_text: This place was the best, One of my favorite spots when i was in the bay area.  So I wasn't surprised that they were on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives.  The food is good, cheap and they have a full bar too.  The atmosphere in there is like the bar in cheers.  They really do remember your name and what you normally get if you frequent the establishment long enough.  Just to show you how good their food is, You would find numerous students from the Culinary Arts school down the street buying meals there instead of eating at their school.  And i was one of them.  There was a rumor that i heard that when Metallica was yet to be famous back in the early 80's.  They used to eat there all the time !  Good enough for the best Metal band ever, good enough for you and me!

tgwk_yuIpeQDR9rLwUW8Uw.review_text: The bbq  brisket sandwich is what dreams are made of,  and lotsa delicious beer and it's across the street from the movies but fuck those movies you're drunk on this delicious beer and now there's bbq sauce smeared all over your pants whatever

WR6033peFiviFPzAV0yhJg.review_text: Another winning visit to my very favorite place to eat in the city...Tommy's Joynt!  I had the sweet and sour spare ribs with mashed potatoes and gravy, sour dough roll, butter ($7.75) and a side of hickory baked beans ($2.25).  The meat was fall-off-the-bone tender...and finger suckin' good!  My dinner partner had the bbq beef brisket with mashed potatoes and gravy, sour dough roll, butter and mac salad ($8.50).  They really work magic with that brisket...sooo tender and a great flavor! All the food was soooo yummy...like grandma's old fashioned home cooking! If you live in the area or are visiting the city, you HAVE to try Tommy's Joynt!!

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Buffalo soldier. Everlasting song: youtube.com/watch?v=S5FC… Everlasting spot: Delicious reasons Tommy's has been around since 1947: - Freshly roasted turkey piled high on sourdough bread - BBQ turkey sloppy joe where the sourdough is more sponge than bread - Buffalo stew with thick chunks of meat on top of even more sourdough - Unlimited pickles inside a help yourself barrel - Full bar if your appetite includes a side of cocktails Everything was served with lightening speed and eaten almost just as fast. Plan on spending $7 - $10 per item. Return after seven years was a lesson in the more things change the more things stay the same. City is changing. The high quality and low prices here are not.

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: Tommy's Joynt is a SF landmark, a shining beacon of indulgence and tourism. Usually when I think of tourist joints, thoughts of North Beach and The Stinking Rose come to mind. What's great about Tommy's is that the locals love it too! It's rare that a restaurant or bar can have it both ways.  My first time dining here was long overdue and seeing as how I now live a mere 3 blocks away, I really had no excuse. We arrived and realized that they only take cash (SO ANNOYING) so we had to take a quick detour. It was worth it, though. Once I tasted the brisket and mashed potatoes my cash only grudge was a distant memory.  Tommy's is open until 2AM so it's also a great for late night grub fest.

KNNJk9AZaQ3QbVhQBTehhQ.review_text: SF's original hofbrau, a local institution. No frills, cafeteria style service, but the food and the eclectic atmosphere are what make people keep coming back.  Love the late opening hours. My favs are the bbq beef brisket sandwich, turkey leg. the oxtail on Sundays and the buffalo stew are also great options for the savory stuff.

KgR1NuGJ7d4B3Kb5CEauPQ.review_text: This place is Literally ME!!!  Good FOOD!, Good BEER! Unlimited Pickles!, Delicious perfect Yellow Mustard!  OMG!!!  I LOVE this place soooo much! That I've Celebrated 3 BDAYS Here! And it's my Current Profile Pic!   Wait in line, and get your GRUB ON!   And whomever reads this... Your automatically invited to my 4th Bday Celebration!!!  Also, just like the napkin says... "There's No Place, Any Place, Quite Like This Place, SO This Must Be The Place"    !!!  I Agree !!!

PCMwR2hEJFisU65D6ojGBw.review_text: I guess I'm just not on board with this place.  The food is good in that somewhat flavorless, but cheap way.  The atmosphere is certainly worth checking out - very eclectic.  Good place to go before going across the street to the movies.  Even better place to go if you want to ruin your workout at 24 hour fitness.

1x1ZXiNXgtofZTzo73bfRw.review_text: We were typical tourist  we had no idea u cldnt park on geary between 4-6 we had the best parking spot ever. After putting 4.00 in machine we were later told by one of the workers that its a tow zone during those hours. So now im stuck carrying two trays of food and abandoned by my husband as he runs out to ensure we still had a ride home. 20mins later he comes back after making 3000 u turns he found a parking spot.   As for the  food it was absolutely delicious wonderful home cooked meats tender and  juicy I had a brisket sandwich and sour dough my husband had a pastrami on sour dough. We both loved our meals.  Inexpensive and yummy... you can't go wrong eating here jst make sure you have quarters for the parking machine and read the signs and don't park on geary between 4 and 6. You have to visit for sure.  Its a bar its old inside so don't expect fancy jst expect yummy food. Because you'll get it.

CTwJy3IYCbP6dMlYMfdU-g.review_text: Open late.  Friendly people.  Good food that fills you up, plus full bar with cheap drinks.  Bring cash since they don't take cards.

MRfRgHHlgPib7Inq2d4umA.review_text: I like the quaint old bar just as much as the next guy. But this place was dirty!!!  Plus the food plain sucked. I am from the Bay Area,and was staying in the city for a conference,and my German colleagues and I decided to venture out to this place. They had the spare ribs,and did not like it I had the pasta and meatballs,and definitely did not like the taste, look, or anything - I mean a brown sauce??: Uggh.. So sorry for the lost charm folks...this place ain't my cuppa tea

Rd_k48XNACxaSBN0D8uk3Q.review_text: I really like the casual no fuss of this establishment. Foods good, service good, beer good. Its an older restaurant in San Francisco and it is fun to see that a lot of the old charm still exists. This is a great place to watch a football game or have a casual hot sandwich.

uOP5d3lhIQP1S4uG5UFXAg.review_text: OH. MY. GOD.  I love me some Tommy's Joynt. This week - went there twice!   TJ's has some really good grub at really good prices. Tons of beers - over 120 - and the most expensive is a $5.75 Chimay on tap. On average, you're paying less than $4 for a tasty beverage.  Now on to the food. This is low key -- no waiters, just a lunch counter with steam tables. You can get classics like Buffalo stew or chili, sandwiches (arguably the best pastrami I've ever had -- better than Canter's or Art's in LA by a long shot) or tasty meats. They have great specials, as well -- I had the lamb shanks, and they were amazing!!  Tommy's Joynt is a real SF landmark. The decor is cheesy but fun, and they're open until 1:45 AM. Bring cash, they don't take credit cards.  Why are you still reading this? GO. I might make tonight round 3 this week...  LASTLY -- the carrot cake? Ridonculoid. I need a slice NOW.

Z3McWRhklUmUjh2zTcQcQw.review_text: Went here with my girlfriend, because we were advised to by her dad.I had the veal cutlet parmigiana. My girlfriend had the turkey sandwich. In retrospect I wish I had got the BBQ Brisket sandwich or even the turkey. I was pretty disappointed in the parmigiana. If I were to rate the parmigiana alone I'd have to give it a 5.5/10 mostly considering how affordable it was. This place is definitely a bargain. I can say that for sure. If I ever get another chance I will definitely grab a brisket sandwich. The restaurant itself was kinda cool. Nice bar. Make sure you bring cash or expect to get gouged using the ATM machine.

yEcXJDqKjtssivl95HY-vQ.review_text: We were vising The City for Pride 2009 over the weekend and stayed at the humble Cathedral Hill hotel on Van Ness. Tommy's Joynt was directly across the street so we wandered in for dinner Saturday night.   The place is charming and definitely has its own vibe. Its cafeteria style and pretty informal. The place has a HUGE list of beers in the bar which we did not get to try, but will make a point to do sometime if we are in the area.   I shared the BBQ brisket dinner plate with a side of mashed potatoes and macaroni salad with my gf and it was enough for us. The brisket was good, especially good after we poured the BBQ sauce on it. We really liked the potatoes and wished they had given us more than a ice cream scoop, however. Macaroni salad was alright to me, very pickle-like in its flavor.   For $10 for the both of us, we were plenty satisfied.

qL5_IFTrN5skua9ixRj-KQ.review_text: I love tommys joynt especialy their meatball sub. Fullest i ever been was when i went to tommy joynt then ghiradelli for dessert. Almost couldnt move.

HSaNZ5e22Sp5rd-q0U0HKA.review_text: I'm not a huge fan of sandwiches in general, but I was pretty impressed by this place.  I went with the turkey sloppy joe which I was a little disappointed with because I was expecting a standard sloppy joe.  It actually turned out to be more of a pulled pork sandwich, but nonetheless, still tasty and I definitely left satisfied.    I actually wish I had ordered more side dishes.  The baked beans were fantastic, and the cole slaw was surprisingly good (I'm not normally a fan of cole slaw).  The next time I go, I'll definitely have to try out all of the sides :)

3mO8lGQ_BhUBZcU5Z5WWjQ.review_text: I can see this is truly a SF landmark - it was packed on Sunday around 5:30pm.  I can also understand why it is featured on Triple D - I would classify it as a classic dive!  My father-in-law recommended this place because he has fond memories of it back in the 60's and he recently went there and told us we had to go to experience it.  So, we did.  The counters, tables and chairs, etc are probably all still originals from the 60s - which made me feel kinda dirty.  The food was not bad - you get a platter of whatever meat you want with gravy, mashed potatoes, and some sort of salad for $9.25 - not a bad price.  And it all tasted pretty good, but honestly, I have had much better hof brau-type experience when Smorga-Bobs were still around!   Truly this rating just comes from the overall chaotic experience we had.  You walk through a line and get served from behind the counter, and you pay at a cash register (cash only).  Then, you have to find a place to sit, and help yourself to lukewarm water - it took 20 minutes for a cocktail waitress to ask us if we wanted anything to drink (again - pay cash when she brought it).  For me, the whole dive feel to the place is fine, but I really think they ought to upgrade their food serving counter.  And given how busy it is, I don't think it would be bad to have someone seat you and make sure you have water and drinks - it would surely cut down on the chaos and bring in some more tips.

_E4IPr5U4jzfoOd2azHJfg.review_text: An iconic place, been open since 1947 at the same location.    Came here for lunch today with friends and I had the Saturday Special of sweet-n-sour spareribs.  Comes with two huge ribs.  The first one was tender and fell right off the bone, the 2nd one was a little more difficult to manage.    Cole Slaw was ok, not my favorite kind of dressing though, it was a little too vinegary for my taste.    Price was right, $9 something for the ribs platter and added a side of cole slaw for $2 something.  (CASH ONLY).    Unlimited free dill pickle slices in the barrel, just help yourself.

pXeGiGgexdzYoVz-uhObAw.review_text: Been going to this place for years.  Food is dirt cheap - how can anyone call this place pricey for carved meat/hot meal?  Why wait for Thanksgiving for carved turkey, stuffing, mashed potatoes & gravy.  The pastrami & bbq beef is yummy!  Remember the pickle barrel before taking your seat.  International beer selection.

fcS1VWp5tbvKVnNkKP4lnQ.review_text: A classic cafeteria style restaurant from the good old days. They got the retro orange heat lamps keeping the meats warm and the food trays stacked ready for business. The line moves fast as all the food is already cooked and just needs to be thrown on a plate. Had the juicy looking round of beef with mashed potatos and coleslaw. The meat looked better than it tasted but it was all right. Mashed potatoes were medicore and so was the coleslaw. Overall medicore for this Vegas buffet style food, but not really many places to get this in the city, so it'll do.

sbbcdP1toreDe5T23E3HiA.review_text: Be forewarned I was told by my friend never to eat here since he got food posioning from this place but I ignored his warnings and ordered a ground sirloin beef special on a Thursday.  Hours later my stomach was making funny noises and I had to go to the bathroom every 5 minutes..I'm never coming back here again....unless I wanta a stomache

PHnLOMJagYK15VpD4UT2Fw.review_text: Great food at a great price. I had a corned beef sandwich and stuffing with gravy. Both were very good and filled me right up. They also have a nice selection of beers and a full bar. If I lived closer I would be here every week

yoi3G0l8JLQ3fEZHfrpS-Q.review_text: This place is yucky and gross! Over rated!

-eEKOlSVCGU2v4aARLSQOQ.review_text: This place seems very grungy to me.  The food was alright, but I felt like I needed to shower after I left.  Several of our utensils were still crusted with food and the cups were dirty as well.  I do not tolerate that from any restaurant.  It just makes you wonder, if the things that they know the customers are going to see are that dirty, what is everything else like. Yuck!
