xFVOE7My4Yje7sUj9Bdgkg.review_text: How can you argue with decades of good food in one of the most comfortable buffet style restaurants in San Francisco. I love this place and never go away hungry, broke, or agitated by bad service. It's not fancy or and beautiful but does what it does, well.

1eOf0y_ndQPaQVcE2v6tDA.review_text: I love Tommy's! I'm surprised "comfort food" doesn't come up in Yelp's review highlights for Tommy's. I would imagine that is how most people would describe their food. My favorite meal is the BBQ brisket with mashed potatoes and gravy and side salad with their amazing blue cheese dressing. I don't know if they make their dressing in house, or where they get it, but it is one of my favorite blue cheese dressings out there. I love that stuff.   If you are hanging out with a manly man, or your dad doesn't want "any of that small portion trendy restaurant shit", take them to Tommy's. Or if you'r hanging with a girl like me, who has an appetite like a man, take them to Tommy's. Portions are great, the prices make you feel like you got a deal, and the environment is homey, cozy, unpretentious... it's just great. And they have a full bar with lots of neat beers, WOO!

o9Ez0unDH1XninHhs3h2Fw.review_text: I don't know about any of you, but the cafeteria at my school was gross. Nightmare gross.   Tommy's Joynt is not as good as my school cafeteria. At least they had a salad bar.   I love ribs. It's hard to screw them up. I ordered ribs here and they pick it out of a huge pan of oily brown watery liquid that the meat has been sitting in for god knows how long and I get a nasty grisly piece of fat attached to a bone.   I think they boil all of their food. Hello? Are we in a 1960's midwest home? Do we boil our veggies and meat so they taste like water and are runny and soggy? It's not hard to stick them in an oven. Also, there's this amazing thing nowadays called, spices. They make things taste good. Use them.   I've eaten here about 5 times and every time I have almost vomited and eaten like 5 bites.   I am not a fan of nasty cafeterias. I am not a fan of flavorless fat and soggy veggies.   Also the guys who serve your food are rude. I point to one area of soggy meat and ask, what's that? They look at me like I'm an idiot and say, "Lamb." Um... am I supposed to know what meat's are what by the amount of brown in them? Darkest is cow, then lamb, then ribs, then pork, then turkey, then chicken?   I hate to be sexist but... I can't understand why guys like this place? It's gross. Period.

6DOZd2V5hravM4w96iXSSA.review_text: Food:   Cafeteria style. But nothing tasting like cafeteria food. It's authentic. It's delicious. It's prepared with soul. Mm. Soul. I feel like there's a little African American woman next to a German grandpa in the back cooking their great grandmas recipes.   We ordered the lamb shanks, sauerkraut, gravy and mash potato, and got a side of bread and some vegetables with the shank.   Hold on. Let me just stop you right there. That gravy though. It was loaded with the meat jus and holy moly it wasn't like any gravy you get on the streets. I mean, it was a gravy I got on the streets but man it wasn't, you gotta go and try it. I paid 16$ total for my meal, and shared it with my girlfriend. It was enough for the both of us! I would also suggest getting the "meal of the day," it's different every day and it's discounted.   It's self-sit, and there's a quiet upstairs room. The first floor is popping. It picks up later at night, small groups of locals to families all come to dine at this neighborhood legend.   Lastly, the lamb was pretty juicy, tender, gelatinous at some parts, and just well seasoned. Great job tommy. I'll be back.   Cheers!

gJ9H5Iub70Mmpi6U-ZBrlA.review_text: So this place has been here since my Dad was a kid in Canada & my WWII era Godfather from Jersey used to take me here when I was five and I was infatuated with the idea of buffalo stew.  Cowboy's and Indian's movies were still mostly in black & white on the TV, we were doing 'Earthquake Drills' in grade school that were essentially kiss your ass goodbye drills because the ICBMs had just been launched, and Johnson or Nixon was on the 6 O'clock news promising we'd be out of Vietnam soon....and Mom & Dad were actually believing them.  And it hasn't changed a bit since I first went there in about 1969, and probably since it opened a couple of decades before that.  Food is inexpensive, both in quality & cost...read; this place was meant to feed the masses with massive portions and inexpensive booze.  You're not going to leave hungry if you are down with basic cafeteria grub in really large portions; giant haunches of Bessie the Dairy Cow past her prime, Turkey drown in gravy, Buffie the Buffalo in a Bowl or on a a Hoagie.  This is basically lots of food on the cheap and decent pours if you tip reasonably.    You're not going to take a date here if you are trying to impress her; only take someone you've been with for a long time who isn't from SF.  And isn't a snob.  What you are not going to find is made to order meals and overpriced drinks.  Its a Cafeteria.  And for Cafeteria food, it has been consistently filling in the nearly five decades I've been around.  When you're on a low budget & not trying to impress anyone, but don't want Tacos, this is where you go if you're from San Francisco; hunks of cheap flesh and a food time warp back to the 50's or 60's.  And the day it dies, a little piece of me will die as well.

E1mqbn2YVAt2a3ZHdO-ORQ.review_text: I lived in the city for nearly 20 years and drove by Tommy's frequently but never went in.  My husband and I recently relocated back to the Bay Area after about 7 years away and had seen an episode of Diners, Drive-ins and Dives that looked pretty appealing.  We went on Saturday after picking up our packet for the Bay to Breakers.  The place had just opened, so there was plenty of seating and immediate service.  This is where the story goes bad...  We both opted for the pastrami sandwich.  That was, undoubtedly, the worst piece of meat either of us have ever eaten.  Sliced way too thick and so full of fat that we had to deconstruct our sandwiches in order to have anything worth eating.  And after reading all of the rave reviews, I'm hoping that it was just a fluke (?).  I, personally, am not willing to try again, even if the prices are more than reasonable.  The only redeeming quality was the barrel of pickles - delicious!

U-1ThLJS4GYbxEJ9T6kcfQ.review_text: It's a great place for a quick delicious sandwich or beef brisket but I think I will have to come back here to try the spaghetti and meatballs. The pastrami and cabbage. The spareribs and rice. The buffalo chili. The buffalo stew sandwich.   It really all looks amazing. And 2.75 for coors light. U can't beat this place.   Minus one star because the place is somewhat dirty and cramped.

AAPtqVOGScAjy6DgUP_gXw.review_text: Great price for the speed and quality of food.  It's not amazing.  It won't blow you away.  You won't go home and write a letter to your parents notifying them that you are dropping Catholicism because you've found a new Mecca.  But it is good.  Fresh cut sandwiches with a quick, grab-your-food-and-pay style.  Perfect for a quick eat before a movie.  Plus, Metallica goes there.  Don't you trust Metallica's food choices?  I do.  Probably too much...

br9Ah_OCmOvxsp-xGz6IZQ.review_text: I found this place by accident, but apparently it is a San Francisco institution. If you hate restaurants with faux memorabilia plastered all over the walls to create "character", then it's because they are imitating the real thing, which is places like this.  Yes there is memorabilia everywhere, but it hasn't been picked up from a junk shop, it has been collected over the decades that this restaurant has been trading. The whole place is aging very gracefully.  The food is simple comfort food, generously proportioned, with big slabs of meat in the sandwiches. Gravy on the side, and you can help yourself to pickles. If you are not in the mood for a sandwich, try the daily special, or maybe chilli or lasagne.  There is a full bar, and drinks are served separately at your table (there is no table service for food).  The best thing is that although this has all the hallmarks of a tourist trap, the prices are super reasonable, both for food and drinks. The only criticism I make is that sometimes there is a queue for service, but of course that is a sign of a good restaurant.

xfYSTbq112oXxYV29J_WDw.review_text: This is more like 2.5 stars, but I feel there are too many 4 and 5 star ratings so what the hell.  I don't mind a dive bar, and the bar at this place is good enough and has a decent drink selection.  The service was either good or indifferent depending on the employee, definitely experienced worse before.  The food, my god, it's overrated.  It was only a step above Stouffer's frozen dinners.  Bland baked beans, mashed potatoes obviously from a box, and the brisket, while tender as brisket should be, was covered in a watery, boring sauce, which was also all over the "potatoes".  The atmosphere, like I said, was divey.  If I could have gotten a spot at the bar, I feel my experience would have been a bit better.  The booths feel cheap as hell, and the whole building felt like it was held together by load bearing beer posters.  Summary: Drinks are fine, food is bland, and I wouldn't want to be in there during an earthquake.

1vvgSS263dlPBa2PgQM__g.review_text: We went there late-night after watching a movie at the nearby AMC. What attracted me was the fact that it was so full of customers at that hour, and there was a line waiting to order food. Somewhat like 'The Pantry' in L.A., but with much more ambiance. I had the beef brisket as a sandwich and my son and his gf shared a healthy serving of spaghetti and meatballs. Everything else looked good and would probably go back on my next visit to SF.

w5sAPorr-a3c1-EIwJQNXA.review_text: You see I've tried being a vegetarian, vegan, etc - but deep down inside I was born a carnivorous human being, and so I will forever love eating meat. Stumbled upon this place because we were starvinggggg and I LOVE TOMMY'S JOYNT I must say. It was a very busy day but the food was amazing so it was worth the wait. I got roast beef and that thing was sooooo good and I can not wait to try again. My friend had corned beef and he said that it was delicious as well!

98kge3NovzBHx61kPyIMSg.review_text: You can never go wrong with a plate from Tommy's Joynt. Don't be fooled by the size of the line.... it goes by a lot faster than you think ((unless the people in front of you who have been in line for the past 10 minutes don't understand the concept of being ready to order when it's their turn to order.... but that's not Tommy's fault... that's their fault))  I usually go with a plate because you get a generous helping of a side of your choice. But if you're hungry for a sandwich, you will not be disappointed. The sandwiches look small, but they will fill you up. Just make sure to get a side of potato salad, and a big side of pickles (you help yourself for pickles from the giant keg of pickles to the left of the register). ***Note to sandwichers: if you're leaning towards the round of beef, you're better off getting it on a plate. The round of beef is super rare and it's a challenge to take bite sizes from a sandwich. You'll need a knife to get though the delicious rare meat***  Drinks are relatively cheap. Getting a full meal feels like you're stealing from Tommy because it's so cheap.   If you go and it's crowded, don't be afraid to pull up a chair at someone else's table. Thats how they do here. It's a good way to make new friends (and get a chance to see/taste the other offerings that you didn't order).  Oh... and BRING CASH. You'll need it.

TLzwLBhPoO33w85VOXz97g.review_text:
I used to go there a lot when I was going to school.
 a lot.
 After midnight, went to a bar, need some thing to eat.
 got to go to Tommy's, nowhere else but Tommy's.
  I lived Sutter and Larkin.
 So it was very handy.
  I don't even remember what I had because I was too drunk.
 Whatever.
 Wait, I remember the bathroom was up stairs.
 or down stairs?!
 I was too drunk.
 I remember that their were 3 chefs with white long hat in the right side and their was a long counter bar the left side.
 I think I only ordered pastrami sandwich with the dipping sauce.
 and more beer.
 so I get more drunk.
 I think they opened after 2 a.m.
  long time ago.
 It was very reasonable too.
  Place like this, you can not to be serious.
 I don't know.
 Hope still the same.

67HwuY1mtttvvnqn9tHU0Q.review_text: It was good but not great. The pastrami was a bit tough. I liked the corn beef better. Also this place is cash only so be prepared.

LyXvIE71cMeiBaPZI_Yq2w.review_text: My parents met here on a Halloween date. My Dad got involved in a bar fight, and when the whole bar joined in, he rescued my Mom. They went walking along Maritime Park and Dad proposed.   Well that's what Dad says.  Mom says they met here, went for a walk and he proposed.   Well at least they agree on the important parts...  Now, on a rare occasion I will come here with the parents and listen to them talk about how it hasn't changed. I love my parents.

MyPqaSmY-pgHN2pXG_n3yA.review_text: Only reason I did not give this place a 5 star is because there are places where the food is superior but this is a rock solid 4 stars to be sure! This place is consistently good with the quality of their food, the tastes, the menu, and the service. I always get the lean cut of the meat and make sure I get 3 dinner plates to go so I can sample at home with the family. Tommy's is a real SF landmark.

AFxUWTF6uUvwHPU3g7aERw.review_text: Sorry for the delay in review! This place was great! My family and I ate here while on vacation. We easily found parking just around the corner. When we walked in to the Joynt I was in AWE of the huge sign which listed the beer selections! If we weren't driving I would have had more than just one beer!!  Seating was a piece of cake. I got the kids settled while my honey stood in the short line to order.   The food was terrific! We tried the pastrami sandwich which was super tender and so tasty! I wish I could have that sandwich on a regular basis!! We also had the buffalo stew and it was good. My daughter had the turkey leg and my babies had spaghetti.   Our waitress (who I think was the only one working at that time) was great. The place was fairly busy, but she did a great job. She was attentive and knowledgeable about the beers.   WE CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK!!

HnhQgDVycdu_AUKsntZS6g.review_text: Where else can you get a FAT corned beef sandwich for $5 at 2am in San Francisco? Oh, did I mention that while it was only $5 it tasted good??  This place is a riot. I walked in and thought I was going inside a circus - not because of the people who worked there, but because of the random decorations hanging from the wall; that made me laugh.  The corned beef was just good - and for it being a late night snack, post bars, that made it even better.  One minus - they only take cash, so come prepared.  A really fun place because its just so trashy inside decor wise, it actually works.

1hCqFYc0oNpw7aZZBuEh6A.review_text: Some years ago my friends John and George were in from out of town, and the plan was that they would meet up at Tommy's and then come over to my place. Instead I got a series of phone calls where John would tearfully say "I'm at Tommy's and I can't find George" followed by George calling and drunkenly reporting that "I'm at Tommy's and I can't find John." After a few repetitions they showed up and told us it had been a joke. But now the joke is on them because when they recall it they think they actually were too drunk to find each other.  It may seem like I'm digressing, but not. Tommy's is a SF institution, great for everything except the food which is very neutral middle of the road stuff. The pickles are free but standard jarred fare. Some of the food is not that cheap so may as well order a hot dog or the specials since the eating experience will be the same.   In fact if Tommy's wasn't in SF I'd give it one star less, but here it's a great palate-cleanser between your meals of raw kampachi and artisanal organic cheese. It's a part of "old", Harry Bridges-style San Francisco and in fact it might be a good idea to eat there on July 5 in commemoration of the union busting "Bloody Thursday" in 1934. It's also a good contrarian choice to watch the Super Bowl or other mega sports event because there are lots of televisions yet not overwhelming crowds.

xlsWgIgUNp8oUOinCXcjpw.review_text: I'm from Riverside, CA and went to San Fransisco to visit. I love this place! I got the thanksgiving dinner (turkey, mash potatoes, gravy, stuffing) and they were all so delicious!!! The sides that came with my dinner (beans, bread) were also really good. I wish I could come back but its so far :(

5JD9U4h-DyIpHlSuYodCtQ.review_text: Tommy's is THE place in SF to go to get REAL food. You know what I mean... prime rib, corned beef and cabbage, buffalo stew, meatball sandwiches, cole slaw, etc.  Good, hearty meals at a reasonable price. The food is good and the ambience, feel and history of the place is great.  They have tons of different types of beer at the bar and its an all around great place to hang out.  I've been here on quite a few trips up to SF now and always seem to end up coming back.  (oh, and as my roommate likes to remind me all the time, apparently Metallica was formed here)

XrtCszxXH35oTHOKpG_bBA.review_text: Best corn beef I ever ate and the atmosphere is great.

fojptcVycoRhrLUU7XSSNg.review_text: I've always been wondering what this bright, colorful building was about.  I've driven by here a TON of times, especially since Japan Town is rite down the street.  But when I realized that this place was on Diners, Drive-in's, and Dives my boyfriend and I made it a plane to visit this place after the historical 100th Bay to Breakers.  I believe we killed enough calories to grab a big meal and chase it down with a few beers.    The place inside it dark, which kinda sucked for my boyfriend and I since would transition lenses were activated by our 4 hour walk.  But thankfully, Yelp was able to help narrow down our selection so we would have to be the couple that held up the long line because we were looking over the menu.    I ordered the Corned Beef plate with the sides of green beans, the cucumber salad, along with a glass of water.  My boyfriend ordered the Pastrami Sandwich, with the potato salad, and a coke.  I really wasn't too impressed with the Corned Beef because my mother makes it once a month, so the taste and flavor was expected but without the carrots and cabbage that I'm normally used to.  Aside from the additionals that I wish was in my corned beef, it was good.  Probably something I wouldn't order again, but if you're looking for some good corned beer... there you go.   My boyfriend's pastrami sandwich was pretty good.  It came with a side of aujus, which you can never go wrong with.  I didn't like his potato salad - I preferred my cucumber salad.  My water seemed a bit oxidized because it was a light grey color from all the air bubbles, then it turned to a normal color.    I think the next time I visit, I'll have the buffalo stew.

_piDlvveZEliJsgHFRzFZw.review_text: Yes, please. A San Francisco staple. When you walk into a place and the first thing you see is a long line and a sign that says "Cash Only" you know it must be good. After reading some reviews my partner and I decided that we would walk a few blocks and find out why this place was so special. There wasn't a long long when we walked in, probably because we went at an odd hour, but I would've waited in a line twice as long for the food.   We both ordered the exact same thing, bbq brisket with mashed potatoes and a salad with ranch dressing. The order came with a roll (carbs, my favorite!). First off, the brisket was melt in your mouth, pure deliciousness. Even if the mashed potatoes were made from a box, it felt like they were made from scratch with lots of love. I could eat them for days. The salad was a salad, nothing special, but the roll was carbalious.  Of course we had to have a drink. My #1 choice is ketel & soda. I'm all about getting doubles and triples, but I have to draw the line at quads and quints. The drink was extremely over-poured and was basically un-drinkable. I wasn't wanting to get completely drunk off one drink. Luckily they were having a special of all ketel one drinks for only $5 which was pretty amazing. Just watch the pour or go in expecting to get drunk off a few drinks.   If you're in San Francisco, uber, walk, ride, fly, do whatever you have to do to visit this place. It's worth it. Worth every star.

I-02Mz45H7siHsjjgVxPgQ.review_text: SOLID SOLID SOLID! I always go for the french dip!! That is all for now

A5Y6GXac4JVHtUxkmSwA8g.review_text: This was THE spot to get a hearty meal when I lived in SF. If you're into meat, this is the place for you! I remember getting meatball sandwiches here when I was a kid. There are very few things they serve that I don't absolutely love. This place is CASH only so remember to hit the ATM before coming here. (And bring lots of it because you'll wanna try everything on their menu!)

OLf0URMxLHYEXgm26mDdTg.review_text: If you were trapped and tortured in the desert for 50 years, each year getting worse and worse, hotter and hotter, brutal and blistering, then finally rescued and given a perfectly cooked Thanksgiving dinner with the love of your life, your kids, childhood pet, best friend, a cold glass of your favorite beer, and Jeff Goldblum... it wouldn't taste as good as Tommy's Joynt.

X5K2qcvdkzUvq18sMqB1OQ.review_text: I think I was around 9 years old the first time my dad took me to Tommy's Joynt.  I remember being really scared and not understanding why he liked it so much (I was a small child and a girl making it hard to appreciate humongous hunks of meat)...that's what she said.  Sorry, couldn't help myself... Anyway, now that I am older, and still a girl, I realize what a huge favor my dad did for me.  I had spaghetti there as a kid, but today I have whichever piece of meat appeals to me at the moment (that's what she said!)  Sorry, I must be on fire today.   Also, if you are going to a niners game, you can easily find parking around Tommy's Joynt, have some delicious food, and a few cocktails, then jump on the muni bus that will take you right up to candlestick...not bad...not bad at all. Anyway, if you are into meat, check it out.  You wont be disappointed...

9ZK7NWdqDES13o3FsFBCbg.review_text: This place rocks, great food, great prices and a real nice atmosphere.  I come here when I miss my mummas cooking, I recommened their beef stew :)

EsoGUze9fiRVrEWR31pKMw.review_text: As a San Franciscan, this was my first visit to the famous Tommy's Joynt.  I ordered the dinner menu, and whoa meat over load on my dish.  The meat was super soft and delicious.  I ordered my dinner ($9) with mashed, dinner roll and baked beans.  The beans were a bit too sweet for me, but it was still delicious.  The alcoholic drinks seems pretty inexpensive ($4 for a kamikaze).  Dont forget to bring cash, because this place is a cash only.  There is an ATM located inside, but am uncertain of the ATM surcharge.  Probably the same as any where else.  Cant wait to try the sandwiches here.  :)

RKfETgoe0wuZds8EMDBw0Q.review_text: Local joint.  People seem to be very very excited about it and seem to return frequently.   As a first timer I have to ask -What's the big deal?    Food is served via crowded buffet at the door. Once you stand in line to get food you stand in line again to get your beer. You sit down at a greasy table and come to find you forgot the silverware. Back to the buffet to get the metal.   The food is brown and bland.  Reminds me of my Midwestern roots.  Not judging, just sayin.   You do get huge portions so if you need to load up on calories, this is the place.   Service is random.  A waiter/waitress may come by and ask I you need anything.  Or they may not.   So you gotta ask yourself, do you feel lucky?   Well, do you, punk?!

flW086sAjtHDab-5XJxKoQ.review_text: Wow, just wow. I loved this place!  We went here on our trip to the bay area and I was blown away. I knew the place was most likely going to be fantastic based on the sheer number of Yelp reviews; however, things can always be hyped.  When you walk in, just note that this place is cafeteria style. It's a little different, but do not judge that it's not going to be great.    I ordered the turkey dinner plate. It came with the necessary fix-ins of turkey (cut fresh), mashed potatoes, vegetables and stuffing.  I also tried their mac n cheese which was great. Just note - this is a heavy meat place. They do have fish options though!  We found our own seat - all the seating is first come, first served but this place is good for groups and had ample seating on a Friday night. Our server came over promptly and took our drink order when we sat down.  I also helped myself to their free pickles. Some of the best pickles I have ever had!

omrCjG2LidihfnMTDcdNng.review_text: Great food. Cash only. I had the BBQ beef and it was very good. Can't wait to go back and try the brisket and the lamb shanks. This place is great if you're a meat eater. Tv's upstairs and downstairs for watching the games. Great atmosphere.

Um6iwSDI1rm-_ybDja8jTA.review_text: The food is decent, but it's really about the margs.  they are delish.  You can definitely taste the alcohol, but it's not over powering.  Plus the limey goodness goes down easily.  The owner is apparently the international ambassador of tequila, or some similarly fancy title.  In any capacity, he knows his stuff and has quite the spread.

M19NwFwAXKRZzt8koF11hQ.review_text: (See pics) Updated review. Totally comfort hearty BBQ beef brisket with gravy, mashed potato, in a colorful but dark bar style joint.  Line moved quite quickly with a full board of all sorts of meaty choices. This is a great place to eat before or after a movie.

sFz6QG21hr4OMVxdHZfZoQ.review_text: You're hungry. You want meat with no fuss. Then you go here. And booze if you're eating here.  It's one of SF's oldest and it even has a cameo of sorts in one of the coolest psuedo documantaries by Russ Myer called "Mondo Topless" (a lot of scenery from SF in the early 60s and a ton of boobies, very cool). Metallica has even had many meetings here in the early 80s metal scene (it was well documented in some VH1 special on them).  I'm not saying this is the "best" place for a roast beef dinner - you want that, then go to the House Of Prime Rib further down Van Ness. But the place is cheap and they're open late (1:30 a.m. for a late night snack). I'm usually down with the turkey sandwiches freshly cut from the carcass. The pastrami on rye with swiss is also a good choice...again freshly cut in front of you. (No, this is not a vegetarian friendly place...unless you want a side salad or a cheese sandwich...mmmm, yum). There are daily specials and I have had the salmon w/rice and the oxtail stew - both pretty decent.   Again, I'm not saying it's the best. But if you're hungry and want no fuss, then go here.

klyP2_nIV8c7QVV8iqPevg.review_text: Best sloppy joe I ever had, brings me back to middle school =)

4EQSMqnhbRRMdWeGefRVag.review_text: This is a great place to go for some late night food after carousing at bars in the city.    I have only had their pastrami and corned beef sandwiches.  You saddle up to the station, and the attendant carves up delicious slices of juicy meat right in front of your eyes.    Their bread isn't my favorite, but the meat is oh so tender and definitely delicious.  At ~$5, it's not a bad deal either.    I've always been fairly drunk when I came in here, so I haven't tried their beers, but it looks like they have a lot on tap.

QAIbAbx3bKxFNZs3ndKAVg.review_text: I hate doing this, but I must drop them a star.  Went in today at 11 for some hangover food. I  hesitated with the turkey...because I thought there is no way they have gone through a whole turkey in one hour since opening. I should have trusted that instinct. My turkey was COLD as in I think it was not freshly roasted that day. (If it was, then the cooks come in at 5am to make sure there is a fresh turkey to start the day, which might be the case because the roast beef looked hot and rare.) The lettuce on my friend's salad had seen better days and the gravy was lacking any flavor (someone must have forgot the salt).    I also wish they would do a deep cleaning of the place. I get it is old and that is part of the charm, but the crude on the walls at the booth I was in was gross. And there was dust on the wall that looked like it was there for years. I am not sure why they don't clean it occasionally.   I will go back because it is the place to go after a night of drinking and dancing when I am in SF.

Rg2idPf4S7Cb13anamh02w.review_text: The buffalo chili was good, but I must have ordered the only rip-off item on the menu! I left hungry, after eating my plate of chili that was served on top of a bed of plain, white rice. I say plate of chili, because the dish was only 1" deep and 6" in diameter. What the hell is up with that? Is it supposed to be just an appetizer? I was not able to attain crapulence!

umsIG90wRX5RIXfMseNp_g.review_text: Someone in this strand called Portland destitute, so I had to try it out before reacting all knee-jerkily. Here's the rundown.  Open late = true. Meat = plentiful (but can one earnestly say flavorful?). Line = intimidating on my way out, but OK on my way in. Price = affordable indeed. Signage = bigger and more plentiful than the place itself. Overall experience at Tommy's = A-OK.  So, in conclusion...  Portland = not destitute. Totally has comparable (if not better) late-night meaty options.

dtieD3T2dlbmD2hxAhOsmg.review_text: Cafeteria styled.  Order & sit down.  Pretty good portions.  Ordered: - BBQ Brisket of Beef, dinner style ($10) with mash, a dinner roll, and salad  - Corned Beef Sandwich on Sourdough Bread ($6)  Self seating. Cash only.  Parking in lot is $3/1 hour. Or street parking $2/hour. We fed the meter $2 and still had 10 minutes left.

oZLaT1AK277BeitorYBtTA.review_text: MMMM beef brisket.. We got here right before the dinner crowd, so there wasn't a line yet. But when we left, the line was going out the door. I got a beef brisket dinner and bf got the roast beef brisket. I fell in love with the beef brisket! It was so tender and delicious..the roast beef was okay too, but I didn't like it as much. I like the vibe in here and that you can get your own water, and that they cut the meat right in front of you! I wanted to try some buffalo stew but I was too full. If I'm ever in this neighborhood again, I'll definitely come back. Get the beef brisket now!!!

DkFR-AE68Nr0jRR8mKQmlA.review_text: Not just because I share the same name as the Joynt do I love it so but because in my 27 years on this planet it has never changed and has always been great.  They still only take cash, still have great drinks and the buffalo is still flavorful and lean.  The hours are unbeatable as well.  I come here with friends and my parents and just whenever I'm hungry and solo and I can't get enough.  I have never heard anyone (in person)  put it down and for good reason.  Upstairs bathroom looking down on the whole place and a balloon machine in the bathroom ;)

F5LhbsLPALA0B_yUBG2n9A.review_text: I guess everyone has to go to Tommy's Joynt at one time in their life.  I was out with a group of friends and they wanted to go here for dinner.  I'm not a big fan of "cafeteria" style restaurants. The food seems to always be  lukewarm and sitting out for hours.  I also have bad memories of subsidized lunches from my childhood, so pushing a tray down a line with people scooping stuff on my plate kinda freaks me out.     I shared the mac and cheese, salad and cheesecake with a friend. Mac & cheese tasted like mushy mittens with cheese.  Salad was oily. Cheesecake was "meh".  The bread roll was the most tasty, but isn't that what they serve in prisons?   You have to admit that everything was cheap, but you also get what you pay for I guess.   I'm glad other people enjoy Tommy's, but it's just not for me.

AqwTAjoyG5HfhQi2-ab4cw.review_text: Prices are cheap and the atmosphere is kitch, but food wasn't all that good. I had the roast beef with green beans and tried a slice of friend's corned beef. Both were tough and the roast beef lacked flavor. The green beans were mushy and basically the stuff out of the cans.  I was rather disappointed because I saw the place on FoodNetwork and it's been around for so long. The food just wasn't all that good. I like what they're trying to do but I just didn't like the food.

YWFbTcVnun8i03XnEU7kVg.review_text: Dear Tommy,  Thanks for feeding me and my rowdy friends so late on a Sunday evening. I really appreciate that you keep your joynt open until 2am, 7 nights a week.  Since we had been drinking and could not drive, and since your joynt was only about 6 blocks from our hotel, you were the perfect spot for a super late night dinner. If it was not for you, my friends and I would have went to bed hungry, which would have sucked.  Thanks again  Your pal, Craig R   That's right, you read correctly, Tommy's Joynt actually stays open until 2am, 7 days a week. Tommy's is a large, cash only, bar/restaurant that looks more like an old cluttered garage than it does a restaurant. Tommy's Joynt has all dark wooden walls and tables. The wooden walls are plastered with old pictures, antique beer steins, Christmas lights and lots of other kooky decorations. To get your food at Tommy's you have to wait in a cafeteria style line that is usually pretty long. Tommy's does not offer paper menus. Instead,  Tommy's list their menu on the wall above their kitchen, which is where you place and pick up your order.   Tommy's is definitely a carnivore's paradise. Their menu consists of things like buffalo stew, BBQ turkey sloppy joes, steak sandwiches, corned beef, lamb shank and many, many other delicious sounding carnivorous platters. Well, to be honest, I wish I would have gone with one of the items I just mentioned because the dish I ordered was not that great. I ordered their burgundy beef with white rice. Tommy's BB is made with big beef chunks, potatoes, carrots, mushrooms and celery in brown gravy. The meat in this dish was not really flavorful and was kind of tough. The sauce and veggies were good though. I also got a side salad and a side of coleslaw. Both of these were standard, nothing to write home about. I did happen to try some of my friends buffalo stew and it was phenomenal. The buffalo meat was really flavorful and juicy. I also had a chance to sample my friends beef brisket and it too was just average but still better than my burgundy beef.   The prices at Tommy's Joynt are dirt cheap. My entire meal with a lemonade was around ten dollars. Nothing on their menu seems to be over ten bucks, which is almost unheard of these days. The service is also amazing here. The long line moved quickly and since the food is served cafeteria style your order is given to you almost immediately after it is ordered.   Since my friends buffalo stew was so good and since everyone raves about their BBQ turkey sloppy joes I will definitely return to this joynt next time I'm in SF.

qlcfSLkF6JQMfpoyBIHtaw.review_text: Great Atmosphere! You order your meats and they are cut in front of you. A meal special is about $10. I had the BBQ Brisket with Mashed Potatoes and enjoyed it thoroughly. Highly recommend this place!

VgtcRwMPiAEeuPsayXB4kA.review_text: Been three years since I've been here. Got some sandwiches for me and my posse, ham and roast beef. I can't believe I'm saying this, but they're actually better at Lefty's. Yup, you heard me. Here, they were on the dry side, but you do get a generous amount of meat. And nice workers are always appreciated.

Po-th7nTUaWsqY9G2ouQog.review_text: Fun fest for the eyes. Clearly a SF institution. Great beer selection from all over the world. Food is cafeteria style. Ever had buffalo?

pF7uEfsYCT_7AIKqBel2Xg.review_text: Tommy Joynt beckons me back again and again.  The meats are top notch deli quality but the prices are basement blowout.  Service is always quick and friendly.  Beer list rivals the best pubs in the city but the prices blow them all out of the water.  Decor is nice and authentic too.  And they are open until 2am.  Nothing in SF is open until 2am, not even the bars that are supposed to be.  Best place to head after a movie, drinking, or just for a good dinner.  And no matter how hard you might try, it is near impossible to spend $20 here...most of the time I get a full dinner and beer for less than $10.

HvnADWS5Ma6ZHGFy3ESmfw.review_text: My husband and I stopped here late one night after leaving a club.  We'd been wanting to stop here for ages and we weren't disappointed!  You walk in and the place smells like my grandma's house used to!  Funny thing was that the smell was beefy, and it made me really want the turkey!  But, we were sharing so we compromised.  This NOT a place for vegetarians!  Their meat is the main draw.  We shared the corned beef plate.  It came with mashed potatoes and a salad.  The place was packed at 1 am on a Friday night, but it was still comfortable.  We weren't drinking, but HOLY CRAP they have a HUGE assortment of imported beers.  We had to wait in line quite a while because the place is cafeteria style, but at the same time, you don't wait for the food to be cooked and brought to you.    The corned beef was very tasty.  Very tender - not like OMG the best ever, but well worth getting again.  The mashed potatoes tasted beefy in a pleasant homey way.  Like they were made with beef drippings of beef broth.    The funny thing was the thousand island dressing.  Dunno what it was about it, but yum!  Not a strong flavor but uber tasty!  I'm trying to think of another reason to go here again!  You have to admit, braving Van Ness parking can be a pain.

uk3K5OjoxDT6bZB1EQNIwA.review_text: Got the turkey dinner....was pretty good, no lie, definitely rivals Lefty's turkey dinner.     Both white meat AND dark meat, stuffing at the bottom, potatoes and gravy were delish, and hiding at the bottom of this mound of food is stuffing!! Sourdough roll to boot, Thanksgiving in February without those a-holes we call family.    I don't even know where to fit this in - it's not a complaint just an observation that the others I was with think I'm crazy but - I am a huge Costco fan, have been a diehard fan for 7 years since I got my first Costco card at 18.....and I am 90% sure the potato salad here is Costco potato salad.  It's totally cool if it is, I'm sure other people like it, but if anybody in the kitchen at Tommy's is reading this and you do indeed use Costco potato salad - it's fine, I GET it, that huge tub for gosh what $6.99? That serves 50?  Understandable.  However, if you are going to serve other bomb-ass food and then throw Costco potato salad on it, you better at least make it your own by mashing it some more, adding more veggies, BACON, dry mustard powder, not just as-is from the Costco container right to the serving plate!   If this potato salad is NOT Costco potato salad, then my stance is that the potato salad tastes like Costco potato salad.

oGApnuX1aTXa7a7eQfxRcg.review_text: After reading all of the good reviews, and seeing the mouth watering pictures on yelp, le boyfriend and I ventured here while we were in SF (senior ditch day tehe!).  Though I love the character and personality that this place has, I was a bit disappointed.  I ordered the beef brisket dinner plate, which was sooo yummy and tender. The sauce they pour over it was good too! Nice and tangy. The mashed potatoes were mediocre.  My bf got the pastrami sandwich on sourdough and that's where the problems begin. The meet was boring to me, and it was just bread and meat. I would have no problem with this if the meat was super juicy or had intense flavor, but nope. The au jour or w/e didn't help much.  My salad was drenched in watered down ranch, and his clam chowder was also watered down.   Our water was milky.. a big no no.  The guys behind the counter are super nice and efficient, the carver threw in an extra piece for me!  I want to come back and try other things, i'm not giving up on you yet!  Also, cash only! They do have an ATM machine available but it charges $2.00 -_____-

0AmhTcL1mVOXTS2BY_XRWw.review_text: Where else can two people have a good hearty fulfilling meal for under $20!? Few, few places can do it SO well.  The meat is tender and flavorful and they have a few selections to choose from. Had the brisket dinner plate with mashed potatoes, dinner roll, and two bowls of Clam Chowder all for less than 20 bucks. The clam chowder was pretty damned good too! This was a perfect meal after catching a movie at the AMC 1000, especially since we already had parking. I can imagine it can get pretty busy here but there are plenty of tables and a couple of booths for seating. Though be ready to carry your food to the table cafeteria style. Oh yeah...CASH ONLY :(   (Really!? In this day and age?)

VCfw7fmucfwgRwBczIh4NQ.review_text: Atmosphere- check Beer selection- impressive (Pumpkin Barleywine? This place has it.) Authenticity- Check Value- check  Quality of food- Not so sure. My husband and I both got food poisoning Flavor- Left a lot to be desired. Pumpkin pie tasted like pumpkin sponge soaked in soap.

LIqrhnF3lfwwULcn4afnyg.user_location: Lower Pacific Heights, San Francisco, CA
LIqrhnF3lfwwULcn4afnyg.review_text: Got the BBQ beef sandwich. Was very good but the sauce the came with it is what gave it the fifth star. Got a cool old school feel.   The lack of credit cards kind of stinks and it takes a little while to get a drink but the food makes up for it. If you don't mind waiting in line for 10-15 to get your food it's worth it.

jVaiCNmWOjoI0led5LZuyA.review_text: came here on a friday night with some friends. it was my first time, and i had heard good things so i was pretty excited, but the food was just meh. for $12.31, i had a medium sized salmon fillet (steamed and crusted with spices and sesame), really mushy green beans, small bowl of fruit salad, and a hunk of bread. it was a decent amount of food for the price, but the quality of food was nothing to write home about; it was a meal i could have easily prepared better at home. it wasn't really busy that night, and the servers looked and acted pretty tired, but they had probably been working all day.

BOU25_BWQnLdFJBKUe2XdQ.review_text: There food really isn't that great. I came here a few times to grab a beer which they do have a wide selection of, but at an inflated rate. So a couple times I decided to go and try their food since it does look pretty good. Parking over here is already bad and need to be careful of all the guys fly across Van Ness and up Geary. You swear you are standing on the freeway.   My mistake on both times. The first time the food just didn't taste good and was just lousy meal for the amount I paid. The second time I thought I would try something different and had a different result. I walked out of there with diarrhea.

7KO-zPCvZ7KveX4Kj2BxlQ.review_text: Guess when the camera's are gone so goes the taste and the service.  Had higher expectations, fail!

bNmwSHzthRsUISrKoDBNvw.review_text: Very AVG. There is a reason they drown every thing in gravy ,the meats bone dry. Wouldn't last a second in NYC with choses like Katzy
